Lastly, a meal wouldn't be complete without their Jackfruit Carnitas tacos, an explosion of flavor found on both of their happy hour and entree menu. Agradecido por Gracias Madre! It is one of the reasons why the Mission is my favorite neighborhood for vegan food.

Gracias Madre is somewhat unique in the sense that it's a completely vegan, completely Mexican restaurant. The menu isn't huge but Â there are enough options for appetizers, entrees, drinks, and desserts. The appetizers and drinks are pretty small from what I've seen but the entrees and desserts are decent sized. Some vegan restaurants are a little weird (especially in SF) but the food and people at Gracias Madre are relatively normal, making it an accessible restaurant for non-vegans.  We got the Gorditas which were fried potato/masa cakes which came with salsa and cashew crema. They were small but good although I would I have preferred more crema. I got the pozole which was a good portion and had a hearty flavor. It was a little on the spicy side so be aware if you don't like spice. My wife got the jackfruit "carnitas" tacos which were also a good size. The jackfruit had a good flavor from the marinade but I thought the soft texture was a little boring. I've had sautÃ©ed jackfruit "carnitas" before which develops a nice little crunch and in my opinion was superior to the Gracias Madre version.  We got the flan for dessert which was definitely enough for two people. The sauce and texture were nice but it reminded me a little more of soft tofu than true custard. I might try something else next time. Cocktails were good but quite expensive for how small they were. We also got a glass of horchata which was surprisingly refreshing. Some horchata is over-the-top sweet but theirs was a little more refreshing.  Overall, four stars because Gracias Madre is good and unique, but it didn't quite hit the Wow factor for me. Staff was somewhat friendly but not overly hospitable. They offer indoor and outdoor dining at a reduced capacity which doesn't really lend for the best atmosphere but that's not their fault. Be prepared that they are very strict on masks and you must have yours on when not actively eating or drinking. I'd recommend making a reservation and arriving early because parking can be difficult to find. Also be aware that the online menu doesn't quite match the real life one.
40-50  mins

Pretty... pretty good. Good drinks, good service. Excellent salsa. Decent entrees.  I got the house shrimp dish by recommendation of the waiter and was not disappointed. The rice was a little spice-forward (not spicy per se, but had a distinct flavor that I wasn't a huge fan of).
Thanks for your review, Clayton! We've sent you a private message with more details.

Came here for dinner on a Saturday night. Didn't realize this place was so popular so I didn't make reservations in advance. Thankfully, the outside seating is open for walk ins so I was able to get a table without a wait. The downside is there is only 1 heat lamp for the entire outdoor patio area so be prepared and wear extra layers. I appreciate that they have complimentary chips and salsa. I got the Chile Verde for my entree and the Tropisueno margarita. I absolutely loved my entree. The pork was tender but not too fatty. The portion size was perfect. Filling but not over stuffed. My drink was great also (standard SF prices). Service was 5 stars! Our water glasses always filled. They checked in on us at the appropriate times but were never intrusive. Everyone working there was genuinely warm and friendly. The bathrooms were also clean. Just hope they buy more heat lamps for the outside because I think outdoor dining is here to stay. I'll be back again and would recommend this place to family and friends.

We had a long weekend in San Francisco and are always on the lookout for good food. Â When we visit California, we are always looking for good Mexican food. Â So checked Yelp and found tropisueno. Â  This hidden gem is exactly what we needed. Â Even though it was a little chilly, we sat outside but were very comfortable. Â They had heaters that kept us nice and warm. Â so with Mexican restaurants I always judge it by their chips and salsa. Â It's a tell tale sign of things to come. Â Here at Tropisueno, they didn't disappoint. Â  Chips were good and they came with a variety of salsas. Â Personally I liked the green salsa the most. Â  For our entrees we picked the Chili Verde and my wife had the Chili Relleno. Â Both had incredible flavor. Â My pork was cooked perfectly and the portions were huge. Â My wife also like her meal. Â We were stuffed walking out. Â I am just glad that we had a descent walk back to our hotel. Â  I would return when I am back in town.

I was visiting the city for work but couldn't find a Mexican place close to my building till i find this place in google maps and surprise it's really good. Ordered a plate with enchiladas and a drink everything was enjoyable the food and the service from the girl who take the order named itxel. I'll come back again

Wow what a find! Literally the best Mexican place I've been to in the Bay Area. We went on Halloween night but they managed to sneak us in for a table at 9. Drinks- I got one of their margaritas which was very refreshing - had cucumber in it and was delicious!, my friends got margaritas / bubbly cocktails. Most of the drinks were really good except one.  Appetizers- so they serve you chips and salsa to begin with. All their salsas are delivous! My favorite was tomato and lime salsa. We also ordered plantains- now I'm generally not a fan but this was differently. They were a base layer of beans to these which changed the game for me. And Queso dip - this was okay. Regular queso with a twist Mains - we got the chicken soup and that was literally the highlight of the night. The most delicious soup I've ever had, almost like a chicken gravy My friends got enchiladas which they liked too. Overall a great place- will definitely visit again!
Thanks for the great review and photos, Shruti! We've sent a private message with more details, so please check your inbox when you get the chance!

Amazing vibes here! Their complimentary chips and salsa varieties were so good. Anyways, a friend and I met up at Tropisueno for an 8PM dinner on a Saturday. She made the reservation, and I got there a couple minutes early so I went in there first. They checked my vaccination status before allowing me in. The place was pretty full, and I can see why. Beautiful, homey decorations throughout and everyone there was so nice.  The 2 of us shared a ceviche and it was delicious. I love ceviches! The one we tried was the Ceviche de SalmÃ³n Crudo - Fresh tartare of salmon, chile de arbol, cucumber, avocado, cilantro, red onion, Fresno chile and lime. It came out so fast so we had this plus the chips and salsa to munch on before our entrees arrived. My amazing friend had a strawberry margarita (I think?) and I had the Tropisueno margarita (Canton ginger liquor, lemon, El Jimador blanco, agave. Rose infused sugar-salt rim). We enjoyed these drinks and they didn't skimp out on anything. So good.  Our entrees arrived, and we got the following -  Caldo de Mariscos - Lobster-chile broth with shrimp, calamari, sea scallops, P.E.I. mussels, tilapia. Served with a side of rice. I don't have these seafoods much when I'm at home eating with the husband and kids because the husband is allergic to shellfish, so when I'm out without him, it's seafood time! The caldo de mariscos was pretty good! The broth was flavorful, not too salty or anything. There was a decent amount of the various seafoods in there in comparison to other places. The quality was great too. Each and every piece was yum. The rice was a bit on the dry side, but it's pretty good with the broth.  TampiqueÃ±o - Grilled 8oz chile-marinaded carne asada, served with a mixed cheese enchilada, ranchera sauce & guacamole. I think that was what my friend ordered. She said it was really good! The description sounded good and it looked really delicious. I have a feeling that if the husband and I went here, this would be a dish we'd get.  Our time at Tropisueno was really great. I'd definitely come back and try more of their yummy drinks and food!

I've been coming to Tropisueno for a while now and it's never a disappointment. Always a good vibe with great authentic Mexican food. The sauce is just right with the fish. I would recommend making an appointment because it can get busy! And being a opt of your vaccine card. Guacamole is great as well!
Thank you for your continued support, Lara! Please check your inbox for a more personal message from us from when you get a chance.

RUN here! Everything is good, plentiful and spicy. The flavors are on point and the portions are filling. We got a chicken burrito, guac and the soft shell chicken enchiladas with mole. And every last thing was amazing. It was definitely $50 very well spent and we would most definitely return
We love the photos, Shami! We've sent a message to your inbox personally thanking you for this 5-star review!

Visiting San Francisco for work, and had to grab dinner while i was out trying to buy a jacket. Lol. I'm almost certain i will eat here again before i leave. Â See below for pros and cons.  Pros: --food was really good.  --chips and salsa were top notch. Chips were thin and served warm. It comes with three different salsas--all of which are very delicious.  --waitstaff was attentive and pleasant. --inside and outside seating.  --nice vibes  --drinks were AWESOME!! Cons:  --kinda hard to find. It's on a weird side street.  Note: make sure you have your ID and vaxx card. You can't get in without it.
We appreciate your review, Erin! Thank you for stopping by -- we've sent a more detailed message to your inbox!

Taqueria by day, full service Mexican restaurant by night. Tropisueno offers the best of both worlds and does it at an affordable price point. Food - This was my first time back in years and the food was better than I remember. Complimentary chips and salsa are provided (which I shouldn't have to mention but a growing number of restaurants choose not to). I ordered chicken and carnitas tacos with guac, both of which were excellent. Traditional street tacos are simple but when the meat is of this quality you don't need other toppings. Ambience - Located across the street from Yerba Buena Gardens Tropisueno a favorite amongst business professionals in FiDi. The outdoor patio, decorated with planter boxes and string lights, is a refreshing change of scenery in a concrete dominant area. Indoors has ample seating (can host up to 175 guests) and a substantial bar with a lengthy drink selection. Service - We stopped in for lunch the other day and were greeted by the hostess who was checking for proof of vaccination. Lunch is served taqueria style, so you order your food inside at the counter and they bring it to your table. The staff was friendly and very helpful when I was inquiring about the menu.
Thank you for taking the time to leave this review, Dennis! We've sent you a private message with more details. Check it out!

We ordered Â chicken enchiladas, chicken tacos and 2 combo of tacos :- veg tacos and tofu tacos and a couple of guacamole. They give chips for free so guacamole and salsa was a good addition.  Chicken enchiladas- average. Considering this place is a Mexican only place I was expecting much better enchiladas. The chicken was very less and was missing it's flavors.  Chicken tacos were good. Good portion of chicken.  Veg & tofu tacos were average.. I have had much better tacos at so many other places. Prices - I found my food to be very average in taste so as per the taste I found the place expensive.  The only good thing about this place is that they checked vaccination cards of all of us and then only allowed us inside which was comforting considering I was dining with an infant.  But because of average food and high prices I will probably not come back here..!!

Great service, good drinks, and tasty food. Ordered the sopa de pollo and found it to be really well spiced along with having a good amount of chicken. Depending on where you sit you might find it a little bit cramped/loud but that is probably to be expected on a weeknight in Fidi. All things considered, great option for a post work meal and I will definitely come back to try another dish :-)

The location is great. It's in the middle of downtown SF in the Union Square area. Many transit options are available to get here: bus, cable car, metro, and of course walking. It's nestled in between skyscrapers and a neat little walkway area.  The vibes inside are great. They have some heavy cumbia music playing in the restaurant. Tons of people walking by and talking. There is a nice patio area that has strong lights. I think they give you a poncho if you sit outside with is cool. Needless to say, the ambiance is great.the bathrooms are gender inclusive and clean. The service is awesome. We got seated soon after showing the hostess our vaccination card. The servers are attentive and constantly fill your water. Our meal came out very fast! I cannot state how fast it came out. The complimentary chips might be the best part of the meal. They were amazing! However, I was not satisfied with the flavor the rice at all. It kinda smelled (and tasted) like body odor? Not sure how to explain it but I'm sure if you tried it you would understand. Perhaps it was just a bad vegetable mixed in on this day or something. I'm not particularly picky but the rice wasn't it for me. I would definitely want to know if anyone else has came here and felt the same way? They have vegetarian options for the tacos. We enjoyed our jackfruit and tofu tacos but definitely ask for no salsa or for it on the side if you don't like spicy. The default salsa is a 8.5/10 on the hot scale for me. The rice really tainted my meal and is the reason for a low rating. Other than the rice, it's a good Mexican meal. The prices are alright. For being SF, $20 can't get you a lot but it also gets you enough. Our plate had rice, beans, and 2 tacos. For a meal for two, you should expect to walk out of here for about $45. I'm putting this at a $$$ but it fits right in there with any other SF restaurant. Bottom Line/TLDR: great location but alright food

Located in the heart of downtown SF, TropisueÃ±o is an ideal and accessible spot to meet friends for dinner or happy hour in a bustling area. I've brought many friends here over the past few years, and recently returned for the first time since the pandemic. It felt really nice to sit in a crowded restaurant again! I've always loved the ambiance inside TropisueÃ±o- slightly noisy and dimly lit. There's also a lovely patio outside on Yerba Buena Lane.  I'm always a sucker for complimentary chips and salsa, so the fact that TropisueÃ±o offers it keeps me coming back. There's a delicious spread of three salsas- the orange one is my favorite. Today, the chips were a little stale and a bit underwhelming, but I usually love the chips and fill up on them.  I ordered the veggie tacos. They're honestly not my favorite tacos. I prefer a chewier and warmer tortilla and more substantial filling. I think TropisueÃ±o's strength is its entrees/plates (my friends usually order the chicken mole or the enchiladas), but there are very limited vegetarian options. I would love to have more dishes to try on the menu.  TropisueÃ±o is one of my staples in the city and I will always come back for the ambiance and the margaritas. Highly recommend if you're looking for a fun time in an exciting area!
Thank you for your feedback, Avani. We love the photos! We've sent a message to your inbox personally thanking you for this review. Check it out!
Best Mexican food in the city!!! Try the combo plate We really liked the enchiladas & tomales
Thanks for your support, Christina! Â We'd love to have you back to serve you again soon -- Salud!
Amazing service. You can even grab blankets if it's too cold outside. The food has great peloton size and the queso is so cheesy and delicious! Great for a large group

Hi Coco, Although we weren't able to send you a private message, we still wanted to take a moment to personally thank you for this 5-star review! We're glad to hear you enjoyed your visit and were a fan of our queso. We appreciate your feedback and hope we get the chance to serve you again soon! Keep in touch: Facebook @Tropisueno Instagram @tropisuenosf

If TropisueÃ±o were an MLM, I'd be writing this from my Italian sports car en route to my all-expenses-paid trip to Cabo. I've taken countless people here since discovering this place years ago, more than half of whom have told me that they later recruited, erm, brought, others. Thankfully for everyone, TropisueÃ±o is not an MLM but rather the best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to with consistently great food, service, ambience, and surprisingly affordable as well given the gigantic portion sizes. I came last Wednesday around 6:30pm and though it was fairly busy, I was seated immediately. This was my first time back since COVID and I'm happy to report that besides the complimentary chips being not as thin and crispy, everything else was as amazing as it's always been. As an extra COVID safety precaution, you order online via QR code and also pay online.  Every item I've tried on the menu has been a banger, but my go-to is the pollo con mole poblano, which for $18 easily can feed two with leftovers to spare. This dish is especially good and I have yet to find a place that can compare. The mole is a perfect blend of spices that makes the chicken so flavourful but not salty. The dish comes with two tortillas but they will give more if you ask at no charge.  The servers are always attentive and friendly, and out of all the times I've been the food has never taken more than 20 minutes to arrive, even on the busiest of days. They place such emphasis on exemplary service that one time I came we received a dessert on the house as an apology for the extra tortillas taking a while to arrive even though we didn't even say anything.  Their cocktails and happy hours are well known too, although I haven't had the chance to see for myself. Even without them, I can't recommend this place enough. Stop reading reviews and just come give it a try!!
Wow, thank you for this outstanding review, Elaine! We've sent a more personal message to your inbox. Take a look when you get the chance!

After a long drive from redwood national park, we were looking forward to a good meal. We made reservations through Yelp and called the restaurant for an earlier seating and they were able to accommodate us.  We tried the following food: Empanadas de hongo- mushroom empanadas - this was good. The dough is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside . One of my favorite dishes here. Tacos de Cachete- braised beef tacos - this was just ok. The beef seems to lack flavor. Tampiqueno- skirt steak - ordered it medium well but it seems slightly more to well done. It was not very tender and a little salty. This was ok.  Old school platos - ordered a chicken enchiladas and carne asada tacos - the chicken enchiladas was ok. The carne asada tacos was very juicy and delicious. This is second favorite item we had.  Restaurant has a very nice ambience and great service. The food was just average.

1000/10. Soooo good. My husband and I showed up around 5:30 on a Saturday and were seated immediately. Our waiter was so attentive and friendly - I wish we caught his name but he was the best! To start, the chips and salsas were delicious. I loved the medium and the spicy salsas the most but all three were flavorful. We also ordered the chile con queso as an appetizer and it was top notch. For entrees, my husband got the chile verde and I got the tampiqueÃ±o. Oh my God - both were amazzzzing. The meats were full of flavor and cooked to perfection - and the sides were perfect. I'm serious when I say I'd eat here everyday if I could. The cherry on top was the prices!!! Soooo worth it. He had "la muerte" to drink and I had "the tempest". Both somewhat tangy as we like and strong too hehe. We were visiting the city but if and when we come back, we will definitely eat here again!!!
Glad to hear you enjoyed your visit, Natalia! Check your inbox for a personalized thank you.
Soooooooooo goooooood!!!!!! The salsas are very tasty. Chips are very fresh. We got a steak quesadilla and it did not disappoint!
Hi Sara, We're happy to hear you enjoyed our steak quesadilla and chips with salsa! Thank you so much for your review and we hope we get to serve you again soon!

Order: California Style Salmon Burger (w/ avo, greens, tomato & aoli) & side sesame slaw Super fresh & yummy! Inside was big with plenty of seating, would be great for large parties. Parking in the Inner Sunset can be a little tough, but if you're up for a little walk, park in Golden Gate Park for a lovely stroll. Right off the busline, easy commute  Service was really nice & accommodating Â  'Bowls & Greens' were large portions and looked really good!
Thank you Megan S. so much for your 5 star review! We are glad you enjoyed your experience and we hope to see you again soon, -The Pacific Catch Team
Strictly on the mai tai to go drink. It was so potent had to throw it out. Maybe it was was sitting around to long not sure but it was so so so strong.
Hello,  Thank you for your review and we are sorry to hear about your experience. Please be on the lookout for contact from one of our team members to hear more.  -The Pacific Catch Team

I noticed my initial Yelp review was ten years ago so I thought it appropriate to update it.  Each time I come I order the same thing. Â The ahi poke bowl. Â  What happened to the bowl? Â  Today it came on a platter. Â Ok by me. Â Hubby & I both got the regular size. Â  As always the ahi was seasoned and fresh. Â  Hubby & I both ordered draft beers. Â Two sizes - 16 oz or 20 oz. Â Went great with our poke bowls. Â  Can't go wrong with this menu item. Â  Robert our server today was great. Â He was friendly and efficient.  We did notice no gold fish shaped pretzels or edamame. Â Is it due to the pandemic or cost savings?
Thank you Shirley N. for your review. We hope to see you at Pacific Catch again soon!

It's been awhile since we've come. We came for dinner, and there was a good size crowd. Â Maybe because of their happy hour 4p-6m. Â Hubby & I both had a rice bowl with brown rice. Â I had the Thai green curry bowl of grilled shrimp, and he had the Korean marinated skirt steak bowl. Â Daughter had the crispy shrimp taco plate. Â  The Korean bowl was somewhat too sweet for hubby. We started with the Peruvian ceviche consisting of ono and served with Â purple chips which were a bit soggy. There's a small parking lot; however, we always park inside the GG Park and walk over.

*Open for indoor seating, outdoor seating, and takeout* It's been a while since I've been to a Pacific Catch, so I was quite pleased with this experience.  Service and Staff: We didn't have a long wait at all to get a party of three seated outdoors. The staff were all wearing masks and were kind. The outdoor seating was beautiful with little stalls for people to sit in. I really liked what they did with the outdoor space. Food and Drinks: I got two tacos and I thought both were good. I wish I had seen what the sauce for the fish taco was because I'm not a cilantro fan. Not sure what the sauce was on the steak taco, but it was delicious! Had a little kick to it, which was a nice surprise. It was some sort of spicy aioli.  Ambiance: Definitely more of a casual place, so no need to dress up. Can be good for a casual date, family gathering, friend hangout, etc.
Thank you Mel S. for your review. We hope to see you at Pacific Catch again soon!

The Korean BBQ is my favorite item here!  They do a great job with the steak here - perfectly grilled medium rare so it's super tender. Flavor also on point.  Thai brussels perfectly crispy!  The only thing not hitting the spot is the Kimchi fried rice - my Korean friend said there isn't any strong Korean accents like the usual gochujang and kimchi flavors...  I've tried this dish at the Palo Alto location and my friend said the rice was really good so I know this place is missing something in their kimchi fried rice.  The overall dish is still pretty good for a seafood/american restaurant chain like Pacific Catch so I still would come back!
Dear Angel L.,  Thank you for your 4 star review. We are glad you enjoyed your experience at Pacific Catch. We hope to see you soon.

My housemates and I went here for drinks and finger foods and let me tell you. Pacific Catch is a... catch! Hehe. - Cabo calamari: 4/5! The calamari was seasoned well and paired with a creamy sauce. I would have preferred them to be a bit crispier though! - Thai coconut shrimp: 5/5! The shrimp was battered perfectly, with a nice flavor of coconut (not overwhelming, not artificial-like). The sweet potatoes were a great side, but they were soft :( I like my fries fried well! - Blood orange lemonade and margarita: I can't comment on the margarita since I did not drink alcohol, but the blood orange was pretty good! (3.5/5!) It's nothing too special but a good alternative if you want to feel included when you're the designated driver haha Overall, I'd give Pacific Catch a 4/5! The service was also very good. Our host was kind and consistently checked up on us!
Dear Rovingaile P.,  Thank you for your 4 star review. We are glad you enjoyed your experience at Pacific Catch. We hope to see you soon.

A nice place for larger gatherings and happy hour (3-5pm) Drinks were the highlight of my dinner as the food was just ok. I got the POKE CHIRASHI ($23) and it was huge. The rice tasted mushy and not v well seasoned as you would expect from a non-Japanese restaurant. Fish tasted fine and not fishy-- loved the yellowtail but the Serrano ahi and original ahi were meh. Would order more of the guava-Rita again! So good! Pina Colada was your average pina colada.  Service was ok. Asked the waitress for top 3 recommended dishes and she gave us 2 and walked away.. weird but ok.
Hello,  Thank you for your feedback. We take everything into consideration to help improve. We hope to have you back with a more positive experience!  -The Pacific Catch Team

Had dinner with a couple of longtime friends and were fortunate enough to get outdoor seating on the "former parking lot", now, "tropical patio"! I had a terrific "West Coast style" grilled salmon bowl with roasted cauliflower, avocado, marinated cucumber, radish salad, cilantro-Pepita pesto, soy-tahini drizzle with a base of half brown rice-quinoa blend and half organic greens! Was delicious and a perfect light dinner!
Dear Patrick M.,  Thank you for your 4 star review. We are glad you enjoyed your experience at Pacific Catch. We hope to see you soon.

Came here multiple times before writing this review. Their poke and ceviches arent the best so I'd probably just get a poke bowl for like $15 elsewhere rather than paying $20 and up for very little fish. Also got their firecracker salmon roll ($13) and it was a bit too dry. The only thing I really liked was their taco platter which comes with 2 tacos, black beans, and fries for $15.I got their fried cod and it was huge and crispy. Â It was totally worth it! you can spilt this with two people and order drinks for HH and you'd be good.
Hello,  Thank you for your feedback. We take everything into consideration to help improve. We hope to have you back with a more positive experience!  -The Pacific Catch Team

Kudos to Pacific Catch for sourcing their seafood sustainably. This made it much easier to decide where to order fish from! Note my order is based on a delivery only.  I ordered a "small" poke bowl with half greens and brown rice base. They made it simple to customize to your preference. I was pleasantly surprised to find a generous size for a small. Even after scarfing down a good size portion there were leftovers! Ahi and veggies were super fresh and flavor profiles were quite satisfying. Would love to try Pacific Catch once things really start opening up and maybe even bring my pup! According to their website they are dog friendly. Love that Pacific Catch thinks about their impact on the environment not just with their food sourcing, but with waste. Makes a huge difference that all packaging is compostable.
Dear Nova P.,  Thank you for your 4 star review. We are glad you enjoyed your experience at Pacific Catch. We hope to see you soon.

Soooo I usually ramble on and on in my Yelp reviews...but not tonight LOL.  Ordered 4 lobster rolls for me and my family. The taste was cool but I've never had so many lobster shells and "bones" in my food before.  Pacific Catch tryna ruin my teeth ):  That is all.
Hello,  Thank you for your review and we are sorry to hear about your experience. Please be on the lookout for contact from one of our managers to hear more.  -The Pacific Catch Team

Variety of vegetarian options on the menu: 4/5 (Didn't get food but probably will next time!) Cleanliness and social distancing practices: 5/5 Excellent outdoor dining experience - they definitely made great use of the parking space and the tiki inspired decor made it a lot of fun. Each seating area was separated and felt private. We just got a couple of cocktails (excellent variety) and some chips/guac, but we'll probably be back soon!

Hello Lavanya K.,  Thank you for the 5 star review. We are happy to hear of your positive experience. We value your input and encourage you to let us know more about your dining experience at Pacific Catch.

We used to enjoy going to Pacific Catch at Corte Madera so we decided to try this one in SF for our date lunch. Â We were seated outside before we could pull out our immunization card. Fine. Â The seating was really second class. Â It was so loud next to the street and there was just a table and a bench. Nothing else like a forgotten corner. Â The waiter didn't come until much later and after we finished eating we waited and eventually had to find someone to give us the bill. Â  Food was so so. Â I ordered the new 3 pieces of tacho but it was hard to describe. Hubby ordered the poke bowl but he said it was too salty.
Hello,  Thank you for your feedback. We take everything into consideration to help improve. We hope to have you back with a more positive experience!  -The Pacific Catch Team

We went to Pacific Catch this past Friday (9/10) around 7pm and while there was a lot of promise in all aspects of this restaurant, almost everything missed the mark. It started off on a low note with a hostess who was just incredibly awkward. It was not clear whether she was being rude or just had no social skills. Â After the most bizarre interaction, she seated us in this Siberian triangle between the kitchen, bathroom and to-go order prep station. Can you imagine a worse place to sit? The bar area looked inviting and cool, so as soon as we sat down I decided to walk back over to the hostess and ask her how long of a wait it would be to sit in the bar area. I won't break down the conversation to minutia, but it was just completely ridiculous. She had absolutely no idea what she was doing and no manners whatsoever. I decided to just to give the table she had originally put us at a shot and not overthink it. That was a huge mistake, it was tawdry, loud and just overall a strange place to sit. There were moments when several staff members would come stand directly next to our table and have like little powwows. Â It was a prep area.  The cocktail menu had several things that sounded good, but everything was exorbitantly priced and I had a sneaking suspicion they'd be skimpy. I was told they were out of the cocktail I asked for (I believe it was a guava marg) so I went for a traditional Mai Tai. My drink was a rocks glass, packed full of ice, a splash of pineapple juice and a teaspoon of dark rum. Â You are much better off ordering beer at this restaurant because the cocktails are extremely skimpy and incredibly over priced. Â  The calamari was a small portion, super greasy and was served with a tiny drop of some totally bland aioli. Â If they turned the heat up on their fryer, fried the calamari longer, allowed it to properly drain and improved the dipping sauce, it would be pretty decent because the batter was not too thick.  The fish tacos: the Hot Fish was by far the best one. Â The Guajillo shrimp was pretty good. Â The Baja traditional was super bland and lackluster. Â The furikake fries just tasted like regular fries. The beans were surprisingly good.  The poke/ceviche trio: the original ahi poke was good, the Korean ahi poke was too kimchi heavy and the yellowtail ceviche was lackluster and way too watery. I know this is a really bougie sounding critique but: bad knife cuts! If you're going to make poke and ceviche, your knife cuts on the fish are very important. Improperly cutting the fish changes the texture and can make it either pleasant or unappealing to eat. I wouldn't recommend the poke or ceviche for this reason, although, as I mentioned, the original poke was good. The tortilla and wonton chips were stale and greasy.  The thing that really put the nail in the coffin was the fact that they use those tacky tableside credit card machines where they make u tip them while they stand there gawking at you. Â I hate those machines. Â They are always awkward to use, they NEVER give you a receipt and, my biggest issue is that it makes treating somebody to dinner very awkward and uncomfortable for both diners. Â Plus, if you are still finishing your cocktail or conversation, doing this whole payment ordeal makes you feel like you're being asked to leave. Â I guess I just need to start paying cash.
Hello,  Thank you for your feedback. We take everything into consideration to help improve. We hope to have you back with a more positive experience!  -The Pacific Catch Team

Used to love this place!  First time back since Covid and boy.. it's changed.  I had the Korean bbq plate and the ribs were terrible.. boiled and had like 2 little bits of meat. Also an order of tacos which seemed promising but we're soggy all around and a mess to eat. Had to flag down a server in a completely different section for basically everything and was told Our server apparently went on his break and didn't tell the other servers - explains the soggy tacos.  The place was literally half empty on a Saturday afternoon and the awkward host sat us in the back near the restrooms and my poor kids were freaking out about the flies that were landing all over us, them and our food.  Teryaki kids bowl had a foul sour smell taste to it which I didn't realize till I opened the box of leftovers which basically went untouched and ended up tossing.  We couldn't get out of there fast enough.
Hello,  Thank you for your review and we are sorry to hear about your experience. Please be on the lookout for contact from one of our team members to hear more.  -The Pacific Catch Team
Menu is mix of Mexican Japanese fusion. Good mixture of foods of both cuisines. Warm, attentive staff see to your enjoyment of the experience.
Thank you Clifford W. so much for your 5 star review! We are glad you enjoyed your experience and we hope to see you again soon, -The Pacific Catch Team

Pacific Catch has converted its parking lot to an excellent outdoor dining experience. It feels like they have thought of everything to make the outdoor dining experience relaxing and comfortable. The tiki-themed decor and ambiance are very reminiscent of being in a tropical resort. There are barriers that separate tables and retain social distancing. They even provide hand sanitizer and sunblock for diners.  We ordered the poke, sticky ribs, and fish entree. All were good but I personally enjoyed the appetizers more than the entree. The Poke is served with house-made tortilla chips, the poke tasted very fresh! The ribs were tasty and I wish the portion size was bigger but I understand that it's only an appetizer. The service was excellent.  If you do not wish to dine in the tiki area, there is also outside seating along the side of the restaurant. It may even save you wait time as well since the tiki area seems to have longer wait times.

My friend and I been wanting to go to this restaurant for awhile so we decided to go here since it's open again. Currently, they redone their parking lot to make space for a tiki themed outdoor dining area. We thought that was so cool! We arrived here at 4:35pm on Saturday and quickly got seated at the tiki area a few minutes after that and ordered our food. We went here for a late lunch/early dinner. I ordered the Lobster Roll with Cajun Fries as my side with a Guava-Rita drink and my friend ordered the Ala Carte Taco which includes the choice of 3 tacos and a side. He chose the Spicy Sriracha, Grilled Fish, and Traditional Baja tacos with a side of Chips and Salsa. We also ordered a Dulce De Leche for dessert. I enjoyed my Lobster Roll, but it was messy to eat. The fries I chose for my side item was also good and I liked how you get the choice of either regular, sweet potato, or cajun fries. My order also came with some type of coleslaw, which was very good! I also liked my Guava-Rita drink, but I had salt added to the rim of my cup which made my drink taste sour at first. Other than that, I actually couldn't taste the alcohol in it so I enjoyed it. I also tried some of my friend's order (we like to split our items in half) and his was nice, but I prefer my order more. From my friend's order, I'd rank my favorite taco to be the Traditional Baja, then Grilled Fish, and least favorite would be the Spicy Sriracha (too spicy for me). The nachos from my friend's order was cool too, but the nachos were very hard. Now time for dessert! We both enjoyed our Dulce De Leche! It wasn't too sweet and the presentation was nice. The icecream tasted homemade and the spring roll was still crispy! I'd recommend this place! The ambiance was very pretty because of the tiki theme and if you go here at night, then it's even more beautiful! Since we went at 4:35pm, that meant we were able to see both the daytime and nighttime version of it this outdoor dining deck. It helped make outdoor dining more relaxing. Most importantly, the food was good and service was great!
Dear Elaine N.,  Thank you for your 4 star review. We are glad you enjoyed your experience at Pacific Catch. We hope to see you soon.

The thing about Pacific is that you always know the fish is fresh and well sourced. Nice space here though I do prefer the new patio when it's nice out. Seating was prompt , and the courses came in a timely manner with the server being available for another round of drinks when we needed. As for Dinner , it was the 3 Taco Bar option which had some nice choices on the menu both from the Sea & Land though I opted on their fresh spicy Cod, and some tasty Fries. Btw since I was not driving my beverage was an easy to drink Lager, but if you are the one providing transportation then parking is normally available on Irving after 6pm if you are diligent.
Thank you Joseph A. for your review. We hope to see you at Pacific Catch again soon.
My GO-TO place! My top 3! Japanese Wasabi with Poke Poke Charashi  Thai Brussels Surprisingly, I got the packed brownie and it was so good!

I don't know what has been happening lately, but Pacific Catch's poke quality has been bad the past 3 visits. I come specifically because their poke is usually fresh. I noticed their original is always good. However, the California poke use to be my favorite. The first time I actually had to get it sent back. The second and third, I sucked it up. Poke is one of my favorite food and I am 100% sure it was not fresh.

I love love love love loveeee pacific catch. I have been here many times throughout the years and k never get sick of it! The California poke is a must and surprisingly the original flavor is amazing! I came here twice in the past 3 weeks and I honestly want to go back.  I always get the rice bowl with California poke and it never disappoints. The poke trio is a must - the jalepenos poke, California, and original are my too 3.  I had the calamari which was good but wish it was a bit crispier. The ceviche is good but I liked the calamari more.  My first time going was AMAZING. Food was AMAZING. And RACHEL was the best! She was so kind and cheerful. She deserves a raise! :D  The second time going was a bit of a bummer with service. It was pretty hard to our waiters attention and our food took pretty long to come. I thought they wait until you finish ur appetizers and then they would bring in ur entrees. But, our food didn't come until 15-20 min after we were done with our appetizer. And they also got my order wrong.. they fixed my dish within 5 minutes though.. But How come our food didn't come 5 minutes after my appetizers were done? :( don't know. And RACHEL WAS NOT OUR WAITRESS DURING THIS SECOND DINE IN! Overall, I have to give 5 stars because the first visit was great!

Went here last week after softball w a party of 12 at 8:30 day before outside lands - and guess what:  - excellent service  - effective triage  - attentive wait staff  - excellent food  *its Â possible guys* Although I only have the kale salad pictured - yes, was trying to be healthy before an otherwise unhealthy weekend- it was EXCELLENT. All the tacos and pitchers of margs were fabulous too.  I like this spot b/c you can count of great service, quality and creativity on staffs part to be accommodated ~~ well done

Tacolicious is one of my favorite spots in the Marina! Great for groups or just two people grabbing a bite to eat. Their margaritas never disappoint (get a pitcher if you have a group) and the tacos are consistently good. It can get loud so fyi in case you're looking for a quiet place, this is not your spot. I personally don't mind the noise at all, in fact one of my favorite things about Tacolicious is the vibe and energy - it's always a fun time!  My favorite tacos are the carnitas and chicken tinga. The guacamole and salsas always hit the spot. All of those items are gluten free, which is a big plus for me. They have more gf options on the menu for anyone looking for a gluten free go-to spot in the neighborhood.  They don't take reservations, but I've never waited too long. I've heard the breakfast is amazing, so I'll be back soon to try it for myself.

This is an amazing restaurant, I'm definitely coming back! Came here with a friend and we were immediately seated, and from then on taken care of by the lovely Skye. She was so kind, attentive, and helpful; honestly just an above-and-beyond person! The restaurant itself was super airy, with a light and easy atmosphere and fun decorations.  We got drinks to start, and enjoyed them both immensely with the side of chips and salsa. The tacos themselves were pretty good, although I felt that the cod taco could have had a bit more sauce to up the flavor profile. Both meats were well-cooked, however, with beautiful presentation and enough heart to fill you up with just two tacos. I can't wait to come back and try all the different options they offer.

First and only time was 2010, per my Yelp review haven't been since. Â When my friend was in the neighborhood and called me up and said I'm at tacolicious wanna grab lunch and some beers? Â My memories actually came back and remembered the tacos to be meh...but hey it's been a long time, let's give it another shot.  Same as 2010, same salsas too, don't fix what's not broken right? Â I guess it's not broken for certain people and give it up for them for being here this long.  Having taco in the name and known not to be real deal Mexican, at least spice up something. Â I mean gosh I don't expect a half side of goat face cabeza and abuela made fresh tortillas, but if not Mexican add some crazy seasoning in your beer batter for baja style or amp up some unexpected chili salsas. Â Can you Char up the tortillas, it tasted cold like if you just took it out of a bag and ate it or from the fridge. Â  But no it's the straight forward stuff and not what you expect to spend $100 for two people, 3 tacos and 2 beers each. Â Crazy town, could of fed entire family and friends at Taqueria Vallarta. Â My taco nights much much better at home, think Traeger smoked pork butt for 15hrs, tear apart, scratch sticky hot bourbon bbq sauce, smoked bbq pulled pork tacos! No need to talk about the type of tacos, they were edible, pretty plain again. Â  All good, had a nice outdoor table on chestnut, people and car watched while hanging out with a good friend. Â  Didn't realize they took The Grove spot, I liked the that better, use to go for breakfast and their huevos rancheros was simple and clean. Â Tacolicious maybe again for beers, glad you're around though. Â Tough times. Â I feel ya.

just had a snake there with my 6 year old son. Â we had 4 tacos and the chili con queso. Â i think the tacos were pretty greasy, i was very surprised for a marina joint, i would think hella clean and healthy looking but was super greasy. Â i mean i don't really mind, but pretty marina girls will be like, i don't know. Â anyway, the meat also wasn't so authentic mexican style unless they're trying a different more urban hip style and not authentic. Â chicken was sloppy, had huge pieces and very small pieces. Â carnitas, beef short ribs, and chorizo potato. Â not much special flavoring going on. Â it was alot better when i doused a bunch of habenero salsa on it. La Cumbre Valencia and 16th. Â The best tacos I've ever had. Â Wait, I haven't yelped that place...

First off,  The salsa that comes out with the chips are amazing. The review is really 3.5/3.8 stars for me since the tacos were a bit bland.  But, that's to be expected I guess considering the location and the clientele they serve. We will definitely come back here to try it out again and give it another shot. Good drinks but for the most part, the tacos could use a bit more flavor.  I will update this review once we come back and really stay and explore the menu.

If you're looking for something authentic, go else where. But if you want some tasty over priced tacos and drink, come on over! They've got some tasty margarita pitchers I would 10/10 recommend! If you're in a group and can eat lots of tacos, I do suggest getting their huge platter of tacos, it's cheaper than ordering 2 at a time

I was a little concerned because the service started out really slow but this was likely because we showed up at prime lunch hour and they are checking vaccine cards at the entrance so I would actually look at this as a positive. The Chunky salsa was a great way to start our lunch off, we also got the Spicy chili con queso which delivered on the spicy claim. The free chips were crispy, fresh, and not too greasy. I ordered the beef, spicy shrimp, pork, and carne asada tacos. The shrimp taco was super spicy. My mouth was literally on fire. I am a bit of a wimp when it comes to spicy but even my husband who likes spicy thought it has a good kick. The best taco was the shredded pork it wasn't watery and it was jammed packed with flavor. This restaurant is not afraid to spice things up and delivered a very flavorful meal.

Some people are definitely team Tacolicious, but Â I was a bit disappointed. The location on Chestnut is a great spot, in the middle of the Marina and the space itself is high energy but the food was sort of a letdown. Tacos: we tried the chicken tinga, carnitas, and pork special, fried avocado, braised beef, and special pork shoulder. Carnitas were good, braised beef and pork special were fine; fried avocado and chicken tinga would skip altogether. The chicken was dry and the fried avocado I just didn't care for -too much fat on fat. The sauces they come with, the habanero in particular, tasty. Albacore tuna tostadas: nice smoky flavor but fish wasn't super fresh. Would skip The Paloma I had was also way too sweet for my tastes. Would come back with a group for margs but not for the food alone.

Is it weird not to have tacos at Tacolicious? There are lots of other delicious items there that you can have a complete meal without having tacos.  I love queso. I love queso so much I wish it was it's own food group. Queso isn't offered at many Mexican/Tex-Mex places around here, so I always order it when it's on the menu. Tacolicious' queso is surprisingly spicy...it really creeps up on you. The serving looks small but it is super filling given how dense it is. We also ordered guacamole to start...which was probably pretty aggressive; we could have just eaten guacamole and queso for lunch. Instead, we balanced our meal out with salads - I got the Marina Girl salad which was fairly filling for being vegetarian.  There is a lot of seating outdoors with a few high-top tables and more low tables. They also have heat lamps which are crucial during these cool summer months.

100 reviews in without talking about, Tacolicious!? Cray. Pre-covid. Mission District. Strong margaritas. Perfectly salted chips. Sauces. Ah, the simple days.  Between the 2 of us, we inhaled 5 tacos, a kale salad, and 2 rounds of chips and salsa...happy and satisfied! Baja fish tacos were the best, quesbirria always, and that kale salad was a winner. I really wanted an alcoholic drink without the alcohol ( I know, who am I?!), and got the Silas because the coconut water and pineapple juice combo sounded soooo refreshing, and it was! The presentation of the drink made me feel like I was on a beach. It was a perfect drink to compliment Â the meal.  You want to talk about perfect drink though...the horchata cold brew here is the one. Taste like a churro and a coffee had a a great night together and BOOM. My husband decided to get one to go, then after a few sips I decided I needed my own. Then, we both decided that we need more of these "mini vacations" from the kids. We walked around the quieter side of Marina, with horchata cold brew in hand... ah, take me back! First time at this Marina location and we were not disappointed at all! If you're like me and still a little nervous about outdoor dining, you'll like it here. They got tables spread out more than 6ft apart (almost) around the whole block it feels like! A sprinkle of tables here under the sun, a sprinkle of Â them there near the shade, and it is and feels safe. QR codes for the menu and payment transaction, staff are wearing masks, and the bathrooms are open!

Can somebody say TACO TUESDAY like Lebron. These tacos were amazing. Dropped in here for a late lunch by accident and the food was amazing and vibe was really chill. I sat at the bar and the bar tender was really helpful in helping me to understand their ingredients and recommended a good choice for me. The tacos were heaven on my tastebuds. Quaint size restaurant, outside seating, good music and good drinks too. If you're in the area looking for a good meal, stop by.

I've always thought of Tacolicious as a safe and good (new) Mexican spot. However, my experience this time was not as nice because I didn't love the food! I appreciate their immediate and free serving of chips and salsa. I thought the fish taco was too fishy and not flavorful enough, and the crispy avocado taco also lacked in flavor other than how spicy it was. The albacore tuna tostada was my favorite food item, and even then, the flavor was mostly salty and had no contrast. The highlight of my experience was their horchata- great flavor and presentation, but too little to drink for $6. I always enjoy the ambiance of tacolicious although this time, on a Sunday evening, it was LOUD. I would recommend tacolicious to younger folks who might not mind a loud environment for some decent food and good beverages (maybe even get a pitcher). I will be returning with the hope of a better experience.

My friends and I came here for some late night munchies. We did run up the bill with a large order but I got to try a lot of their tacos. Here's my top three taco ranking:  1. Guajillo Beef 2. Carne Asada 3. Carnitas Definitely sample their sauces because they're all amazing. The prices are a little high for tacos but the presentation and quality make up for it. I'd come here again with my family for a nice sit down taco dinner but pricey for a college student :)

Taconaseous! Â Had some braised pea and collard green tacos at Â Chase Center and they tasted like ass. No polite way to put it. If ya'll want to cater at the games realize it reflects poorly on your brand as that sh** was nasty.
$32 pitcher weak margaritas (hella watered down) and $18 for 6 hard shell oily ground beef tacos. Definitely got way better place for Taco Tuesday in SF.
Gray was awesome! Amazing customer service. Definitely will be coming back here again

Favorite spot so far in Marina. We always have MF tacos and chicken + Traditional Carnitas Taco. Margarita Mucho Gusto is our go to drink! Service is great, staff are very pleasant, kind and go above and beyond. We never had to wait for the service longer than it should be. Clean space and everyone is wearing a mask. :)

Fun taco spot in the marina. They do have outdoor seating during Covid times and there are boards to separate you from bustling Chestnut Street. Our waitress, Victoria, was super friendly. We popped in for a quick snack and drink while we were walking down Chestnut. They were able to seat us pretty quickly. We got the Baja style and Camarones tacos. Both types were very flavorful but were smaller than we expected. They come with an assortment of salsas and condiments which pairs well. The food is served family style and also comes with a huge basket of chips. Drinks wise, we both liked the Hemingway and Pasion. Â Would definitely come back!

Yay for the crazy amount of chips they give to you! I loved the dine in experience, pre covid, but even during the pandemic, I've ordered for pick up and delivery and they never disappoint. Of course I order tacos, like what else would I be ordering?! Got an order of their 3 tacos, then another order of their 5 tacos, next time, it'll be an order of their 9 tacos. Who doesn't love tacos? Also their salsa is spicy AND flavorful, if you can handle the spice...add more lime haha Their carne asada and carnitas are always my go-to.  Another item that I love is their ceviche and roasted corn but that was when they had dine in, so don't quote me if they don't have it on the menu anymore. You can't go wrong with a nice glass of agua fresca, so refreshing!

This place is always amazing!! The margs delicious, the tacos divine! The staff is always so welcoming and accommodating and I am so excited that outdoor dining is back to enjoy every taco tuesday here!

This place was delicious! I'm super into tacos, and both the shrimp and salmon tacos were delicious! I had the fried shrimp one and the grilled salmon one. Both with no crema, but they were still Really good.  The guacamole was fresh and chunky like I like it. The chips are actually made in house (you can tell cuz they're a little oily). The coconut shrimp was also really good, and you can tell they seasoned the shrimp under the coconut coating. So bomb  I'm definitely coming back here when I come back to SF! The waiter John was so helpful and considerate! He was amazing at tending to our needs and kept checking on us to make sure everything was okay.
Thank you Ashley H. so much for your 5 star review! We are glad you enjoyed your experience and we hope to see you again soon, -The Pacific Catch Team

Good thing we have Pacific Catch to dine within our Neighborhood.  They have outside door Sitting.. Annie our Server is Awesome. Since we always dine here ... My roommate Never ending favorite the Sea Bass with Asian Chimichurri and Brussels Sprouts is spot on... Sticky ribs is good too ...the Meat melts on you mouth..I got the Mixed Crispy Catch... 2Pc Fish 3 Pcs coconut shrimp and Calamari with 4 different sauce ...We have Bentley our Fur Buddies favorite Chicken strips too.. Annie made sure our buddy been taken care of too..She's well versed with the menu..

Good Local Restaurant along Chestnut and Webster...Tried this place for the first time since we walk our Bentley at Marina ... Their Stripped Sea Bass with Asian Herb Chimichurri side of Kimchi Rice and Egg is soooo good that my roommate Cleaned the plate really Good. Their Wagyu Burger is good too.. Since we have our Bentley with us..ask for their Tenders with no salt..My Buddy's happy... Service is great..they check on us often... Id be back for that Killer Sea Bass as my roommate didn't even share it ...

Fresh fish, fun atmosphere, and prompt service... What more do you need?  We decided to stop here for a late lunch and I was pleasantly surprised. We ordered the Original Ahi Poke and the special Korean BBQ Poke bowl which came out pretty quickly. Serving sizes are generous and well worth the amount of money compared to some other poke joints that I've tried.  All the ingredients tasted fresh and the fish to rice ratio (as well as other ingredients in the bowl) was more than fair. My only criticism is that the the poke itself was pretty saturated in sauce to the point where I felt like I didn't need to add any more of the sauce that came specifically with the Original Ahi Poke dish. That may just be a personal preference though as I usually opt for light to no sauce.  Can't speak for their dinner but for lunch, this place is a solid choice! Would definitely come back to try other items on their menu.
Dear Leslie S.,  Thank you for your 4 star review. We are glad you enjoyed your experience at Pacific Catch. We hope to see you soon.

Another great place we stumbled upon while in San Francisco called @pacificcatch at 2027 Chestnut St. Â on the table Â Thai Coconut Shrimp Â Chips & Guacamole Â 2 Taco Platter (Hot Fish and Salmon) with black beans and sweet potato fries. Â All of the food items had a good flavor and everything on the menu sounds delicious! Â I'll definitely be back! Shout out to our awesome waiter, John, who was friendly and offered some great suggestions.
Thank you Connie F. so much for your 5 star review! We are glad you enjoyed your experience and we hope to see you again soon, -The Pacific Catch Team

Fresh fish, and a generous serving size! The aesthetic of this restaurant is like a tiki bar. We were sat down quickly without a reservation, and orders taken quickly. The drinks are also served in cute little tiki mugs. We ordered a mai tai and a coconut mai tai. The drinks are rather strong! The poke was well balanced in seasoning and pairings with the vegetables on the side. The tuna was fresh, although a little rubbery in some pieces. The serving sizes are generous. Overall, a well-priced casual seafood dining choice!
Thank you Karen Y. for your review. We hope to see you at Pacific Catch again soon!

Came here for their delicious looking new Hawaiian menu, and whoops, they don't actually have it at this location  Instead, we opted for two poke options on the menu, the Serrano Ahi, which is appetizer sized and really good, and the Japanese Wasabi Original Ahi Poke, which I didn't like as much. This was a very decent sized amount of food, I couldn't eat it all myself. The whole plate was really just wasabi flavored, and I kind of wished there was another flavor running through as well.  Overall, good spot for good fish! Next time I'd definitely try the tacos, they look great!
Dear Sarah S.,  Thank you for your 4 star review. We are glad you enjoyed your experience at Pacific Catch. We hope to see you soon.

This place was awesome. In fact, it was so awesome we came back 2 times in the span of 3 days. It's on a street of many different options for eating, Pacific Catch stood out with their outdoor dining space and inviting atmosphere. We were able to sit outside and enjoy the beautiful day and had some incredible food.The menu had a variety options to choose from and it was hard to decide, but we knew we couldn't go wrong.  I feel like we tried the whole menu. We had ceviche, salmon rolls, thai brussell sprouts, French fries, West Coast salad, Asian chimichari salad, and tacos. It was all delicious and packed with flavour. The service was great. They were kind and attentive. Would definitely recommend checking it out along with their various locations.
Thank you Constantine J. so much for your 5 star review. We are glad you enjoyed your experience at Pacific Catch and we hope to see you again soon.

Parking is hard to find since it's really close to cool spots but if you don't mind walking a little bit you can park across the street at golden gate park side. They offer a lot of foods to choose from! We ordered Korean BBQ Ribs and Korean Steak. Their serving size is okay a little bit pricey but good food happy tummy! We order Wagyu burgers for to go. Their servers are very nice, I asked our server to pick which card who will be paying and he understood the assignment! Definitely going back for their wagyu burgers!!
Thank you Ruby Jade N. so much for your 5 star review! We are glad you enjoyed your experience and we hope to see you again soon, -The Pacific Catch Team

I love the place it has the best environment and the food quality is phenomenal we ordered like 4-5 dishes and one was surprisingly better than the other, you have to try the coconut shrimp because it's very unique and you don't get the chance to try it everywhere.
Thank you Sandy S. so much for your 5 star review! We are glad you enjoyed your experience and we hope to see you again soon, -The Pacific Catch Team

Born and raised in Hawaii, my poke expectations are HIGH. So having been told that Pacific Catch has good poke, I was very skeptical -- especially because the mainland does poke differently. However, I can tell you that I've easily found the best poke in the Bay Area at Pacific Catch!  I ordered the poke chirashi bowl on GrubHub and it was not cheap. However, for fresh fish in San Francisco, I didn't expect anything less. I will say that even though it was a hefty price, I would definitely get this again for a special occasion. The fish is MARINATED (this is so rare in the Bay Area) and truly reminded me of home. Not to mention the freshness of the fish which is evident as soon as you open the box. My favorite of the three was the classic shoyu poke, but all three were delicious. It's also rare that you see hamachi being used a fish for poke, but it definitely added to the bowl.  Just based on this one dish, I'll definitely be back to try more!

Hello Grace L.,  Thank you for the 5 star review. We are happy to hear of your positive experience. We value your input and encourage you to let us know more about your dining experience at Pacific Catch.
35-45  mins
there Baja taco for take out. Order before hand, this small Resturant is always busy crazy!
Dear Yvette P.,  Thank you for your 5 star review! We are happy to hear that your experience was up to the Pacific Catch standard. We hope to see you back soon!

Quality declines each time I eat here.  The most recent visit (about 2 weeks ago), they gave me avocado that was browning. It was so clearly bad. And their signature poke dish was also terrible- the fish cuts were done so poorly that the fish was chewy and inedible. See pics. I reached out to them hoping they would make it right by offering a refund-- no answer. Don't eat here. You can find better food elsewhere.

I ordered Pacific Catch through Hyperflyer yesterday because they go directly through the restaurant instead of charging third party fees, and guys! This was so good! You definitely have to try it if you haven't. I was particularly hungry, so I got a salad and sandwich with fries. It was all delicious. The salad tasted fresh and crisp and all the ingredients worked together just right. And the sandwich was so satisfying. It was all fantastic. I'll be ordering from them again.

Hello Ramiro M.,  Thank you for the 5 star review. We are happy to hear of your positive experience. We value your input and encourage you to let us know more about your dining experience at Pacific Catch.

10/10. For some reason I never expect Pacific Catch to be good as it is and I don't know why. The fish is grilled to perfection (and I'm very critical of even slight over-cooked fish) and so flavorful. We got the fresh catch mixed grill for 2 and it was the perfect amount for two hungry people. We chose the Hawaiian salt style with Thai brussels and brown rice as the sides. LET ME RAVE ABOUT THE BROCCOLINI -- I COULD LIVE OFF IT. Like I've never had broccoli this good. The charred wood flavor is amazing! If the owner is reading this can you please tell me what you use?!  We arrived late on a Friday night, shortly after 8pm and we were seated right away on one of their heated parklet spots.

Hello Sherry S.,  Thank you for the 5 star review. We are happy to hear of your positive experience. We value your input and encourage you to let us know more about your dining experience at Pacific Catch.

** The following review reflects my delivery experience DURING the COVID-19 pandemic. ** Yes, I know it's a chain, but I noticed that quarantine conditions have made me less persnickety about what businesses I choose to patronize. By and large, I'm just looking for healthy fare, and if it's seafood, all the better I say. I happened to notice the $17 Asian Chimichurri Salad with Grilled Salmon on their menu and was immediately intrigued. Could it be a cross-cultural collision with no eyewitnesses to assess the damage? Fortunately it was more of a melting pot concept with the traditional Argentinian sauce given an Asian makeover with a miso dressing. It consisted of a bed of mixed organic greens mixed with quinoa, roasted cauliflower, avocado, cucumber noodles, tomato, edamame, and daikon sprouts with a hearty salmon filet on top (photo:  bit.ly/3mfBcmS ). That was quite a creation, nicely presented and it hit the necessary flavor buttons. That could have been enough, but I indulged a bit more and ordered the $9 Elote, a trio of Mexican-style corn cobettes made decadent by a creamy butter laced with lime juice and caked with cheese (photo:  bit.ly/3iuxvYk ). Who wouldn't love that? So much for healthy fare. Maybe it should be called Pacific Catch & Release. FOOD - 4 stars...very well put-together dishes, that's for sure AMBIANCE - n/a...this one's in the Marina...I can imagine the "vibe" but this was a delivery  SERVICE - 4 stars...certainly prompt enough with no spillage  TOTAL - 4 stars...no pain from this chain RELATED - Looking in the Marina? Here's a collection of places I've tried and reviewed:  bit.ly/2HyFdzC

After looking over the for about 15 mins to base our order all around the calamari with one of the few places with it in the area at 11am. Call and of course. "They no longer have the calamari!" REALLY?! That's the one item you should've never lost. And be professional and remove it from your menu. And quit with the bate-&-switch

Hello Sodro- We promise we love, love, love calamari. Â I am so very sorry you spend time deciding on Pacific Catch...only to find we were out of calamari. Â We have been super challenged with finding sustainably-caught calamari. Sustainable squid is currently in low supply, with an increasing demand. Â While our commitment to 100% sustainable seafood can leave us out-of-stock some times, the calamari issue is impacting our guests the most. Â We promise to return calamari to our offerings as soon as we're able to get the good stuff in! Â Again, sorry about our miss here. Â Thanks for this opportunity. Â Be well, Shawn Brady, Operations
Amazing shrimp ceviche!!  If you download their rewards app you get a free shareable. Â We had coconut shrimp and they were great too.
Thank you Kristin M. so much for your 5 star review! We are glad you enjoyed your experience and we hope to see you again soon, -The Pacific Catch Team
Nice lunch spot by Golden Gate Park. Cute outside tiki area. Had a the Pupu lunch special and some drinks. Nice variety. Now very filling, but I think it's intended to go with other items.
Dear Anthony N.,  Thank you for your 4 star review. We are glad you enjoyed your experience at Pacific Catch. We hope to see you soon.

I was slightly disappointed with my meal, as were my coworkers who ordered here. I got the regular size which is $19. That in itself is quite expensive. I got half greens and half rice and they gave more like 3/4 rice which was very dense and soft. They gave a plentiful amount of shrimp, which was great! But the forgot the avocado AND MISO DRESSING. This is a salad. How do you forget the dressing. They forgot it on two other salads too. The Asian herb chimichurri was good but the whole thing was bland due to lack of dressing.
Hi Lexy, Thank you for your review. We take all feedback into our future decisions as we look to improve and hope to do better if you choose to dine with us again. The Pacific Catch Team

I was really pleasantly surprised by this place - how good the food was, how well it was prepared, the portion sizes, everything. I would love to try this place again!  I got the poke sampler and Korean bbq plate. The poke was OK- the quality of the fish was good, but it really didn't travel well via delivery. It was next to a hot dish and it came lukewarm to me which I didn't like. I also didn't like that there was too much "filler" ingredients - lots of seaweed and less fish. The Korean bbq plate exceeded my expectations. The steak was really perfectly medium rare and super tender, the portions were huge, the kimchi rice tasted surprisingly authentic, and it was just awesome overall. Same criticism here though, there was too much "filler" - in this case, way too much Brussels sprouts and could've had more steak.  I'd love to try their other dishes or get the bbq bowl again, it was really good!
Dear Jane D.,  Thank you for your 4 star review. We are glad you enjoyed your experience at Pacific Catch. We hope to see you soon.
35-45  mins

Honestly, AMAZING food! Pretty fast service and really good chicken. Been here quite a few times and every time the food is great. Only reason I give it 3 stars is because of the poor service. Cashier was rude and rushed us around, I don't remember her name. This happens every time I come here. They are usually pretty busy but come on, a little customer service would help them out a lot.

So glad I found this place while walking by to a haircut one day. The area isn't the greatest so I really like how the storefront is just covered in graffiti; it seems fitting. I'm always a fan of Korean-Mexican fusion going back to the early days of Kogi in LA, so was excited to check this place out.  Aria mostly focuses on fried chicken, and they do it really well. I got the Homies, which is basically a sampler of all their tacos. The regular KFC was solid, with 2 huge pieces of chicken that the tortillas could barely wrap around. The GFC was supposedly spicy but it wasn't really at all, which was a letdown, but the gochujang flavor was good. Lastly the bulgogi taco was my favorite, with the beef very tender and flavorful. I could do without the cheese on the tacos, but that's a personal preference. I definitely recommend this sampler dish for your first time - it's plenty big to fill up even someone with a big appetite.  Only reasons I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 are the lack of spiciness in the GFC and the tortillas, which were not memorable and mostly disintegrated due to the huge pieces of chicken.

Honestly, I wanted to give this place a second chance before I wrote my review, but I regret even trying Aria again. I wish I could give this place 0 stars. I just can't see what people like about this place. I don't even know where I should begin because I am so overwhelmed with disappointment! Nothing I tried is good here! It was such a waste of money.  Let's start with the chicken. I had many pieces where they were just 90% batter. Where did the chicken go?! Why is the chicken all boneless?! Boneless is nasty. The bones help retain the moisture in the meat. This chicken was dry as heck. I'm talking like almost as dry as the desert, sand paper, beef jerky.. you name it. Look at the color of the soy garlic from the first time and then the second time. They are so inconsistent. How is it that the second time they made it, it's SOOO much darker?! I didn't even bother touching the other fried chicken and tossed it out, because it didn't look good at all. What a waste of food and money.  The kimchi fried rice was so plain and boring. There wasn't a whole lot of flavor. Some sesame oil and sesame seeds would be a great addition for flavor. Also, look at how I received my rice! It is all clumped up!! Furthermore, look at the closeup photos I took. There is a spot in the rice where it has no flavor at all. They did not prepare the kimchi fried rice properly. Where is there a spot of plain white rice? Why is the fried rice clumpy like that?!  I would recommend this place to anyone and I would rather tell people to steer clear of Aria. This had got to be the worst Korean food ever and I am always honest with my reviews. If management wants to speak with me, I would gladly provide my feedback because they could use a lot of improvement.  Like seriously, how is clumpy rice and dry as heck chicken acceptable?! In what world is this okay?

I purchased the soy garlic Korean fried chicken, which came with 10 pieces. The price is fairly reasonable. Note: if you order through a delivery app, you will notice a price increase. My colleagues and I ordered through Doordash.. they did not separate our orders and just combined it. You would think they would take extra safety precautions during this Coronavirus pandemic. I was expecting to have my own box to eat out of, but luckily I have my Tupperware. There really should be an option to separate our portions of the orders. Literally 3 orders were combined into two boxes. So we each counted 10 pieces. The chicken itself doesn't have a whole lot of flavor, it's just salty. It does come with a soy garlic sauce, but I found the sauce to be quite sweet. The batter on the chicken is actually quite thick and didn't have any crispiness to it at all. I'm actually quite disappointed. The dish doesn't even come with Daikon radish. All the other korean food places I've ordered from include Daikon radish. I'm also really not a fan of boneless fried chicken. The chicken wasn't juicy at all. The chicken does smell good, but it just wasn't for me. I doubt I'll be ordering from here again.

We order DoorDash from here pretty often. Portions are always huge and prices are good! There was a lot of meat on the bulgogi fries, but I wish it was warmer, but that's an easy solve.  The veggie kimbap wasn't as good as it used to be.. but I might just be picky.  Lastly the kfc with sweet and spicy sauce is always good! We eat it for dinner. Lunch the next day. And a couple pieces left the day after.

I live close by so I had to check out the hype. I went here a little late and there was an insanely long line. If you're going here I'd reccomend putting in an online order because it took us about 40-50 minutes to get our single order of fries. The fries were subpar. I was really expecting something to stand out like some type of unique delicious sauce, unique fries, or a damn good meat on top. It was more like plain oil flavored crinkle cut fries, probably some tapatio sauce, and cheese, meats. Something that didnt seem made in kitchen so in not sure why it took so long. I don't blame the cashier/chef guy because he was super accommodating to all of the delivery people and those who got the wrong order.  I saw another couple with the fried chicken and it looked amazing, so I might give this place another try for that fried chicken. The line was also a little confusing. People were crowding the front entrance so you think that they're in line to order, only to find out you have to order online anyways.
Bulgogi fries are FIRE. Perfect ratio, combination of flavors etc... just try them if you're in the area

After our hike in Marin, I wanted to grab a quick snack before dinner. I decided to give this place a try. Bulgogi Fries - the bulgogi has more of a sweet taste than savory and there were a number of pieces that were a bit hard and dry. I wish the cheese was melted completely because it would've made it better. Â There was this kimchi like liquid sitting at the bottom and it made are fries pretty soggy.  I think their kimbap might be better to order because fries were disappointing.

I ordered delivery through doordash and OMG I am truly wow'ed by the GFC bowl and kimchi. This is the first time I tried Aria. It is delicious!!!!! Â It is sooooo good and the kimchi is the best I've had, so fresh!!!! Mmm I don't want it to be finished lol I got the soy garlic chicken with rice + egg and one dumpling.

Love this place. Absolutely taste-smacking chicken (I prefer the chicken with sauce cooked in), generous portions, family-operated. Can't really go wrong here - honestly my go-to party dish with friends because it's so large, delicious, and shareable. Honestly, that's all there is to it. Get Aria :)

Stumbled upon Aria Korean Street Food pre-pandemic and was blown away after the first bite. Serving up some mean Korean chicken with bold flavors, they have easily become one of my favorite spots to eat in the area.  Located in the lower Nob Hill area of San Francisco, Aria Korean Street Food occupies a cozy shop to feed their patrons. As with most places in that area of the city, diners are subject to find street parking if you plan to come in to order. However, during the pandemic we've ordered online and have always received our food in a timely and great condition. This doesn't surprise me since pre-pandemic when we've come in to the shop, the service was impeccable - friendly, patient, and efficient. This only complements the excellent food making Aria Korean Street Food a memorable and tasty choice when that chicken craving hits. My husband and I love the Gangjung Fried Chicken in the Garlic Soy Sauce and the Korean Mexican Street Tacos (the "Homies" is the best sampler of what they have to offer).  If you're on the fence or craving some Korean chicken, there's no need to look further because Aria Korean Street Food has got you covered. Already dreaming about my next visit!
35-45  mins

Came here before covid for dine in. Amazing food with great presentation! Definitely instagram-worthy. We got the combo A which included everything from bulgogi bibimbap, spicy ramen to 2 types of fried chicken. The flavored ones are definitely better than the non-flavored ones.  Downside was the place was a little small and could only sit 3-5 people so expect long wait time on the weekend. Bulgogi bibimbap 5/5 Korean fried chicken 4/5 Gangjung fried chicken 5/5 Spicy ramen with sunnyside egg 5/5

SERVICE Did takeout via Yelp/Grubhub. Service was a breeze--food was even early. They provided our food in a bag with chopsticks but no napkins. Not that big a deal, didn't realize till after we left. FOOD Portion size given it being considered a "specialty" food spot, was surprisingly heavy, big! That's always a plus side, can feed a few mouths with just one order or several meals haha. Definitely order rice with these because super rich. We ordered the Gangjung Fried Chicken, Bulgogi Fries, and Mandu glazed. All pretty good....not sure if anyone has mentioned the *interesting* flavor of the bulgogi fries.
