Not to spoil anyone's visit here but my friends and I all thought the same thing--let's just say if you've ever had too much to drink and it didn't set well with your stomach...it's an all too familiar smell and taste. That's not hate on the food, I'm only being honest lol it wasn't necessarily bad, but something of the flavor was just reminiscent of something that should be unpleasant. Not totally sure how I feel about it, but probably won't order the bulgogi fries next time  PARKING It wasn't a very busy street at least when we went, didn't have trouble finding a spot to pull over and park for a few minutes to grab food and/or eat in the car.

Make any excuse possible to just go for it and get the Family pack. Grab a friend, SO, or anyone and get the family pack to try a variety of chicken and bulgogi options. For $40 for 20pieces of chicken and bulgogi Kimbap this is a great deal. I ordered through an app so I cannot comment on the physical space of the restaurant. Meal: Korean Fried Chicken- 9/10 Solid crispy yet juicy on the inside fried chicken strips. They are boneless and I preferred to eat them without any additional sauces. Gangjung Fried Chicken- 7.5/10 Similar to the fried chicken but premise with a sweet and sour tangy sauce. The sauce was pretty good but the texture of the chicken got a little too soggy for my taste. Bulgogi Kimbap- 7.5/10 Essentially a Korean style sushi roll with vegetables and bulgogi meat on the inside. Originally I wasn't a fan but ended up heating the roll up and enjoyed it a lot better that way! Price: $40 for the family pack, I split with 2 people total and it was enough for 2-3 meals, great deal!

I know one of their main locations is in SF, but I am so glad they have a pop-up right now in San Jose! I ordered through DoorDash and it's probably one of the best choices I've made so far this week. I ordered the bulgogi taco (not pictured - was too hungry to snap a pic LOL) and it was packed! They are pretty generous with their portions! Would definitely order again and try their other tacos. I also ordered the bulgogi kimbap and again.. portions are generous!! I requested to get chipotle aioli dipping sauce on the side and *CHEFS KISS* the sauce gives it a tiny kick but so much more flavor. I think the kimbap came with about 20 pieces as well! So definitely shareable. Everybody raves about the chicken wings etc. and it's something my boyfriend and I have to order next time whether we're in the city or comfy in our home in SJ!

Got some more food for takeout from here and was super satisfied with the fried chicken and gyozas! I ordered through UberEats.  Fried chicken with soy garlic: The fried chicken was still crispy when it arrived and the garlic soy sauce was on the side. Decent portion size! Super good, would recommend. Will definitely get again! Mandu: I got glazed Mandu with the sweet and spicy sauce! It was also still crispy even though it was drenched in sauce. Also not bad, might get again.

Was really craving kimbap and this definitely satisfied that craving! The rice to toppings ratio was good, and the toppings were seasoned well. It came with a sauce on the side - I got the Chipotle aioli which was an interesting pairing that I hadn't tried before.

I ordered this through door dash and all I can say is WOW. I wasn't sure what I was in the mood to order but an acquaintance suggested Korean street food when I listed my options. I'm so glad they did and I am so glad I found this exact spot because the food is absolutely amazing. Let me preface this by saying I have never before had Korean street food and for this to be my first experience it was absolutely perfect. The portion sizes were great, especially for the prices that they had listed, all the food I ordered I honestly wasn't sure if that would feed me and the other two adults in my household but it fed us and we had leftovers for the next day for all three of us. Â I really wanted to order quite a few items just to sort of get a sense of the menu and the flavors which is why in my photos you'll see I have a bunch of food lol. I ordered: Bulgolgi fries: like the Korean version of asada fries which is what I am used to. This was such an interesting twist that I would absolutely buy this again. The fries were cooked perfectly they were nice and tender and fluffy on the inside. Not to mention just the size of the fries that they give you are really big, not small skimpy end pieces or anything. The meat on top was nice and tender and juicy, the sauces they use were so interesting, it was this combination of sweet and savory and it just meshed so well all together. They really do an outstanding job on these fries.  Kfc rice bowl: This was actually the last thing I tried and I was getting a little full when I tasted it but it was still absolutely delicious. The rice is nice and fluffy and they really stuffed the bowl with it, the chicken is crispy and juicy on the inside, the egg on top is my favorite because I love putting a Frided egg on top of rice I think it really complements each other. They also included a couple potstickers which was interesting because I thought it was chicken so when I bit into it I was a little surprised but their potstickers are delicious so it really just went together smoothly.  Bulgolgi kimbap: I am so so so glad I ordered this! It was my absolute favorite. Think sushi with the Korean twist to it, instead of your typical seafood they use the same tender meat they do on the fries, and they put fermented radish I believe inside. Let me just say that the fermented radish may sound a little funny if you are not used to it but having tried it, I am absolutely counting down the days until I order this exact roll again. It's so refreshing and filling at the same time because of the rice, but it also gives you that full without feeling heavy feeling which I really love.  Gangjung fried chicken: WOW, crispy exteriors with juicy and tender interiors. They cook this to perfection. I would say more but there's only so much you can say about chicken, as far as the sauce is though you absolutely have to try them to really understand the full flavoring. I did try them but unfortunately I'm not familiar with the ingredients that go into them so I cannot perfectly describe them yet. Savory would be a good basic description though! Fried mandu: Think potstickers. Nice and crispy exteriors and thoroughly cooked while remaining juicy interiors. Absolutely perfect.  Overall the food here was absolutely delicious, the price point was what I wish i'd pay at other places local to me and I will definitely be ordering from here again!!

Tiny hole in the wall, we almost walked right by it. We were there on a Saturday at lunch time and while the food took a while to come out, it was really yummy! We got the Korean fried chicken with the sauce on the side (sweet and spicy and the spicy aioli) and an order of the bulgolgi kimbap. The chicken wasn't dry and the breading was nice and crunchy. The kimbap was flavorful and fresh.

Second time doing online pickup through Doordash for their San Jose/Oakridge Pop-up location. First time around, the boneless fried chicken were amazing. Chicken was soft and juicy. The right amount of sauce. This fried chicken was different than the other Korean Fried Chicken locations in the South Bay.  Second time around, sloppy. They filled up the Korean fried chicken so much sauce that it spilled into the box. Spilled into the box, spilled into the to-go bag.  Tip: If you plan on ordering two orders of Korean fried chicken, I suggest sharing with 3+ people. Korean Fried Chicken becomes too salty after eating one order.

Ordered online and went for pickup. The lady that was at the window seemed like she was in a rush and asked me to repeat my name three times over, maybe it was a rough day for her, I don't know, but I won't hold that against the food. When we tried the food (we ordered kimbap and tacos), we were underwhelmed. Flavors were not very complex, typical sweet and tangy sauce which was fine but I was expecting more based on the Yelp reviews and pictures. Kimbap pieces were stuffed with rice making it tough to eat. Tacos were on plain flour tortillas which didn't seem like they were heated up at all. Overall, we had higher expectations and the food/service didn't live up to them.

We ordered: * Aria Combo B = KFC 10 pieces, gangjung (glazed) fried chicken 10 pieces, 2 rolls of bulgogi kimbap and 3 homies taco sampler (KFC, GFC, bulgogi).  * Bulgogi rice bowl = bulgogi on white rice, fried egg, kimchi and a fried dumpling.  Both the KFC and GFC was crispy, juicy and delicious. I liked eating it with the chipotle aioli sauce. The menu says combo B serves 4 but I think it can feed more like 6 people. The chicken tacos were packed with big pieces of chicken and lettuce. However, I did not like the bulgogi in that taco or the rice bowl. It was dry and kind of bland.  Ordering online was simple and pick up was ready on time. There is only a pickup window at the door so there's no dine-in options. I thought it was weird that they didn't have chopsticks but we took our food two blocks down to Sergeant John Macauley Park for a fun mini picnic.
35-45  mins

Tl;dr great tacos Great tacos in New York, the line moves quick, the toppings are delicious, and most importantly the meat is juicy and flavorful. The portion for one taco is pretty good and I was able to taste every ingredient, a true testament to a great taco.  My only gripe is the price. I'm used to $1-3 for a taco and these start at $4 but for New York that's not terrible I suppose. Definitely would come back again.

Really good tacos!! They're a little pricey ($4-5 each) but tasty. The line can be long but it moves fairly quickly, and the kitchen staff are super sweet.  I wasn't expecting such good tacos outside of (southern) California, let alone Chelsea! Having lived in CA my entire life, the best tacos I've ever had were in San Diego and little mom and pop taco trunks in Oakland. The tacos here at Los Tacos are almost comparable but the prices here are probably at least x2 as much as tacos normally go for in CA.  Their menu is straight to the point and no frills: you have a choice of meats + nopales being the vegetarian option and can decide between tacos, empanadas, quesadillas, or a nopales plate. You can also choose whether you want guac, onions, pinto beans, and/or cilantro. After placing your order with the cashiers, you get a print out which you give to the kitchen staff. They'll ask you what you want and prepare it fresh for you. I love that you can look into the kitchen -- things are always being cooked on the stoves and pork is cooked on a vertical rotating spit. There is no question about the quality of food. I wanted to try their nopales plate with pollo asado (~$12-13). Came on a base of cooked nopales, with a scoop of pollo asado, guac, onions, cilantro, and beans. I added pico de gallo, lime, and salsa later. So good!! Tldr; would come again if I was the direct Chelsea area, but given the price per taco, I've also had better at hole in the wall places.

REALLLY GOOD TACOS!! I had the chicken tacos and it was amazing, very well seasoned and strong flavors. I do wish they did give me more toppings on the taco but overall good amount of food for the price! I also ordered the "especial" which i fell is not well highlighted on the menu because there is no description for it. It is kind of like an empanada that they fill w the meat of your choice and some other toppings. Really yummy!! Overall really great spot in Chelsea market, would want to visit again in the future!

Pretty good taco! The lines are pretty long but it is worth the wait. After placing your order, you take your receipt to the line and they make the tacos for you. I ordered the carne asada and the al pastor. Carne asada was flavorful and tender. Al pastor...probably the best ones I have eaten so far. Holy moly! Get the al pastor, you wont regret it. Its sweet and spicy...just yum Pass the horchata. Not sure if i got a watered down batch that day but it was just not good Beware of the medium and hot sauces!! It was so spicy so be mindful and put little by little haha dont be like me where i just dumped it all! My mouth was on fire!!

Not my first time here but oof, still as good as ever especially eating it while it's still warm  There's a wait time but it goes by quick enough and definitely worth the wait!  I got 2 pork, 1 steak and 1 chicken to share with a friend. They aren't big but definitely packed with good flavor so 2 tacos did the job for me. I wasn't even hungry yet but the first bite brought back my appetite, ugh I'm salivating as I think about the taste.  I thought I would enjoy the pork as I did once before but it was more mediocre than I was expecting, still good though. All those toppings of guac goodness and what not was perfection. Now for the steak or chicken, both looked the same but, I think I ate the steak because the meat was on the charred side and oh my Jesus, that was heaven.  DIVINE I would have typically avoided any hot sauce but it was already on the taco when served. That was a good move cause the dash of hot sauce gave that kick making all the flavors dance on my tongue Even as the prices steadily rise for the tacos, it's still such a good treat to have. GET IT!

Totally craving these tacos as I write this review!  Tip: Grab a beverage to enjoy while you're waiting in line! There's a bar right next to it, and you can also visit the wine shop around the corner (they have individual pre-packaged alcoholic drinks). You need a mask to order a taco!  Service/Ambiance: Super popular and located inside Chelsea Market. You will order at the register first and then bring your ticket to the counter on the left. Help yourself to the toppings/sauces! There's usually always a wait here, so prepare yourself. I did come once right when it opened, and there was already a line. There are tables outside that you can sit at and enjoy your food. Â  Food: choice of corn or flour tortillas (love the corn). Be sure to get the con todo (all the toppings - onions, cilantro, salsa, and guacamole)! Adobada (marinated pork) is definitely my favorite meat choice as it was delicious, juicy, and savory. You can watch them shave the meat off as it rotates over the heat. The carne asada (grilled steak) is also great! I know some people complained about the price, but I think it's actually not that expensive for authentic freshly made tacos in NYC.  Overall: lives up to the hype - brave the tourists at Chelsea Market to get your taco fix!

Located in the heart of Chelsea Market, this spot had the longest line of people of any shop and came at the recommendation of a local so we decided to try it. I am so so so so glad we did!  Ordered a carne asada tostada and an abodabo (pork) quesadilla and both were freakin' delicious. This also pumps them out QUICK so line around the market moved very quickly and we had our food lickity split. Tostada was piled high with carne asada, avocado cream, onions, and cilantro. The quesadilla was FILLED with cheese and crispy pieces of pork. Both were dripping meat juices as we ate them, so tender and delish. Topped both with self serve salsa options, including pico and a hot red salsa. Def can't wait to come back and order more tacos!

If you are looking for a quick snack/lunch to grab as you see sites, stop inside Chelsea market for some amazing tacos!! We tried the pollo asado and steak tacos as well as the quesadilla. The quesadilla isn't like your normal Americanized one, but instead it's basically a taco with cheese and sauce inside. All were very good, great quality and quick! I personally wish they had a little bigger menu with either another type of meat for the tacos or a Mexican style salad. Very good food though.

I'm gonna go straight to the point: unbelievably GOOD!!! I've tried 4 kinds of their tacos, loved the chicken the most! They're just perfect. Don't have anything negative to say! The staff is very welcoming, helpful and friendly.  You gotta try this place if you're in NYC. Easily the best tacos I've tried so far!

I feel like I'm missing something, but I didn't think Los tacos was worth the hype. I've had better tacos for less money at hole in the walls, with much shorter lines. The tacos weren't bad; they were just slightly lacking in flavor. I got the nopal and adobada tacos. Neither was that amazing. I also wish they'd been more authentic and given two taco shells. I wouldn't go back. Source: me, a slightly pretentious person who has tried Mexico City street tacos, and died and went to heaven after eating them

A friend recommended this spot and I saw it on one of Yelp's top 100 lists, so we stopped by on our most recent NYC trip.  Inside, it's pretty chaotic. There's a line to order which is normal. After you order, you go to the counter and hand your ticket to someone in a sea of people. They ask what kind of tortilla and toppings you want. Then eventually they hand you your food.  We escaped the madness inside and ate our taco outside. We got the adobada taco on a flour tortilla with all the toppings.  This is one of the best tacos I've ever had. I highly recommend checking them out!

Being not native to NYC, I just had to see what the dealio is with this place having a bunch of raving reviews. I got the carne asada quesadilla and a nopal taco. Carne asada quesadilla: weird-looking quesadilla, but it'll do. Now for the carne asada.....not the most tender carne asada that I've had but man oh man the citrusy marinade. Super flavorful. Didn't even really need the help of a lime wedge. The cheese added a bit of oomph but not an extra-dollar oomph. Nopal taco: I've never had nopal before but was very intrigued about it after seeing all of the nopales being cooked on the grill. Not too fond of the stickiness of nopal (similar to that of okra). If you like nopal though you'll probably like this taco as well. Overall I dig the food here.....but I dooo kinda agree with other reviewers in that the tacos are a bit expensive for what they are (over $4 a piece). Is it fair to say it's cuz it's NYC? Lol idk I'm just a tourist from Cali. I went on a Thursday at 7 pm. Line wasn't long at all and I got my food fairly fast from all of the cooks streamlining their efforts (was also entertained with the main food preparer dancing to the Mexican music blasting at this spot).

WOW love these tacos! Great tacos, super fresh toppings, salty fresh chips. Located inside the Chelsea Market which itself is really fun but can get a little crowded. And the ordering process can be a little confusing. You order with the cashier and they hand you a ticket which you then take to a chef who makes the order and asks about toppings. Then wait for your number to pick up your tacos. This place always hits the spot and will be one of my fave tacos in the city.

If you're in the mood for some mouthwatering, authentic Mexican tacos, then this is your place! From the warm flour tortillas to the tender meat to the fresh sauces - all incredibly delicious! We ordered the Carne Asada Taco ($4.75 each) and Pollo Asado taco ($4.50 each) con todo (includes onions, cilantro, salsa, and guacamole). The steak and chicken were juicy and tender - every single bite was an unforgettable flavor bomb. The simplicity of the ingredients yet the amount of flavor these tacos had is truly undescribable.  Tip: After paying at the register, make sure to hand your ticket to one of the cooks so they can start your order. While waiting, grab some of their homemade salsas they have on the counter along with some lime wedges to squeeze over your tacos! Once you get your tacos, just find a place to sit (or stand) and enjoy!  Los Tacos No. 1 is one of the best if not the best taco spot in NYC! I am so glad to have stumbled upon this place. These tacos truly are fresh, simple, and authentic.

LOVE this place! We were checking out the surrounding area and came across this place. The taco is a bit more on the expensive side, but you pay for what you get! The tacos were larger than usual and they gave a good amount of meat!  The line was long, but it went by pretty quickly. I definitely can't wait to come back!  If you haven't tried this place out.. Do it!!

We went on a Saturday afternoon (around 2 pm) and the line was SO long. The entire hall was crowded full of people. The line moved pretty quickly - I think we waited about 20 minutes? There was nowhere to sit inside or outside so we had to stand and eat the tacos. 2/5 for the experience. Luckily, the tacos are really yummy! I got the pollo asado (chicken) and adobo (pork) on corn tortillas. The tortilla was amazing - soft, simple, with good corn flavor and texture. Both the chicken and pork were very flavorful and not dry at all. I'm a picky eater so I didn't get any of the toppings (onions, salsa, guacamole) but it didn't matter because the meat was so good. And I appreciated that they didn't skimp on the meat. 5/5 for the food.

Best tacos in NYC! The prices have doubled but it's still a great bargain and a guaranteed delicious meal. Â Amazing how busy the food hall still is and how long the line is for tacos. Everything is made fresh in front of us to order.

Some of the best "authentic" tacos I've had. Long lines and the service was not great (our order was lost and the staff didn't acknowledge we were still waiting and kept taking new orders) but despite the LONG wait the tacos (pork, chicken, and carne asada) were all good. Really enjoyed the chips and guacamole too. First time I've given a five star despite the poor service so you know the food was outstanding. Make it a point to go!

The best corn tortillas I've had in a very very long time. I tasted both chicken and pork tacos. Both were perfect, extremely flavorful. With those 2 salsas and the fried , it took the flavor to a whole other level. Lines move pretty fast. Definitely No.1 for me at Chelsea market.

wow.... This is the BEST place in NYC for tacos. I'm a huge fan of Mexican cuisine & I love me some GOOD TACOS & I must say, this place lives up to its hype!! It's best to believe the rumors that there's never NO line, haha. It's pretty long... but it goes relatively quickly so..no worries hungry fellow foodies :). I ordered the Adobada Taco, Carne Asada Quesadilla (toasted), Carne Asada Taco, Chicken Quesadilla & the Pollo Asado Taco. My goooooodness, they were all so DELICIOUS! I think my favorite was the carne asada quesadilla (the flour tortilla is toasted). It almost reminds me of a Crunchwrap supreme (which I LOVE) from Taco Bell. There are nice little self-serve stations on the bar for some fresh limes, radish, and 3 salsa flavors. If you're stuck debating whether or not to come try this place out... stop. Do yourself a favor, and just do it. You won't regret it, trust me :).
Start your review of  Cafe Habana .

We were both craving for Cuban food so we decided to make a trip to visit cafe habana and it was definitely worth the trip! We got the  1.Cuban Sandwich with fries 2.Caribbean Style Citrus Marinated Roast Pork Plate Served with rice & beans 3.Grilled Corn -Cafe Habana's Famous corn Mayo, Cotija Cheese and Chili powder served with a lime wedge 4. Toastones & Guacamole - Fried Green Plantain with our House Guacamole & Garlic Mojito I didn't have a favorite, everything was delicious and I enjoyed every dish!
Linda, Thanks so much for your comments, we really appreciate that you took the the to visit us! Hope to see you soon!

I have been coming here for years 17 in NYC plus before I lived here and it's always been excellent, today it was not good, we ordered 2 Cuban sandwiches and corn the corn was good but only 1 piece for $6 when the photo on the menu had 2 pieces. The sandwiches tasted ok but wet and not crispy the fries were under cooked we won't be coming back Edit Jose I won't be coming back $45 and still hungry, there are plenty of other options why would I waste my money again ?
Huw, Â thanks for your feedback, we will work to make your next experience a 5 stars review.

Shopping in the neighborhood and everyone was getting a bit hangry and we found this on Yelp. Â  Well worth the two block walk! Â   Corn is unbelievable! Â Beans and rice were tasty. Â Pork was excellent. Â Only thing that was not a complete hit was the shrimp tacos, though they were good our crew preferred the pork or plantain. Service was quick and friendly.
Thanks Rob, We hope to see you soon!

Came here and got a pork platter, Cuban sandwich, and Mexican street corn.  Pork platter: Didn't feel too special. What you'd expect. Nothing really stood out but it wasn't bad Cuban sandwich: Tasted pretty good but bread was really hard to chew! I thought that my teeth was going to fall off :( also found a strand of hair in my sandwich. Told the waitress and she just said sorry really fast.  Mexican street corn: The star of the meal! Honestly soo good. I saw lots of people coming here for just the corn and they know what's up!!
Thanks Nina, we work to make your next visit a 5 stars experience!

Cafe Habana has been my go-to place for Cuban street food. Â Even after moving away from the city for many years, I continue to find my way back here over and over again for its grilled corns. Â If one says that these corns are to die for, it may not be too far from the truth. Â The grilled corns are so packed with flavors with the cheese, spicy powder, cream, and lime juice covering them, and the flavors really mingle well with the sweetness of the corns. Â I've had grilled corns when I went to South America. Â Ironically, they weren't as good cuz the corns there weren't sweet! Â  While I've definitely made trips where I only got the corns, this time we also got the Cuban sandwich, a frozen margarita, and a Mexican coke. Â The Cuban sandwich was solid - packed with flavors from the half-fat, half-lean pork's juice and cheese, and satisfies and fills the belly. Â I got the "abandoned" frozen margarita this time - the woman picking up her order before me claimed that she never ordered one and refused to pay for it. Â The bartender turned around and served it to me when I ordered one lol. Â I didn't mind and, tbh, completely expected that he'd do that. Â But it gives you a good idea that this is definitely a cheap-eat place, not a high-end restaurant. Â  They have 4 or 5 tables set up outside with coverings that would protect you from the rain. Â Definitely a good option in addition to their indoor seating in the midst of the ongoing pandemic.
Thanks Jing, we love your review!
We have visited NYC four times and each time we have gone to Cafe Habana. Their Cubans and corn are the best. They also have great service.

Please bear in mind that I have visited Miami. I have tried Cuban sandwiches there and am well aware that anything outside of Miami or Tampa will never be the same. It is like comparing New York style pizza to anything outside the New York/New Jersey metro area. You are not going to get that experience no matter how hard you want it. Now I cannot speak for the rest of the menu, but for $14, I got a decent, but not superb Cuban sandwich. The bread, while an authentic Cuban baguette, needed to be a bit more sweet (but not too sweet, as then it becomes a medianoche), the pork is succulent and flavorful, the ham is tasty, but you do not taste much of the mustard or Swiss cheese. In fact, it almost has a bit of a tangy taste to it. The pork needs a bit more bite, otherwise it would have been perfect. It comes short of being a great sandwich, instead it settles for being only a good one. Maybe that is a reflection of the rest of the menu. Good, but not great.
Matthew thanks your your review and feed back, we will work to be great for you in your next visit!

Reading other Yelpers reviews here it seems the must get item is the Â Mexican Street corn, so that what I got because Â for mew if you don't Â got street corn you don't got me coming. Â  The verdict is the Â corn is good, especially if you looking for some of the corn being Â charred. the cheese-mayo sauce is tasty and the lime that comes with it Â will give it that extra kick. So far nobody beats my favorite street Â corn from NJ's Tacoria, but if I am in Habana's hood they are good Â enough for me to do an other.

**Rating: 3.5 stars I stopped by the restaurant on a Friday morning around 11 AM and it was empty. Therefore, ordering and getting my food was a very quick process.  The restaurant has a very old school diner vibe. The server at the counter was friendly and efficient at getting my order.  I decided to get:  --CUBAN SANDWICH: With the way the sandwich is advertised as the best Cuban sandwich in NYC I definitely had to order this. The flavor of the sandwich was delicious - a great mixture of meats, cheese and delicious bread. It was also a great size as well. The main complaint I have though is that the pulled pork that came in the sandwich was slightly dry and did mess with the texture of the sandwich a bit. However, apart from that it was a solid sandwich.  --SHRIMP TACO: The shrimp are plump, juicy and bursting with flavor. The taco itself is stuffed with ingredients and definitely a great taco. The only issue is that the corn tortillas are very flimsy and absolutely disintegrates as soon as you take a bite. It would have been better if it came with two tortillas instead.  --BAJA FISH TACO: Also lots of ingredients stuffed inside the taco but not as good as the shrimp taco is. The fish itself was quite bland. Additionally the tortillas were also very flimsy and would have been best if it could come with two tortillas instead of just one.  --RICE AND BEANS: The beans were too dry and rice was just ok. It could have used slightly more flavor. Just average.  --MEXICAN STYLE CORN: Delicious. A must order.  All in all, though there were some hiccups with certain items I can definitely see myself coming back here the next time I am in the area. Thanks for a nice lunch!

Came for the corn of course. In the past I'd have grabbed a Cuban for the road as well but the way my Celiac is set up . So someone do me a solid and have one in my honor. Other Fam favorites Beer Battered Catfish, & Abuelita's Marinated Skirt Steak. I would have taken a photo but I ate it to fast and simply forgot. But if you haven't stopped by for at the bear minimum the corn DO Â IT Â YESTERDAY !
$10  min
60-90  mins
Start your review of  Cafe Habana .

Great spot for cuban food located in a convenient spot in lower Manhattan. I got the fish tacos and they were really good. 2 fish tacos but comes with rice and beans. I also got their Mexican corn on cob and it was soo good here. Cheese and corn what's not to like! My boyfriend got the Cuban sandwich and he really liked it!

I was really excited to try this place out as my friend raved about how good the cuban sandwich is. I went with the same friend spring 2021 and my friend said the sandwich just didn't taste as good. So maybe something changed with the restaurant food quality during COVID, idk.  The meal was fine but nothing to write home about, and not worth the trip to it unless you're very nearby. Nothing about this meal was spectacular. I got the Cuban Sandwich and Pulled Pork. The sandwich bread was soggy and just tasted like a lot of deli meat in a panini... it lacked more texture to make the sandwich really stand out. The pulled pork was just okay, and the rice with the pulled pork was cooked with too much water.
Thanks Lenny K.. If I see you again  Best mojitos in town? Check out the spot around the corner for corn on the cob.

This spot is real chill and good energy. The staff is amazing from Rosemary,Michelle, and Azuia(I know i got her name wrong, but the st.Vincent woman. They're so nice and so courteous to your needs. The food is always well cooked and tasty!  They're famous for their corn. I've even brought my dog here, and Michelle and Rosemary provided me food for him.  I will def visit again
Thanks Gregg, thanks for your review! We hope to see you soon!

Vaccine cards are ask for at the door only if your dining in ! With its Â cute old school Cuban style setting has some amazing tacos and well known for there corn and Cuban sandwiches (which I had to bring home for my husband) And as always when going to a new place I ask the host what is her favorite and she selected the tacos amongst other things On this day I got two tacos 1 shrimp and 1 fish which u have the option of adding rice and black beans to for about $16.00 and change also got two mango margarita which was absolutely delicious $10 for a small and $14 for a large. There menu is very simple and easy to look at. My lunch Â was great because I'm a small eater had to take the rest home now remember I said there famous for there Cuban sandwiches so a lot of customers were ordering them to go and I had to get one to go and boy was it on point!!! It's a must try!!! Service was fast and accommodating .Definitely heading back for lunch!!!!
Thanks of taking the time to gave us a review, Dacia, we really appreciate it!

Small spot. Always busy. But they have a walk-in location right next to the restaurant and only like 2 tables. Not many options like the restaurant though. I got the chicken street tacos and street corn. I really liked both. I don't think it's out of this world but it's definitely good especially if you are on the run while shopping or walking around soho. I would also rank it as affordable.
I like their spicy cucumber margarita. It is so good.  The waitress is good as well. It is located in soho. Very good location.
Came here for a quick snack since it was right by our AirBnB. We didn't order much except for chips and guacamole and drinks. Everything tasted decent and I enjoyed the atmosphere.
This place has gotten terrible. Living off the past from 10 years ago. Really sad service and food. Don't come here. It's filthy inside and rusty (and not in a charming way).
Thanks for your feedback Tj, we will work to make your next visit a 5 stars review.

Tried their grilled corn on cob and it was so delicious! The seasoning is loaded with flavors and even though I only got one corn, I felt pretty full by the time I finished it. It was probably the best Mexican corn on cob I've had! I've tried other things on their menu like cuban sandwich which was also heavenly. I think the corn on cob and the cuban sandwich are definitely must-get items from here. Seating area is pretty limited as the restaurant itself is tiny!
$10  min
60-90  mins
Wonderful service, outstanding food, had the best experience. Gustavo definitely played a part in our great time here. So grateful and had an incredible night.

We came here for a quick bite before an off-Broadway show. It was busy on a Saturday night but there was plenty of room at the bar. They were playing fun top 40, Latin, and dance music.  This restaurant has a great selection of tequila and mezcal-based drinks, as well as sangria. I ordered the Toloache margarita. It was very fruity with hibiscus and blueberries. It didn't taste like a traditional margarita at all, but it was flavorful. I wish I'd had more time to savor it. My sister got the mezcalita de pina and said it was tasty, but not very spicy. The flavored salt around the rim combined really well with the drink.  To eat, we shared the guacamole. We asked for it to be made spicy, but it was quite mild. The portion size was also a bit small for the price. Nevertheless, it was super fresh with satisfying chunks of avocado. It came with a chipotle salsa which had a nice kick and was great for mixing into the guacamole. The food arrived very quickly which we appreciated as we were in a rush. The bartenders were nice. I'd love to come back to try the rest of their menu.

Came here for dinner before a Broadway show and the place was bumpin! I can imagine they are probably busy everynight with people trying to catch a meal before heading off to the theaters near by...  MAKE RESERVATIONS!  We're lucky we got inside seating, seating outdoors seems pretty cold and the food would be cold as soon as it leaves the restuarant! We were tucked upstairs, in a corner, next to the railing. Get ready to get cozy, there's not much elbow space if you're seated upstairs. The lights are dim and the room is loud. Our servers were attentive and refilled our waters, cleared our tables without us asking.  The food: We ordered the "Bacalao Trufado" - Â fillet cod decorated with truffles on top, and "Camarones Toloache" - shimp on a tostada drenched in their homemade salsa. Both meals were delicious... but I don't think the shrimp was worth the price. We also ordered the guac trio, one traditional, one spicy, and one with fruits! (Never heard of that one before!) If you're feeling adventurous, I'd say go for the trio, but if you decide not to get it, you're not missing out either!! I'd definitely just stick with the original if I came back!  We didn't get to try desserts because we were in a rush but next time I come back, we're definitely gonna order some!!

First time at the Times Square location Â  Â   They had cute heated houses on the street that we choose to sit in  We got an order of guacamole which was fresh and not spicy I had the short rib quesadilla that was very good but small portion Â  Â My friends had chicken quesadilla which was much larger and tons of chicken The margaritas are fresh and go down smooth Â  Â  They have tons to choose from

Toloache is a great option if you're not particularly hungry. We ordered the shrimp quesadilla and the Pollo Toloache, and while both dishes were very tasty, the portions were small.  The quesadilla feels like an appetizer, and the Pollo Toloache is an entree for a not-so-hungry diner. The former has a little spice to it, which added to the tastiness. The latter felt refreshing, in large part due to the corn and salsa.  To be fair, the service was very good, and the indoor area is very pleasant.

Craving some Mexican fare? This place had really tasty and attractively prepared food. Our servers were attentive and cheerful. (It's a little hard not to get their attention because our table for 2 was next to the kitchen entry and it was a single lane two way path.) Their popularity is evident by the number of patrons in their 2 levels and we were pretty packed in there. So if you want some yummy Mexican food and a robust crowd, this is the place for you!

I'll admit to being very picky about Mexican restaurants, having grown up in Southern California. My experience with Mexican restaurants in New York City has been nothing short of abysmal. So I was prepared for the same here, particularly when the salsa showed up and was something closer to cream of tomato soup. But then the short rib tacos with bone marrow arrived, and things changed completely. This was one of the best items I've ever had in a Mexican restaurant, and could easily have been served in many of the top fine dining small plate restaurants in the city. I'm not sure this one item fully justifies the four stars, but since the guacamole, Margarita, and ceviche were fine, it's at least a 3-1/2 star place. Just be sure to have the short ribs.

Randomly walked in after seeing a show nearby. Didn't have a reservation but they sat us at a little bar section. Didn't really have any expectations going in and it turned out to be an excellent experience! Service was a smidge slow but they were pretty busy and we were sitting in kind of a random place. We had a couple cocktails one which had full pieces of hibiscus inside. Both delicious and quite unique actually. Had the mild guacamole for an appetizer. Chips were fine but the guacamole was quite good. Very creamy and you can see them making it from scratch at the back of the main seating area. Had the yellowtail ceviche. Was nice to have a ceviche without shellfish so my partner could try some. Fish was fresh and the whole thing was presented very nicely. The standout of the dinner was the chicken breast. Super juicy and came with a fantastic corn salsa on the side. The sweetness of the corn just perfectly complemented the chicken and it was incredible! There was a bit of a draft through the door for where we were sitting, not sure why they couldn't close the door. And there is only 1 bathroom for the first floor so there was always a line. But otherwise the food was excellent and very different from the usual mexican fare of most places. Check em out for sure.

Being from Los Angeles, I've had my fill of great Mexican restaurants. But, it's always great to check out a different interpretation of some of my favorites.  While the tortilla soup didn't have the "kick" I was expecting and was a bit too much like tomato soup for my taste, the carne asada tacos were excellent. You get 2 per order and they have that street taco taste and look. My gorgeous date had the shrimp tacos and I thought those were even better.  The Caesar salad was fresh and our friends ordered chips and guacamole for the table. The salsa was just ok but the guacamole was some of the best I've had.  It was quite loud and very packed even for an early dinner on a Friday night. The service was excellent and we were able to get out of there quickly to catch a concert at MSG. Subway line is literally right outside the door.

This was a great lunchtime find in midtown. The guacamole is every bit as good as past reviewers reported. Great value to taco selections coming with rice and beans during lunch service. My lechon tacos had an extra crunch texture and flavor due to bits of chicharron! The shredded chicken enchiladas was flavorful with accompanying subtle smoky sauce. Classic light and crunchy churros with both caramel and dark chocolate dipping sauces concluded a value packed midday meal. Will bookmark this eatery to patronize on my annual Big Apple visits!
$15  min
50-60  mins

The inside of this feels very ornate, great date spot, and service very friendly. We were seated immediately on a weeknight around 6:30. We got a seat on their balcony. We ordered the chips with guacamole and mild salsa and ceviche. The ceviche is served on a taco, tasted alright. Then we ordered the pork tacos and the short rib. The short rib taco was probably the best taco I've had in a longgg time. The flavor profile was dynamic, taco stayed intact the whole time, perfect amount of stuffing. Pork taco also delicious but less memorable. Overall thought every piece of food was great!

Went for dinner with friends last week. It was a warm night so we sat outside in one of the little cabins, which was nicer than being on the sidewalk (lots of street noise though, still). All the food was good, from the guacamole to the fish tacos (we had lobster and some other fish). But I think the portions were a bit on the small side, especially for the prices. The chocolate crunch cake was really good! The staff was so so. They brought our entrees while we were still eating our guacamole, so we weren't ready for them. And they weren't all that attentive after they brought the food.  I'm always on the look out for good Mexican and I'd go back. But maybe better service inside.

This review was tough because the drinks were good, the ceviche tasting was VERY GOOD, but the paella was SUPER overcooked and the Carne Asada was nearly inedible. It tasted weird and just came with a weird cheese enchilada and potatoes (?!). Maybe we just got the two least favorite entrees on their menu, but I wish we had just gone with appetizers.
Great place with delicious drinks . The guacamole trio was delicious and they serve it with warm crispy chips . The employees are very friendly and efficient! Highly recommend it !

The food was soooo good that I forgot to take pictures. We went thinking it was going to be a regular Mexican restaurant, but it was more on the upscale fancy side. We didn't have a reservation but they still got us a table within 5 minutes.  Appetizers are more of a single serving appetizer, don't expect to be sharing with others. Food portions were just right for the price.

Food was just ok. Everything was pretty bland. It looked pretty good. Service was not great. Server didn't check on us at all once the food was delivered. No offer to refil drinks. Â Our guacamole had an odd taste and color and when I asked about it the server simply said that was how it was supposed to be.

Horrible service. I've never been to a restaurant and had to wait almost 45 minutes for a glass of water. I understand it's short staffed everywhere but if it's that short, don't open up every table you have in a restaurant! The food wasn't even worth the wait for, the portions were tiny. My friend ordered the quesadilla and I ordered the hamachi ceviche- both looked like a kids meal with it's tiny portion- didn't even taste good. To top it all off, when our waitress decided to collect our bill, we gave her 5 credit cards and asked her to split it 5 ways and she said she could-then she came back saying we only gave her 4 cards and she "missed" the fifth card that was in one of the pockets and couldn't redo the transaction. Do not recommend!!

Good Mexican place with good cocktails, food and deserts. We loved everything we ordered (see attached photos) except the tortilla soup. Cocktails, quinoa paella, veggie enchiladas borrachas, and two deserts were yumm!!

Made a reservation for the weekday for 7pm. I literally live one block away and got here right before my reservation time. The place wasn't that busy at all. They told me to wait a bit while they get their ish together and find my reservation. A couple walks in and immediately demands to be seated because they have a reservation. I'm a little peeved by this because I was obviously standing in line with the hostess and this couple ignores me. Whatever, chalk it up to the white privilege and colonizer mentality. But she served them first? Unacceptable.  They decided to seat us in the worst location possible. On the street, where there's heavy foot traffic and where the sun is blasting into my eyes while it sets. Waited for my friend who promptly showed up afterwards. We sat down and caught up real quick, but one of the waiters came over and rushed us to order something. We just sat down and didn't even get a chance to look at the menus. I won't lie, I'm definitely guilty of never being ready to order and am mindful of this. But I also don't like being rushed and always ask for a few minutes. But something you haven't seen someone in a long time and want to catch up. He came back again and asked within 2 minutes. Unacceptable once again. I got the Carne Asada, though pretty pricey, I assumed it would have been pretty good by the amount of reviews and the waiter recommendation. I would agree that it's pretty good, but not $35 good. My friend asked for a recommendation and the waiter suggested the Tacos. My friend then asked about portion sizes and spiciness. He's Lebanese, so he loves spice and wanted to get full. Neither accomplished. He wanted to order more food but we were already having a bad experience with this place that we didn't want to give them more money. Overall, definitely a miss. I'd skip it. Could be a one-off experience though, so keep that in mind

Favorite gourmet Mexican spot in the city- been coming here for years. Cocktails are solid, delicious, and bartenders are wonderful! Try all three guacamole's- each has a unique flavor and because it's guac so why not have more... Their tacos, particularly the bone marrow short rib, are absolutely amazing (and worth the $$)- every bite an explosion of flavor- you won't regret ordering this. We drive into the city looking forward to eating these because we've never eaten better tacos anywhere else (Los tacos no. 1 are also good, but not made with bone marrow which is the star ingredient in these tacos).
$15  min
50-60  mins

I haven't been here in a few years, but was really glad I stoped in today. Â  This spot has always been tiny, but you can see. Ganges due to covid restrictions have taken place. Â So be warned, seating is super limited and they are requiring proof of vaccinating to dine in. Â  Mint lemonade was awesome! Tortilla were a little over done today... but honestly the quality of their tacos is so good that your tastes buds over look that.

This place it tiny and hidden in China town. Â It's a well worth the stop. I've come here for one thing and one thing only, their fish tacos. Â They are the best fish tacos I've ever tasted. The fish isn't over cooked, it's served with a slightly spicy sauce, avocados, and pickled onions (and I'm not a onion person), but this is perfection!!! Their mint lemonade is a perfect companion!

We only got the breakroom fries here because we wanted a quick bite before Blood Manor, and it HIT THE SPOT. Exactly what I wanted my loaded fries to be - crispy and soft, sufficient cheese and meat bits, with the fried egg on top. They also have maybe a hundred hot sauce bottles (ranges from mild to super hot) inside, although there's probably only like 4-5 kinds.

This fantastic gem tucked away down Baxter st. packs a serious punch for greasy comforts. Â  When you walk in it's a little tight, but that just makes it all the more cozy when you throw down their juicy burgers. Â I usually get the signature Double Breakroom Burger with a side of Breakroom Fries... both are out of this world. Â Here's the descriptions straight from the menu. Double Breakroom Burger: 6oz Patty, Crispy Pork Belly, Tempura Onion Ring, Sunny Side Egg, Jalapenos, Lettuce, Tomato & American Cheese Breakroom Fries: Seasoned Fries, Tater Tots, Sunny Side egg, Bacon, Pork Belly, Cheese & Jalapenos You honestly can't go wrong with anything you see on the menu, just be sure to grab a friend and a fistful of napkins, you'll thank me later.

Mint lemonade was bomb- perfect balance between sweet and refreshing flavors. Most lemonades I've tried are too sweet. This one isn't. As for the rib eye steak sandwhich, the meat is well seasoned and cheesy. Very nicely wrapped to ensure the product doesn't get cold. The only thing wish could be better was the bread- the inside was too bland, not the typical hero bread I usually eat. Otherwise this is great place for a quick bite.

One of the best taco joints in the city. The best fish tacos I've ever had! The crispy and tasty texture with the aioli. The break-room fries are a must if it's your first time here. Honestly I wish I opted for the taco trio because amazing. Also the heavy hitter in the room is the lemonades. Just go ahead and get the large. I got the passionfruit lemonade and it was the perfect mixture--not to sweet. I'm definitely going back here for sure.

Great "bar" food place. This place offers hispanic food such as tacos or quesadias with your choice of meat as well as burgers amongst other variety of similar style foods.  I would give 5 stars if everything was perfect, the only item that wasn't that good was bacon wrapped hotdog. It was as advertised, but I think a thicker/juicier hotdog similar to Sam's Club would taste better. This one was dried out and didn't yield much flavor to the dish. This is the only bad experience of the place!  As for the good, that covers the costumer service, food, and inside. The person at the register was very helpful in explaining different food and even provided to bring food out to us. There was seating outside and inside (which is small, but give the ability to look outside).  The tacos and burgers were amazing, they weren't greasy, but are messy to eat. Lastly, the variety of hot sauces for the spiciness fan is quite large in comparison to other places. I think I counted around 7 or 9 different sauces. (Try the garlic one!)
was okay but nothing too memorable

Breakroom is a neat little spot in Chinatown for fresh tacos. Expect their service to be iffy, but they make good on their 3 mix-and-match Taco Platter. Most popular is the Tempura Fish. Batter is nice and crispy, though the fried fish can feel a bit heavy and even bland. I'm an avid fish 'n chips fan, and prefer more zing from tartar or malt vinegar. At Breakroom, I just end up being very liberal with their lineup of hot sauces instead! Grilled Steak taco is nicely charred, but also straightforward. It comes topped with only pico de gallo. Good taco, but not astounding. Cheesesteak is another popular ooey cheesy one, and Pork Belly was highly lauded by my friends for its crispy bits, so I'll have to try that next time. I also enjoy the Breakroom Fries, a combo of fries and tater tots loaded with some good and deadly stuff. Cheesy, carby, bacony fun to devour. Mint Lemonade is refreshing, sweet, and full of minty goodness. It pairs well with my (self-induced) spicy tacos. Lesson learned, be careful of all the hot sauces lined against the wall. They'll draw you in, then turn around and burn you!

Really solid tacos! I got the break room fries and a fish taco. I have been going to this place for years but not often, to be honest the prices are wayyy too high. $10 for fries and $4 per taco. It's a good place to eat just not very often and a treat yourself moment.
Website and Yelp said they were open until midnight. Â Walked almost 3/4 mile and arrived at 8:45pm only to be told they were closed. Â Who closes at 8:30 on a Saturday night in NYC?

Finally able to get here. I had the 3 tacos platter. Very good tacos. Fish taco  Cheesesteak taco (melted cheese and sauce) Fried prom belly taco (great crunch) They had a bunch of hot sauces as well. I will try their burgers next time.

I've been eating from break room for a while ... at this point this review is way over due .. a co-worker Â referred me this place she said " the tacos are ridiculously good " and even that wasn't the best way to describe tune tacos ..  I only have the fish tempura tacos and they are extremely light and flavorful, Â not grease at all , no over kill on the special sauce they use either .. most definitely hits the spot each time Â the fries are good as well .  This place is usually crowded so i advise you call ahead , when they are operating Â during regular business hrs , i placed a online order it only took approximately 35 mins for Â the food to be ready Â . The staff are super friendly as well . GOT MY VOTE AGAIN AND AGAIN

Always wanted to try Breakroom since I've heard about it so often, so I decided to pop in and pick up the Breakroom fries. I wasn't able to compare an experience to anything since I've never had it, but the fries were severely underwhelming. It boasts pork belly and bacon, and when you hear pork belly, you think tender, fatty, tasty. But the pork belly I got looked like it was double fried and re-fried, and it was crispier than some of the bacon itself, on top of it being super dry. It did lack taste, in which the cheese and spicy Mayo (I think?) made up for.  The fries itself were also quite crispy. The only thing that was decent were the tater tots it came with, since those weren't actually over-cooked. On the other end of the spectrum, the sunny side egg was under-cooked, with egg whites still running.  At this time, I'm giving it 3 stars since I wasn't able to try out the full menu yet, since I know they're more known for their tacos, so I hope to return and try those out and hope for a better experience. Â  This review was based solely on the fries, which I hoped would be better :/

The tempura tacos here are outstandingly tasty, and the fries are famously good.  Do yourself a favor and get the pork belly while you're at Breakroom -- you can thank me later. (And believe me -- you will.) Our entire meal was really good and came quickly after we'd ordered. The entire staff was really nice. (I can see why this place has a cult following of sorts!)

I came here with two of my friends after a long day. The food was really good and I think it's pretty cheap compared to other places in manhattan. I got the three taco platter and I chose the carnitas, fried pork belly, and chipotle chicken. The tacos were amazing. It wasn't too much or too little so when you ate it it wasn't messy and just the right amount of food in your mouth. They were pretty juicy too. I also got the chili cheese fries and that was bomb as well. The fries were crispy and it had a lot of flavor. My friends got the burger and they said that it was good as well. Â I recommend getting the three taco platter since two tacos was enough to make me full. They also had outdoor dining but it's pretty small so I sat inside with my friends where it was a three seater.

This is the perfect late night bite and/or burger taco joint on a budget for NYC prices. The flavor is packed and stacked high in the break room burger and you can't go wrong with the tacos as well. We got the fish tacos and it was light and fresh. The Chipotle chicken taco is also great. The burger is definitely the highlight and the combination of the onion ring, egg, and juicy burger definitely hits the spot

Breakroom is the perfect joint in Chinatown for late night munchies. Â  + Breakroom Fries: a pure work of genius- loaded tater tots and fries with cheese, pork, fried egg, bacon, and green onions. Â You can thank me later ;) + Breakroom Burger: beef patty with pork belly, fried onion rings, a runny egg, jalapeÃ±os, and all your traditional burger fixings. Â It will get soggy in the take out bag and it will be a mess to eat, but you'll scarf it down anyway. Â How could you resist that fatty goodness?

The young worker today at 7pm did not greet me Or my party when we walked in.  when I asked him about dine in or take out he didn't give me a response or make anyone feel welcome. Suggested we dine in but didn't offer a menu or anything , lead us to sit.  Then juicewrld was playing... while I'm a fan it was specifically songs about overdosing which I don't feel is appropriate music as it can trigger people to loved ones who've passed away. "All my friends are gonna die young" , to which he also didn't say anything. I then walked out because I was now having a negative experience

It's a little bit difficult to locate and with all the other restaurants around it you might get distracted, but because I was craving tacos. Tacos it was. The tacos are very tasty also depending on what kind of meat you get. We got 2 Taco platters, so got to try out 6 tacos. Â The fish taco, the spicy pork were my 2 favorites.  -1* because the guac that came with the chips and guac wasn't really guac.

My friend Jordan and I both were FAMISHED by the time we came crawling to the entrance of Breakroom. It was time for a break, indeed!! I went for the chopt cheese sandwich and he went for the chicken sandwich. I can't speak for his sandwich since I haven't had a bite, in respect to COVID-19 and respectful hygiene, but I will say his sandwich didn't look too shabby. As for my chop cheese, well, you already know how it goes - it was MIGHTY FINE!!! Portions were substantial and I appreciate the diversity of hot sauces they had to offer. It's not too different from the lineup of hot sauces Hot Ones on youtube likes to offer, only in that their options are limited to 4 and don't have you crying for milk by the end of your meal. The only thing I would like to see in the future is the QR code at the door for access to a virtual menu and possibly the option of a sandwich + drink as a combo as you would see in a fast food chain. Alas, I realize this is a mom and pop shop and so perhaps what I'm asking for is merely a pipe's dream and probably won't materialize as it is more expensive to run an individual business. Thank you Breakroom for a delicious meal!! My friend is Southern and if you've impressed him, there's something to be said!! We will be back for sure.

Those nachos were worth trip alone!  Carne Asada Quesadilla was full of flavor and fresh.  Elotes are offered on the cob or off which is great when you want to share or keep your hands clean.  Next time I'm in the city I'm going back. It's just too tasty! And this is coming from a picky eater/non-foodie.

Rosa Mexicano is a massive restaurant that may be too loud for some, perfect for others. One of the challenges is to secure the waiter's/waitress's atrention, but once you do the service is good.  We thought the shrimp tacos were well made but $10 for two tacos was a little expensive, considering the tacos weren't out of the ordinary. Our entree was the pollo adobado al carbÃ³n with carne asada, which comes with Chihuahua cheese. The cheese is fantastic, and the sauces that come along help make the meats moist. It is a bit of a costly dish too, considering the relatively small portion, but we were relatively content.

Came in for a quick happy hour drink before meeting up with some friends. I was interested in the mini frozen margaritas they had for $7 (though to get a large for $12 is it really a deal), and they had a bunch of fun flavors to try out. I went with a blood orange and then got a mango after. The blood orange frozen margarita was so insanely tart but still tasty, maybe mellow that out? If it was just a little less tart (like I'm not making a face when I taste it) it would have been amazing. The mango frozen margarita was great! Highly suggest ordering this flavor if you like mango. Not too sweet.  Took off another star for the fruit flies this place has by the bar. For some reason someone on the decorating team thought it would be a good idea to have random fruit/veggies in a bowl they don't use on the bar. I actually had to ask the bartender to move the bowl near me to get the bugs away.

Went here expecting a nice cold marg but their beautiful bar from outside fooled me because they don't have their liquor license yet. Gorgeous interior and kind staff, it's definitely a very popular spot. The guac was kind of bland, though nice that it was made fresh in front of us. The quesadilla was nothing special and other Mexican places definitely make a better, more impressive ones.

We came here on a Saturday afternoon for a break after a long day. We sat down and waited and waited for someone to come over. The restaurant wasn't busy but we sat for awhile waiting for our food and drinks to come. We had ordered multiple rounds of drinks and food but, the waiter was no where to be found at times. He did appear quickly when we paid and collected the check without even clearing out the table. We ordered every single taco off the menu and we found the shrimp taco to be our favorite. Its a little spicy but, super delicious. My friend loved the margaritas and wants to come back to get more. The place has decent food but, mediocre service.

I been to this location a few times in the last few years including, their other location near Lincoln Center. We came here recently for brunch with some friends. RM has a decent brunch deal. They have a handful of brunch dishes and $20 unlimited drink deal with a purchase of an entree.  I ordered churros french toast ($11) and thought it was tasty. My friends thought it was too sweet but, I thought it was fine. The only thing I would change would be the "syrup". It was a berry honey infusion. Personally, I would have a dulce de leche sauce or caramel instead. I also wish that they included more fruit on top of the french toast because I was still a bit peckish after consuming. My dining partners got sopes benedict ($13), torta de desayuno ($13) and huevos rosa ($13.50). Â Everyone enjoyed their dish and thought they were delicious I wish the brunch menu had more items including more vegetarian dishes. I did enjoy eating here as their brunch menu was more affordable than their normal menu which can be costly. The service was okay and our server rarely stopped and a few times we sat there waiting for more water.  This restaurant does charge a 3% COVID recovery fee on each check. They do offer free chips and salsa along with a fan favorite skillet of cornbread.

I really love it here. The ambiance is gorgeous.. perfect for a casual lunch OR if you wanna dress up for a fun birthday celebration. The booths and huge and beautiful and I've been 4 times now and the food has been consistently good (as well as the drinks) I feel relaxed and warm here in a weird cozy way. Does this make sense? No complaints. Great service. All the right stuff here.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon for brunch. Waiter serviced our table very well, food was great, drinks were great! We had the tacos de heuvos and churros trench toast. The latter was definitely a huge dessert and the tacos was amazing. They have $20 bottomless brunch and a wide selection of flavored drinks. Frozen mango margarita was our favorite!

One of my new favorite spots for bottomless brunch! For under $40, you can get a delicious meal and unlimited frozen margaritas, sangrias, and bloody marys.  I ordered the churro French toast which has a crispy cinnamon outer coating which a light and fluffy interior. With it, I ordered a pomegranate frozen margarita, strawberry frozen margarita, and white sangria. All were delicious!

I've been to Rosa's a few times but not since the pandemic. I was excited to see how things changed since. The food is still as amazing. The service has gotten better but could be better. I came mid-day and we were a party of two. We ordered a coco mojito and a Margarita. We got guac for the table. It was absolutely delicious. We also ordered two sets of falutas. Also a order of octopus tacos.  The drinks were both really good. The Margarita was frozen. It was delicious and really cold. My sisters cocomojito was really good as well. The guacamole and chips are a MUST. The salsa they give with the complimentary chips are also really good.  The flautas are really good. We got them stuffed with chicken. They are covered in different sauces which some are more spicy than others. Theres a green sauce. A white sauce and a mole sauce. They were SO good. Lastly the octopus taco. I didnt care for it. It was sort of dry. It needed something creamy. The grill marks from the octopus came be overpowering and need some acid, something.  I cant wait to come back. I want to try more items on the menu.

Best part of this upscale Mexican cuisine establishment is the atmosphere, almost chic. Â Our group had variety of drinks, most enjoyed options of creative margaritas. Â The choice of apps & entrees were OK - but not aspiring or memorable, ...kinda average
50-60  mins

First dinning experience post vaccine mandate and it was successful. Walked into Rosa and they requested our vaccine proof..2 of us were vaccinated and 2 of us werent so we sat outside...(we had no issue with that because outside is a vibe) sidewalk seating had Â tables with bright red chairs and great service our waiter Benjamin was funny, made recommendations and was attentive. We had chips with salsa, a order of guacamole and happy hour margaritas. The flavors were great mango, strawberry and pomegranate. They were so good we ordered full size (well we had to it was already 615..lol..happy hour is from 3 to 6).  Ok so now the real reason im reviewing, we came to participate for resturant week but started the party early. Rosa's menu was well balanced with Â food choice so we decided to try a bit of everything. Our starters were good, shrimp cocktail in a citrus sauce with avocado, tomato and cucumbers. The relleno was good also. The suef and turf was delicious however my rice was a bit grainy. The shrimp and steak were prefectly cooked. The grilled portobello with impossible chorizo was a hit as well. For dessert we tried the banana pie and the guacamole sundae...both got devoured b4 i could capture a picture. Overall we had a great time, its lively, festive and eating outside gave us the room to be loud and enjoy.

Been to this location several times pre and post pandemic. Food and service is good. Best to make reservations in advance if possible especially during prime dining hours...  During pandemic dining, one member in the party to leave their contact info in case there was need of contact tracking, scan bar code for the menu. Once the city went back to full capacity, servers provide the menus once again. Beverages: Wine, sangria, margaritas, non-alcoholic beverages...you decide. Food to share: Guacamole (pick your level of spicy), chips and salsa Pulpo Cerviche - grilled octopus  Camarones - a bit too spicy for me Grilled skirt steak tacos - a bit spicy for me Pan-seared cod - delicious and highly recommend Dessert: Tres Leches - muy delicioso and highly recommend Churros - they are small and come with raspberry and chocolate dipping sauces - was ok

Another hit! the stars was all about the food. I ordered ceviche and a shrimp & rice dish. My apologies for forgetting the correct name however, I was very happy. The service was ok. I sat outside and it was a little too much going on for me with lots of pedestrian traffic, car honking, dogs barking and the hard smell of marijuana floating across my nostrils every 5 minutes. I got high off contact a little bit. But back to the food... it was really good.

Long overdue update. This is a reliable place and they always deliver on drinks, food, and service. They are also great for post pandemic because they are diligent and their inside seating area feels more spacious and airy. Recently I enjoyed their pomegranate margarita and vegetarian quesadilla. Both were excellent.

I pass this place all the time but never stopped there. So glad I finally for a drink with a friend. We didn't do happy hours. I don't know if it is authentic Mexican. We got some nachos which was tasty. I ordered a mezcal which was fantastic. My friend ordered a mock tail with mango and liked it a lot. We are planning to bring a larger group of friends.

The outside seating was really well spaced, the staff were really nice and the food was great. The guacamole is always so fresh here and I love the chips and salsa. The grilled fish tacos were fine, a little dry. The street corn was delish and so were the margs.  Always a reliable place when in the area!
New Flatiron high quality and service Mexican! Â I prefer more Mexican heat/spice but that is a personal preference!

Do not patronize an establishment who does not support civil liberties and religious freedoms. No establishment or government has the right to suppress the freedom put forth by God almighty and supported by the constitution. Vaccine mandates are segregation.

We tried this cantina yesterday after much research through Google. I use the term cantina loosely since the restaurant is cavernous. I found that they had a different take by serving foods from various regions of Mexico rather than the standard same old dishes. I opted for the tres enchiladas which were three different ones. Beef, pork and chicken. The beef enchilada was topped with a traditional red sauce, the pork with a green sauce and the chicken had mole sauce. It was fun to have three different flavors and textures on one plate. It didn't have the refried beans or yellow rice that I did not miss a bit. The flavors and spicy bite were winners all around. My SO had the carnitas which was a mixture of braised pork with cilantro, pickled red onion and grilled pineapple. Â Served with handmade corn tortillas. He loved it and left sated. Unfortunately, he didn't wrap the carnitas in tortillas since he claimed that the carnitas were enough to satisfy. I drank a frozen, blood orange mango margarita and found it very good.  It costs a bit more than most Mexican places but quality comes with a price.  The service was excellent and the manager come over to see what we thought of the food.  Oh, and to the people that say vaccine requirements are against their civil liberties and religious freedom I say don't patronize them or sit outside where vaccinations are not mandatory. I am so glad to see this establishment is protecting their clientele. We are vaccinated and will continue to be vaccinated. I will not patronize a place where vaccinations are not required for indoor dining. Vaccine mandates are NOT segregation and they save lives. If your religion forbids vaccinations, cook home and leave the rest of us alone. Sorry to get political...no I'm not.

So I went here last minute mainly because it was surging on seated (app that gives cash back for dining, check it out and use my referral code afshan1 so we both get money). My first impression of this spot was woah it's so large and feels fancy( I was dressed in a tee and jeans) but then I looked around and most people were dressed casual. We sat by the steps - I would say that's the best seat bc not fully inside or on the sidewalk and started with the nachos which were amazing! Then had the salmon and Josefina's Quesadilla to share both which were great. Honestly the quality of food here is great and portion size is average. Only one star off because service was kind of super slow/they sort of forgot about us but was ok since we weren't in a crazy rush and I get that it was dinner rush.

The best part is that it's so spacious! I came for the tableside guacamole, but unfortunately they weren't doing it because of covid, so they just brought it to the table. It was pretty good, just needed some salt. Tacos were decent, I loved the Elote!! Nice service.
50-60  mins

Tl;dr great tacos Great tacos in New York, the line moves quick, the toppings are delicious, and most importantly the meat is juicy and flavorful. The portion for one taco is pretty good and I was able to taste every ingredient, a true testament to a great taco.  My only gripe is the price. I'm used to $1-3 for a taco and these start at $4 but for New York that's not terrible I suppose. Definitely would come back again.

Really good tacos!! They're a little pricey ($4-5 each) but tasty. The line can be long but it moves fairly quickly, and the kitchen staff are super sweet.  I wasn't expecting such good tacos outside of (southern) California, let alone Chelsea! Having lived in CA my entire life, the best tacos I've ever had were in San Diego and little mom and pop taco trunks in Oakland. The tacos here at Los Tacos are almost comparable but the prices here are probably at least x2 as much as tacos normally go for in CA.  Their menu is straight to the point and no frills: you have a choice of meats + nopales being the vegetarian option and can decide between tacos, empanadas, quesadillas, or a nopales plate. You can also choose whether you want guac, onions, pinto beans, and/or cilantro. After placing your order with the cashiers, you get a print out which you give to the kitchen staff. They'll ask you what you want and prepare it fresh for you. I love that you can look into the kitchen -- things are always being cooked on the stoves and pork is cooked on a vertical rotating spit. There is no question about the quality of food. I wanted to try their nopales plate with pollo asado (~$12-13). Came on a base of cooked nopales, with a scoop of pollo asado, guac, onions, cilantro, and beans. I added pico de gallo, lime, and salsa later. So good!! Tldr; would come again if I was the direct Chelsea area, but given the price per taco, I've also had better at hole in the wall places.

REALLLY GOOD TACOS!! I had the chicken tacos and it was amazing, very well seasoned and strong flavors. I do wish they did give me more toppings on the taco but overall good amount of food for the price! I also ordered the "especial" which i fell is not well highlighted on the menu because there is no description for it. It is kind of like an empanada that they fill w the meat of your choice and some other toppings. Really yummy!! Overall really great spot in Chelsea market, would want to visit again in the future!

Pretty good taco! The lines are pretty long but it is worth the wait. After placing your order, you take your receipt to the line and they make the tacos for you. I ordered the carne asada and the al pastor. Carne asada was flavorful and tender. Al pastor...probably the best ones I have eaten so far. Holy moly! Get the al pastor, you wont regret it. Its sweet and spicy...just yum Pass the horchata. Not sure if i got a watered down batch that day but it was just not good Beware of the medium and hot sauces!! It was so spicy so be mindful and put little by little haha dont be like me where i just dumped it all! My mouth was on fire!!

Not my first time here but oof, still as good as ever especially eating it while it's still warm  There's a wait time but it goes by quick enough and definitely worth the wait!  I got 2 pork, 1 steak and 1 chicken to share with a friend. They aren't big but definitely packed with good flavor so 2 tacos did the job for me. I wasn't even hungry yet but the first bite brought back my appetite, ugh I'm salivating as I think about the taste.  I thought I would enjoy the pork as I did once before but it was more mediocre than I was expecting, still good though. All those toppings of guac goodness and what not was perfection. Now for the steak or chicken, both looked the same but, I think I ate the steak because the meat was on the charred side and oh my Jesus, that was heaven.  DIVINE I would have typically avoided any hot sauce but it was already on the taco when served. That was a good move cause the dash of hot sauce gave that kick making all the flavors dance on my tongue Even as the prices steadily rise for the tacos, it's still such a good treat to have. GET IT!

Totally craving these tacos as I write this review!  Tip: Grab a beverage to enjoy while you're waiting in line! There's a bar right next to it, and you can also visit the wine shop around the corner (they have individual pre-packaged alcoholic drinks). You need a mask to order a taco!  Service/Ambiance: Super popular and located inside Chelsea Market. You will order at the register first and then bring your ticket to the counter on the left. Help yourself to the toppings/sauces! There's usually always a wait here, so prepare yourself. I did come once right when it opened, and there was already a line. There are tables outside that you can sit at and enjoy your food. Â  Food: choice of corn or flour tortillas (love the corn). Be sure to get the con todo (all the toppings - onions, cilantro, salsa, and guacamole)! Adobada (marinated pork) is definitely my favorite meat choice as it was delicious, juicy, and savory. You can watch them shave the meat off as it rotates over the heat. The carne asada (grilled steak) is also great! I know some people complained about the price, but I think it's actually not that expensive for authentic freshly made tacos in NYC.  Overall: lives up to the hype - brave the tourists at Chelsea Market to get your taco fix!

Located in the heart of Chelsea Market, this spot had the longest line of people of any shop and came at the recommendation of a local so we decided to try it. I am so so so so glad we did!  Ordered a carne asada tostada and an abodabo (pork) quesadilla and both were freakin' delicious. This also pumps them out QUICK so line around the market moved very quickly and we had our food lickity split. Tostada was piled high with carne asada, avocado cream, onions, and cilantro. The quesadilla was FILLED with cheese and crispy pieces of pork. Both were dripping meat juices as we ate them, so tender and delish. Topped both with self serve salsa options, including pico and a hot red salsa. Def can't wait to come back and order more tacos!

If you are looking for a quick snack/lunch to grab as you see sites, stop inside Chelsea market for some amazing tacos!! We tried the pollo asado and steak tacos as well as the quesadilla.
