The quesadilla isn't like your normal Americanized one, but instead it's basically a taco with cheese and sauce inside. All were very good, great quality and quick! I personally wish they had a little bigger menu with either another type of meat for the tacos or a Mexican style salad. Very good food though.

I'm gonna go straight to the point: unbelievably GOOD!!! I've tried 4 kinds of their tacos, loved the chicken the most! They're just perfect. Don't have anything negative to say! The staff is very welcoming, helpful and friendly.  You gotta try this place if you're in NYC. Easily the best tacos I've tried so far!

I feel like I'm missing something, but I didn't think Los tacos was worth the hype. I've had better tacos for less money at hole in the walls, with much shorter lines. The tacos weren't bad; they were just slightly lacking in flavor. I got the nopal and adobada tacos. Neither was that amazing. I also wish they'd been more authentic and given two taco shells. I wouldn't go back. Source: me, a slightly pretentious person who has tried Mexico City street tacos, and died and went to heaven after eating them

A friend recommended this spot and I saw it on one of Yelp's top 100 lists, so we stopped by on our most recent NYC trip.  Inside, it's pretty chaotic. There's a line to order which is normal. After you order, you go to the counter and hand your ticket to someone in a sea of people. They ask what kind of tortilla and toppings you want. Then eventually they hand you your food.  We escaped the madness inside and ate our taco outside. We got the adobada taco on a flour tortilla with all the toppings.  This is one of the best tacos I've ever had. I highly recommend checking them out!

Being not native to NYC, I just had to see what the dealio is with this place having a bunch of raving reviews. I got the carne asada quesadilla and a nopal taco. Carne asada quesadilla: weird-looking quesadilla, but it'll do. Now for the carne asada.....not the most tender carne asada that I've had but man oh man the citrusy marinade. Super flavorful. Didn't even really need the help of a lime wedge. The cheese added a bit of oomph but not an extra-dollar oomph. Nopal taco: I've never had nopal before but was very intrigued about it after seeing all of the nopales being cooked on the grill. Not too fond of the stickiness of nopal (similar to that of okra). If you like nopal though you'll probably like this taco as well. Overall I dig the food here.....but I dooo kinda agree with other reviewers in that the tacos are a bit expensive for what they are (over $4 a piece). Is it fair to say it's cuz it's NYC? Lol idk I'm just a tourist from Cali. I went on a Thursday at 7 pm. Line wasn't long at all and I got my food fairly fast from all of the cooks streamlining their efforts (was also entertained with the main food preparer dancing to the Mexican music blasting at this spot).

WOW love these tacos! Great tacos, super fresh toppings, salty fresh chips. Located inside the Chelsea Market which itself is really fun but can get a little crowded. And the ordering process can be a little confusing. You order with the cashier and they hand you a ticket which you then take to a chef who makes the order and asks about toppings. Then wait for your number to pick up your tacos. This place always hits the spot and will be one of my fave tacos in the city.

If you're in the mood for some mouthwatering, authentic Mexican tacos, then this is your place! From the warm flour tortillas to the tender meat to the fresh sauces - all incredibly delicious! We ordered the Carne Asada Taco ($4.75 each) and Pollo Asado taco ($4.50 each) con todo (includes onions, cilantro, salsa, and guacamole). The steak and chicken were juicy and tender - every single bite was an unforgettable flavor bomb. The simplicity of the ingredients yet the amount of flavor these tacos had is truly undescribable.  Tip: After paying at the register, make sure to hand your ticket to one of the cooks so they can start your order. While waiting, grab some of their homemade salsas they have on the counter along with some lime wedges to squeeze over your tacos! Once you get your tacos, just find a place to sit (or stand) and enjoy!  Los Tacos No. 1 is one of the best if not the best taco spot in NYC! I am so glad to have stumbled upon this place. These tacos truly are fresh, simple, and authentic.

LOVE this place! We were checking out the surrounding area and came across this place. The taco is a bit more on the expensive side, but you pay for what you get! The tacos were larger than usual and they gave a good amount of meat!  The line was long, but it went by pretty quickly. I definitely can't wait to come back!  If you haven't tried this place out.. Do it!!

We went on a Saturday afternoon (around 2 pm) and the line was SO long. The entire hall was crowded full of people. The line moved pretty quickly - I think we waited about 20 minutes? There was nowhere to sit inside or outside so we had to stand and eat the tacos. 2/5 for the experience. Luckily, the tacos are really yummy! I got the pollo asado (chicken) and adobo (pork) on corn tortillas. The tortilla was amazing - soft, simple, with good corn flavor and texture. Both the chicken and pork were very flavorful and not dry at all. I'm a picky eater so I didn't get any of the toppings (onions, salsa, guacamole) but it didn't matter because the meat was so good. And I appreciated that they didn't skimp on the meat. 5/5 for the food.

Best tacos in NYC! The prices have doubled but it's still a great bargain and a guaranteed delicious meal. Â Amazing how busy the food hall still is and how long the line is for tacos. Everything is made fresh in front of us to order.

Some of the best "authentic" tacos I've had. Long lines and the service was not great (our order was lost and the staff didn't acknowledge we were still waiting and kept taking new orders) but despite the LONG wait the tacos (pork, chicken, and carne asada) were all good. Really enjoyed the chips and guacamole too. First time I've given a five star despite the poor service so you know the food was outstanding. Make it a point to go!

The best corn tortillas I've had in a very very long time. I tasted both chicken and pork tacos. Both were perfect, extremely flavorful. With those 2 salsas and the fried , it took the flavor to a whole other level. Lines move pretty fast. Definitely No.1 for me at Chelsea market.

wow.... This is the BEST place in NYC for tacos. I'm a huge fan of Mexican cuisine & I love me some GOOD TACOS & I must say, this place lives up to its hype!! It's best to believe the rumors that there's never NO line, haha. It's pretty long... but it goes relatively quickly so..no worries hungry fellow foodies :). I ordered the Adobada Taco, Carne Asada Quesadilla (toasted), Carne Asada Taco, Chicken Quesadilla & the Pollo Asado Taco. My goooooodness, they were all so DELICIOUS! I think my favorite was the carne asada quesadilla (the flour tortilla is toasted). It almost reminds me of a Crunchwrap supreme (which I LOVE) from Taco Bell. There are nice little self-serve stations on the bar for some fresh limes, radish, and 3 salsa flavors. If you're stuck debating whether or not to come try this place out... stop. Do yourself a favor, and just do it. You won't regret it, trust me :).

Favorite taco spot in Manhattan. This place isn't meant for lingering. Rehearse your order before you reach the register, let the assembly line workers know what type of tortilla you want and def ask for con todo/everything on top.  New to me was the accoutrement bar. My first visit here was during the peak of the pandemic when indoor dining was banned so seeing the salsas and radish was a delight. My brother, who has lived in ATX and San Diego, was a fan.

We enjoyed our quick lunch at Los Tacos No. 1 near Times Square. It was really cold and windy so it was nice to have a moment out of the wind.  Once you place your order and pay they give you a ticket. You move down the line and hand the ticket to a person behind the counter. You'll be asked if you want flour or corn tortillas and if you want them the way they come (onions, salsa, cilantro, guacamole). The guacamole is more of a guac sauce than actual guacamole. Very delicious. We also ordered the chips and guacamole. It's about a 1/4-1/2 cup of guacamole, the chips were really good. Not too thin, they hold up when you dip the guacamole and that is what I want in a chip;). There is a sauce bar where you can find pico and assorted sauces. I didn't get a picture of those but you'll see them in other reviews. I didn't add sauce to my taco because I wanted to taste the flavors as they are originally in the taco. I had the Jamaican tea and it was good, I didn't really want a soda or water so it hit the spot. Not too sweet but had a good flavor, slightly fruity flavor.  We each ordered tacos and I have to say the chicken taco was full of flavor. You can tell that they didn't just cook chicken and add spices. It takes time for the flavors in that chicken to fully incorporate. One of the best tacos I have had.  It's standing room only, I sent my family over to watch for a spot while I ordered for us #divideandconquer and that worked out alright. I wish we had tried the Chelsea Market location because there are tables there since it has more of a food hall situation going on....nonetheless it was a delicious quick lunch Â and I'm glad we were able to give it a try!

Sadly, I don't have pictures because I ordered them to-go and was super careless about carrying them around... anyways, I would say the flavor of these tacos are on par with LA tacos! It just hurt me a little bit on the inside that I could buy 4 LA tacos for the price of 1 NY taco Â But still worth trying!!  The adobado tacos are a little salty and didn't have as much filling, but they still tasted great. The carne asada tacos were my favorite -- super flavorful and a equal ratio of meat to tortilla in a bite. I tried my friend's nopal taco and it was surprisingly good! I liked the crunch of the cactus, but I wouldn't say it's good enough to get again. It's a good vegetarian option though!

Mexican Taco Magic! Whatever you do, make sure to order at least one taco with the cheese tortilla. Basically, instead of a corn or flour tortilla, the taco toppings are served over a tortilla made from grilled cheese!! Amazing!!

Yumm this taco place does not disappoint which is clearly reflected in the reviews. Ordering is a relatively straight through process, and they make Â your order right in front of you. I ordered one of each of the asada, pollo, and adobada. They were all good, but hands down my favorite was the pollo. So freaking delicious!  There's places to eat here, but they are counter style, and you stand. It's pretty busy during the lunch rush, but well worth it!

Following popular opinion, this place is a quick and convenient stop. They have a small menu, which helps with the speedy service, though it still covers the basics and with the cactus, offers something for adventurous foodies. Even the customizations (tortilla and toppings) are kept simple. Prices are a bit high for tacos, but I'll contribute that to a mix between quality ingredients and COVID prices. What I Ordered: Pollo Asado Tacos (no cilantro)- the chicken was pretty juicy and well seasoned; onions were raw as anticipated; salsa was spicy (not expected); guacamole was creamy. P.S. Does anyone know if they make tortillas in-house?

Walked by this location and decided to get 2 tacos as a quick snack - the space is very bright and clean, with tables you can stand and eat your food. The tacos were amazing as usual, especially love the adobada!! Will be back!!

Finally got to try these in person!!! Long line but totally worth it. So reasonably priced and it comes with all the toppings like guac! Their salsas are HOT! I loved the verde and the red one was good as well. So many flavors going on. Super happy and will be a regular spot i return to when I visit nyc!

I know a good taco when I eat one. These tacos were it. Maybe some of the best I've ever had. We did delivery through Uber eats and while the tacos didn't taste that fresh, I could taste the potential and the flavors and that's why they deserve 5 stars. I really enjoyed the carne asada. The flavors were great. I like that the tacos were also loaded with guac! I didn't really like the cactus taco. Not really my thing I guess. I wish they had given us salsas such as verde. I like how the packaged the horchata. Looked kind of funny but Â very clever to avoid spilling! I definitely want to try this place fresh some time, I know it'll be amazing!
Great tacos!!! Pork tacos were amazing!!. Quick and easy place to get tacos ( in and out ) 5 bucks a taco. Reminds me if 5 guys was a taco place.

Came here upon the recommendation of a friend. Coming from Texas, I was exposed to some of the best tacos there is to offer. Some of the best I've had were served out of a broken down food truck in a middle of a parking lot where the staff only spoke a few efficient words of English: flour, corn, cilantro, onion, cash only. So when I came here, to this English-speaking brick and mortar location, I was thinking, "This probably won't be as good as those late night taco truck stands in Houston." I would say that this was a pretty great experience that rivals the upper tier of good tacos in Texas. This is basically a take-out place. There is some room outside with standing tables but expect this to be a walk-and-eat situation. I got the adobada quesadillas with corn tortillas and it was pretty good. It was basically an open faced taco with cheese for a dollar more, so I don't know if the cheese was worth that extra dollar. However, price point aside, the taste was pretty good. Savory and rich. My server gave me an extra dollop of guac without any addition charge so that was pretty clutch. I don't remember it being spicy and so I think it could definitely benefit from a touch of heat. I wouldn't say it's the best tacos I've had but I would say it is still a pretty good one. Definitely come here if wherever you are from aren't known for their tacos - if that's the case, this place is pretty good for you. 4/5 stars.

Delicious and fast street tacos near Times Square! They make the tacos right in front of you, and it's fast. I ordered one Carne Asada taco and one Pollo Asado taco. Both the corn and flour tortillas were good, but the flour were my favorite. Make sure you get them "Con Todo" - with onions, cilantro, salsa, & guacamole. This place has counters where you can stand and eat.
Delicious tacos just like Tijuana mexico . Handmade Flour or corn tortillas  Asada tacos with guacamole

Not gonna lie, a bit disappointed. Everybody raves about Los Tacos No. 1 But the tacos are overpriced and the place is just so damn crowded  I pulled up on a Tuesday night with a friend, the line moved incredibly fast. I was so impressed. With a line out the door, I waited all but 5 minutes. We ordered two carne asada tacos, the cactus taco, an agua fresca, and horchata. I love that the tacos come with all the fixings (salsa, guacamole, onions, lime). And you can ask for corn or flour tortillas. I got flour tortillas.  The carne asada was really delicious; tender meat, a little bit of a kick, juicy guacamole, and petite. The agua fresca was refreshing but watered down. I know, it's water but still. My friend said the horchata was good so I'll take her word for it Â But what really put the nail in the coffin was the cactus taco. Everybody in the comments said it was good so I took a leap of faith but damn. I fucked up! Cactus was slimy, lacked seasoning, and because it was diced rather than sliced, the texture was just all off for me. I wanted a crunch factor or something to relieve me from this soggy cactus. Relief never came. I simply gave up...  I paid about $20 for two and 1/2 tacos and a drink. In new york city, no surprise. But still. Pricey and it's not like it was blowing me away. Plus the fast-paced environment means lots of people crowded into a hot taco shop, shoving their faces on little counter tops. Not great for groups, not enough room. Just quick casual dates or a bite after a long day.  But I know my local taco truck can hook me up for half the price.

Such solid tacos!! Tried beef, pork and cactus tacos. Thought cactus was a bit sour for my liking- reminded me of a pickle- but the other two tacos were amazing! Wanted to get everything "con todos" except I learned the salsa was spicy, so I skipped that. The pork was cut right in front of you from a huge BBQ pole and both meats were extremely flavorful and not dry at all. The guacamole and cilantro provided a refreshing kick to each bite of taco. Will be coming back to try their quesadillas!

Visited this location right before a show with a friend and we were in and out within 30 minutes. I like how efficient this location is and we did not have any trouble finding a table to eat our food. They check vaccination status before you order if you're dining in, so make sure you have that on hand.  I had two quesadillas and my friend had their plate with nopal. I had nopal in one and carne asada in another. I would not recommend the nopal in a taco or a quesadilla because it's very wet. If you do get the nopal, I recommend a corn tortilla because it soaks up the sauce better.  We were going to see a show, so I didn't get a drink. But the horchata is always solid at Los Tacos No. 1's.

Probably my favorite tacos in Manhattan! Super authentic and simple, 4 variations and a choice of 4 toppings, you honestly need nothing. Everything is quick without being hectic. Eat at the var table or takeout. I'm a regular here...

If you are like me and get overwhelmed by NYC Midtown and food options in the city overall, a good place to start is here. It is simple and honest. Quick, affordable, and very fulfilling. Deserves the hype, I think, because of the guac crema that the tacos come with. It seems very popular by NYC Youtubers for a good reason and has multiple locations to try. The cups at the salsa bar are messy but with million people in town, kudos to the team for keeping the counters clean.

My favorite tacos!!! I order the steak, pork and chicken tacos. Changed it up today and ordered a chicken V quesadilla which is essentially a chicken taco but with cheese. The pork and steak tacos are my favorite. Very flavorful and today they seemed spicier than usual but nothing I couldn't handle. I always get a horchata; there's is perfectly made.

I hadn't planned on visiting Los Tacos No. 1 but it came recommended by multiple friends, my partner and I were in the area after (finally) checking out the High Line, and it was dinnertime - seems like a sign, right? We waited in what we thought was a pretty long line (only to see it get even longer as we waited!) and placed our order: one of each of the tacos. We figured we needed to try everything (but also leave room for dessert). This was a mistake because we practically inhaled the tacos and wanted more, but didn't have the energy to get back in line. The pollo asado was my absolute favorite - the chicken was SO flavorful and juicy. Very happy to have visited and hope to be back soon!

Oh man...where to start?  Order their adobada/al pastor. Â Wish they would serve lengua, but I digress.... Their Dasani or Polan Springs is $5 or something obscene like that. Â Their "make your own tacos" would be impeccable had they not charge/included multiple containers of mediocre guacs.. I'm here for your meat, not guacs.

I haven't been here in a few years, but was really glad I stoped in today. Â  This spot has always been tiny, but you can see. Ganges due to covid restrictions have taken place. Â So be warned, seating is super limited and they are requiring proof of vaccinating to dine in. Â  Mint lemonade was awesome! Tortilla were a little over done today... but honestly the quality of their tacos is so good that your tastes buds over look that.

This place it tiny and hidden in China town. Â It's a well worth the stop. I've come here for one thing and one thing only, their fish tacos. Â They are the best fish tacos I've ever tasted. The fish isn't over cooked, it's served with a slightly spicy sauce, avocados, and pickled onions (and I'm not a onion person), but this is perfection!!! Their mint lemonade is a perfect companion!

We only got the breakroom fries here because we wanted a quick bite before Blood Manor, and it HIT THE SPOT. Exactly what I wanted my loaded fries to be - crispy and soft, sufficient cheese and meat bits, with the fried egg on top. They also have maybe a hundred hot sauce bottles (ranges from mild to super hot) inside, although there's probably only like 4-5 kinds.

This fantastic gem tucked away down Baxter st. packs a serious punch for greasy comforts. Â  When you walk in it's a little tight, but that just makes it all the more cozy when you throw down their juicy burgers. Â I usually get the signature Double Breakroom Burger with a side of Breakroom Fries... both are out of this world. Â Here's the descriptions straight from the menu. Double Breakroom Burger: 6oz Patty, Crispy Pork Belly, Tempura Onion Ring, Sunny Side Egg, Jalapenos, Lettuce, Tomato & American Cheese Breakroom Fries: Seasoned Fries, Tater Tots, Sunny Side egg, Bacon, Pork Belly, Cheese & Jalapenos You honestly can't go wrong with anything you see on the menu, just be sure to grab a friend and a fistful of napkins, you'll thank me later.

Mint lemonade was bomb- perfect balance between sweet and refreshing flavors. Most lemonades I've tried are too sweet. This one isn't. As for the rib eye steak sandwhich, the meat is well seasoned and cheesy. Very nicely wrapped to ensure the product doesn't get cold. The only thing wish could be better was the bread- the inside was too bland, not the typical hero bread I usually eat. Otherwise this is great place for a quick bite.

One of the best taco joints in the city. The best fish tacos I've ever had! The crispy and tasty texture with the aioli. The break-room fries are a must if it's your first time here. Honestly I wish I opted for the taco trio because amazing. Also the heavy hitter in the room is the lemonades. Just go ahead and get the large. I got the passionfruit lemonade and it was the perfect mixture--not to sweet. I'm definitely going back here for sure.

Great "bar" food place. This place offers hispanic food such as tacos or quesadias with your choice of meat as well as burgers amongst other variety of similar style foods.  I would give 5 stars if everything was perfect, the only item that wasn't that good was bacon wrapped hotdog. It was as advertised, but I think a thicker/juicier hotdog similar to Sam's Club would taste better. This one was dried out and didn't yield much flavor to the dish. This is the only bad experience of the place!  As for the good, that covers the costumer service, food, and inside. The person at the register was very helpful in explaining different food and even provided to bring food out to us. There was seating outside and inside (which is small, but give the ability to look outside).  The tacos and burgers were amazing, they weren't greasy, but are messy to eat. Lastly, the variety of hot sauces for the spiciness fan is quite large in comparison to other places. I think I counted around 7 or 9 different sauces. (Try the garlic one!)
was okay but nothing too memorable

Breakroom is a neat little spot in Chinatown for fresh tacos. Expect their service to be iffy, but they make good on their 3 mix-and-match Taco Platter. Most popular is the Tempura Fish. Batter is nice and crispy, though the fried fish can feel a bit heavy and even bland. I'm an avid fish 'n chips fan, and prefer more zing from tartar or malt vinegar. At Breakroom, I just end up being very liberal with their lineup of hot sauces instead! Grilled Steak taco is nicely charred, but also straightforward. It comes topped with only pico de gallo. Good taco, but not astounding. Cheesesteak is another popular ooey cheesy one, and Pork Belly was highly lauded by my friends for its crispy bits, so I'll have to try that next time. I also enjoy the Breakroom Fries, a combo of fries and tater tots loaded with some good and deadly stuff. Cheesy, carby, bacony fun to devour. Mint Lemonade is refreshing, sweet, and full of minty goodness. It pairs well with my (self-induced) spicy tacos. Lesson learned, be careful of all the hot sauces lined against the wall. They'll draw you in, then turn around and burn you!

Really solid tacos! I got the break room fries and a fish taco. I have been going to this place for years but not often, to be honest the prices are wayyy too high. $10 for fries and $4 per taco. It's a good place to eat just not very often and a treat yourself moment.
Website and Yelp said they were open until midnight. Â Walked almost 3/4 mile and arrived at 8:45pm only to be told they were closed. Â Who closes at 8:30 on a Saturday night in NYC?

Finally able to get here. I had the 3 tacos platter. Very good tacos. Fish taco  Cheesesteak taco (melted cheese and sauce) Fried prom belly taco (great crunch) They had a bunch of hot sauces as well. I will try their burgers next time.

I've been eating from break room for a while ... at this point this review is way over due .. a co-worker Â referred me this place she said " the tacos are ridiculously good " and even that wasn't the best way to describe tune tacos ..  I only have the fish tempura tacos and they are extremely light and flavorful, Â not grease at all , no over kill on the special sauce they use either .. most definitely hits the spot each time Â the fries are good as well .  This place is usually crowded so i advise you call ahead , when they are operating Â during regular business hrs , i placed a online order it only took approximately 35 mins for Â the food to be ready Â . The staff are super friendly as well . GOT MY VOTE AGAIN AND AGAIN

Always wanted to try Breakroom since I've heard about it so often, so I decided to pop in and pick up the Breakroom fries. I wasn't able to compare an experience to anything since I've never had it, but the fries were severely underwhelming. It boasts pork belly and bacon, and when you hear pork belly, you think tender, fatty, tasty. But the pork belly I got looked like it was double fried and re-fried, and it was crispier than some of the bacon itself, on top of it being super dry. It did lack taste, in which the cheese and spicy Mayo (I think?) made up for.  The fries itself were also quite crispy. The only thing that was decent were the tater tots it came with, since those weren't actually over-cooked. On the other end of the spectrum, the sunny side egg was under-cooked, with egg whites still running.  At this time, I'm giving it 3 stars since I wasn't able to try out the full menu yet, since I know they're more known for their tacos, so I hope to return and try those out and hope for a better experience. Â  This review was based solely on the fries, which I hoped would be better :/

The tempura tacos here are outstandingly tasty, and the fries are famously good.  Do yourself a favor and get the pork belly while you're at Breakroom -- you can thank me later. (And believe me -- you will.) Our entire meal was really good and came quickly after we'd ordered. The entire staff was really nice. (I can see why this place has a cult following of sorts!)

I came here with two of my friends after a long day. The food was really good and I think it's pretty cheap compared to other places in manhattan. I got the three taco platter and I chose the carnitas, fried pork belly, and chipotle chicken. The tacos were amazing. It wasn't too much or too little so when you ate it it wasn't messy and just the right amount of food in your mouth. They were pretty juicy too. I also got the chili cheese fries and that was bomb as well. The fries were crispy and it had a lot of flavor. My friends got the burger and they said that it was good as well. Â I recommend getting the three taco platter since two tacos was enough to make me full. They also had outdoor dining but it's pretty small so I sat inside with my friends where it was a three seater.

This is the perfect late night bite and/or burger taco joint on a budget for NYC prices. The flavor is packed and stacked high in the break room burger and you can't go wrong with the tacos as well. We got the fish tacos and it was light and fresh. The Chipotle chicken taco is also great. The burger is definitely the highlight and the combination of the onion ring, egg, and juicy burger definitely hits the spot

Breakroom is the perfect joint in Chinatown for late night munchies. Â  + Breakroom Fries: a pure work of genius- loaded tater tots and fries with cheese, pork, fried egg, bacon, and green onions. Â You can thank me later ;) + Breakroom Burger: beef patty with pork belly, fried onion rings, a runny egg, jalapeÃ±os, and all your traditional burger fixings. Â It will get soggy in the take out bag and it will be a mess to eat, but you'll scarf it down anyway. Â How could you resist that fatty goodness?

The young worker today at 7pm did not greet me Or my party when we walked in.  when I asked him about dine in or take out he didn't give me a response or make anyone feel welcome. Suggested we dine in but didn't offer a menu or anything , lead us to sit.  Then juicewrld was playing... while I'm a fan it was specifically songs about overdosing which I don't feel is appropriate music as it can trigger people to loved ones who've passed away. "All my friends are gonna die young" , to which he also didn't say anything. I then walked out because I was now having a negative experience

It's a little bit difficult to locate and with all the other restaurants around it you might get distracted, but because I was craving tacos. Tacos it was. The tacos are very tasty also depending on what kind of meat you get. We got 2 Taco platters, so got to try out 6 tacos. Â The fish taco, the spicy pork were my 2 favorites.  -1* because the guac that came with the chips and guac wasn't really guac.

My friend Jordan and I both were FAMISHED by the time we came crawling to the entrance of Breakroom. It was time for a break, indeed!! I went for the chopt cheese sandwich and he went for the chicken sandwich. I can't speak for his sandwich since I haven't had a bite, in respect to COVID-19 and respectful hygiene, but I will say his sandwich didn't look too shabby. As for my chop cheese, well, you already know how it goes - it was MIGHTY FINE!!! Portions were substantial and I appreciate the diversity of hot sauces they had to offer. It's not too different from the lineup of hot sauces Hot Ones on youtube likes to offer, only in that their options are limited to 4 and don't have you crying for milk by the end of your meal. The only thing I would like to see in the future is the QR code at the door for access to a virtual menu and possibly the option of a sandwich + drink as a combo as you would see in a fast food chain. Alas, I realize this is a mom and pop shop and so perhaps what I'm asking for is merely a pipe's dream and probably won't materialize as it is more expensive to run an individual business. Thank you Breakroom for a delicious meal!! My friend is Southern and if you've impressed him, there's something to be said!! We will be back for sure.
Yum for the breakfast burrito to go! Sauces are yummy too, ordering online and pickup was easy and quick.
Thanks Constance!
Absolutely delicious Filipino food. The breakfast bowl may just be the best hangover cure ever created.
Thanks Aaron! I agree. That bowl rocks.
So glad this opened nearby! Â The adobo burrito and adobo bowl was deliciou!
Thx Aminry! Xoxo

After a long day in NYC, we were back at our hotel relaxing. We got hungry and didn't have the energy to go out again. I don't usually like using the delivery apps, but we were tired so we ordered from this place on DoorDash.  We got a DP Burger, Beef Short Rib Taco, and Cali Burrito. Everything was fantastic and it was delivery. I can't imagine how good it would be fresh. The taco is the best birria we've had. I loved the sausage in the burger. The chicken in the burrito was delicious.  Don't let the terrible pictures I took of the takeout lead you to any conclusion about the food. I promise, it was delicious.  This Filipino/Mexican fusion is a must try in my opinion!
Youâ€™re the best Jaqueline! Thx for taking the time to review. Hopefully weâ€™ll see in the store next time.

This might be the greasiest meal I've ever eaten but I'm not mad at it, especially because I needed to soak up some drinks... We had the longanisa poutine, birria tacos (chicken and short rib) and cali burrito. The birria tacos were the definite standout. While the longanisa sausage in the poutine was too dry/lean for my taste, doused with their hot sauce, we were happy campers.  Most importantly, the vibes here are 5 stars or as their menu says, approachable and energized. Everybody was super friendly and the dive atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming, especially for the neighborhood.
Wow. Thanks Alyssa. Thatâ€™s awesome. Glad u liked it. See u soon we hope

Went around a month ago and the interior was nice, service was pretty good too. I saw a lot of great reviews and decided to try this place but the food is pricey and lacking.  I ordered the adobo taco and it was so salty, it had me chugging water for a while. My friend ordered the noodles and they were your basic instant noodles except you can get those from a supermarket and boil it yourself for less than half the price.  The fries were alright, probably the best part of the meal.

UPDATE: Owner Jordan of Flip Sigi replied to my comment below said to refund my money (initially thought was super sweet gesture due to my terrible experience) but I never got the refund after writing to him. Meh.  I really wish I could give a higher rating but our experience at Flip Sigi was VERY disappointing. I tried their food (tacos, burritos, longanisa fries, dan dan noodles, and hot wings) awhile back with friends at their other old location. We enjoyed our food then. Was craving their burritos and went out of our way to get them. We drove 2 hours and 30 mins circling around for parking and to beat traffic to spend $35 on 3 sad burnt burritos that were so so so tiny!! They were more like mini wraps to be exact not even half the size compared to a chipotle burrito. Will not be returning.
Wow. Thatâ€™s not our typical response. Please write me so I can refund your money. I hate thinking you left disappointed  info@flipsigi.com  - Iâ€™ll look out someone with your name AZHLY.

Got a chance to try out flipsigi today and i did not expect to just give three stars (noooo!!) especially since this was filipino fusion! First though, we arrived and there was no wait. Staff was wonderful and orders were prompt. We sat outdoors and was grateful for the heater. To start, we ordered pork belly baos and the calamansi. I loved that the juice was refreshingly tangy and sweet! The buns were soft and nicely made. The pork was okay though. Part of the meat was tender but the other half where the skin is is chewy. I got the dandan and shouldve taken the label "spicy af!" Seriously. It was hella spicy! My eyes were watery and tongue was burning! (i may have low-medium spiciness tolerance though) I had to get some of my husbands adobo OG (which i liked) so i can eat something lol the spiciness of the dandan could've been overlooked but it was on the sour side and was just not my personal preference in terms of taste.  Im a little disappointed really since i expected to be mindblown seeing that their photos were so mouthwatering and plus its filipino food! Cmon. Maybe i shouldve tried the burrito instead? Hmm.
Lemme kno when u want to come back and try something less spicy.

Amazing Filipino fusion food! Came here on a Thursday for dinner with two other friends and there were plenty of open tables available for seating. Their regular menu looked fantastic but when we got to the restaurant I saw this poster for their Manilla Thrilla sandwich and knew I had to get it. This sandwich was a smoked brisket sandwich with kimchi coleslaw and was delicious! The portions were a little smaller than I expected but surprisingly very filling. Will absolutely be back to try more items on their menu!
Thx josh! Canâ€™t wait to see u back in here!

Filipino fusion coming in hot in West Village. Flip Sigi melds Filipino comfort food with a mostly Mexican approach but also manages to work some other combos into the mix. The menu boasts a bunch of burritos and tacos but you can also grab yourself a sandwich or even a heap of poutine and they serve their brunch menu all day. Yours truly opted for the longanisa poutine which came plied high with fresh, house-made sausage, onions and a whole bunch of other fixings atop a mountain of fries. Nothing wrong with any of that and that could easily have been a meal in itself but why stop there? I also ordered the Plan B-Rito, which came stuffed with longanisa, ham, bacon, eggs, hashbrowns and avocado. It was breakfast meets lunch, served at around 9:00pm. Smallish place but a fair amount of seating, most of which is outdoor. Friendly staff and one of the few places in the city serving quality eats without breaking the bank.
Thanks for coming by Jason
1 free Egg-Wich

A friend had recommended this place and had been wanting to trying their dessert. The dessert was good. I love ube, so this was a nice treat! The cake was a little dry. I wish it was a bit more moist. I think it would've been great if they topped the Â cake in sweetened condensed milk! The rice crispy cereal was a little random, but I did like that it provided the crunch. Their menu looked intriguing, but I unfortunately didn't get anything other than the dessert. I will definitely have to come back and visit! The service was great. The cashier was super nice and welcoming. Our orders arrived super quick!
Thank you for the great review. Iâ€™ll share your complements with the crew.

EVERY SINGLE THING WE ORDERED WAS GASP-LEVEL GOOD And for a close second place, it was super affordable. Check in on Yelp for a delicious pork belly egg sandwich.  We got the loaded fries, and my kids gobbled the garlic fried rice and cheeseburger.  Would eat here every day, no problem.  Staff is unbelievable, vibe is cool.
Thank you for the review. It means a lot to all of us. See u next time. Iâ€™ll share with the crew.

We came here today after work after seeing some cool spots on Yelp and wanted to check them out. Flip Sigi was at the top of my list. Fusion Filipino? Yes!! Located on a corner of a busy street, the restaurant itself wasn't too busy so we got a whole booth to ourselves. The waitress there was so so nice, and her energy made the experience all the better!  The menu is pretty small and the prices were very inexpensive, perfect place to go if you're looking for smaller portions. (I say small, but they're actually the perfect size for me!) We tried: Dan Dan noods, sinigang fries, chicken adobo tacos and pork belly bun. I enjoyed everything except the Dan Dan noodles, sadly! I probably hyped it up so much for myself, as it looked really good in the pictures. I felt like the noodles were a bit undercooked and the flavour wasn't hitting for me. But that didn't affect my experience at all. My fav was definitely the pork belly bun! I'll be back to try the other items! (And for the good vibes and unlimited fountain soda)

Was a really good meal, especially given I was hungover. Got a bunch of things and shared. Fries were great and had some type of vinegar seasoning- ketchup was different but awesome. Burger was solid but wouldn't order it again. The star of the show was the short rib birra tacos. So delicious and could tell the meat was smoked for a long time - full of flavor. Cali burrito was also a solid thing and would order it again. Word to the wise the Cali burritos are BOGO on mondays. Great experience I'll be back there again soon. Ps. It's BYO booze

The pork belly bao was pretty tasty but the pork was kinda dry. I did like the sauce !  The fries really disappointed me. Â They were bland , didn't have any seasoning as far as I can tell and didn't taste homemade and were soft. Â They do come with a small banana ketchup and their special sauce which was good.  I don't think I'll make a special trip there nor order delivery again. Â .

Cali Burrito ($10): oh mannnn this is good! When I first opened the container, I was a bit surprised by how small (length wise) the burrito is, but it's actually quite stuffed, especially with the protein, so no complaints. Worthhhh. I haven't enjoyed such a good burrito in a long time! The crispy pork belly and the chicken here is realllly good. In fact, the chicken was so juicy and flavorful that I thought I was eating carnitas. Yummm. Crispy melted cheese plus fries are also such a great addition in this Short Rib Birria Taco ($5.25): the Filipino style birria tacos - the taco shells are sooo firm and crispy omg. They didn't break, has a great crunch, and the short rib is delicious. These tacos are flat and there's also not much in terms of toppings but it's hella juicy Longanisa Birria Taco ($4): not the biggest fan of the sweetness in this one

I am so happy we went here while visiting NY. Everything on the menu looked so good! My favorites are the Birrias and pork bun!  The service was great! They were all helpful and nice. I would definitely come back and try the other items!
So happy u enjoyed everything. Thx for coming thru Arianne. And thanks for taking the time to review! See u next time

A fun little spot to try! It's Filipino but kinda fusion. I had a DP burger which was super tasty and also tried the pork belly buns and the poutine. All were very flavorful. Definitely a casual place, but a good place to hang out with friends.
Thx Alyce! Looking forward to seeing u and your friends again soon

This place has a very cool concept and I'm a sucker for good fusion food combos. I was in a rush so I dropped in quickly and everyone at the restaurant was kind enough to be very quick with my food. The service is great and everyone there Is extremely kind. They have a cute outdoor seating area where they will bring the food out to you and it's a nice bustling west village spot. A great fast casual spot!  I got the Dan Dan noodles with an egg on top that were nice and spicy. They add a lot of green onions which I personally loved. One caveat I will give is the noodles are pretty spicy so if you can't handle spice don't get them because it might be too much and opt for their other bowls instead.
Thx for taking the time to give us some stars. It really helps these days. Hope we see u â€™round.

Amazing!! This is my first time trying Filipino food (or Filipino fusion?) and I am so amazed. We got the Cali Burrito and the breakfast Egg Sandwich with pork belly. The way they cook the pork belly is sooo good. It's so crispy but still soft and juicy, blends so well with the eggs. It melts in your mouth! I personally liked the egg sandwich better than the burrito. The burrito is good - which I expected anything stuffed with fries to taste good. But that egg sandwich just hits differently... you gotta come try it! Gonna come back to try the burgers next time. Also did I mention their staff members are also super friendly and they also have many outdoor seating space?? You can also check-in on Yelp for a surprise. :)
Thx fir the love Anna!
1 free Egg-Wich

*ordered delivery so can only comment on food* nothing beats a hot, flavorful bowl of pho on a cold day. we ordered the house special pho and it did not disappoint. honestly wished i had ordered 3 more bowls of just the beef broth. also had the shaking beef, which was delicious but ended up just eating most of my boyfriend's pho. it's pretty hard to find solid viet food in Brooklyn but will definitely be back for more!
Cash only.  The ATM they direct you to is broken.  Drop the cash post COVID, pretty awful way to start a meal at a very clean NYC ATM in the first place.

Came here on a Friday evening. Restaurant is small and cozy. Each party is separate by a plastic barrier to maintain distance as per covid protocols. Ordered the lemongrass chicken pho. It was aromatic and delicious. Very filling and perfect pick me up on a cold night in NYC.  Highly recommend.

Surprised that I haven't left a review here yet, as it was always tradition to grab dinner here before an event at Barclays (pre pandemic). I finally returned last Saturday even though I didn't have an event - I was just craving pho! And 5ive Spice is definitely one of the best spots in Brooklyn for it. I got the Beef pho ($12) while my bf got the 5ive special pho ($17) and added an egg for an extra $2. We forgot how big these bowls were - it felt like there was actually more protein than noodles (no complaints there) and I couldn't even finish my bowl so I brought home the last several bites. Amazing.  We also got an order of the beer battered fish tacos (2 for $9.50) which were just as yummy and messy as I remember. I personally prefer the traditional style of banh xeo (and wish that they served it here!) but the tacos are a unique menu item that you can't find anywhere else. We each got a Viet Iced Coffee ($4/each) that we couldn't finish as well, bringing home almost one full cup after combining our leftovers (lol). We also shared a lemongrass porkchop banh mi ($10) which was deeelicious - the bread was so fresh. We also ate one half of this, and brought the other half home. Yes we may have over-ordered, but the value of the food here is great - not overpriced and the portions are generous. The only thing to note is that this was our first time sitting at the high chairs/table and unfortunately it was a bit awkward since we were sitting side by side, and were directly facing another couple... there was a black bar across the table that kind of separated us from them, but it still seemed like we were a bit too close for comfort. Even our server got our orders mixed up, thinking the 4 of us were together, and then accidentally swapping our banh mi orders (they got the traditional, we got the porkchop - they didn't realize they received our porkchop until they were halfway through the sandwich). Perhaps each couple should've sat across from each other instead, but I think it would've still been awkward with that black bar across the table. Not a great table for couples and a bit tricky for sharing if you are with a party of 4. Still, it's one of my favorite spots for dine-in Vietnamese food. Always look forward to coming back!

5ive Spice will not dissapoint. Browsing the drool worthy pics on Yelp, we decided to order the Beer Battered Fish Tacos (Banh Xeo), the Braised Short Rib Banh Mi and the Beer Battered Â Banh Mi. Â For starters, we began the Spring Rolls and Vietnamese Iced Coffees. The Vietnamese Iced Coffee is a MUST get! Imagine strong Vietnamese brewed coffee with just the right amount of added condensed milk. Â The boldnest of the coffee and the sweet creaminess of the condensed milk emotes notes of rich dark chocolate note and finishes with light sweetness without being overly creamy. The Spring Rolls are on point and are unlike no other spring rolls from other Viet food places. Inside the spring rolls is a nice mix of pork with shrimp, wrapped around a light and crispy skin. The addition of the shrimp lightens the meatiness of the pork. Â Served with fish sauce, romaine, pickled veg and mint, these are banging. The Beer Battered Fish that were Â inside the Tacos and Banh Mi were nothing exciting but the accompanying bean sprouts, pickled veg, mint, cilantro and fried shallot garnish adds dimensions of brightness, sweet, sour and textures. The Cocnut Rice Crepes that were used as the taco shell were crisp but not crunchy crispy on the upper edges but the bottom side was soggy. Â  The Braised Short Rib in the Banh Mi was beefy in flavor and tender. The meat was seasoned lightly. Fully assembled, the Banh Mi was savory yet bright from the pineapple coulis, bean sprouts and basil.  All in all, 5ive Spice was a great experience and will visit again. With so many great reviews for the. The Pho and Bun, these are in our sights for our next visit!! Notes: -On the corner of 5th and Bergen St. -Outdoor seating is limited and fills up quickly during busy times -Indoor seating is available. Need to show vaccination card to dine-in. -Take-out is very popular -Scan the QR code in the restaurant for the menu - 2 locations: Brooklyn (Park Slope), LES (Mulberry)
Pretty tasty food for a pretty food price! I wish they were more explicit about cash only so they don't surprise customers like us when the check comes and we have to go hunt for an ATM.

My favorite viet spot in NYC omg I love this place so much that I ended up going again literally the day after I tried it for the first time... oops... 5ive Spice has such incredible classic Vietnamese noodle dishes such as pho, bun/vermicelli, rice dishes, banh mi sandwiches, and rolls! A unique offering of theirs is also Banh Xeo tacos where the shell of the taco is a viet rice crepe and you can choose your meat for the filling. Most dishes are in the $10-$20 range. HIGHLY recommend their 5ive Special Pho!!! The broth here is simmered for 12 hours and it tastes so flavorful and hearty. It comes with beef and short ribs and the meat is so tender.  I am also obsessed with their Lemongrass Chicken Bun / Vermicelli Salad bowl! The chicken is grilled to perfection and well seasoned. I love to get it over half rice noodle half salad because I love my veggies and the ones served here taste fresh and light, perfectly pairing with the grilled protein heh. I could eat this every day.  Honestly I've tried a lot of their menu offerings and you really can't go wrong with anything because it's all just so good. I also love their Mango Papaya salad app and the veggie pho! They also serve drinks and cocktails here to make your meal even more fun if you are into that hehe I really like the Ho Chi Minh with soju, yuzu, and lemon :3 Truly immaculate Vietnamese food and one of my all time favorite spots that never fails to satisfy me whenever I find myself craving a solid pho or vermicelli!

5ive Special Pho is the best pho in NYC! Broth is flavorful with a good kick and a heavy portion of meat+noodles. I do wish they had tripe and tendon! Fish tacos are better than the short rib tacos. The special taco shell is nothing crazy. Spring rolls are on point!  I understand the place is packed but the staff needs to be a more attentive. I saw a few tables struggling to track down a server to put in a order. We had to wait a long time asking for plates, forks, and water. Â I guess next time just ask for everything in one shot. Like I always say, the best food comes from the places with the crappiest service.  I'm definitely going back to try the banh mi!!!

I came here after a long tiring day and indeed this place did not disappoint!  There's outdoor dining but the restaurant itself was relatively small so if you have a big party then this place will probably not be able to accommodate. I had high expectations because Mikey Chen recommended this place and hell yeah I trust this guy! The beef pho was phenomenal. The broth was so rich, which can be tiring after a couple of sips but I kept reaching back for more. The 5ive Spice Special Pho was indeed on another level. Spicy, rich, and flavorful - all fitting words to describe this dish. Oh the Lemongrass Banh Mi was a scene stealer. At first, I was disappointed that there were a lot of carrots but she was there for a reason. The perfectly grilled chicken paired with the carrots and baguette - what a perfect marriage.  However, we did have a slight interruption during our meal. We found a piece of paper in our soup but the waitress kindly apologized and took it off our bill. That's really the only negative - hence 4 stars. Highly recommend coming here if you're near the area or in Manhattan.

NOTE: CASH ONLY This is probably one the best phos I've ever had! After seeing multiple glowing reviews on the braised short rib pho, I knew I had to get it! The service was great and food came out quickly. The broth is deep with a hint of spice and tang, and the rib was tender. Overall, I really enjoyed my meal!

I've heard so many good things about 5ive Spice and was finally able to get around to it! The servers were extremely nice. The restaurant was cash only, but they directed me to the nearest ATM. After returning, I was seated immediately! I already knew what to order, so it did not take long, The Veggie Banh Mi was amazing! You have the option of mild or spicy, and of course, I had to order it spicy. It wasn't an overwhelming spice. They seasoned it perfectly. I believe they used some sort of chili paste/oil, but don't count me on that. The pickled veggies weren't too sour. It paired well with the spice level. The fries took a while to arrive, but it gave me time to enjoy my Banh Mi.

My favorite spot for pho and banh mi in brooklyn! My all time favorite place to get pho closed due to the pandemic and I was devastated. I thought I would never find a replacement, but then 5ive Spice saved the day! I order takeout from here consistently. Honestly there was a point where I had to have it at least 1-2x a week. The pho broth is super flavorful, the serving size is perfect, and it comes with all the fixings! I have tried the lemongrass chicken, pork chop, and beef pho. I love the chicken and the beef! However, I took off one star because the most recent time I ordered the pork chop pho, the pieces of pork were fatty and chewy. It wasn't good at all. Nonetheless, they've always been consistent otherwise, so I will def order it again. The banh mi is just as bomb as the pho! I have had the chicken and pork chop banh mi. The veggies are always fresh and crunchy, the bread is perfect, and the meat is always moist. It's my absolute favorite sandwich!  Pro tip: if you're ordering this for delivery, order it well before you're ready to eat because it will take forever (but it'll be hot when it gets there)! ig: @newyorkcityfoodie

I've eaten at 5ive Spice twice in the past month and both times were great! The first time I ordered through a food delivery app and everything was packed perfectly and in the most organized way I've ever seen.  The second time, I dined in and again the food was fantastic and the service was friendly. The beef pho has the most incredibly flavorful broth! I could just drink the broth and be happy. The steamed veggie dumplings were good as well but the springs rolls are fantastic!! They are perfectly fried, crispy, crunchy on the outside but not greasy. The dipping sauce is a great compliment and the pork and shrimp filling has excellent flavor. I'm already looking forward to round 3.

5ive Spice is such a gem! I discovered this place from good ol' Mikey Chen, and right when I saw him biting into a fat beef short rib, I had already bookmarked the place.  Even though the indoors had nice AC, my boyfriend and I couldn't resist the beautiful outdoor seating. The music was also phenomenal, playing one upbeat song after another. You scan their QR code for the menu. We both ordered the Beef Short Ribs Pho ($17) and Viet Tacos ($12). 5ive Spice was also super generous and kind to offer your choice of Spring Rolls or Dumplings with a Yelp check-in, and so we were able to get 2 free appetizers! Everything that came under the sunny lighting that day looked beautiful: the smells, the vibrant greens, the appearance. The Spring Rolls were amazing, especially when wrapped in lettuce and carrots. The Fried Chicken Dumplings were interesting, as I never had an outer dough like that before. The Viet Tacos came with 2 tacos, and was honestly pricey. But boy, was it interesting! The shell was surprisingly pretty hard, despite it just being a coconut rice crepe, but I love the texture, mixed with bean sprouts, a juicy shrimp, and bits of ground pork.  The Beef Short Ribs Pho needs a paragraph on its own. The ribs are gigantic! And while it was sunk in soup for a long time, the slightly spicy kick of the seasoning woke it right back up. After a while though, the fatty parts and meat can get too heavy. The pho was intriguingly good, with flavors of sour, spicy, and sweet. As someone used to the typical beef briskets pho, this is definitely a must try for something different! Lastly, that bathroom. Their bookshelf bathroom alone stands out, aside from their bomb food. I highly recommend checking this place out for pho one day!

This review is based on delivery. I ordered the short ribs pho, a Vietnamese coffee and a side of taro fries.  The short ribs pho was insane. The short ribs were super tender and melted in your mouth and the pho was nothing short of flavorful. The pho traveled really well; they separate the broth and the noodles/bean sprouts/etc.  The Vietnamese coffee was great as well. The taro fries were basically just slices of taro but fried, wasn't anything spectacular imo but it came with a nice dipping sauce. I'll definitely need to try this place in a dine-in environment, I'm sure it would've been even better!

If you want to have authentic pho, this is the place to have it. Highly recommend the beef pho, though the beef is not as tender as the ones that I used to get in HK or Vietnam. The summer roll is refreshing and delicious as well. I would say it's already much better than a lot of the fusion Vietnamese restaurants in New York.
Delicious! Throughly enjoy my bowl of pho while here! Service was amazing and food came out quickly. Wings weren't my fave but everything else was great!
Best Vietnamese food I've had! I love their modern take on Vietnamese cuisine and could not recommend their short rib vermicelli enough. Their chicken wings and fried spring rolls were also delish!

Last night, craving pho, I biked over to 5ive Spice with my girlfriend. There were no outdoor tables available so we dined inside. It was VERY busy with many delivery and take-out orders being picked up, yet we were quick to receive water and place our order.  I opted for the beef pho ($12), which comes with brisket and rare steak. My food was served in record time. I've waited longer in fast food drive-throughs. This service was astoundingly speedy.  The pho itself was very good. I'm a stickler when it comes to the broth, and 5ive Spice has excellent broth. The meats were also delicious, and abundant; they hooked me up on noodles as well. The serving ended up being so big I took some home with me, savoring the rich broth as a late evening snack.  Having taste-tested much of the competition, I consider 5ive Spice to be my favorite pho between Columbia Street and Prospect Park. While the menu has some innovative fusion flair, the mainstays are traditional and, dare I say, authentic. Big portions, great flavor, reasonable prices, attentive service.

Note: Cash Only! I stopped by 5ive Spice over the weekend for a lunch date. We sat outside which was lovely and quaint, providing a nice view of the people moving about 5th Ave. Scanned the QR code for the menu then got down to decision-making.  The menu is chiefly modern Vietnamese with a fusion blend; short rib is a meat specialty and tacos are a thing. We ordered the wings, fish tacos, short rib tacos, and the specialty pho.  The tacos were a home run. I enjoyed the soft shells, a proprietary recipe, and the fillings made for a hefty appearance. I added on salsa, fresh and tangy. The fish was clean, a breaded filet of cod fried to a crisp, not soggy or greasy. The short rib tacos were a bit messier but I loved the flavor.  The pho was also delicious. The brisket and round steak fit the bill, though the short rib stole the show. Tender, juicy, and lots of it. I enjoyed the meatballs, and the broth deserves some acclaim as well. It's a variation on a classic formula and for me, totally hit the spot.  Less impressed with the wings, but with all this food, there would obviously be some playing favorites. I might've liked the wings more without the sauce on top. Not bad, just turns out it wasn't what I needed.

Wow. This place is good. We had the Banh Mi, one chicken and one fish. Outstanding. The bread is great. Ordered mine without the typical carrots. Our friends had the pho, and loved it. Oh and crushed ice in the soda...why doesn't every restaurant have this? Cozy outdoor seating and excellent service. Cash only! ALLERGY FRIENDLY: I have a few allergies that are challenging at Asian restaurants including soy, sesame, and some vegetables. They take allergies seriously and servers know their menu and and ingredients. I had no problem here.

No matter how many times I come to Salsa and Beer, I always have mad love for this place. Please bring your vaccination card to ensure a smooth time coming in! Salsa and Beer proportions are unlike any other restaurant I've been to. Yeah, the items do get pricy. But the servings are basically two meals, so you're saving money in the long run. I got their Asada Burrito which comes with a delicious red sauce over it with a side of beans, Mexican rice, little salad and some sour cream. There's a separate area where you can get your salsa buffet style. The meat is so juicy and the salsa was so flavorful. The pico de gallo is such a nice touch to balance the heavy taste of the dish.

I am shocked by these reviews. Â  This Mexican food was not terrible, but it was subbparr. Â And this is after going not ONCE but multiple times hoping that maybe I just ordered the wrong type of dish because holey smokes there is always a long line of people waiting to be seated so it must be worth it, right? CONS_______________________ 1. LOW QUALITY MEXICAN FOOD - In Los Angeles, we are so fortunate to have a plethora of delicious Mexican food available. Â Salsa & Beer does not meet the minimum line of selling tasty and fulfilling dishes. And the whole point of eating out is to have an appetizing, Â high grade meal. Â I recommend definitely NOT getting the burritos (oversalted) nor the salad (it's like requesting a salad from del taco or taco bell). Â If you're going to go to Salsa & Beer no matter what then order the shrimp fajitas. Also, I would stick with water because the horchata and jamaica have way too much sugar in them.  2. LONG WAIT - If you want to dine in, expect to wait 45 minutes to an hour before you're even allowed to walk into the vicinity.  3. SLOW SERVICE - You really have to try to flag someone down. In my most recent visit, I had to get up and head towards the hostess station to ask for water and this was after our table was waiving our hands trying to get the attention of our waiter... it was about 25 minutes before I got up and asked someone else.  4. COCKROACH IN TAKE OUT BOX Â - The last time I went was with my family. We ordered some take out. Â My brother was the one to notice whilst he was eating at home that there was a roach in his meal.  PROS______________________ 1. COMPETITIVE PORTION-SIZE - Nowadays, as a consumer, we get less and less for what we pay. Â The portion sizes here are decent. You could share your meal.  2. STYLISH RESTAURANT - Although this is a pro, having a nice looking restaurant is nothing without good food and efficient service (which Salsa & Beer lacks).  CONCLUSION_____________ *I do not recommend Salsa & Beer.  The food here has more misses than hits. And even when the food is a "hit" it's still not mouthwatering, it's just okay food.  I gave it a 2/5 but I really wanted to give it a 1/5; however, the cockroach in my food was probably (hopefully) just a one-time unlucky situation.

If you want a meal that will last you four days, delicious and reasonably priced, come to this place! By pure coincidence, someone recommended this place so we can avoid the LA traffic. And who knew that I would find a good Mexican food in North Hollywood? They have a parking lot in the back and street parking is also available. Quick service and some friendly staff. I am just not a fan of having a self-service salsa bar despite being given gloves for handling the ladles. But it still makes people congregate in one section. I still recommend trying this place Put and would return if I'm ever in the neighborhood.

I can see why the line for this place is always long. The food is delicious, portions are huge and the price is cheap. My michelada was made really well. The bean dip for the chips is very good. For my entree i had the creamy chicken fajita and had to stop myself from eating the entire thing. I brought leftovers home, warned them in the air fryer and they were still delicious. I'd for sure come here again.

You know when you walk into a joint after getting a primo parking spot and can hear the late great Selena beating over the speaker system Â it's going to be a good experience and nothing beats the experience at the Salsa & Beer of North Hollywood (Sun Valley adjacent). Located just down the street from Home Depot and Public Storage near the intersection of Sherman Way and Lankershim this authentic Latinx restaurant of mega portions, beer and the perfect margaritas is definitely where you want to go to enjoy an experience. You'll be seated right away whether at one of their two bar seating locations, at a table or booth. The have complimentary chips and dip and an epic self serve salsa bar with containers which are great for to go as you might not finish this jumbo plate of eats. The Vegetarian Burrito (with no sour cream, cheese or ranchera sauce is my default) go to but they also have grilled potato tacos, salads, sides and a bean and cheese burrito option that can all be made more plant based friendly or already are by default. Modifications are super easy and they always accommodate.  The combination plates seem to be the favorite for most as you get an entree dish with two sides and a salad. I would definitely partake if they ever add a more vegan friendly option to their constantly growing and expanding menu. The famous Â house Margaritas are a must, especially blended and even more especially Raspberry, Strawberry and Mango... Pineapple can hangout too. Make sure you get that chilli powder/tajin rim also.... Muy feugo! I can't say enough great things about S&B numero dos... Even the parking attendant on duty is just as warm and friendly as your host, hostess and as much as our amazing server.  We were greeted the moment we walked in and and thanked highly for or late lunch/dinner experience here on our way out by all the staff near the door. Te amo Salsa y Cerveza! Be back soon!

This is literally the best Mexican food I have ever had. The bean dip with the chips is insanely good and the portions are massive. I'd avoid appetizers since they give chips and dip. I strongly recommend you come here.

Food is good, wait time is horrendous. Definitely not worth a two hour wait, plus they don't take reservations. It's been years since I've been and I won't be back atleast to this location. There is no reason you should be waiting 2 hours to be seated

SPECTACULAR SHRIMP FAJITAS =========================== My friend wanted to take me to Salsa & Beer for awhile now as we both love good Mexican food. Â We are a bit burned out on local places, so we went there on June 23, 2021. I knew right off the bat I would be ordering the shrimp fajitas after reading other Yelp reviews. Â Jill told me they are always really busy too so we decided to go right when they open at 11:00 a.m.. Â We arrived at least fifteen minutes before they opened and there was already two people in line. Â  Jill and I decided to split an order of the shrimp fajitas that comes with rice, beans and a little guacamole. Â We made a mistake when we ordered the skinny Cadillac margaritas. Â They were alright, but we should have just ordered a regular ones. Â We'll try to get our husbands to go when we can figure out a good time. Tip: I highly recommend going the back route from the Crescenta Valley if you are in the Foothills. Â Take the 210 West, Exit La Tuna Canyon, head south to Lankershim Blvd. and turn left on Sherman Way. Â So much easier than dealing with the 2 Freeway, 134 West and 170 North.

Parking, horrible. Service, mediocre. Fajitas, delicious.  When I tell you the fajitas were sizzling, I mean they were LOUD hahaha  It was tricky finding parking around here since their parking lot was full/closed? but the fajitas were so good. I think it came out to about 18 dollars but it was an unreal amount of food. You're definitely going to have leftovers for lunch the next day unless you're sharing.  The wait and the service were mehhh but I'd be willing to give it another try.

In my visit, I was not surprised. The main room Somewhat traditional and not very showy. But I did like the temporary installation outside, the parking area, since due to the covid-19 pandemic they had to improvise and that has been good. As for the menu, personally too large the portions, and if for most people that is the best part. Unfortunately, my chosen option did not taste as good, very spicy. My companions, out of 5 of us, 3 found it very good food.
Super yummy! I always come here and the service is great! They get super packed and the parking lot is super small so make sure to be ready to wait. The Zacatecas fajitas are also amazing!!

Salsa & beer is such a good spot! The prices are reasonable and the portions are massive. Parking can be tough but it's worth it. The service is always mediocre at best but the food makes up for it.  My favorite is the Guadalajara fajitas! Comes with chicken, steak and shrimp topped with a spicy sauce. And of course the traditional fajita fixings of onions and peppers and 3 tortillas of choose! I always ask for extra to have with my leftovers! It is also served with a side of rice, beans, guacamole and a tomato salsa.  They have this bean dip that's served with warms chips at the beginning that is absolutely amazing. As well as their margaritas!

The customer service here was really good. The waiters were attentive and they had free parking with an attendant who guided you to park. The fajitas were mediocre but the dips, sauces, and a margaritas were perfect. I can see this place being super packed with a line on weekends but we were able to get seated right a way without any wait at all.  I would like to go back and try something different but I don't recommend the fajitas from my personal taste buds but someone else may beg to differ. Everyone I encountered was very friendly and inviting.  The exterior setup was nice and creative. They also had heaters to keep guests warm bc nights in Cali can be very breezy lol. Nonetheless, give this place a try

This place is amazing! I have been here twice (I live in San Diego) and I have tasted quite a bit of their menu, and still just amazed. I got here right before 11 am, when they open their doors, and there was a line out around the corner. This place does very well.. By the entrance there is a salsa bar where you can go get as much salsa as your little heart desires. And each one is VERY tasty! Today we ordered a combination plate with taquitos and shredded beef enchiladas, and a carne asada & grilled shrimp plate. Everything was fabulously plated, cooked and seasoned. Great food. Our waitress was very attentive, as well. I will continue to come here anytime I am in the vicinity! Yup!!

This was my first and last!!!!I am Â sorry but I don't understand why a lot of people come here maybe because they put a looot of food !!!!! when You see the plate the hungry goes away it is too much but ok ok what about the flavor, I am Mexican and this food is not authentic Mexican food not flavor at all . my carnitas really dry the molcajete wasn't on a molcajete they was on a fajitas plate margarita no flavor I am sorry but I stick with la barca or el Ranchito Â from HP

A great to go place but don't expect to get in on the spur of the moment. Their login app is wonderful snd their greeting staff work very hard to seat you on time. The best part other than great food is their salsa bar. You would me amiss if you didn't try any of their homemade sslsa's

After almost a year of not coming to salsa and beer I finally gave in to my craving. Due to COVID I hadn't wanted to come because it's a 1 hour drive and i thought the food would be cold by the time I arrived back home but I finally decided to go buy food. I called ahead of time so my food would be ready when I arrived. It was ready within 45 min and their COVID safety is really good. They have all the to go bags packed and you just give them your name and they hand you your items. I definitely miss dinning in there but I guess for now I have to settle with take out until I feel comfortable enough to eat out again.

I love this place! I really enjoy coming to this place because the food is delicious. The drinks are good too. I always get the steak fajitas, it's a big portion. You get the tray of fajitas and then a plate with beans, rice, and guacamole.They give you a lot of food and I can never finish it but I have food to take home.  The only downside to this place is the wait time. The first time I came, I arrived at around 12pm and it took an hour to be seated. After that we learned the lesson and since they open at 11 am we are there 20min before they open. If you arrive anytime after 11:30 then you will probably have to wait an hour.  They have a parking lot behind the restaurant, depending on what time you arrive then you might not find parking.

This restaurant has really gone down hill. First I want to say my husband and I would come here all the time since 2013. I've been their when they were jam packed and was still provided with amazing service, food, and drinks.  Yesterday was our first time back since the pandemic started. Everything was horrible. Food wasn't no where near as good as it use to be, the margaritas sucked, salsa bar sucked, and service was horrible (besides the bus boy, he was amazing and was doing the waitress job pretty much). My daughter chesse enchilada plate was burnt. Mine and my husband combo fajita plate had HUGE pieces of veggies. Like the prep person in the kitchen doesn't give a @$%*. The fajita plate had no flavor. We ordered a chicken tortilla soup and our soup had no chicken and tortilla but HUGE pieces of veggies. Like come on cut and prep right. Also they never brought us spoons so we can eat our soup. I had to walk to the host in the front for a spoon and it took her 10mins to bring back two plastic spoons. They were never like this. Mind you it wasn't packed/busy at all when we went on a Thursday @5pm.  I ordered a mango margarita but our waitress gave me a peach one. I was waiting for her to come check on us so they can remake my drink. She never came by so I decided to drink it. When she came by 25mins later I asked for a pineapple margarita. She brings me back a lime margarita. I had to hunt down our waitress so she can tell the bar to remake my drink. She takes my drink back. When she comes back it's the same lime margarita and they added pineapple juice.  Salsas were horrible. No flavor what so ever and their salsa were bomb as hell before!  They also charge a 4% fee for using plastic. They never ever did that before. Also our waitress seemed like she didn't want to be their or work. Definitely won't be coming back. It's sad because this places use to be one of my favorite restaurants in SFV, it's definitely not the same as it use to be.
5 stars to the one on Sherman Way. Â Best Mexican food I have ever had. Â Yes the wait is long but IMO it's worth it. Â Oh how I wished they would serve breakfast. Â Bet it would be amazing.

This place is amazing. Delicious margaritas and food all at affordable prices. Plates are huge and are easily shareable. My husband and I shared the chicken, shrimp and steak fajitas and it was incredible. Margs were also on point. Don't just walk here - run. And make sure to get there early because there is always a wait.  Also, I love that all of the vaccinated staff where pins to say they are vaccinated.

*Reservation Option Available +Vaccine Card Request FIRST TIME HERE: Sunday Nov, 28th 2021 around 8PM We didn't have a reservation so wait time was about 30-40min * Plenty of seating outside to wait * In door & out door seating  * Bar * Paid Parking We sat inside our waiter was "Jaime" Friendly guy Food: Was Delicious, Flavorful, Amazing Mole for sure & I love the idea of complimentary Chips & Mole.  Staff: Attentive  Unfortunately, I found a hair on my plate :( So I couldn't really enjoy my food as I would've wanted...you know that uneasy feeling after. I didn't want my husband to know so he could enjoy his food, but couldn't keep him. One thing I really appreciated - Jaime, did an amazing job handling my concern, I appreciated his service and just for that I'd like to come back and give it another shot and try more plate options.

I would actually give this restaurant a 4.5 rating. The mole is very good. Our party of three split the Festival de Moles for $35 and enjoyed it. Ideally, you want to make a reservation for dinner weeks in advance. Both times I came here there was a 20 to 30 minute wait.

Disclaimer: I am not a big fan of mole and I think this is what this place is mainly known for Parking- a lot right behind the restaurant...we didn't see any street parking available...a valet will park your car for $7 Location- it wasn't beautiful or updated in any way but had a clean authentic feel to it Staff- the people who greet you as you come in and take you to your seat were friendly and made a good first impression; our waiter was attentive without feeling intrusive Food- we ordered the mole sampler which comes with 4 different moles and rice and tortillas...mole is just not my thing...the lightest one was the best tasting; we also ordered the tlayuda which we thought was really good...it has a crispy base and three meets on top to eat it with...this is something that is easly shareable with a couple people; the chips were served with what I think was a mole and cheese on top and were different and pretty good Drinks- the jamaica was tasty and natural tasting; the pina colada was $1 more on the bill then what the menu said but I didn't feel like complaining for a $1...it was delicious Prices: overall, I just feel like everything is about 20% more expensive than what you think and lunch for 2 was over $100

The feeling of true Mexican cuisine while not having to leave the states. Guelaguetza was actually recommended by my girlfriends professor. And it was well worth the trip. Never having mole i didn't know what to expect and with that being said I am no professional in the mole field, but I will say for my first time, I wouldn't have wanted to try from anywhere other than Guelaguetza. It was very flavorful and enjoyable. Came for lunch and got the sampler. It was more than enough food for my girlfriend and I. We left full and content. Four different moles which came with a very yummy large fresh tortilla as well as a side of rice. It was a fun experience and allowed for me to expand my food horizons. It doesn't get much more authentic than here. The service was attentive and passionate Â for what they do as if you ask for recommendations or what something is they explain everything with pride and detail. Much recommended for an authentic Mexican bites
