After taking a brief 3wk sojourn from my restaurant reviews, your diligent culinary correspondent returns, his eyes + appetite laser focused on the Oaxacan sensation Guelaguetza, a Family run restaurant recently awarded the LA Times prestigious "Restaurant of the Year" honor.  Though Guelaguetza rocketed straight to the top of our "restaurant bucket list" the moment I read its effusive review in the Times, it took beautiful wife + I a moment to make the 35 mile trek from Diamond Bar.  ... But the worth was well worth it!!  You arrive to valet parking off the restaurants Irolo Street entrance- In this heavily compressed neighborhood where parking is as precious as gold, trust me- Pay the $7 for the valet parking.  Guelaguetza welcomes it's guests with a bright red, cavernous box shaped restaurant, throbbing to the beat of the live bands that play every F & SAT evening. Â If you arrive during "Date Night Rush Hour" (6-9pm F-SAT eves) expect to wait 75 minutes, minimum.  Or do like we did and take your meal at the well stocked bar.  For Mole lovers, Guelaguetza could well herald your Heaven on earth moment. The restaurant lavishes guests with no less than SIX handmade moles: Negro, Rojo, Estofado (stew), Verde, Coloradito and Amarilla.  Tonight we sampled the Coloradito over the warm chips. It's a savory but mild Mole that carries a sweeter than expected taste profile. Â While I know it has its legions of fans, neither Leti or I were crazy for it.  The Amarilla (yellow) Mole ladled copiously over her chicken + rice entree, however, was a guaranteed showstopper! Rich, velvety, complex and savory but NOT too spicy. Excellence on a plate, guaranteed to stick to your ribs and be licked off your fingertips!  For our hard-core Mole partisans out there, we suggest the Festival de Moles, where Guelaguetza serves you its world famous black (negro), yellow (amarilla), red (rojo) and Coloradito moles over mounds of shredded chicken + rice. $35.  Oaxacan cuisine is best understood as a pre-Hispanic food, complete with huge, savory dishes like tlayudas (pizza shaped thin tortillas layered w/ ingredients), dried meats like tasajo and memelas. And yes, for the stout-hearted amongst you, you can order Oaxaxa's protein dense chapulines (grasshoppers), served plain or Mexican style (fried with jalapeÃ±o, onions, tomatoes + avocado).  Guelaguetza serves up all facets of its wonderful, complex dishes in a family friendly climate. We look forward to bringing our children and friends to this remarkable establishment!

Scott thank you so much! We truly appreciate words like yours. It fills us with so much joy and gratitude to know that you truly enjoyed your meal and experience. We look forward to having you back soon!

I really enjoyed my experience here partly due to the food and the rest due to the great service. The staff here are so friendly and accommodating. When my grandmother told our waiter she got spiced up from the chilaquiles, they brought out a small plate of fruit to help her out! So cute. And their tlayudas are so delicious and enormous. One alone could feed 2-3 people. I got mine with mole negro and egg, and I liked that the mole was really sweet, and the base was nice and crispy. I appreciate that they sliced them up like pizza, easier to eat it that way.
Thank you so much Kaya! Words like yours give us so much energy to keep going! It makes us so happy to know that you enjoyed your food and service. Can't wait to have you back!

Came here on a random Tuesday night for dinner. Guelaguetza is located on Olympic, and there is street parking available behind the restaurant. Honestly, I would not recommend parking there (safety). There is a massive valet lot that you can park in :-) This place gets very busy, even on weeknights. I recommend making a reservation. You'll need to make a reservation a couple of weeks in advance.  When you walk in, you're greeted by a gorgeous colorful interior that feels like a nice, family restaurant. Lots of big families celebrating birthdays come here. I love it. I asked my server for this recommendations (it was just me by myself and I don't eat much). He recommend the Horchata. It's a beautiful pink color with fruit and nuts I believe. Highly recommend. Â I then got the Enchiladas Campesinas, which are chicken enchiladas covered in their famous mole sauce and topped with cheese. Ask for the Oaxacan cheese! It's very filling so can be shared with others. It also comes with bread and a side of rice.  Overall, I would come back to try their other traditional Oaxacan dishes! So many options!
Thank so much for your words Donna! We are so happy to know that you enjoyed your horchata and enchiladas. We can't wait to have you back!

My second time here. Still very delicious  they start you off with chips covered in Mole sauce . This restaurant is inspired by Oaxaca flavors .  They have a variety flavors of Mole ,which is one of my favorite foods.  I love their choices of appetizers that way you get a bit of everything. I really enjoyed the quesadilla frita ,has potatoes with cheese ,covered with black beans ,deep fried perfectly  Another good choice is their variety of tacos ,great way to taste different flavors ,try the memela sampler (keep in mind the tacos are homemade tortillas) Â Another favorite is Molotes ,potatoes with chorizo ,tiny bit spicy .  I noticed everyone had rice on there table. I decide to order my own. It came a small 8 oz of white rice with veggies. Nice and light .  I noticed all customer tables Â had different colorful flavored drinks . I decide to order a cocktail (Paloma) loved it ,they also have a lot of non alcohol drinks as well to choose from.  Many more big plates options .
Brenda thank you so much for coming back! Words like yours fill our hearts! It makes us so happy to know that you enjoyed a variety of our foods. We can't wait to have you back!

This is easily the best Oaxacan food on this side of the border! I don't care if you mom is from Oaxaca and makes Oaxacan food in your house, this restaurant is still better!  Everything from the food to the drinks was INCREDIBLE! The enchiladas almost brought tears to my eyes because the flavor took me back to my trip to Mexico. The mole sauce packed so much flavor that with each bite it was literally an explosion in my mouth... pause... I visited on a Friday evening without reservations. I waited approximately an hour to get seated. It was worth the wait, especially since there was a live band playing Spanish jams.

Bryan thank you so much for your kind words! This give us life and makes us feel very happy to hear that you enjoyed our food! It fills our hearts to know that the enchiladas brought you so much joy, we pride ourselves in bringing authentic food and flavors from Oaxaca. We can't wait to have you back!

More like 3.5 stars. I've been coming here for years and didn't really understand what all the fuss was about. Yes, putting sauce and queso on the chips is a nice touch, but then they get all soggy, not cool. The moles were OK too, but nothing out of the ordinary (maybe it was just the varieties available that made people rave) and the chicken was often on the dry side. Black beans were pretty good and the molded white rice, well... That all changed recently; we went off the beaten path a little bit and had what was the best meal I've had at this establishment in many years. We ordered the molotes, which look like empanadas shapped like kibbeh, and are stuffed with a mixture of Oaxacan chorizo and potatoes, think Mexican "corned beef hash" and there you go. The guac on top was a little bland but these things were delicious, and the chorizo had a nice little kick.  They were followed by chile rellenos, one of each, cheese and chicken (thanks to our server for suggesting). The chiles were on the smallish side (I understand they're from Oaxaca and not Pasillas) and generously stuffed. The chicken is shredded and seasoned with among other things, raisins, but not overly sweet. The cheese one is crammed chock-full of queso (which I find oddly flavorless) but the real star here is the sauce, which was delicious. In fact, the cheese relleno and sauce kind of reminded me of the old winter standby, Campbell's tomato soup & a grilled cheese sandwich, but much better. Delicious. There's a huge bar menu, but only one white wine, wtf??? Drinks are generous but you can run up a bar tab if you're not careful. Food portions are generous, too, and at these prices they should be. Service is friendly and attentive, and be forewarned, you will almost always have to wait. We arrived at 6:30 on a Wednesday evening and waited 45 minutes for our table. The room is big and loud (it was a Chinese restaurant in another life) so this isn't the best choice for a romantic dinner, but the live music on Wednesdays and Fridays is very cool. Guelaguetza is kind of an L.A. cult favorite and those places aren't always everything they're made out to be, but at least now I know what to order if/when I return. Took long enough...
Thank you Juan! It makes us so happy to know that you enjoyed your meal and experience. We are grateful you gave us another chance, thank you! We hope to see you again soon!

3.5 stars. Tasty Mexican food with a focus on Oaxaca. As others have mentioned it's pricy, though. The moles are tasty and the tlayudas are good as well. They sprinkle the chips with Oaxacan cheese and the salsa is OK. It's a big, boomy place and the service can be pokey and somewhat distracted. Live music most nights, too. Worth going to at least once if you're a local. They have a full bar and a large selection of tequilas and mescals if that's your bag. Valet parking or take your chances on the street.
40-50  mins

I've been waiting to come and try this establishment for the longest time, today it finally happened.  Got there 15 minutes before they opened to avoid the crowds and long waits to be seated! That's always a good idea for very popular places people!  They opened and we were 3rd in line, hostes greeted us and showed us to a table right away! Our waiter showed up right away and took our drink order.  I ordered a Chocolate de Leche and my wife a Cafe de olla, waiter brought some chips topped with mole and our drinks.  Chips with mole were delicious, the chocolate and cafe de olla were superb! My wife ordered La feria de los moles dish, 4 different types of mole with chicken breast. I ordered a Tlayuda Guelaguetza with tasajo, chorizo and pork cecina. I also odered a empanada con Huitlacoche, all of this items were very tasty, flavorful and delicious! Great ambiance, great service and very reasonable prices for what you get. High quality ingredients go in the process and preparation of this amazing dishes! I highly recommend this establishment!
Jose thank you so much! Words like yours fill our hearts with so much happiness and gratitude! We are so happy to know that you enjoyed your dining experience with us. We can't wait to have you back!

Everything was absolutely flavorful! We got the Molotes de Papa con Chorizo as an appetizer. The plate comes with three pieces - they're big and are stuffed with lots of meat. It's a super filling appetizer.  We ordered the Enchiladas Campesinas and the Tlayuda Guelaguetza. Both were huge servings! The enchiladas are three tortillas stuffed with plain shredded chicken in a mole of your choice. I picked the Mole Negro. It was good, but a bit too sweet for my taste. Either way, it was a still a very good mole. The tlayuda was about the size of a medium pizza. It's essentially a big tortilla covered in beans & oaxaca cheese and topped with three types of meats: grilled chorizo, grilled beef tasajo and grilled marinated pork cecina. Food was so flavorful & authentic! It makes sense the restaurant always has a huge line outside.
Thank you so much Erika! Words like your makes us very happy. It fills our hearts to know that you enjoyed your dining experience. We hope to see you again soon!

I like the Mexican vibe of the restaurant. They served crickets and moles. The crickets were quite sour, probably to kill off any funky taste. It was my first time trying the moles and maybe moles were just not my thing. A bit too sweet for dinner.
Absolutely wonderful. The food is delicious and the staff is nice. Queso fundido, pozole, birria chile relleno are all so good! Easy parking too. Highly recommend.
Chile Relenos, tacos and drinks. Â Everything was great! Â I come here everytime I am in LS!
Wowo! El sabor exquisito y unico, buen servicio, los meseros amables Gracias Gabriel.

The food was interesting and tasty. My favorite dish was definitely the Especial de Carnes and Queso Fundido. Â  My review is primarily for the great service! Our server Jair was exceptional! I had additional friends joining us for dinner and Jair was very accommodating. I had asked if we needed to put our name down again to get a larger table and he suggested a few ideas. He check with the host and the wait was about 1hr. So there was a single table next to us that was wrapping up on their tab. Jair quick and accommodating response to join the table was greatly appreciated although he could of easily said there is nothing he can do.  My observation was that there were different servers. There were some in white shirts and some in black shirts. The ones in white shirts seemed to be the primary servers and the ones in black shirts seemed to be the helpers. We were there for almost 4hr until they were closing and of course we were ordering a lot of drinks. There was multiple times my rowdy group was trying to get more drinks and while the main servers were not available (it was a busy night), the helpers stepped right in and tried to help us. I love how they all helped each other and demonstrated great teamwork!

This place is soo pretty we got to eat outside in the patio.  Service was amazing everyone super nice and attentive,  But the food!!  That was on another level of food coma!  Everything was super super delicious Â  We had seen this place on a YouTube video and knew we had to try it when we came out to California. And sure enough it didn't disappoint us!  Amazing place they have here!

Tried the meat and cheese platter for 4, as well as the queso app. The place is delicious and seems fairly authentic? Lots of Hispanic families when we went, always a good sign. The little mole I was able to try was also really good. Horchata came with a prickly pear fruit topper that made it a little different than the ones you see most days.  Live music was a pleasant surprise, though my only gripe is that it was SO LOUD that I had to almost scream across the table to a single friend and STILL couldn't really hear them. It was a bit of a bummer because it was the first time we'd been out in a long time and was looking forward to chatting. It was also hilarious watching the lone kid on the stage - he really looked like he didn't want to be there. His dad or whoever was singing and playing and he was just like =___=.  Plenty of parking in front of the restaurant on Olympic after 7pm.
Cindy thank you so much for your kind words! It make us happy to know that you enjoyed your meal. We hope to see you again soon!

Excellent festival of mole: negro, rojo, coloradito, and estofado (light, with olives and pickled chiles). Was surprised at how sweet each was. Rojo was my fave: my favorite balance of Chile flavor with all the nuts, spices and chocolate. Negro and coloradito were runners up, each deeply flavored in their own way, coloradito tasted somewhat sweeter. Estofado was good but very mild, but I liked the pickled chili kick in there. They put coloradito on their tortilla chips appetizer which is very tasty. Cocktails are pretty flavorful, and horchata is very mild flavored and exceptionally pretty with bright pink cactus syrup.  Service was very friendly but wait was quite long even at 3pm on Saturday afternoon: about 70 minutes for a table for 2. We sat outside and it was comfortable.  We'll be back to try some of the other dishes.

Thank you John! We love your description of the moles. We are very glad to know that you enjoyed your food and cocktails. Thank you so much for your patience and waiting to be seated. We look forward to having you back soon!
40-50  mins

Omg this place is AMAZIng  Was invited to a private birthday party ... The place is gorgeous the food is amazing  Yes Amazing ...great service delicious drinks  God whiling I will be back soon... This place is a must Definitely recommend.

Been to Toca Madera a handful of times now - and it never disappoints! It is consistent in its vibe, menu options, quality of food and service ; the downside is it's almost predictable how the night will unfold.  I've now tried so many things on the menu I don't even have a specific recommendation exception there really isn't a dish I wouldn't try again! If I had to pick a top three it would be:  1. Ceviche Blanco  2. Mexican Sashimi  3. Tostaditas  #4 as a bonus would be the tomahawk steak (if you have enough people to split it). Feel free to skip the calamari.  Definitely recommend Toca Madera, it is quite loud in many places, so a heads up to know your dinner party and make sure they're down for the vibe.

I absolutely LOVE Toca Madera, such a cool atmostphore. I've gone twice now, and the fire twirler is reason enough to come. But even more so if you are a tequila drinker like me as they have everything posssible under the sun including delicious specialty cocktails that are beyond extravaggent. Both times I've been there a guy with dirty blonde hair named Mikey was behind the bar where we sat. Amazing service, he knew the drinks so well and truly made our evenings special.  We also got a rare steak and honestly it beats any steakhouse! Yum! Pro tip: this place gets busy! Be sure to make a reservation! This is definitely a spot I'll be hitting up more due to ambience, perfect bartender service, and above all the best tequilas and food is outstanding. Their tacos are so bomb!! On blue corn tortilla, must have.  Can't wait to come back!
Always love coming here! Vibes and food are on point as usual! The music is so fun. Our server was amazing this time. Can't wait to come back!

Love the vibe, food and drinks! The cocktails are SO good, lots to choose from! Seriously felt like I was at a restaurant in Tulum. We came on a Wednesday and it was lit, I could only imagine how the weekends are here.

To say this is our new favorite Happy Hour place in LA is an understatement!  First of all, interior is absolutely gorgeous. We got a seat at the front of the restaurant next to the window and got a perfect view of the whole place. They offer complimentary chips and salsa which was 10/10. We also ordered the ceviche which was served with plantain chips which was very unique but so good!! We also got the guava margarita and ghost rider cocktails which were great as well and super spiked lol

Where do I start?! I wish Yelp allowed us to upload videos! Most of my footage was video. I really enjoyed this place!!  We came on a Tuesday at 7:30P and it was a good amount of ppl. We had Taylor as our server and he was awesome! We sat on the third floor level which was so nice and offered an awesome view.  Two of us ordered the Carne Asada -- and the presentation was very nice. It's served on a hot rock that continues to cook the steak to your liking. Very cool! The other two order the Salmon which they enjoyed but not as much as we enjoy those steaks. At some point Taylor was feeling great and sent us the first Passion Fruit hot shot on the house! Such a cool experience too! Thank you Taylor for that! We liked them so much, I ordered another round. They bring it out on fire and it's a whole thing.  We must've come on a good night too because they had live entertainment (pictured, but the video is a better depiction). She ate the fire and did a little dance and whatnot -- very cool and on point. The whole thing was a vibe!  I would go back 10 times a week! Go and check it out. There was paid parking in a small lot next door that we were lucky enough to get. It was a very good time! One of favorite spots that we visited. Can't wait to visit L.A. again to go here.

Talk about being smokin' HOT â€ almost a year later, and Toca Madera is still the place to be! I absolutely love everything about this restaurant. From the food (obviously), to the decor, to the ambiance, and right down to the amazing staff. Special shout-out to our waiter Justin. Who asked my family and I, if we were celebrating anything- to which we said yes- a birthday, and he brought us over some cool shots! If you're reading this, thank you- you're awesome! My experience when dining here is never short of a great time. I can't recommend this place enough! As I write this, my mouth is drooling thinking about the carne asada, and the spicy habanero sauce that comes with it! Check out my foodie page on Instagram @kimeats.la for more!

Come to Toca Madera if you want to be surrounded by good vibes, and are ready to eat delicious food!  This place is seriously so cool, from the decor to the ambiance, right down to their tasty food.  This review is a bit late, as I went pre covid, but I just had to share my wonderful experience with you all! The staff are patient, knowledgeable of menu items, and attentive- which is great because they're usually always busy.  A huge plus about this place, is that the drinks aren't watered down! Best of all, everything here is super Instagram worthy. I can't wait to come back for more.

First time here and everything was incredible. If there are levels of Mexican restaurants, this is a 4 star restaurant.  The service, the dim lighting, the greenery around the bar, the sofa bar cushions were actually comfortable. There is a gorgeous patio out back. We got lucky and found parking on the street. We had great service with lots of suggests.  The passion fruit margarita is a must! The Caesar salad with chicken was phenomenal. There is a rub on the chicken that had the perfect amount of spice and flavor, very juicy.  I came around 3pm but it does state there is a dress code, I'm sure for dinner.

I love that they have a variety of vegan and low carb dishes to choose from. Not only does the food look good but it tastes even better. And omghe their drink selection and presentation is quite impressive. Great atmosphere and whoever designed this place, definetly made me feel whatever the Toca Madera vibes was supposed to be.

Hello Mazen,  Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a review. We are so pleased to hear your positive feedback from the entrees, to the drinks and the overall ambiance of Toca Madera! Â Please reach out to us via Direct Message if you need anything in the future! We look forwarding to seeing you again soon.

Sexy, lively, lovely ambiance and great drinks. Definitely reserve this place ahead of time so you can skip the queue because this place does get poppin at night, especially weekends.  Got the Los Muertos drink. Mind you I am not a tequila drinker (I'm a gin cocktail type of girl), and this tequila cocktail got me hooketh. Had blood orange, lime, agave, hibiscus and topped with sprinkled brown sugar which would be later torched on fire, adding that bit of sweet twist to the tequila cocktail. Delicious and entertaining to watch the bartender sprinkle fired sugar into your drink.  Came here to grab some bites; which were the Mexican Sashimi and grilles scallops. Both were so good! Both dishes had stunning presentation which made the whole experience even better. Mexican Sashimi was served in tuna in the shape of a rose, with avocado slides, radish, and thin cucumber slices adorned with pomegranate seeds and edible flowers. Sashimi itself was excellent but the presentation definitely made the tasting better. Grilled scallops were cooked to perfection. Super soft and had a lot of flavor too. You dip it in the yellow sauce and take a small chunk of the pickled radish as you devour the scallops. You could taste the charr and crunchiness of the scallops too.  Towards the end of the night, there was a fire performer doing amazing fire stunts in the dining room and it definitely took me by surprise. The music was awesome. Mostly EDM (deep house/club music vibe) which elevated my overall dining experience because I love me some good food and good dance/house music. It did give me a bit of a Tulum vibe. Overall it exceeded my expectation and I can't wait to be back, but for future dinner reservation.

My second time at Toca Madera for brunch, and the experience was just OK.  I don't know if it was just an off day or what, but everything was blah. The first time I ate at Toca Madera was for a friend's birthday, and the food was terrific. The second time I went, I ordered the same thing, and my steak was undercooked, and overall the taste was not good. I will say that the atmosphere is amazing, but aside from that, I don't think I will be back. Also, the hostess was rude. We made our reservation through OpenTable, and when we arrived a few minutes late. She lectured us about being late, and she said they would accommodate us now but not in the future. Mind you; the restaurant was basically empty. Anyways that was a complete turn-off as I did not appreciate the way she spoke to use.
Thank you for your feedback. I'm sorry to hear about your latest experience with us. Please be on the lookout for a DM from us so we can talk more about what happened.

Food and drinks were amazing. Â The atmosphere was lively, Â the decor was beautiful. Â The tree and lanterns set the mood. The walls were covered with plants, and the restaurant had a woman perform a fire dance a few times during our visit.
Thanks for visiting Toca Madera and for taking the time to leave a review. I am pleased to hear you had a wonderful experience with us. We hope to see you soon!

If you're in West Hollywood looking for strong drinks and good food, look no further. Â  The hubby and I popped in after making reservations and before seeing a show to get loose. Â We started with very strong drinks. Â So strong that I couldn't even finish my guava margarita and had to pass it over to him. Â  We shared the queso fundido with warm tortillas which was excellent. Â It had mushrooms, onions, soyrizo and poblanos which was comforting, warm and delicious. Â We not only used the tortillas that came with it but also the corn chips that were complimentary when we were seated. Â  Next came the chicken enchiladas. Â Though they could've been a few degrees warmer inside, the flavors were very good, tasted fresh and well put together. Â They had a kick to them for those that aren't used to any spice in their food but we devoured them nonetheless. Â  LA isn't cheap and the bill after tip was over $100 for an appetizer, entree and two drinks. Â Steep but the company was good, so I'd do it again.

Look out every other restaurant ever - because Toca Madera has taken first place in my heart. The ambience, the food, the gorgeous bar, and the beautiful dining area surrounded by plants and vines .. it was all such a great experience. I actually cried after taking the first bite of my Enchiladas...I haven't been able to eat dairy in years and haven't had a cheese enchilada in probably 4 years (that actually tasted like real cheese)! It made my entire evening. Im sitting and eating leftovers as I type, and it's seriously just as good. Everything we ordered was absolutely incredible - from the drinks, to the appetizers, and the chocolate vegan mousse! Our server, Michaella, was INCREDIBLY kind, attentive, and knowledgeable. She made my birthday so special and we really enjoyed talking to her. We will absolutely be requesting her in the future when we return.  Tips:  they have valet parking to the left of the restaurant for $14  we were able to sit at the bar and enjoy a cocktail while they were getting our table ready they have Mezcal Monday's and Taco Tuesday's!!

Thank you for visiting Toca Madera and for taking the time to leave a review. I am pleased to hear your all around experience with us was great! I will be sure to let Michaella know your positive feedback! Thanks again we hope to see you soon!

Strong drinks, decent food, great ambiance.  Firstly, the drinks are strong yet delicious. I ordered a drink with honey and ginger, per the Bartender's recommendation (forgot the name, but you can mention it to the Bartender). The drink itself was lightly sweetened yet not overpowering. On top of that, you don't really taste the alcohol and you'll feel the buzz when you're ready to order a 2nd round. They also serve shots with a cucumbers as garnish and somehow lit on fire. It's very unique imho. The guava marg was also very refreshing.  Next, the food. They have great presentations with their shrimp tacos. The color pairings on the taco plates looked very vibrant. It had green and pink garnish on top, then shrimp, followed by a purple tortilla, served on a bamboo/wooden platter. The flavor of the shrimp tacos were decent. Â The Carne Asada entrÃ©e' I ordered was served on hot plate, and the rice, beans and salsa was served in a separate bowl with another napkin for the hot tortillas. Again, the Carne Asada entrÃ©e' was decent.  The ambiance of Toca Madera was very modern and luxurious with a hint of rustic. The roof was basically the sky, and though the interior may seem dark prior to entry, once you step in, it becomes very bright and upbeat. They also have a back section which is even brighter, though I didn't tour that area as much.  Overall, the ambiance, atmosphere and strong drinks were the top selling points of Toca Madera; the drinks were moderately priced for the location its in. Unfortunately, the food was a bit more on the lackluster side and seems overly priced. The service was also a bit slow though I believe there were only 2 servers working that day...though they had at least 4 bussers around.

What We Ordered: Drink - Winnie de Pooh Appetizer (not pictured) - Flautas Entree - American Waygu, A La Roca, beans and rice  Pros: Toca Madera was a great experience! It an upscale Mexican restaurant that is lively and energetic. The food was AMAZING! The pico de Gallo (which I believe was complimentary) was the freshest I've had in a LONG time! Please also try the flautas, so good and spicy! I would surely visit Toca Madera again when visiting LA.  Cons: None! Make a reservation now!

2nd review for this business  UNPROFESSIONAL AND CHILDISH!!! Â so apparently someone Was upset about my last review ( most likely the owner). I got a private message from a fake page stating that I should just stay home and eat Taco Bell. LOL. Â Sir/ma'am. I've had Taco Bell, and I'd rather eat there dude. Trust me . Don't be mad at me, be better.

Not all are treated equal that's for sure... so I came in with a group in influencers that apparently had a set menu. Â That's cool. Â But I told the waiter before hand that I would like to order the steak and he can charge me separately. This never happened. I never received my entree. The entire time he was no where to be found. It was like trying to spot a rare bird. I guess we weren't as important as the other customers because we were getting things for free. So he didn't feel as if he needed to check on us. Â But danggg. IM TRYING TO PAY YOU! Â HEELLLOOOO. Â The food that I did try was okay. Nothing to bring about. This place did have vegan options which is nice. Not that it matters to me much. It was more like a club in there than anything. Really LOUD. Maybe he didn't hear me say "Hey I wanna pay you for my steak thanks".

I've had this place bookmarked for some time and I was excited to know that it was walking distance from Kyle Chan's Jewelry store. I was even happier to find out that we made it just in time for happy hour. We were seated outdoors at a high table top. It was a bit warm but it cooled off as the evening rolled in. The husband and I ordered a few things to share. We ordered: -Manchengo truffle fries ($9): curly fries that were thankfully not too salty or oily. Served with a somewhat spicy cream sauce   -Street taco box- ($18) 5 tacos in a box. pro tip: they're in the box's drawer! A few options available but all tacos need to be the same protein (vegan chicken, jidori chicken or shredded beef). We ordered the shredded beef. The tacos were super small and in my opinion, a bit over priced. Nothing special other than being served in some fancy box.  -Ceviche blanco ($10): Chilean sea bass poke style type of ceviche. This was pretty darn good! All the ingredients were super fresh, plenty of fish and avocado to go with each bite. Highly recommended. I also had one glass of their happy hour cabernet. It was a nice pour. I was tempted to get their guava margarita too but held back. Do I regret it? Kinda. I would have added the 4th star if our waitress would have told us after she walked by multiple times that our tacos were inside the box. I had to ask her if she could check in on the tacos since we were pretty much done with all our other food. Sadly our tacos had been sitting inside the box the whole time.. they def weren't hot anymore but just warm since they were individually wrapped in foil. We just stared at the box with the condiments for almost an hour waiting for our tacos to come out. Sigh... Who knew. I would say skip the tacos for sure if you come here and be ready for a semi expensive happy hour. Service is ok, you might have to be on top of your game and be the one proactive about getting their attention..

First thing first....get yourself a reservation if you can. We got lucky, and was able to get a spot in the front patio. But, we did have to hang out for a bit.  We yelped this place and didn't read all the reviews. Lol. So, this is like a classy Mexican cuisine restaurant and a day club at the same time. Lol. Loud music. Like club music. And look, I wasn't mad by it....just wasn't prepared for it. Lol.  Once we got seated, service was pretty good. Cocktail list is pretty exquisite. The presentation on the drinks were excellent and the drinks also tasted delicious and unique.  Meals also came out the same. Hot. Beautiful presentation. Unique and powerful flavors. And as far as price...I'd say reasonably priced for the items they present.  I would definitely eat here again. Will bring my club attire next time tho. Lol.

Went here last Thursday with my best friend. It was nice! I enjoyed my time here. It was very loud, and we were seated right under a speaker, which made it super hard for my friend and I to hear each other. We wanted to sit in the indoor garden area, but the way reservations work is weird. It's not specific.  We ordered the queso Fundido, it was amazing!!, The guacamole was good. I got chicken enchiladas and my friend got ceviche! Everything was delicious! I'm not sure I'd come back here based on how loud it is, but otherwise the food was good. I can't complain :).

Hey Esmeralda,  Thank you so much for leaving a review. We love hearing you enjoyed the food and drinks, but were disappointed that you may not return because of the music! We are always looking for feedback, so if at any point the music is too loud we are happy to adjust. We do hope to see you in again soon, and would love to seat you in the Garden!

I got the papas breakfast tacos and added black beans. I also got the mole poblano and both were delicious. It hit the spot. Â I also got the horchata and added cold brew. Sheesh!!! We just finished a 5k so this was the right move. Try them out! You won't regret it!

We are coming here for long time now and have tried every taco they have and they were all delicious. They have some great vegeritian options also. Â Staff and service is amazing also. I will definitely come back again and again

Fresh tortillas and incredibly flavorful tacos! Any taco that is priced three dollars and over I tend to have higher expectations. Guisado delivered! I opted with trying out the sampler, which consists of 6 mini tacos. Tinga de pollo and the steak picado stood out to me, in all honesty however, I loved every bite of each taco. The freshly made tortillas and ingredients are what separates Guisado from the sea of taco trucks & restaurants in LA. The horchata is also slightly milkier than most taco joints. Tastes like cinnamon toast crunch in a cup  I left smiling. Felt the love in each bite!

Ooh man so yummy!!! I love Mexican food and tbh I don't think we have anything as good as this in Hawaii.. so sad LOL. But I really liked Guisados and everything I tried. The taco sampler was so worth it there was just one I wasn't too into but still! Really great flavors and each was unique in its own way. I also loved the ceviche special! So worth it and was a nice change up because it was refreshing and crunchy!! And tart! The tamales were yummy too I've never had these kinds of flavors in it and I wish I got more honestly. The location was a bit surprising but I would 100% go back for this food. OH and of course the horchata was amazing. Wishing I got their other drinks because they looked amazing too. So stoked I tried this. I recommend!

It was my first time here and I'm so glad I decided to try it. Customer service is friendly and helpful. They have their own parking lot, but it's quite small. Luckily there is street parking too right next to it. My absolute favorite taco I tried here was the Cochinita Pibil. This taco has a sweetness to it that balances out the savory. Amazing flavor. My second favorite had to be Pescado. Honestly all of them were amazing but my least favorite was the shrimp. I tried almost one of each taco to see what it was all about. I am definitely a fan of the different flavors they have going on with the different meats. Funny enough they have a taco with ONLY peppers in it which is extremely spicy- try at your own risk lol. One thing too- I hate horchata but I tried the one here and I'm still thinking about it! Omg! Please do yourself a favor and try their horchata. It had the perfect level of sweetness and cinammon. It definitely slapped my sweet tooth after eating all those tacos! Definitely would come back here again.
Everything was good, and the samplers are a great way to try six different mini tacos for poco dinero. Best tacos were the pescado and the vegan pepper tacos.

Easily some of the best tacos I've ever had. Can't remember what I ordered but the shrimp and beef tacos are the best of the lot. The slow braised beef had beautiful texture and flavors.  Lots of street parking available.

Delicious! My tastebuds were very happy today with the varied flavors of tacos, quesadillas, and ceviche! The Armando Palmer was refreshing as well! And there's plenty of seating inside or out on the back patio. I definitely will come back!

Did you even visit LA if you don't stop at a recommended taco joint? We met a friend here who promised some of the best tacos we've ever had, and he kept his promise! Would recommend starting with the taco sampler, which allows you to choose 6 mini tacos, if you still have room after that you can get favorites in the next round. Our top hits include the quesadilla, frijoles & cheese, cochinita, and steak picado. Don't forget your agua fresca to cool off from the hot LA heat.  Tip: parking in LA can be tough, but they have a dedicated lot a few lots down so keep your eyes peeled.

OK... I gotta say that third time's a charm at Guisados. The first two times (in downtown) the tacos didn't change my life... However, this time around, I was impressed. Â Maybe because I got my own tacos instead of doing the sampler and also now discovering that I have an allergy to peanuts, I have to avoid all molÃ© options everywhere I go and choosing my own tacos was the wayyyy better route. The white fish taco is divine - will be a must get the next time I come here. Â The bistek was another great one. Â I may skip the shrimp just because it wasn't as flavorful as I hoped (in comparison to the other tacos!) Â The pork and chicken were cool and good choices to supplement my two other choices. My favorite part? Â Their house-made corn tortilla!!! Â Whew, the texture is everything. You need about three or four tacos to get full or you can always opt for the sampler (six min tacos) If you are anything like me and the first time wasn't as hyped up as you'd hope it'd be then give it a try another time! Â May be worth a shot :)

Erik from the front is so rude. He was giving me attitude for no reason when all I asked was if I could get sauce on the side. He proceeded to be rude through the whole transaction. Â If I'm paying more than $60 for tacos at least have good service.  Ps food is good especially the drinks but I'd rather take my business to somewhere they appreciate it

Have been here many times since 2016. In in love w the cochinita and the mole tacos. Today my bf and I got the sampler plate for $8 then went back to get more. He loved the cochinita tacos. Everything was tasty with some heat! The house made tortillas were so fresh and you could taste the corn. The service was friendly and quick. We didn't realize their was a dodger game until we drove by the line. It's cool they offer blue horchata. We had the jamaica agua fresca. It was floral and sweet. My bf said it was too sweet and strong for him, but I enjoyed it. The fountain had a leak, so if you sit at the table to the left on the decline, your feet will get wet. My sock got wet since I wore slides lol. The customers had sticks up their Â the local hipsters were pretty obnoxious and entitled about the extra chairs that were next to me. - just a tip if you're tired of the new "locals".

Every time I'm in LA I always try to stop by a Guisados. Â  Best horchata I've ever had, hands down. Â I would like to be baptized in their horchata before I die. I get the Quesadilla con Chorizo & the Mole Poblano every single time and then I cycle through these ones:  - Camarones - Pescado - Tinga De Pollo - Bistek en Salsa Roja - Steak Picado - Chicharron They're all so good and really filling!

After running an errand in the area, I figured I might as well enjoy some awesome LA eats. Ever since I visited this taco spot with my buddy, I've been craving a return trip, so I made my way back to Guisados recently. Just like the first time, these tacos were just as amazing as I had remembered them!  Service: Great! Just as friendly and polite as previous trip! Decor: Cozy entranceway to place the order at the counter, but it opens up to a spacious back patio. Beautiful ambient lighting above, a small waterfall along the side wall, and a gorgeous mural on the all of the small parking lot (recommend you street park somewhere and walk over) Food: For my drink, I had a cup of their Jamaica (about $2.50). It is a drink that is both refreshing and slightly tart at the same time. A great drink that pairs well with the meal.  My all-time fave and MVP of them all - the Cochinita Pibil ($3.25). I can't get over that incredibly, melt-in-your-mouth, tender shredded pork mixed with that perfect blend of sweet and spicy achiote chile/habanero salsa. Also, the tart from the pickled onions compliments it all very well. I loved the quesadilla on my last trip, so I kicked it up a notch by going for the Quesadilla con Chorizo ($5.75). Oh man, I have to say, this is a thing of beauty nestled in that homemade, warm corn tortilla. Imagine a giant block of gooey queso panela surrounded by that smoky, slightly sweet and spicy, seasoned ground pork tastiness. A new fave of mine instantly! Speaking of new faves, have to add their Bistek en Salsa Roja ($3.25) to my list. Juicy strips of flank steak are dressed with red bell peppers, tomatoes, chile arbol, and an avocado slice. Truly yummy!  While not bad, this was probably the most ordinary of all the tacos I tried - their Camarones ($3.50) taco. Generous servings of shrimp are surrounded by a fajita filling (grilled onions and red/green peppers) along with a chipotle crema (sauce is on the faint side in terms of flavor, so I actually wish it had a bit impact).  Each bite was pure joy t! With such consistent quality and flavors, I will be making return trips to #guisados for sure!

My favorite, new, go-to taco shop in LA! Why have I become such a quick, passionate new fan? First, I really enjoy the ambiance of the atmosphere they have created there. The corridor to the ordering desk is cozy but it opens up to a bigger, interior dining area. The outdoor patio is this super relaxing and tranquil seating area with hanging lights, beautiful Latin art murals, a small waterfall, etc. The mural out in the parking area wall is fantastic! Second, the service was super great. The cashier had a bright, warm smile and a super enthusiastic, pleasant, positive personality. She genuinely was excited to share with me all the dishes they had to offer at this shop. Third, the tortillas are absolutely great! You can tell it is handmade and fresh because of how fluffy and lightly, pleasantly corn flavoring it is (no old tinge in taste). Fourth, their horchata is the right balance of milky, sweet, and cinnamon bite. Fifth, the tacos are just simply amazing - yummy overload. I tried the four recommendations I received. Item #1 is the quesadilla which contains this grilled, giant chunk of queso panela that is supported with a light chipotle cream sauce and the smokiness of the grilling. Item #2 was the pescado (fish) taco which is composed of a flaky fish center balanced by crisp cabbage, a light cilantro and avocado sauce, black beans, and refreshing pico de Gallo. Item #3 was the mole poblano taco - soft but giant chunks of stewed meat topped with a scattering of queso fresco, sour cream, dried chile flakes, and red onion. To me, had this wonderful meaty, peppery flavor to it. The final item, my buddy and my favorite, was the Cochinita Pibil. It's a taco with an addictive blend of sweet, tangy, and spicy all-in-one! The taco is composed of marinated pork, red achiote spice, black beans, pickled onion, and habanero chile. All of these were solid tacos in my opinion. Will definitely visit again to try the other tacos!

Love this place! We went evening on the swan rental, this place was nearby. Due to the ratings and it being close we gave it a try.  Shout out to the cashier that was here on Saturday evening, they were super welcoming and helpful.  Parking is a little tight, we're lucky to grab a spot but they do have an additional lot within Â walking distance with a banner. Â  We got the OG sampler, consist of 6 mini tacos, horchata (blue dodger theme),Jamaica, lime Aguas frescas.   We sat outside, weather was nice and they have a great outdoor seating that's inviting. Out of all the tacos we tried, I absolutely love the chicharron, steak en salsa Roja, the shrimp, and fish tacos. The only one I didn't like was the chile verde pork I thought was on the tough dry side. But that's what the sampler is for.  For the vegetarians, they also have a nice selection. I tried their mushrooms with cilantro Â very flavorful!  All in all great place to try Guisados and FRESHLY made tortillas!

This place is so good the tacos are legit and reasonable, with some great and patient service. The drinks are good and well priced this is definitely a repeat spot with great artwork as well. Anytime I come by this place has a line and I can see why, if you ever see it free definitely go by.
Always delicious! Love their homemade tortillas. Great selection, tasty and flavorful tacos. They are small, but we just buy more!
Sampler is the best! Love their handmade tortilla is super delicious. Steak one is the best.
Would I recommend this business? Does a bear shit in the woods?! Delicious, fresh, deeply flavorful and lite tacos every time. Reliably satisfying.
Consistently incredible tacos that will make you want to take a drive here from any part if town just to eat them.

Hands down some of the THE BEST tacos I have had in a long time! Â I am sad that they are all the way in DTLA because I live in Orange County lol. Â I ordered 3 tacos: Bistek en Salsa Roja (5/5): Â Chef's kiss. Â Delicious AF. Â Flavors galore. Â SO. GOOD. Steak Picado (4/5): Â Very good meat and flavoring. Â I honestly did not need any extra sauces. Camarones (5/5): Â Mmm... Spicy spicy but oh so good. Â This is not a mild spicy, it's a kick in your mouth spicy so if you can't handle the spice, it won't be too nice (for you) lol. The staff here are tremendous. Â Very upbeat and friendly. Â The food was so good I had to go to the counter to compliment the cooks. Â Will be back if I am ever in the area!

Food: 3/5 Service: 3.5/5 Ambiance: 3.5/5 Overall: Pretty Standard fare in my mind. The extended review... Food: 3/5 - I had a few different flavors and the flavors were fairly standard. Â There wasn't anything that particularly stood out for me. Â  Service: 3.5/5 - Friendly staff but it's more of a order at the counter and seat yourself restaurant. Ambiance: 3.5/5 - Good outdoor seating in the arcade but of course you don't know who will be around you. Â There were a few smokers near by so I wasn't ecstatic about that.

I came here twice and I surely wasn't disappointed. This review will just be straight to the point that this place is absolutely great. Delicious, affordable, and plenty of seating in the back to enjoy your delicious and affordable tacos. They also make great drinks too and offer a variety of options that you can pick.  I highly recommend you get their sampler plate and if that is not filling, you can easily order more after you are done with the sampler plate so that you know which tacos you like the most.

Camarones Â and Pescado tacos are straight delish. I am truly glad to have experienced a foodgasm before I left the area.... Much respect for such a simple but authentic dining experience. Â  is the best way I can put it. Â The taste was so fresh every bite.........

Bottom Line: Inferior to the original location, Guisados DTLA has a little trouble being prompt on their orders, but is worthy of a visit. I'd recommend the East LA location. Ordered the Asada and the shrimp taco. I feel both tacos were homogeneously tasteful. The tortilla shells themselves were a little over-fried and greasier than I'd like. Still above average than most places. On the plus side, their tortillas are homemade.

Some of the best tacos I've had!!! They were pretty cheap and the service was really good. We got a few different options and were not disappointed by any of the tacos. The lemonades were also refreshing and much needed on a warm day.

The sampler is a great choice because you can taste all their different tacos Â  tasty food well seasoned plus they sell alcohol it doesn't get any better than this! Og sampler must get! Staff extremely friendly and clean atmosphere most importantly!! Will definitely be returning!

I knew I would eventually have a true 5-star experience that relied solely on the deliciousness of the food and not the nice service or cool ambience. This food, without anything else factored in, is a 10 out of 5 I will remember this spot and come back to it religiously from now on.  The tortillas are hand made and the food is straight from grandmas cookbook. The essence of Mexican food, not just tacos, is here. The home style selection is what true Mexicans call tacos. The homemade dishes that ppl out into a soft fresh tortilla during dinner to make a "taco" No ppl we don't eat al pastor tacos or carne asada tacos at home. I can't get over how yummy each and every morsel was.  I had the carne en salsa roja taco. Steak with red sauce. Tasted like my mom made it. Tortilla was delicious as well.  The tinga taco tasted so much like my sisters famous recipe that I think it may not be so secret after all. Wow! And a kick of heat on this one that will make you want more. Also comes with avocado, several do.  The mole poblano taco was also a textbook rendition with nice sweet notes and small warm chocolate vibes. Good to change it up.  Then I had the chicharrÃ³n taco and let's just say it stole the show. So flavorful and served with a bit of frijoles (beans) it was like a bite of home.  Overall I cannot overstate how much this place has impressed me. The cheapest meal was my most memorable.

With so many options for tacos nearby, I feel lucky to have found such a gem of a spot.  I actually never had tacos with braised meats...I'm hooked! We got 2 sampler plates and everything was delicious. Saucy, juicy and not dried out, flavorful and not too spicy.  I came hungry and was worried the sampler size tacos wouldn't be filling but it was plentiful.

Tasty tacos, beautiful Mexican atmosphere and outdoor seating, hole in the wall type place. Wonderful for cheap tacos with good flavor.  I got the spiciest taco with like 5 different types of peppers, and boy did I cry. Was fun to eat and totally worth it, just to clear out my nostrils. ;p  Otherwise, I'd recommend the steak (which creatively had sesame seeds and pumpkin seeds for a secret crunchy texture) over the chicken taco, tho both were great.

Tome el sampler. Las tortillas hechas a Mano. Mole, bistec, cochinita pibil y mas. Porciones perfectas. Aguas frescos y cervezas. Muy atentos y amables.

These tacos are some of the best in LA! First off, the price is spot on for the serving size. We had more than enough food for dinner for 2 people for $40.  We ordered from postmates and the order was wrapped well.  We got 9 different tacos (all types - vegan, vegetarian, pork, etc) and they were ALL absolutely delicious. The only one I will call out - we did get one of the Chiles Toreados tacos and it was killer. I got hiccups from the spiciness on the first bite and couldn't even finish it. I was warned and was expecting that when I ordered it though, I guess I was just in the mood for pain. They were unfortunately out of tamales so we didn't get to try those, more to look forward to on our next order!

I went out on a taco splurge to find the best tacos in Downtown Los Angeles. For this unofficial competition, I decided to try Sonoratown, Tacos 1986, and Guisados. Determining these taquerias was based on most Yelp reviews, proximity, and somewhere I haven't tried before. Details of each review will be posted individually to the shop, respectively. And in one of the reviews, I will reveal the winner.  We were the only group inside waiting for our food. A stranger comes in and approaches the cook. The cook hands him food covered in aluminum foil, and the person immediately walks out. I think charity is remarkable goodwill, but when someone pays full price (as these tacos were on the pricier side) and is patiently waiting for his food, I just thought it was not the right time to be doing that in front of my face. Â I hope that incident was a misunderstanding.  I ordered: STEAK PICADO TACO - Flank steak simmered with green bell peppers and bacon. Served with green serrano chile atop black beans - This taco was so soft that a person with no teeth would not have difficulties to finish this meal. The meat was juicy and packed so much flavor. Between the three taquerias, I enjoyed this taco the most. Bravo! CHICHARON TACO - Pork rinds simmered in chile verde. Served with green serrano chile, atop black beans - This was another soft taco that melted in my mouth. The texture of chicharon was very smooth and buttery. Both tacos were super delish.  I learned that tacos come in all sizes and forms. This restaurant shows that meat does not always have to be grilled for satisfaction; instead, braised meat is perfectly acceptable in a taco culture.

My undergrad old stomping grounds! I was studying at FIDM when I first discovered this place! I was instantly hooked! It was definitely nostalgic to come by not only because it had been a place I frequented a lot in my FIDM days but because of Covid. It breaks my soul to see so many restaurants and businesses suffering a huge loss as a result of COVID-19. Â  Anyhow, the tacos here are amazing! I have tried pretty much almost everything on the menu. My favorite is still, the chicharrÃ³n tacos!! Â the chorizo quesadilla is a close second! Last night I of course had a chicharrÃ³n taco but I also had the mole poblano taco. Best part in my opinion is the hand made tortillas! They taste just as good as the tortillas I've had in many parts of Mexico during my travels! The aguas frescas are also so yummy!  I'm staying at the biltmore hotel so this was just around the corner for me to walk to. It was still early but he streets in DTLA were eerily desolate! :/ I was the only customer there and Tina, who took my order came and just started a conversation with me and asked me if my food was ok because I took out my tacos to take a picture lol . It was nice to talk to her and share our mutual thoughts/feelings Â on the whole covid 19 situation and not being able to have a dine-in experience in many restaurants. I thanked her again for my food/order and I walked through the indoor/outdoor plaza/corridor and went back to my hotel room to enjoy my tacos! Guisados has several locations, definitely recommend stopping by if you're near any of the locations!

This place is so great! Â The service is fast and the food is delicious. Â  Did I mention the prices are awesome too. Â  I work in the film/tv industry, so I love that this DTLA location is generally close to where we are filming. Â I usually get the chicken mole tacos and sometimes the carne asada. Â  Â Both are excellent choices and they don't skimp on the meat. Â  The family packs are a great value too!
Thought they were rather bland. I had higher expectations but most of the tacos tasted similar to each other.  Overall it's OK.

First time at Guisados and I have mixed emotions. Â I ordered the shrimp taco which was 5 and the grilled fish taco which was also a 5 but the asada tacos are not carne asada as there more of a beef stew type meat. The potato taco was just as good as the picture shows . Probably the worst potato taco I've ever had. And the queso tamale was dry and nothing to rave about. The tortillas are what will make me come back again as they are phenomenal. Oh yeah the salsa is tasty definitely a 5

Ahhhh, Guisados you have me at braised meats!!  Came here in January when the lockdown was lifted and outdoor dining was open. We sat at one of the indoor patio tables and ordered the sampler (6 mini tacos) plus a mushroom taco and a shrimp taco. TBH, I couldn't tell you which one I liked the best, I inhaled them all so fast. Â Every single one of them was packed with flavors and meats were perfectly juicy. I didn't even stop to take pictures of the food, it was that good! Â  The agua Fresca was good too, but a bit too sweet for my liking. Staff was friendly and chill. A total gem in DTLA!!
I luv Guisados. Their tinga and mole tacos are the  bomb.com . las Aguas frescas, de limon y melon son tan refrescantes. I luv luv them.
This is not your traditional taco place, but definitely worth a try! The fillings are more "wet" - imagine chile verde inside of a taco.  The horchata WITH cold brew is a must have!!!!

Their carne asada is delicious very good and flavor. Their red chile is spicy and green chile is flavorful, but not much spice. Everything else on the menu is okay, but their carne asada tacos is what my husband and I keep going back for. The place itself is not very aesthetic and it can get crowded and rowdy in the evening, especially on weekends.

Fast, inexpensive authentic tacos and burritos. An LA staple. Can never go wrong with El Taurino or King Taco, although, I'm a bit bias, and tend to favor King Taco Â ... but either's great, and can never go wrong with their red sauce. CMON NOW  Just gotta come back on the weekend one day! To try their "Castillas Rancheras" !! And "Barbacoa" !!

We stopped by for a late night taco run, and this place was busy on a Friday night around 11:30 pm. I ordered carne asada tacos, and my friends ordered carne asada burritos. The table we sat at in the dining area had not been bussed (not sure if they even do that there) but we had to clean up someones mess before we sat down to eat.  The food was good, as was the green salsa and horchata....but the one thing that irked me is the DISGUST Â inside the ladies room.  Ladies do better! Management BE better at caring about the cleanliness of your facility! If your bathroom looks this way, what does your kitchen look like? The bathrooms had no paper towels, a backed up toilet, and very little toilet paper as well as trash everywhere. Bathrooms say a lot about an establishment caring about the cleanliness and being hygienic , and based on that alone, I would not dine there ever again.

Famous taco place in town. Unhappy experience. I gave one star because terrible customer service  Today I order 10 beef tacos, 10 pork tacos and nachos with cheese. Usually they give good portions of jalapeÃ±os. I asked jalapeÃ±o for nachos, they give me tiny container of jalapeÃ±o. I paid $50 and terrible customer service, I'm not going back from now on
***THEIR CONSOME FLAVOR HAS CHANGED!!!*** been commingto eat Â here for years with my husband and lately their consome has been so watery Â anyone else noticed?

Have loved this place for many many years. Today however the customer service, which may be managements fault, was incredibly slow. Have been sitting here for an hour already and there are still probably 10 or so people ahead of us. Ordering was very fast but they just don't have enough employees working or something. We've waited before but this is ridiculous! No food should take this long! There are lots of people waiting but their calling of numbers has been so slow. The food just isn't coming out fast enough for some reason. Hire people!

Like other Yelpers, El Taurino, carries childhood nostalgia. I remember delicious carne asada tacos, horchata, and long lines. None of those things have changed! Granted, it is about 1.80 a taco, which is kind of expensive for what it is. The horchata is the damn best. Not too sweet, and not chalky. Just perfect. The carne asada taco is solid. The thing that brings it over the top are the SAUCES. I love their red hot sauce. It burns my mouth, but has such good flavor. I wish they sold fries here too. I would love their red hot sauce with asada and guacamole. They sell fried platanos, potatoes, and churros. The oil was new and a good color. Platanos were sweet and fresh.  Restaurants are no different than favorite household brands. I could go to a King Taco closer to home, but it wouldn't illicit the same feeling.

I ordered toco from here and they treat customers poorly and even if they aren't English speakers, they should understand what is beef and pork is. Minus two stars because they are stingy and racist. They are so stingy when it comes to sauces and everything else. As time goes by, portions are definitely getting smaller. The best taco in town! Their carne asada and al pastor are sooo good:) Didn't know we can ask for single taco shell, try it you can have more tacos this way XD

Service is bad, workers need to learn how to handle employees, place has no salt, no veggies to give or lemon so don't ask, and the lady at front handling the food orders is mean so learn some customer service or don't work at all ..

I've been coming here since I was very little. The food used to be great. I stopped coming here a couple decades ago when they started charging for the hot sauce and removed the radishes and the lack of meat in their burritos. And today I came back just due to convenience and I was reminded why I stopped coming here. I ordered a "burrito de asada" and I may as well have ordered a rice burrito. In this picture, my burrito is half way eaten. Where is the meat? I really wish el taurino didn't lower their standards THIS low.

Food is okay but there are so many other good taco places in town too with much better service. Â  It is understandable that some restaurants would do this, Â even though most restaurants would make the pick up order because they trust their customers. Â El Taurino should let customers know on the phone that they will not make the order until it's been paid. Â They did not say anything when I placed my order. Â I ended up standing in line to pay, only to know that they would never start to make it untill I paid and I Â had to walk away. Â I felt like I had been tricked by them. I wasted time driving there and standing in line.

Food is just ok, not worth all the wait. Last time I ordered pick up over the phone, and when I arrive to pick up about 45 minutes later I saw the phone orders don't get put in until you arrive and pay. So they actually do not take pick up orders it's first come first serve. This place needs to stop hiring family members and start hiring people that know how to work in a restaurant. When I dine in. It's usually chaos and food takes usually over 45 minutes to be ready.  Also don't order Uber eats or any other app from them, I noticed they apply the same dumb rule that food doesn't start being prepared until the driver arrives.  Overall I think this place needs better management

I love coming here for their carne asada tostadas and its pretty much the only thing I get. They always hit the spot and never disappoint. They also hook it up and load the tostadas with a lot of meat so that's always a plus! Eating this can get messy though so be prepared for it to fall apart from the weight of the meat. I've also tried their quesadilla with al pastor and it was good but I was expecting a little more meat in it.

Best Torta that I have personally had in Los Angeles; Bistec con queso con todo. Unfortuantely it does get a little busy because everybody knows how fire the food is. They probably have the best decor of any restaraunt I have seen, go check it out for yourself, it won't dissapoint.

Best tacos and way better than their sister restaurant King Taco. Been a regular for 12 years and the people who are giving this place less than 5 stars don't know what they're talking about. Obvi during covid there were going to be some hiccups but last time I went I could tell the regular cooks/preparers were back! The red salsa was spicy just like it used to be and my burrito was FAT. Also Taurino has certain peak times and they stay the same unless it's Christmas time. Annnnnd if you haven't been born and raised in LA then you wouldn't appreciate this establishment and everything that it is. Please take your gentrified a** somewhere else. Side note...if you want more meat just ask for extra carne!

First visit in five hundred+ visits within twenty or so years I am able to walk in, walk straight to the cashier and order without waiting shoulder to shoulder with fellow belligerents in a Six Flags line, wow, there is nein a bloody soul in sight, oh my baby-jesus I have died and gone to taco heaven! Ever see that South Park episode where Cartman buys a theme park? Yes, that is how this peels. Wouldn't say anything's a wowzer, no pickled veg bar, bully yet dilapitading decore, but the saving grace is ET's salsa roja ay-caramba, its extraterrestrial, the holy grail of spicy, it is literally to-die-for and elevates ETs flavors over competitors. TBH their meat variety is more limited, no tripas, good asada, cabeza isn't very juicy... but it's simple Mexican food done right, reasonably priced, and always consistent, having fed starving drunk angelinos for decades and going strong. ET team's sense-of-urgency is always en pointe, y'all rock, if the virus wasn't an issue I'd be smothering y'all in taco-flavored kisses. They hardly speak a lick of English but are always welcoming, least to me, just be positive, it radiates. Tacos, sopes, tortas, tamales, and slices of ooey-gooey stretchy-cheesy quesadillas con carne dunked in sweat-my-elephantitus-balls-off here-comes-the-pain but it's-so-deliciously-addicting salsa roja, if my stomach was immune I'd be chugging this like Dracula, in fact, this must be what Tom Cruise's blood tastes like, drink from El Taurino and live forever...

Interesting joint. Their food is not better in anyway whatsoever compared to competitors, but their Salsa Roja... .... the Holy Grail must've been brimming with this stuff for those knights to go galavanting into oblivion, it's bloody bunny worth it. It's SO addicting that after waking up, weeping on the throne for thirty dirty minutes, here we are at 07:47, cheeks bulging with Butter Pecan ice cream that's been drizzled with caramel Pepto Bismo in attempts to battle the infernal wrath of the tamales heating up in the oven at this very moment! The POWER of Bismo compels you! Aye lads, we.. have zero willpower, but dude you try it, resistance is futile. Decor is bully, literally, cool mural, staff hardly speaks a lick of English so you being inebriated and limited to simple phrases like "Carne Asada Fries" is beneficial. Here is where you gorge after raging in LA if you have $7, don't worry if you're wasted, every man, woman, and child in there is too cause that sauce is sprinkled with crack. -1 Star for your dreadful restroom which deems your cleanliness as questionable, aim for In-N-Out! YOU CAN DO IT!

I have missed you dearly oh Roja...Since my first taste of you in high school it is so difficult to enjoy another spicier, flavorful, and umami up the whazoo salsa roja then you. Yes, your cousin at King Taco taste wonderful as well. But there is something about you here...Maybe it's the fact that I can those wonderful Carnitas Tostadas here where the oil form the meat drenches the bottom tostada, and the top is layered with tomato, guacomole, onions (upon request), cotija cheese, and cream. Or is it when I order an all-meat al pastor nachos with onions...and I douse you with meat and cheese my head is in extreme bliss...But oh, every time I come I do need to wait, but I can be patient for you. I due wish that this wonderful salsa roja was in Orange County.  Till the next time. Nice.

Wow! Tacos are one of my favorite foods, and Leo's tacos really is one of the best taco places I've had. What really brings me back is the al-pastor (pork) huarache. Huaraches are oval-shaped masa (corn dough) that resemble a Mexican sandal (huarache).  The masa is about 0.5 cm thick, packed with pastor (whichever meat of your choice), avocado, cabbage, tomato, and I believe sour cream and queso fresco crumble.  I've also had the Hawaiian Quesadilla. If you love the pineapples with pastor, you might love this too! This particular quesdilla order is filled with pineapple, cheese, pastor, and ham.  This taco truck location is located on a gas station lot, so parking can be quite difficult. There's a line to order at the stand in front of the truck.  After ordering, you'll receive a receipt with your number on it. The most recent time I went, they had a separate Leo's truck specifically for condiments. They have a sign that says it is $1 for extra condiments. I usually show my receipt to them. There are sauces, radish, lime, and onion/green onions.  There are 3 sauces: green, red, guac. My favorite are the green and guac, which both have a slight nice kick of spice to it.  Yum! And service is great. They were very sweet each time I've been here!

CASH ONLY We went on a Sunday afternoon around 3-4PM. Parking could be tight but it is manageable. You can park at the gas station or street parking. It was a long wait because the person in front of us ordered 50 tacos. We ordered chicken, carne asada, and al pastor tacos. Their al pastor tacos were really good. I really liked their salsas. My boyfriend liked the chicken and carne asada but they were a bit dry so add extra lime and salsas. They give you radish too. The carne asada fries is $11.

This was the second stop on our self guided taco tour while we were in LA.  We just got a single Al Pastor taco. I thought the taco was pretty good, but I've had better Al Pastor tacos.  I wouldn't go out of my way to try this spot since I think there are better taco spots in LA, but if you're in the area, it's not a bad choice.
The service is quick, food is not bad! The portions of side items (viggies for tacos, salsas) was perfect amount. My kids where happy with everything too.

When in LA you need to go to a taco truck and good thing Leo's has multiple locations! We came around noon and were able to order pretty quickly. We had to get their Al pastor tacos so we got those plus a cabeza and Asada taco alongside their red sauce. All the tacos were great and I did enjoy the asada and cabeza more than the Al pastor which was surprising considering they are known for Al pastor. I just wish the Al pastor was a bit more tender. The slices are thin and perfect yet they had more of a bite then I'd like. The cabeza was cooked perfectly and had that great softness too it. The asada was also damn good so I recommend getting those for sure. And it must be mentioned that these tacos are only $1.75 each! I'm used to tacos in NorCal costing at least $2.50 if not $3.00 smh.

Pulled up to Leo's Taco Truck around 10:30pm and there was a fat line and it was so hard to find parking ;-; We ordered the well known al pastor tacos, a carne asada taco, and an al pastor quesadilla! The tacos were pretty good and I liked how there was pineapple on it!! I know Leo's is known for their al pastor but I lowkey liked the carne asada more. The quesadilla was alright...the cheese was just not super melty which definitely made a difference. Overall, the wait was reasonable for the amount of people that were there, but I'd be okay skipping out on it.

Leo's Tacos serves some of LA's freshest tacos. I often find myself here with friends on a late night after going out or for a spontaneous hang out. Leo's Tacos is located in a corner in the parking lot of a gas station. The lines can get pretty long, but they're still relatively quick.

Hot this taco truck up on a late night while I was in Hollywood. It was ok! I ordered carnitas tacos and for some reason my carnitas tasted like chicken. I think they gave me chicken! Lol the only downside was my taco shells didn't seem cooked like they were right out of the package. I returned my horchata it wasn't sweet and tasted really watery. The light green sauce was really really good if your not into spicy. Will I go back? I'm not sure! Â maybe!

Leo how I love you.... or at least your nachos.... My nachos were absolutely incredible but tacos? My al pastor tacos were terrible! Flavorless the only thing I tasted was the pineapple. I would come back for the nachos but the tacos nope. They also should say the numbers in english because not everyone understands Spanish

As a Bay Area native we often hear the tacos in LA are superior. My partner and I came to Los Angeles for the first time together and we're on a mission to try various types of tacos. This was our first location as we arrive pretty late. There was a pretty impressive line and they had a really cool set up with one track where you order the food and the other truck is where you receive your salsas and additional items for your food. There was a little bit of confusion as our order did not come out and 15 minutes later we checked in and they stated our order had already been picked up. They graciously made us a new order and overall the tacos were pretty good. I was expecting a little bit more flavor in the meat, and I'm happy I tried this place but I can't say it was the best tacos I've ever had. I suggest you come and check this place out and judge for yourself.

AMAZING! Nothing more is needed. Honestly, because this location was next to the gas station, I doubted the taste. However, many people were ordering and waiting for the food to be ready. Once I tasted the food, I knew I'd come back for sure. This place was CASH ONLY.

The tacos are decent, not my favorite. All 3 sauces are great, the al pastor obviously a winner. I wish they put some like grilled onions peppers or jalapeÃ±os to spice it up. BUT - what made the experience 5 stars was the quesadilla hawaiana... oh my lord. I've never had pineapple in a quesadilla before but I'm definitely going to look out for it now!!! Life changing. Their horchata was deep in the cinnamon flavor too. So good.

This is a taco truck in a gas station. It is incredibly busy . The tacos are 1.75 and are delicious . Get the pork with grilled pineapple , el pastor , it's amazing. They only take cash so be ready . The salsas are hot and fresh . Definitely go !

You might see the pics and be like meh, but once you taste that green salsa with the tacos or the quesadilla...you'll be shocked and how good it is!!! We also got the asada fries - very saucy and the meat was good. Love that they give you a little bag with the onions, cilantro, salsas, and turnip things. It lets you really control how much you want on your tacos.

I don't know how people get the pics of the sliced al pastor as my al pastor tacos looked diced and supermarket level quality. I've been here twice in the day time and it hasn't blown me away. El flamin taco is miles better as the al pastor is crispy and delicious. I'm a bit disappointed.

Leo's tacos always tastes delicious no matter what time of day. Apparently they are always busy so expect a wait when you get there after finding that parking spot. Order al pastor tacos and you're welcome. Don't forget to take cash.

The truck literally says "best tacos al pastor" and they aren't kidding. They've earned that name for sure.  We stopped by for late night tacos. They're parked at a corner gas station so it can get pretty packed. They have two trucks, one to order food and the other one just for condiments. Make sure you bring cash! Even just $10 goes a long way here.  We tried out the al pastor tacos, cabeza taco, and a mulita. We ate the al pastor first but I wish we saved it for last. It was so flavorful but my favorite part was how they shave the meat down and how thinly sliced it was. The cabeza taco was good too, but better with all the toppings and salsa. The mulita is definitely a heavier option, perfect if you want the cheesy aspect. But honestly you could just order a dozen of the al pastor tacos only and be in heaven already. It's good by itself already since it has the flavor with the grilled pineapple, but add on their guac, salsa, lime, cilantro and onions for the ultimate experience.  We came back the next night but just our luck, they were closed for Good Friday. This is definitely going to be a spot we return to every time we come to SoCal. They have multiple trucks at different locations too so there's just no excuse!

Al pastor tacos at a great price. The quesadilla was a 10/10 and I could drink the red sauce every day. The spot is in a busy intersection and there is no seating or bathrooms so plan to eat somewhere else!
Better than a restaurant, The food is always fresh and authentic. I love supporting local businesses and it feels right with Leo's Tacos Truck

Where do I begin , well for starters I don't normally buy from food trucks but I've heard a lot about it so I thought I'd give it a try I arrived around 10:30 am a couple of people were there once I was leaving there was already a big line and I can see why . It's only cash no card I paid about $35 for 3 tacos 2 burritos 2 sopes and 2 large horchatas. The meat, in general, is so soft and flavorful I got Asada and tripa for tacos and Asada and al pastor for burritos and just regular Asada for the sopes none of the meat was burned or no stale tortillas I would definitely come back to buy some more it is a 30 min. Drive from where I live but so worth it!
