Given that I still think about these tacos weekly, 10 years after moving from LA, I think it warrants an upgrade to five stars These are the best tacos

Nice. Ricky sets up his fish fryers in the garden adjacent to Mi Alma every weekend from 12:30ish to 5:30ish. The fish, and sometimes shrimp, are cooked up in a delicious golden hot tub of oil and flavor. The tacos are big and simple: just a fish filet (or two shrimp), some cabbage, and some pico de gallo. Two should fill you up, though you may want three just because they taste so good. Hell, have four! Go for it. Try them with all four sauces, but my personal fave is a little mayo, a little spicy red. The garden itself is charming and unique, but has a glaringly problematic lack of shade. They either blast KCRW's eclectic music or have someone playing on the stage. All in all, it makes for a pleasant weekend lunch.

Ricky's is friendly and the tacos are fresh! I like how they use clean oil and the refreshing slaw, jalapeÃ±o, tomatoes on top adds nice texture and flavor to the tacos. Salsas were also great, i really like all three-mild, med and spicy.  The thing I didn't enjoy was the batter of the fish-its too salty. Also the shrimp was kinda small.  I ordered 2fish and 2 Shrimp and it was enough for me. However, $20 for four tacos seem a little steep.
never misses Make sure to try all the sauces/salsas  Fish and shrimp tacos are equally as great  staff is great too

Got 3 fish tacos and 1 rickys special, which had fried fish and fried shrimp. The fish is fried to perfection! I wish they gave lime or something or salted the fish a littleeee. I did feel like it was missing something. The fried shrimp was good!  I love the freshnesss of the tacos. Definitely need to get more salsa next time though!

Delicious fish tacos!!! The food truck is a bit hidden in a random neighborhood and is under a bridge overpass so it could seem off-putting at first but don't let that deter you! The tacos here are super light and refreshing. Some fish tacos can be too heavy but not this one!  I'm excited to come back here again! Definitely one of my top taco places in LA.

I would drive past this place all the time when leaving Griffith Park, and always wanted to try it but was really skeptical. It's pretty common for most places to say they have "the best fish tacos" but this places wasn't joking. They had fish, shrimp and a 50/50 one, so we ordered one of each. Each taco was delicious my favorite was the regular fish tacos. It was flavorful had a nice texture, and a little kick at the end of your bite. Overall it really was the best fish tacos I've had, can't wait to go back.

This taco joint sets the standard for what Baja style fried fish taco means in SoCal! The beach style food is a symbol of fresh cooking right off the grill, and this popular joint always draws a busy line where folks are waiting for our hungry tacos. Go ahead and walk to the order window, or place your order online, for the refreshing and crunchy fried fish tacos. The fat flour tortillas are layered with bits of veggies and condiments and a thick meaty fillet. The fried shrimp is crunchy on the outside and tender on the inside - a must for me every time I'm here!

Yeah, you ain't ever gonna go wrong with RICKYS FISH TACOS. Ever.  With that being said, the beautiful ambiance underneath the historic 5 free with all the passing vehicles, completes the CALI lifestyle.  3 options of "hot" sauces, and they are all beyond flavorful and you're not going wrong even if you dab em all at once. Also crema! Can't forget the cream based sauce it's fire! I doused my tacos like they have never been drenched in my life. Saucier the better I say.  Refreshing and so light. You don't feel off after consuming 5 tacos. You don't get an unpleasant seafood flavor, it's all fresh.  So I can't remember how many of what I got, but it was a variation between the "fish taco" and rickys special. Both were FANTASTIC. A++ in my book. You're greeted by friendly staff from the truck and just the from the feels you already know you're in for a treat. Can't believe it took my this long to finally take a nab at RICKYS FISH TACOS. Thanks for being bomb! Everything was phenomenal. Can't wait to go back!

I love a good fish taco... Ricky's makes a damn good one. Ricky's Fish Tacos was new to me. I had no idea until recently. Shame on me for that. We tried a couple of times, drove by but they werent there. Today, finally the stars aligned. It was just after lunch time on a cool Wednesday in LA. We made our way along Riverside Dr between Los Feliz and Glendale Blvd and spotted Ricky's. Yes!! I ordered 2 fish tacos ($3.75 each) and the lady ordered 2 fish tacos and a shrimp taco ($3.75). You order and pay at the small window on the right. Cash or card. You're given a number and pick up at the small window on the left. When we walked up, there was just one person ordering before us. We ordered and waited about 5-7 mins before our tacos were ready. Sodas & drinks in the cooler door to the left. Pour your own squeeze bottle salsas (in varying heat) and crema inside the cooler door to the right. We walked to the car and posted up there to eat. First thought upon seeing the tacos. Wow. They dont skimp. The cabbage, diced tomatoes and diced jalapenos are aplenty and a generous portion of battered and fried fish. Deliciously crispy battered and fried fish, I might add. Perfect crunch, fresh flaky fish, great slaw with a kick and the perfect crema to drizzle. They are some of the best fish tacos I've had. It's the crunch of the batter and the flakiness of the fresh fish for me. I guess there's a reason why so many people flock here. Jonathan Gold never lied... never. He knew what LA liked and LA liked what he knew. Ricky's Fish Tacos was one of those places.  Street parking along Riverside only. Finding a spot may be tough. Its worth it when you do. I like how they accept credit cards. Service was quick and friendly. There is a letter written in pencil posted on the window that was obviously written by a young fan of Ricky's Fish Tacos. It's a good read.

The batter on these are so delicious !!  Lots of flavor and super fresh !!!  Great service Fast and safe  My only reason for 4 and not 5 stars is that they don't believe in limes with there fish tacos !! Even though the batter is delicious it can be a bit salty and needed that zest to freshen it up and cut through that salt !! Other then that every was delicious and all the sauce cups were a must try on the tacos !
The tacos are good but the prices are very high. I don't think you get for you are paying for.

Mmm absolutely loved Ricky's Fish Tacos. There's a reason why this truck was on Jonathan Gold's 101 Best Restaurants list. They have just a few offerings-- mainly fish tacos, shrimp tacos, half shrimp/ half fish, and occasionally lobster tacos-- and all of their options are stellar. The shrimp tacos, which I doused with the verde sauce, were my favorite! You might want to order ahead as they're pretty popular, and we had a bit of a wait ordering at the truck on a Saturday afternoon.

Hubby had waited a long time to try this. Â At last... Â  The truck is parked right by the 5 South onramp on Riverside Dr. near Los Feliz. Â We went on a Sunday soon after it opened. Â 5th in line or so, we got our tacos after under 20 minutes. Â We tried Fish, Shrimp & Special (combo of fish & shrimp), and they are all tasty. Â Good-sized tacos, and they did not skimp on the ingredients. Â I was full from just eating 2. Â  Hubby had 4, and he said it was probably too much. Â My only gripe is they are a bit too spicy. Â Next time I'd ask them to hold the jalapeÃ±o. Â Don't forget to sauce up your tacos. Â  They range from Not Spicy to Hot and are stored in the fridge built into the truck. Â  The door handle is to your right when you order at the window. Â We would not have known had we not seen the patrons before us open the fridge. Street parking is available but might get tough with all the red curb, but if you don't mind crossing the street, it's not bad. Â  Go try Rick's.

Both the Fish Taco and the Ricky Special are incredible. Always fresh and really fast. Wish they had more hours, their food is a craving all the time.  Their staff is very friendly and helpful.  I wish they did the lobster tacos so we could try them! We found this on buzzfeed and they're the best tacos in LA for sure. I tried this week and I came ten minutes too late

Deserving if its fame. Fish is so light and crispy and the slaw is so refreshing with a nice kick. All their sauces are amazing and would recommend just putting all of them on. Only real downsides is you have to catch them in their limited hours so it might be real busy. Its only a two man show, but that helps you appreciate the effort and expertise that goes into these tacos

I love a good fish taco so I was excited to see that I was near Ricky's on my day trip in LA. Even after a day of eating, I had to drop by to try them out. They are located in an underpass which was a bit difficult to get to, so I had to rely on Google maps to get me there. Because it was a weekend, I was surprised to see that there was no wait, but I won't complain.  I ordered 1 Fish Taco and 1 Shrimp Taco to split with my girlfriend. My first impression was the lack of sauce on the tacos, which now after reading some of the reviews, seems like I needed to ask for it. Kind of disappointing that they didn't offer anything when I picked up the food. The undressed slaw definitely took away from the deliciousness of the fish. I can imagine it would be been significantly better with the sauces. The shrimp taco wasn't too great as well.  Overall, it wasn't the best fish taco I've ever had but now that I know that I needed to ask for the sauce and salsa, maybe I'll give it another shot if I'm ever in the area.

Review During Covid: For the amount of reviews this truck has, it did not meet my expectations, sadly.  Here's why: Fish and shrimp were well seasoned, but the other components were mediocre. The slaw was just cabbage, tomatoes, and jalapeÃ±os-- so it was a tad spicy with that kick. Be mindful how much salsa you put! I put a ton of salsa, so it was spicy! The ratio of batter and protein was not good as well. I didn't taste the fish much, only the batter. I actually liked the shrimp taco better than the fish in this case, but I was looking forward to some bomb fish tacos. The tortillas also did not taste fresh. They had that hard chew type of texture, so it tasted like a day old tortillas.  I liked that you can put salsas on your own, but make sure to use hand sanitizer after. Communal salsa bottles don't feel right to me during this time. I wish they can put it into little containers for us or sanitize the bottles regularly (which I don't know if they do).

Ugh. Does anyone do it better than Ricky's? I think not. The batter is so crispy, yet the fish always so tender. They top it with a basic slaw that probably wouldn't be great undressed, but add one of their salsas and white sauce and the end result in an unbelievable flavor explosion.  Their spicy salsa will knock you off your feet, so I like to start with one taco with the spiciest salsa, and chase the next taco(s) with the mildest. To me, I don't really like the medium tier salsa because I think the smokiness detracts from my taco experience, but to each their own.  COVID update: they are definitely still operating, but wait times can be 30+ minutes if you go during the lunch rush! Bring a book. Or make yourself drool by looking at photos of the delicious tacos you are about to eat.
Truly some of the best fish tacos.  I always send people to rickys fish taco truck for a fix and they always come back satisfied! Definitely a must try.

2 stars based on availability. Been coming here on Wednesday and Thursday and the truck hasn't been here. Called a few times with no response. Not sure what's going on with this truck but I suggest updating hours and time availabilities.

Excellent experience coming to HomeState for brunch. I did not stay to eat at the shop, but there seemed to be nice outdoor seating - though on this particular Sunday morning, it was packed and I would have had to wait for a seat. I was in and out in 10 minutes, including the line to order. Ordered the Trinity, Pechos, and Potato tacos. Thoroughly enjoyed the portion sizes and three tacos might've even been too much if I hadn't been starving. I'd say on a normal outing (read: when I come back), two tacos would be a sufficient meal. I got them on flour tortillas and love em.  The packaging was excellent for take-out, and each taco is wrapped in a burrito of aluminum foil and clearly labeled via colorful tape that's easy to rip off when it's time to unwrap the goodness within. Mine were still warm 30 minutes after I picked them up.  The staff member at the counter was super courteous and patient with my indecisive ordering. He said I should expect to wait 10 minutes, but the food was out in 5. The place is very busy so everything served was freshly prepared.  Overall 5 star experience.

I was jonesing for some queso and remembered that HomeState was on my list. Â Drove to the Hollywood location and waited in line for a couple of minutes. FYI - parking was a huge pain, so beware that you might have to search for a bit. The service was absolutely amazing. Â I asked the cashier server what an appropriate amount of tacos would be and he said 3-4 is a good starting point. Â We got the Blanco, Potatoes, Emo's tacos with the house flour tortilla and it was so freaking delish! Â  Also got the Lil' Queso and it came with a decent amount of chips. Once we were done, a waiter came over with another serving of chips and we had to sadly turn him down. Â Great service for sure! Food all tasted great, and the queso hit the spot. They do check for vaccinations, which made me feel safe. All in all, I'll definitely be back! Ambiance: 3/5 Food: 4/5 Service: 5/5 Overall: 4/5 Would Return: Yes

Really, really good food--and they give you a lot of food for the price.  My only disappointment here was the chicken taco, which wasn't bad, but just wasn't good. The potato taco, however, was DELICIOUS! Reallllly crispy potatoes and the pickled jalapeÃ±os were so good, I'm going to come back specifically for this taco.  The spicy frozen Paloma was great too, and super necessary after waiting in that long line in the heat. I'm not a huge fan of queso but that was also really yummy!

Texas-Toast brisket/chicken sandwich makes for a nice quick lunch. And even though Homeastate reps the Texan style, the brisket is more of a deli/roast instead of smoked. Can you imagine if it were, how much of a knockout this would be?  I felt the sandwich to be dry in certain places, that it required the spicier homemade salsa in order to bring out its better qualities. For eleven or twelve bucks in 2021, I think the restaurant can afford to provide some tortilla chips on the side. Instead, an order is gonna cost you a few dollars more. For busy lunch/dinner hours, expect wait times between 15-25 minutes -- possibly more if you're ordering the Texas toast sandwich.

Seriously great breakfast tacos. Can beat the price, quality, quantity, or that flour tortilla. Tried one corn tortilla, it was good but don't play yourself, go flour only.  My favorite was the don't mess with Texas taco, the beans were amazing. I eat a good amount but 2 tacos was plenty for me. Potatoes are on the salty side but very tasty, & that queso was worth every dip. Very generous portions here & great quality, worth the hype. Came on a Saturday a little before 11am and no line/issues getting seating but by 11:30 there was a huge line and no seating left.

We should have called in before standing in the long line through scorching hot weather. My blood sugar levels dropped before we got to the counter so I headed back to the car to revive myself with some snacks and A/C. They tossed an extra taco with our order for free, we only ordered 6 : Potato, Trinity and Pecos. Thanks guys!  They were all good but my favorite was Potato. The sauces were good too. Nothing mind blowing but an easy meal if you need some fuel. I liked the masking tape they used with the printed names, cute details or what? If you're in the area and are craving some decent breakfast tacos, hit them up. Customer service gets an A+ according to my gal that placed the order before I headed back to the car for relief. There's also a super kewl bookstore across the street too if you want to take a trip back to nostalgia lane..

I've been eating at HomeState since the day they opened. This Tex-Mex taqueria sources only the best ingredients and uses them in their magnificent rolled-up tacos. I've tried quite a few of the offerings and now know what I like: the BLANCO and the PECOS.  The Blanco is their vegetarian taco with egg whites and portobello mushrooms. I add avocado on it for a buck more. It's just a healthy and heavenly morsel, a soft flour tortilla wrapped around fluffy eggs and 'shrooms to do with as you please...  The Pecos taco, I get w avo also and, again, always w the flour tortilla. The brisket is perfectly seasoned, miraculously almost as soft as the fluffy egg, and just combines sooooo well w it and the cheese. That first bite just rolls the eyes back in my head each time. You get HomeState's homemade green salsa verde and red rioja salsa sauce for dipping and while I prefer the green, I always alternate between the two for some reason. Certain tacos are best served with a particular salsa but that's a personal call so just play around with it all. One thing you'll quickly determine though? They just complete the taco, like how Rene Zellweger completes Tom Cruise in JERRY MAGUIRE-- by the end of the meal (film), you cannot have imagined one without the other. (*Yes, I crack myself up.) HomeState has scaled out some and there is probably one near you. I've only eaten at the first one in Los Angeles as it's closest to me, the one on Hollywood Blvd in Los Feliz. I usually carry the HomeState grub over to Go Get Em Tiger for their superlative coffee and it's always just a great way to start the day.

Such good tacos and well packaged too (so you don't have to worry about them falling apart in transit). I went with the potato tacos and it was packed with ingredients. The sauces also pack a punch--pretty spicy in a subtle way. Very satisfying and memorable. Will definitely be coming back for more  P.S I went on a taco tour in LA and this place has by far the best vegetarian options

Ok ok ok. Yes yes yes!!! My bf and I have been dying to try this place and for some reason never did... until today!! Everything was fresh and delicious. We got 2 picadilla tacos (then ordered another to share cause they were sooo dang good!), one chicken and one potato taco! We also got the lil queso dip! Which is an absolute MUST!!!  We will be back very soon :)  Also the root beer they have is BOMB!

Homestate had me with the mention they make their tortillas in house! Â A few friends had been here before and had good things to say. Â The interior is very clean and organized. I ordered the Trinity (Bacon, eggs, potato, and cheese) and a Guadalupe (Chorizo, eggs, and cheese) taco. Â For our party of 4, our order came out quickly. Â Both tacos were really good and the tortilla itself had the texture and slight pull I was hoping for. Â The queso was pretty good too. Both sauces were so good and I found myself bouncing back and forth between the red and green for every bite, culminating in both on my last bite. Â It doesn't top my fav tacos from Austin, but it's up there. Â I'm guessing they're among the best in LA!

This is one of my favorite Tex mex places and would come here in a heartbeat. A friend reminded me that a cute coffee shop was situated here prior. The parking is not super great though. They have a small lot and an extra lot next to it, but maybe a total of 20 spaces. It seems like people somehow make their way here because the rush seemed to come and go around 11:30-12:30 on a Saturday.  My friend and I ordered the loaded queso. Not usually a fan of beans but it was really good over the chips. Don't forget to save a little extra queso for your tacos! Sooooo good!  I got the potato tacos and this one is a classic with cheese melted with some slices cabbage and other goodness on a flour tortilla. I also got the chicken but didn't find it to have any spark.  My friend ordered us both the peach green tea lemonade and it was super watered down and the hibiscus was super tart. I think I'd rather stick to my own water for now. So glad that home state finally came to Pasadena and the food did not disappoint!
Great Tacos, from carnivore to Vegan. Margarita's rock too. I'm a fan of corn tortillas, but they make their own flour in house, I recommend them.

My husband raved about the breakfast tacos here before, and we happened to be across the street already and needed a quick bite before our long drive home. I placed an order through their website for some tacos and it was ready in about 15 minutes. They pack everything so nicely and the tacos are clearly labeled, and comes with red and green salsa.  The blanco was my least favorite of the three but it's a great veggie and healthier option because of the egg whites. It's definitely better with the spicy salsa though. It was a close call between the pecos breakfast taco (shredded brisket) and the tijuana panthers taco but I had to pick the latter as my favorite, because of the addition of queso and potatoes. The pico de gallo added another layer of juiciness to the taco too.  They have more on the menu here than just tacos but I don't blame you if you wanna just come for the tacos itself. Can't beat an all day breakfast taco menu either!
All you need to know is to Just look at the line! Â Tasty hipster tacos across the street from an unhoused sidewalk encampment. Â This is LA!

Second time ordering pick up through Yelp from HomeState. The cheese quesadilla and buÃ±uelos take the win over the tacos. The food was five stars but the delivery timing isn't accurate. I received an email stating my order would be ready in 12 minutes but Yelp never updated an order time even after I picked up my order.  After waiting for the time frame mentioned in Yelp the food was completely cold.

Got 2 breakfast tacos to go. Came 5 minutes after I ordered online and it was ready. Got the brisket and bacon breakfast taco. The bacon one was way better. It was very good. Bacon was crispy. The brisket one lacked flavors, luckily they gave 2 mini salsas (red and green), so added them made it a bit better. Not the best salsa I've ever had, but I'd come back to try their other items. Staff was friendly and polite.

I loved this place. I would drive a long distance for Austin-style breakfast tacos, and this was the best version of those I've had in California. There was a big line, so prepare for a wait, but wow it was absolutely worth it. Strongly recommend.

I was craving some Mexican food and this place hits the spot in Los Feliz. There are definitely cheaper alternatives like taco stands scattered across west LA but don't skip out on this place that offers some Tex-mex style tacos! I personally ordered the popular non-vegetarian choices: Trinity and brisket taco. The trinity consisted of egg, potato, bacon, and cheese and although it appears to be a basic breakfast taco, the execution is excellent. The bacon and potato is quite crispy and gives a good contrast to the soft tortilla. The beef brisket taco is overloaded with brisket along with guacamole. The tacos are filling and at an excellent price point for a standard meal, although it's definitely more than taco stands. The busy-ness of this place varies a lot; we went for dinner and ordered ahead in anticipation of crowds but it wasn't busy, but according to a friend, ordering online helps a lot since the place is takeout style anyway. I've heard that the morning and lunchtime is where it's the busiest so keep that in mind. Note that as of now, there is absolutely no seating options available so you will need to find a bench somewhere to eat or take the food home. Slight inconvenience but it's most likely due to covid precautions

This place just hits the spot! My friends and I have been wanting to come to Homestate ever since they were featured on Buzzfeed and finally were able to. The breakfast tacos are so delicious -- especially with the red and green sauces. Queso is a dream as well. We got three tacos each and our favorites are the Guadalupe, Blanco, and Pecos (Trinity was delicious too)! Drinks are nice and refreshing -- beware the Hibiscus Limeade is tart (like ooh you can really really taste the lime in there) but so good and moreish. When we arrived, there was a line but service is really fast and seats get emptied quickly. They have outdoor and indoor seating (indoor has larger tables for big groups) but both work really well! The music is great, atmosphere is so casual and trendy -- love it!

Surprisingly good! We had the brisket and chicken tacos. The brisket was soft and tasty. The only thing about the tacos is they do get expensive once you add more things to the taco. The tortilla cinnamon dessert was a nice addition! Will definitely be back since my 2 year old devoured the quesadilla.

I had an hour to kill and a hungry stomach to fill, so I looked here on Yelp for a good burrito close to my location. This place didn't disappoint. I asked the very helpful girl at the window if the carnitas were a specialty. She enthusiastically said "YES" (while also telling me the shrimp burrito was what they are most known for).  I ordered it. I liked it. Crispy carnitas in small pieces with a wonderful flavor. Too many places give you big chunks of pork. That's not how you want to do it. Sky's lived up to its "Gourmet" name. I recommend it.  Outdoor patio is inviting despite some of the traffic noise from Pico.

Sad to say that Sky's isn't as good as I remember. Â I used to live on Hauser near Pico but moved in 2010...back then, Skys was in a tiny spot right near that intersection. They've since moved (4 years ago) to a larger space across the street a few blocks down. The ambiance is lovely and staff is fine, but it took a really long time to get my food, and there were only two people who had ordered before me. The food is what was really lacking though. I had one potato and cheese taco and one tofu taco. The tofu taco was DROWNING in oil. Unbearable and inedible. The potato taco was swimming in oil. Not quite drowning...treading oil, if you will. Ha. I took them to the front counter where you place your order and showed the cashier and she didn't seem surprised. I asked her if this is normally how the tofu taco is served and she said yes because that's how you have to cook tofu..."in oil and butter"!! Â Ummm...I've been vegetarian since 1996, so needless to say I've cooked my fair share of tofu. Overkill. Big time. Â She asked if I wanted something else and because I didn't want to wait another 20 minutes for one taco, I asked for two new tortillas instead. The tortillas used in both of my tacos were so drenched in oil and butter that they literally ripped in half when I picked one up for the first bite. I am sorely disappointed, as I've been waiting to come back and try Sky's tacos for over ten years since I moved. The owner is lovely, I remember meeting her a decade ago...she may want to speak to the cooks because this was just so unappealing. Super sad and feeling rather sick as to what I just partially ate.

I've had their mushroom tacos, yummm!  I understand they won't always have them but there isn't a tofu scramble or good vegan breakfast at all.  There wasn't anyone there and they took so long for a small order for 2 people. I didn't see anyone go pick up good either.  I don't recommend to go if you're starving they are slow!!  Also note No raw sugar or non dairy creamer!!?? Really? The coffee tasted awful btw and I did return it. I won't go back for sure.

It's a no for me. I ordered 2 beef tacos for me and a cheese quesadilla for my son. The tacos were just okay. The quesadilla was really bad. The quesadilla contained lettuce tomatoes cilantro and a LOT of sour cream. And when I say a lot, I mean there was more sour cream than actual cheese. No where on the menu does it mention that there were all these extra ingredients in the quesadilla. In addition, there was a photo attached to the menu and it did not show the ingredients either. I had to unfortunately order food elsewhere for my child so it was a complete waste of money. I probably won't be back again.

Sky's! Where have you been all my life? Right under my nose, apparently. I was in the mood for Ground Beef Tacos which are surprisingly, hard to find aside from fast food joints. My initial Google search brought up Yelp's Top 10 Ground Beef tacos "near me" and honestly, there aren't a lot except for Sky's Gourmet in Mid-City. So I made my way over there -- there is a small parking lot that only houses two spots (occupied that day) so I parked on Pico and walked up. The outdoor dining is all moved to the side -- you notice all the markings for appropriate social distancing, as well as available sanitizers for safety. They did a great job with the Patio, turning it into a walk-up window with the Menu on a big screen TV so no one has to touch anything. The Staff was so nice and helpful - all worth the wait! I went home and had really, really delicious tacos and the ground beef is so flavorful! The Potato and Cheese is really good (they use red potatoes) and the Peach cobbler is yum! I've been back since (twice this month) and tried the Chicken Burrito which is OK -- I really prefer the Beef. The Chicken taco is good too, but be sure to get a sauce in it like sour cream, etc. My family got orders of the Carnitas tostadas which are smallish but very good and made with black beans as well. I definitely look forward to my future taco-relationship with Sky's, and want to try the all-day Breakfast menu and of course, can't wait to dine-in when it's safe to do so!

Covid delivery review: This morning I woke up craving tacos! So to satisfy my craving I ordered from here. My Seamless delivery man even said their food is good. Boy this spot did not disappoint! I got the carnitas taco, this was FILLING like they packed the taco very generously. I also got a beef burrito which was huge and flavorful which I really liked as well. Last but not least I ordered Sky French toast to satisfy my sweet tooth. It was soft and delicious w maple syrup and powdered sugar already on top and doesn't taste like your typical French toast.

When people see that Sky's is built on a Spanish Mexican architectural plan with outdoor patio, it seems automatically assumed that it is Mexican run & operated.Â  Like Bill's Taco House on MLK Blvd., Sky's in Mid City is run by Barbara Burrel who is Black so expect an interesting fusion of Mexican, Cajun- CrÃ©ole, and Southern cooking.  Sky's has been on my list way before my Yelping days and am sorry I didn't come earlier. I would have loved to have been seated at the counter to see how the food was prepared. (Refer to Taco Maven Yelper Jay K. for excellent blow by blow descriptions of the cooking process.) Unfortunately, w/ the Pandemic all is take out ordered from the takeout window although it can be eaten in their patio. Since the food can get messy from the thick sauces, there is a convenient outdoor faucet & sink, soap, paper towels to wash up those sauce coated fingers.  1) AutÃ©ntico Mini Taco: cubed Carne Asada Â steak, moist, beefy chaw. Grilled onions, cilantro and citrus juice that adds a fruity sourness. On two small, street-size, corn tortillas. Mild flavour for those who can't handle piquancy.  2)Â  SKY'S FAMOUS GOURMET TACOS: 6-inch corn tortillas: Chock full of chewy, fibrous crawfish in a thick, red chile oil like Brazilian Dende. The red chile used reminds me of Hungarian paprika that adds a sweet, light smokiness, not spicy heat.  Tomato sauce flavours with what may be cumin to add a woody, earthy, herbal smokey tones. Chopped fresh tomato adds sweet acidity, and cilantro adds another layer of green herbal funk that some say tastes like soap. Scattered grating of yellow orange cheddar.  3)Â  SKY'S TEXAS-STYLE RIBS: Meaty, porky, fatty, moistÂ Â  baby-back ribs, baked and slathered with Sky's special BBQ Sauce that may have tomato sauce, brown sugar, cumin. Since these ribs are baked, there is no natural smoke infused quality. Ample sized. Good home style oven baked Sunday dinner.  Two hot sauces:  Mild, thick red tomato based sauce makes up for lack of chile heat with an almost sweet, medicinal cough syrup-like taste.  Hot, pale yellow Habanero looking salsa is garlic scented as well as having a mild fermented, satisfying funkiness. It has an ineffable ultra hot chile pepper scent.  Sky provides another interesting take on the protean ability of the Mexican Taco to take in prepared foods that are not particularly Mexican in origin.  Witness Roy Choi for placing Korean Bulgogi, Daeji Gogi inside of a corn tortilla as well as Wes Ãvila who puts in chefly French technique based cuisine into corn tortillas at Guerilla Tacos. Sky's Gourmet Tacos is possibly an only in L.A. phenomenon.

Dear Gary - This is such a cool review. You are a true gastronome. Not only did you nail the ingredients (Paprika and Cumin), you also "Got it". After 30 years of cooking, it is a pleasure having a true aficionado taste my inventions and think they are worth eating. I never claimed to be the greatest cook in the world, but to rate this highly with someone clearly so knowledgeable - well, all I can say is, that it's gratifying. I hope you will try our Cheesecakes too - I realize it seems weird, but believe it or not we have been awarded "Best Cheesecake" in Los Angeles three years in a row! By the way we now sell our sauces and spice on Amazon and our web-site - just in case you miss them! Anyway - really appreciated the detail and time you took to write the review. Kind Regards!

I came here because signs (the appearance of silver blonde haired and long limbed females around the Los Angeles area) were indicating I should seek Icelandic delights, and since Sky is the abbreviation for Iceland's monetary currency on ISO 4217, I chose to come here to investigate. Â I ordered the $7 chips and guacamole (AVOcado, olive oil, and lime juice), which came as a tiny bag of chips and 1/4 cup of guacamole. Their chips were crunchy, light, warm, and dusted with spice that wasn't too aggressive to be the accompaniment.  The bill said tax was 9%, but I think Los Angeles has a 9.5% tax, so they should consult a computer security professional to make sure they haven't been short-changed by a computer error. I gave them a couple of dollars to correct the situation and mentioned to their employee what the tax should be.

Sky's Tacos The Spirit Airlines of taco stands.  I ordered a Turkey Burger, with grilled onions.  Thought I'd try Sky's.  The Turkey Burger was a hot greasy mess.  I ordered from Sky's.  That burger's sitting in my stomach like a sack of cement.  I ordered from Sky's,  I ordered from Sky's.  I ordered from Sky's.  I tried a lobster taco, it was from Sky's.  It was a soggy mess, it was from Sky's.  Now I'm left disappointed, because I got Sky's, because I got Sky's. Because I got Sky's.  I was used to like chips and guacamole before I got Sky's. I didn't know what too much salt on chips was until I got Sky's (uh uh la la da da) I've never had less inspired guacamole, you know why? Â (why man?) (hey hey) Because I got Sky's, because I got Sky's, because I got Sky's!!

Got to pick up food here seems like a really cool joint to hang and enjoy dinner with great fam and friends, no doubt. I can see the folks who work here, be total family. Just great vibes when you come here.  Got food here on Cinco de Mayo and food took over an hour but wasn't upset cause it seems like an app messed up everyone. But everyone was all over the place and can imagine busy weekends must also be a nightmare. So maybe don't show up hungry? I'm not completely sold on the food. Price point and quality wasn't aligned. We got beef, tilapia, chicken, and shrimp.. Â tacos, burrito, torta, and quesadilla but aside from beef flavor that you can taste, everything else wasn't really present.

The problem with being great at something is that greatness becomes expected. When this place is "on", it's fantastic. The problem we've had is consistency. One week the tilapia taco is perfection. Next week, it's fishy and inedible. The BBQ taco can range from "lie awake in bed craving it" to "I just got three bites in a row of disgusting greasy gristle". We really want to love this place but the lack of consistency has us feeling disappointed half the time, and elated half the time. It's exhausting. I think I'd rather frequent a spot that's just consistently above average so I'm never disappointed.
Love their food, love that they are a long term member of my neighborhood. Highly recommend this place! Try the wild yam taco! So so so good!!!
20 min to get an order of 4 tacos and 1 burrito?? The only good thing is that they gift you cheesecake.. but for the price definitely not worth it! Sorry you need to change prices or do better food

We picked this place because it seemed like they had lots of options.  We got there around 9ish so that was the first mistake. (Out here for work related business and that's the best time we could leave to get some food) The guy taking everyone's orders was just ready to go and you could tell he was just rushing us.  As for the food, for me it was just ok. My family liked their food. We were disappointed in the salsas though. We like spice and heat and the spicy salsa had no real flavor in our opinion.

Went here on a friend's recommendation and came from out of town. Giving a 2.5 stars to the taste of my friend's lobster tacos and pico de gallo were not bad.  I ordered the beef taco, meat was ground beef not steak like, taste was all wrong - taco meat tasted and smelled like spaghetti meat. I couldn't even finish my meal. So disappointing.  Also the lemonade was too high in sugar as was the cheesecake. Ordered the plain cheesecake, came FROZEN, waited for it to thaw for cheesecake consistency and was too sweet to eat.

Jesus these are really good burritos. The sassy sauce is so good it makes up for its incredibly annoying name.  Wow, though. I can't wait to come back. I'm especially looking forward to dining in. But, to go, this is already hard to beat.

I haven't been here in a really long time since they were still at their last location. I ordered the shrimp burrito, open faced and it was amazing!!! Just how I remembered it. My friend got the vegan burrito and loved it as well. The lemonade was good I added a little water to mine and it was perfect. I love their food and will be going back more often.  I placed my order threw yelp. When I arrived I told the young lady my name and she told me she would call me when my order was ready. So I sat at a little table and waited a few minutes until called. Right now the table and chairs outside are just for waiting no eating (because of COVID-19). Great service and great food

A friend and I came after work one day. We order the authentic chicken, grilled chicken, beef, and mushroom tacos. They have a cute patio that we sat on to enjoy the tacos. All were delicious. Â They don't serve alcohol yet but will be a super cute happy hour spot once they do with music kn the patio.

We were on our way to a park for a picnic, and decided to order take out from Sky's. We ordered an assortment of tacos including: 1. Shitake Mushroom 2. Chicken 3. Potato and Cheese 4. Asada At about $3.50 or more per taco, I expected them to be bursting with meat, sauce, and veggies. And that is exactly what I got. My favorite has got to be their potato cheese taco. I'm used to the potato being mashed, but they slice it here. It's a game changer for me! I really liked the saltiness of the cheese combined with the seasoned potatoes along with the marinated coleslaw...It was so good I wish I ordered more of it lol. Adding salsa is not a bad thing, but I think a taco should be flavorful on its own and adding salsa should enhance or add another layer to those flavors. That being said, I thought the chicken and asada were a little dry and needed salsa. The mushroom was a bit oily, but I really like shitake mushrooms, so I enjoyed eating this along with salsa.  Speaking of salsa, they have two types - green and red. I prefer the green as it's more spicy and flavorful than the sweet, almost tomato-sauce red version. But that's my preference. I also wish I ordered chips with this meal! I think next time I visit I will definitely get some. Social distancing and mask wearing is enforced. What's nice is that they have a window where you can either order food or pick up food (so you don't have to go inside). There's also a sanitation area, if you want/need it. I have to also say that the staff didn't get our order wrong. These days I noticed that more of my orders are incorrect - People are not being present with their job. And it's nice to know that the workers at Sky are professionals.

Wow! The Sky is the limit for how awful everything was! If I could rate negative stars I would.  In short: Food was refrigerator cold, overcooked (3 times), skimpy, and bad tasting. Long: Do not order food here unless you like it cold AND overcooked (didn't know this was possible). I ordered a salmon burrito after asking if it is cooked fresh and could be made rare. Apparently this was a risk that was too grand to fulfill. I got a skimpy, grey fish-smear tortilla that was not even room temperature, but cold to the touch. I ordered at the restaurant, waited in the parking lot, and picked up my food once it was called. There is no reason why it should have been cold. Perhaps refrigerator-to-microwave is the cooking method. I went back to report poor food quality and asked for a carne asada burrito instead (thinking that it would be a safer bet), this time medium-rare. I was again served cold food with shredded beef bits and lots of sauce (not good sauce). This time the food was even colder and the sauce on the side was nearly iced.  The "managers" (more than one was present), Jennifer and LupÃ©, informed me after the first screw up that they asked the cook, Maria, to remake the 1st burrito because it was overcooked. They confirmed that they checked the food quality for the cold food that was served to me each time and thought it was acceptable. So my food was messed up 3 times.... I barely even got an apology and Jennifer even mentioned that sour cream, which was not on my burrito, sometimes makes the food cold. The cold items that I expected on the burrito (lettuce and tomato) were barely present. Again, I do not understand how my order could have been so atrociously bad.  I got a stomach ache from simply tasting their cold meat tortillas. I've worked in the food industry for a number of years and I'm fairly certain there are health code violations here. I hope the owner hires new staff. If you're really craving a burrito, order from the food truck, Cemitas Poblanas, down the street. Great service there!

What is up with all of the negativity towards the tortillas? I've heard nothing but good things about this place but it seems like lately there has been a lot of issues with the tortillas?  Like the owner said though, talk to the server, don't get into a mood and post about it online..  Probably why your marriage didn't work out, lol jk but it helps big time when you use your words

Jake, thanks so much for the support! We're happy to make adjustments to your food if need be, so be sure to let us know if that's the case. Hope to see you again soon!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

Recommendation: Not necessarily worth the wait or hype, but still good and large portions. I had higher expectations because of the line outside and the previous reviews. I got the Don Juan which seemed like their most popular item and it was just a solid breakfast taco. Salsa was good, potatoes and tortilla were fluffy, eggs were light, bacon was a little soggy, cheese wasn't melted; altogether decent but nothing amazing. I will say it is dense and heavy and very filling. Ordered: Don Juan El Taco Grande Price: ~$7

Joshua, we're glad you decided to give us a shot! Sorry to hear that the Don Juan wasn't what you expected though. Next time, we know you'll be more wow-ed by our food!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

My friend and I had a big day ahead and decided to start our breakfast out right with some good food from Juan in a Million. We ordered their popular Don Juan El Taco Grande...which was indeed grande. Filled with eggs, potatoes, bacon, and cheese, it was the perfect breakfast taco. I got a side of sour cream as well.  Lots of seating and their Horchata tasted great!
Raychel, thanks so much for the support! We're glad the horchata and breakfast food hit the spot. Hope to see you again soon.  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

Great bang for your buck for breakfast tacos. A generous portion of egg, potato, Â bacon and cheese served with 3 tortillas will leave you full and ready to conquer your day. Plus they offer chips and salsa so it's a win-win. The service is quick and friendly so you can't go wrong with breakfast from Juan in a Million!!

Open since 1980, Juan in A Million is a bit of a hole in the wall. I had seen Juan in A Million on the TV show, Man Vs. Food, but wasn't really expecting much. The dining area is much larger than I was expecting. They have multiple rooms with multiple tables, including a covered patio. There was no wait for breakfast on a Monday morning. We were seated, given some chips and salsa, and the menu. Chips and salsa tasted fresh and homemade. Good low level spice on the salsa too. Still wasn't expecting much looking at the menu. We placed our orders and the food arrived soon after, less than 10 minutes. Excellent service.  Figured I would order the Don Juan El Taco Grande since I had seen it on TV. Per the menu, it's a secret combination of potato, egg, bacon and cheese in a deliciously hot tortilla. It's also ginormous. The waitress offered me extra tortillas, and one Don Juan was enough to make four huge tacos. It's also surprisingly delicious despite the common ingredients. Makes me wonder how I can make it for myself at home.  I also tried a barbacoa taco because I wanted to try something more Mexican. Best barbacoa I have ever had. It was fall apart tender, extremely juicy, rich, and flavorful.  If I had a choice between barbacoa from Juan in a Million and some brisket from Franklin BBQ, I would choose the barbacoa, based on flavor alone. It's also ludicrously cheap. A huge breakfast for two was about $15.  5 stars. 1200th Review!

Nick, we're so glad you decided to swing by and give us a shot! Thanks so much for the support and kind words. Hope to see you again soon for another Don Juan and some barbacoa! All the best, Juan in a Million Family

I did not want to wait an hour in line for a table, so I ordered my tacos to-go. I feel like I saved so much time and avoided the extra frills involved in getting a table. I placed my order, was able to pay with Apple Pay, and got my food in less than 15 minutes! They were so crowded on a Sunday morning - both indoor and outdoor tables were full. They have a parking lot in the back. I'd be lying if I said I didn't just come here because I love the pun in their name. Â I've also heard so much about the Don Juan taco, and it definitely lived up to its hype. At $6.75, it is massive. The cheese doesn't even fit inside the tortilla. I'm pretty sure I took a couple of bites and didn't even look like I did any damage. I really enjoyed the migas taco $3.95 with cheese. Their salsa is great. I'm not sure if I'd come back for the Don Juan, but the migas was for sure something I'd come back for.
Clara, we're happy to hear that our puns and the Don Juan hype got you to stop by. Thanks for the support and kind words! Hope you'll be back for more migas! All the best, Juan in a Million Family

This OG Austin eatery gives me a lot of nostalgia. I used to come here in college and several years later, this place is still as busy as ever. The owner and all the employees are exceptionally nice. My favorite item on the menu is the Don Juan. You practically get five whole tacos out of this monstrous plate of bacon, cheese, egg, and potatoes. Their tortillas are very well made. For $6.75, it's a steal! I had to talk my partner out of ordering one for himself because there was no way he would finish it. We were full sharing one. If any of my friends are in town visiting, Juan in a Million would definitely be a place where I'd bring them.

Lan, we've loved having you join us over the years -- thanks for all your kind words! The Don Juan is always a great choice, and we can't wait to cook for you again sometime soon. Don't forget to bring your appetite! All the best, Juan in a Million Family

We came here based on a recommendation from a friend. It's a pretty nice hole-in-the-wall spot and was pretty packed on a Saturday morning. The food was definitely a lot better than what I was expecting. We ordered the con queso breakfasts and the Don Juan el taco grande. The portions were huge, especially the Don Juan special which was stacked for only $6.75. Definitely recommended!
Victoria, thanks so much for the support! We're happy to hear that you enjoy dining with us. Hope to see you again for another Don Juan!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

WASN'T WORTH IT. Â ALSO, A FEW ISSUES OCCURRED! & WHY IS THEIR GUACAMOLE IS 7.00 FOR A DOLLUP?!  Okay, since I am a fellow yelper (elites and non stand up!! Haha jk) I really researched this place and decided hey, why not! It's in the more rural side of town, but that never bothered me one bit! In LA some of the best eats have tents nearby with the homeless. So, this wasn't bad at all! When we walked in, man, I thought we were going to sit outside and the way that humidity it set up it's a HELL NO. We asked the older man if we can sit inside and he said yes. . Well, he didn't know English and my sister began to sit inside because the man said yes. . Â and the waitress rudely said "no! We have seating over there!" We were like okayyyy, the man told us to sit here! We were about to leave, but I just figured let's see where they're talking about first/way just to go outside in another closed off seating area. Weird? But okay. Like we bypassed the restaurant to go outside to another a/c building LOL.  FOOD: let's get right into this, for Austin it's rated a 8/9. For regular folk, it's a solid 5. I ordered a single tostada, (7.50) my sister got nachos and a soda Â (16.00), my nephew got a quesadilla & soda Â ($12.18), my dad got eggs and chili with coffee (18.00) , and table guacamole (7.00). It was 60.00+ dollars. The guacamole from chipotle is better, I kid you not. My tostada was nothing special, at all. My dad did like his food, but said it could have been better. He said the coffee was great though. My nephew got a quesadilla, and he said he didn't like it. My sister liked her nachos but said it was worth 16.00 at all. Their chips are really great though!  Price: NOT WORTH IT AT ALL! I think they definitely do too much here, and not in a good way. I was told they would take money off for my nephews plate since he's 6. They didn't give him an adult quesadilla, but it was an adult price. She never fixed it. The guacamole for the table is TINY! I could go pick 2 avocados myself and make a bigger bowl for less than 2.00 lol. My tostada was not worth 7.50 with tax. I'll leave a picture below, so you all can tell me if you'd pay 7.50 for it vs 1.00 for one at del taco. Lol SERVICE: 50/50. The older ladies are rude. There was one younger one who was nice, and that's about it. Our server didn't say much at all, at this rate I'm just assuming Texas waitresses are not like CA. In CA we are talkative/ laid back/ and...nice! We didn't find that here one bit.  All in all, I will not be coming back. Between the prices, service, portion, and taste, it was a no for me. Onto the next food place please.

Chrystina, we're sorry to hear that our food wasn't what you were expecting. Additionally, we hope you'll chalk the service issues up to a miscommunication -- our team would never try to be rude to any of our guests. Hopefully you'll give us another shot if you're ever back in the area.  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

A real Austin gem! The location was easy to find, and there was a parking lot in the back. We were immediately warmly greeted by the owner who was both friendly and charismatic. It genuinely felt as if I had entered a friend's home.  The free salsa was too spicy for the tortilla chips but perfect to put on the Don Juan El Taco Grande! The Don Juan El Taco Grande without bacon was mediocre and had too much cheese. It came with two additional tortillas and had a large portion of filling.  However, the horchata was sweet, milky, and delightfully light! The cup was also the ideal size to share with a significant other. My boyfriend ordered the Huevos a La Mexicana and remarked that it reminded him of his grandmother's recipe!  There were beautifully painted murals and vivid colorful walls throughout the restaurant. The plants and flowers were alive and thriving. You could easily tell that a lot of love and hard work had been put into the restaurant. Additionally, there was plenty of shade to sit outside on a hot summer day. The only main feedback I have is that it would be nice if there was free wifi there.
Christine, we're glad you all felt right at home when you walked in! Thanks for the support and kind words. Can't wait to have you back for another Don Juan!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family
Chelsea, we're happy to hear that the Don Juan and horchata hit the spot! Thanks for giving us a shot. Hope to see you again soon for more!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

An Austin classic that's definitely worth a visit! From the shaded patio seating and the vibrantly colored floors, to the hole in the wall vibes and neighborhood location, this place screams Austin. The Don Juan is a massive $6 plate of breakfast taco goodness that's hard to not enjoy. It has all the essential ingredients: bacon, eggs, cheese, and potatoes, and combines them in a massive serving. It's a hearty meal alone, but we especially enjoyed the tortillas that came with. They're soft with the perfect amount of chew, which fit perfectly with the fluffy eggs. Our group of 3 even struggled to finish it! Whether as a nice brunch or hangover cure, it's a definitely worth a visit!
Daniel, thanks so much for the support! We're happy to hear that our food hit the spot. Hopefully we can serve you again in the near future!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

I can't believe it took me four years to finally come to Juan in a Million, but I definitely saved one of Austin's treasures for last. This place doesn't have any frills and doesn't seem like much on first glance, but everything is incredible. Service is great, which surprised me because I didn't think anyone would come to our table more than once. However, our food, drinks, chip refills, and check came promptly. Servers are really nice and helpful. Get their most popular item because it's a lot of food and great value too. Their horchata is one of the best in Austin and it's also a huge cup too. Their salsa and chips are great, and my friends who are big fans of salsa love this place.  I highly recommend! Anytime I crave breakfast tacos I will be coming here.

Megan, we're so glad you had a chance to stop by and give us a shot! Thanks so much for the support. We can't wait to serve you up more horchata and goodies from our menu.  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

"Old Austin Establishments" need to keep their game strong if they're going to stay in business. Juan in a Million didn't give me my money's worth and didn't offer to make things right.  I came in with one thing on my mind: queso and eggs. Things started off wrong when I asked for water with no ice and the server came back with a glass of ice water. It's not like she had other distractions between when I ordered it and when she brought it out. It was immediate. She just didn't listen. It was past their lunch rush. But that's just water. Not a deal breaker. Their Con Queso Breakfast seemed like what I was craving, but not all of it. I wasn't feeling the meat and potatoes that came with it. I asked the server if I could sub these things for extra eggs and queso. She said I could. However, when the meal came out it sure looked like the normal size serving of eggs and queso. When she brought me my ticket to pay, it just said no cg (carne guisada) or potatoes, no note to the kitchen about extra anything else. When I brought this up, I was told they don't do substitutions. That would have been fine, if they told me that in the beginning. I would have ordered the full meal as is. Instead they just gave me an empty apology and I left with only half the food I paid for. Communication, folks! You failed.  Also, the food was meh. The queso was more like a combination of something between queso and ranchero sauce. The tortillas were dry.  Not coming back in a million years.

Amy, we're sorry to hear that there were so many communication issues during your visit. Our team is much better than that, so we hope one day you'll give us another shot.  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

I've heard many things about the famous Don Juan El Grande Taco but unfortunately, it did not live up to the hype. Don't get me wrong - it's a ton of food and definitely a great deal but I didn't think it was anything special. If you're looking for an affordable meal, this taco is for you. However, if you're looking for great tasting tacos... maybe not the spot.  Still, the service was great and they had complimentary chips + salsa for dine-in customers.

Callie, it's really disappointing to know that your experience wasn't everything you hoped it would be. We're proud to be an Austin staple, and we strive to impress every Austin visitor, too! We hope you'll make it back our way in the future for a chance to impress you more. All the best, Juan in a Million Family

Welll 2 stars or 3?  It's been around a while and is quite the locals' find. That being said, in a town with more taco spots than Manhattan has Starbucks, it has some tough competition to fend off.  The positive? The taco was huge, with a lot of stuffing.  The negative? The flavors were just not there - migas was bland, meats were way too salty, and the salsa tasted ketchupy.  I had expected more from this self-proclaimed "authentic" place.

Shradha, we're sorry to hear that the migas and tacos weren't what you expected. Our team is always happy to make changes to your order, so next time let us know if you'd like something different. Hope you'll give us another shot. All the best, Juan in a Million Family

My friends and I stopped here for brunch on a suggestion from our Lyft driver. It did not disappoint! This local staple has been making delicious Mexican food since the 1980s!  I had a great mimosa for $2.50 and the Don Juan El taco grande. This is huge! Definitely enough to share with at least one person. It's a yummy scramble of potato, egg, bacon and cheese with a side of fresh tortillas! They also have free chips and salsa -- even for breakfast. I would recommend getting here early because they always have a wait. I would definitely like to check this out in a return trip to Austin.
Miranda, we're happy that you followed up on that recommendation! Thanks so much for the support. Hope to see you back again soon for another Don Juan!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

Visiting from San Antonio, I have never seen anything like this place. When you have over 100 people eating at one location and about 50 of them are waiting in line to just get in or place an order you know what to expect. I personally met Juan and I can not say enough about him! He is the true definition of "if you want something done right do it yourself" mentality. The way he handles every customer as a usual and a friend makes me feel so welcomed that I didn't want to leave. The way he transitions from greeting customers, to taking orders, to the registers is completely unmatched by any means. Most people complain about having to do someone else's job, this guy thrives and Excels from this. Now for the food part, we'll if you haven't seen the 5 stars, then let me tell you ! The best breakfast spot you can find as an outsider coming in. You will be full and not know what to do with the left overs. Absolutely great place, great energy, and unmatched customer service. If you can find somewhere else that matches or even competes to this In Austin , let me know! (I really wish my phone hadn't lost all my pictures, I could of had plenty of photos for you guys; but please take my word for it!!!)

Jose, we're happy to hear that your drive from San Antonio was worth it! Thanks so much for the support. We're glad everything from the food to the service hit the spot. Hope to see you again soon!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

You know those obnoxious people from the west coast who say Tex-Mex sucks and there is no good Mexican food in central Texas? I am one of those humans......... And the found Juan In A Million (thanks Yelp!!)  I picked Juan's specifically because of the great reviews and close proximity to the Austin airport. I am going to go back to Juan's for fantastic breakfast and Bloody Mary's.  From the menu: DON JUAN EL TACO GRANDE- while I did not order one of these delightful looking breakfast tacos, every table around us seemed to order them and they looked amazing. Huge portions!  CON QUESO BREAKFAST- this is what my hubby ordered. Two eggs served any style with queso, carne guisada, refried beans, potatoes and two flour tortillas. Absolutely delicious. Thank god for splits rules, because I got half. Carne Guisada Plate: this is what I got, (well, + splits rules) served with Rice and Beans. On Friday it is on their daily special list.... and I am a sucker for a daily special! This one is Served all day :) I would absolutely order this again (and again and again)  Drinks: I got a Bloody Mary, it was wonderful. Perfect amount of spice. Bae ordered a Marg... at 10am... on a weekday. It happens *shrug* Chips and salsa. Fabulous salsa. We needed 3 refills because it was THAT good. To be clear: the portions were large, the salsa dish was large, it was just that good. Who can I bribe for the recipe? Hit me up.  Covid: tables are spaced apart. Large indoor and outdoor space. We felt safe eating here.  Staff: fabulous. Pretty sure our waitress was my best friend by the time we left.  Thank you Juan in a Million for a fabulous meal!

You just can't beat a daily special, Julia! We've been the first stop and last stop for tons of folks visiting Austin, and we're glad you're now a part of that club. From our Don Juan to our chips and salsa, you can always expect a fabulous, authentic meal here at Juan in a Million. Come back and see us for another round whenever you're in town again!  All the best, Juan in a Million Family

I came for dinner with my family on a Sunday and we had a great time! It was fairly busy but we were only quoted 30 minutes for a wait and were able to pass that by getting a table in the open seating area anyway. Chips and salsa are self-serve in the open seating area, I'm not sure if this applies to the whole restaurant or not, but you can go back as many times as you want which is nice. I ordered the quesadillas and they were solid! The portion sizes are big so I went home with basically an entire meal still but I'm not complaining. Overall, the service was good but not necessarily the quickest. My biggest complaint was the spider family living in the umbrella over our table. We noticed them once it got later in the evening and while they technically didn't do anything, I felt uneasy knowing there were 10+ spiders hanging above my head while I ate.  COVID Precautions: Some employees wore masks but they didn't seem to be required. Social distancing was minimal.

Heard great reviews of this place. Location wise this has one of the best views of the river. Parking though can be a pain if it's packed, which it was for me when I came on a Friday afternoon) Along that same thread, I didn't actually sit in the restaurant because it was so packed. So I ended up ordering something to go and sitting at one of the tables outside the restaurant that was overlooking the water. Food was great though, would love to try the tacos next time (when it's not so busy)
Great ambiance good food service could be better but all in all not bad! Definitely recommend!  The quesadilla was by far my favorite

Came here on a Sunday around 1:30pm and luckily it was not crowded. The parking is challenging but they had a valet for $7 so we paid and didn't bother with driving all around to find a spot. FYI there is a lot across the street and the walk up isn't bad. The complimentary chips and salsa was amazing! The food was good as well. The steak options are good so I would strongly advise you order anything with steak in it. The views on the river were really nice and we took pictures after lunch. We got lucky with a nice day with awesome weather.

Come here for the scenery, not the food. The drinks are actually pretty good too. The food is average Mexican food, great for day drinking with friends to share some nachos or quesadillas. Staff was very friendly. Pro Tip: Â get there around mid day when they open the deck seating (around the bar) and that is first come, first serve. We didn't wait at all. Our food came out very quickly. The queso was fantastic. Â We got the stuffed avocado appetizer because it looked unique. It was pretty good, worth the try. I ordered plain old chicken quesadillas and they were nothing special but good. Another note: they are currently not serving the fish bowl Hu-La-La drink for 2. I ordered 2 of the halves and the drink was very good and refreshing.

Hula Hut is a place that you come for the environment and to hang with friends. Do not come here during the weekend, just a tourist trap. However pretty fun to sit on their patio on the water for lunch during a weekday.  You come here for the fun atmosphere. Not the food. Chips are terrible. My blackened fish burger was not bad. And the flan for dessert was good. Service was good. Checked on multiple times during our meal, food came out in 10 minutes.

5 stars means the place was extraordinary.  4 stars means it was pretty good.  3 means it's about average.  Which is why I'm leaving the 3 stars. The stuffed avocado was decent, but the place feels a little dirty. I sat on the patio one Sunday afternoon and it felt like the bar top hadn't been wiped down in days and the bar itself looked disheveled.  If you can look past the cleanliness, then this place is pretty unique and definitely has a Hawaiian-ish vibe.

Oooh So good! First time here, while visiting family, and I highly recommend!  The service was amazing. And the food was delicious. Our server made sure to let us know that if we needed to move in case it rain, she would have an area available. And when it did, she was very helpful. She gave quick service. We got plenty of leftovers too! 10/10 would visit again!

My sister absolutely loves this place, but I think the food is just mediocre. The views, however, are stellar, and I will come back time and time again just to sit and eat chips and enjoy the beautiful lake and lovely ambience! We shared the hawaiian fajitas, which were just fine (too sweet, and too chewy of meat for my taste), and I had a very average pina colada. They seemed quite understaffed, and our server kept forgetting about us (lol), but he did apologize profusely and give us a free drink because of it, so that was nice. The bathrooms were also very dirty, which I only hope was due to being understaffed?
We went for an early lunch. Found a parking place. Amazing service and food.  I can't wait to go back again. This is the place I take out of town folk. Great menu. On lake Austin near downtown.

Great place to take people that are from out of town! Â Great queso and fish dishes. Â  Try the pu pu platters. Â Enough food for many. Â The combo of the platter sound strange but lighten up and give it a go. Just don't throw chips into the water or you will be greeted by tons of wildlife. Not the best place for vegetarians.
60-70  mins

Hula Hut offers indoor, deck, and covered outdoor dining. With all the seats they offer, you would think they would have a better handle on organization, however, it's a bit of a rodeo.... NOTE: deck dining does NOT require a wait list, it's first come, first serve. All other dining options, you must either book inside or out at the hostess stands. & what the other seating is next to Hula Hut, someone please educate me because I'm just as confused with that one... Service, not the fastest, which wasn't a surprise. Food, just as much of a disappointment. Hula Hut claims themselves as "Mexican Food with a Hawaiian Twist", but honestly this was more Tex-Mex... and that's being polite.  We ordered the BBQ Baby Back Ribs, the Chicken Flautas, and the Guacamole Salad. The Baby Back Ribs were overly salty, the Flautas too fried, and the Guacamole underwhelming.

I moved here in 1991. My first job was at Lakeview Cafe across the street on Lake Austin Blvd. where Hula Hut is now. I still live in Austin and have watched that area develop. I've eaten at HH multiple times. The last time was 6 years ago (even though I live less than 2 miles away). We decided to try it again tonight and it will be the last time ever! Terrible food, terrible service. Staff that can't even answer basic questions like "what wine do you have, any beers on tap?" Chips that are crushed. All around a HUGE disappointment !!

Food was great, location and atmosphere was great. Drinks were alrighty and restaurant is pricey. But all in all everybody was satisfied with the taste of their food. It was a great view good location. We would definitely return there again

I forget how special this place is in Austin. Â You really do feel like you are on an island somewhere. We sat near the window inside and got the view while inside with the ac. Â It's really hot in Austin especially in the summer but we totally could have gone outside to sit. Â There were fans and while we are waiting it was cool near the water. Â We got there before they opened. Â I downed that they had started a waitlist because we were the first ones there but we weren't the first ones to be seated because they asked us to wait outside and others walked in right when they opened and got seated. Â It was the first time taking my mom here for lunch and we wanted her to have a good time since she loves being near the water.  I ordered a margarita and my sister ordered a Mai tai. Â She said it was a little on the sweet side. They were happy to exchange it for something else. She got the strawberry coconut mojito and it was delicious.  We got my mom the macadamia crusted magi magi fish dish. Â It was perfect. Â If you are looking for a healthier dish this would be it. Â We ordered one fillet and it was plenty for her. My sister and I shared a half order of fajitas. Â Didn't get a picture because we devoured it before I could get one. Love the cheese that it came with. The big shredded cheesy cheese for the win.  For dessert we had the fried ice cream. Â I am not sure if it was suppose to be crunchy on the outside but it wasn't. Super soggy and soft shell that covered the ice cream. Â The side slices of crispy chips I think they are sopapillas were hot and crispy just the way I would imagine fried ice cream would be. Â I was little disappointed with the outside shell of this ice cream bc it was soft. Â We peeled it off and didn't even eat them. Other than that our server, Naz, was super sweet! Very friendly and all smiles.

My friend had been raving about this place for months and she finally took me there for lunch last week. This is one of my new favorite (not so hidden because there's always a wait) gems of Austin and did not disappoint!  Atmosphere: first, it was way larger than it looks from the outside. They have both indoor and outdoor seating but recommend sitting outdoors so you can have an unobstructed view of Lake Austin and daydream about one day owning a boat.  Food: We shared the queso (which was incredible) but for me the show stopper was the table chips! They were warm, thin and crispy - not too heavy but held up when dipped in salsa or cheese. We each got a different quesadilla (chicken pictured here) and it was melt in your mouth delicious. The tortillas were fresh and soft and featured the perfect chicken to cheese ratio.  Drinks: My friend drove so I got a margarita with an add-shot and with the heat outside, was surprisingly strong. They have great happy hour deals, we will definitely be going back to catch them another time soon.

Hawaiian Tex mex... didn't know I needed it till I had it now I can't go back, them fajitas are like gods gift to the world... imma be honest that's all I had here. Yes I get the same thing every time but its like sex in a tortilla. Who doesn't want that

I like Hula Hut. Really, it's okay exactly deserving of its 3.5 stars, but since I can't give half stars I round up. The service is always solid, and I love getting to eat on the water. That alone is worth the price of the food and drinks, in my opinion. Now, for the food and drinks portion of the evening: if you keep to fair simple orders (queso, nachos, etc) then you'll be happy with the food, but I don't think either the recipes or the cooks are necessarily top notch. The drinks, though, are fun and taste good so in the end I keep coming back and drinking and ordering simple appetizers, which I'd recommend others do the same.
If you come here, Â the chips and salsa are"help yourself" and the coconut shrimp is an absolute must. If you don't know what to order for a drink, trust Sam's judgement :)

I don't give 5s often, but for a chill ambiance and great, Â flavorful food THIS is the place to go. They do a great job with their island vibe, you forget where you are! The waitress was well attentive to our needs. I love that they brought out chips and salsa as we waited for our food. The salsa is spicy! They brought our dog water as well as my table. The specialty cocktail pineapple cherry drink was amazing! The portions were HUEGE and so filling.  The BBQ sandwich could have had more BBQ sauce and it was hard to eat like a practical sandwich.

This was in my list of to-visit restaurants for a long time. Went on a Tuesday evening for friends anniversary. There was no wait time and we were seated in the open restaurant next to the water. The ambience was pretty good. Our waitress was pretty good and gave good suggestions for all the vegetarians in the group. We ordered stuffed avocado, veg tubular taco and veg tub enchilada.. stuffed avocado with chicken was the best of the lot. The vegetarian entrees were bland. Too much cheese. 3 stars only for the ambience and service. Food was just okay.
60-70  mins

*COVID Update* Not much to update on safety precautions as by August 2021, there's mostly none. Servers don't wear masks and certainly don't require patrons to do so. No hand sanitizer around, and tables are not socially distanced. Parking in this area is pretty much paid parking on the street. You're very lucky if you find something farther in the residential areas.  This review is for the outdoor bar area next to the restaurant. The line starts at the bar. That is where you order both food and drinks. They'll make your drink right there, and they'll give you a receipt for food. You take the receipt to the small kitchen in the back. There was live music on a Sunday afternoon, so it was really fun to chill, listen, and watch people dance. Most of the outdoor seating here is shaded, so it's not too bad. There's a water station at the bar.  They serve chilled margaritas, and the cup is laced with salt. They have Â beers (can), Don Julio tequila, and other hard liquors. The selection is nice. The bartenders are just trying to make the line go by faster.  The tacos are great! Â I think the best one was the al pastor taco $2.75. They're like the small LA street tacos, but I liked that the al pastor taco was served with chopped pineapple. Guac is $5.85. It's alright, but it's nice to share. The menu inside the restaurant might be more extensive.

First, I feel like I need to say - we had good service from our waiter during our lunch here and it was appreciated. That being said, the rest of this meal unfortunately disappointed. The food was a bit worse than my already pretty mediocre expectations - my queso tamales seemed reasonably moist and might have had some nice flavor to them, but the amount of queso on top of them made it almost impossible to taste. The queso itself was the classic velveeta / rotel variety, which I don't have a problem with per se but I don't think lends itself to the $11 price tag on the entree. The free chips and salsa were appreciated and not bad - though I found myself a bit confused that it tasted like they'd sweetened both the red and green varieties with some added sugar which I'd consider wholly unnecessary. However, my biggest reason for a two star instead of a three star review was the margarita. I love a quality marg but was not expecting one from Guero's house blend. This marg, however, was almost entirely undrinkable. I couldn't taste anything but extremely watered down tequila and maybe a squirt of lime juice - I found myself pushing it away after a couple sips. And the icing on the cake - an $8 price tag. In conclusion, you can eat much better on South Congress for half the price.

Hello Jack,  We sincerely apologize for your recent experience at GÃ¼ero's. We're so sorry to hear that our food and drinks were not up to standards. As a family run business, we continuously evolve from our guests and always appreciate feedback and will pass it along to the team.

Stoppped in for a cold beer. Bartender was friendly maybe becuase my wife speaks spanish and they bonded. He was attentive and made good recommendations.  Chips and salsa (they serve red & green which we like) were very good.  Other items on the menu looked good ands there is a lady in the rear part of the restaurant making fresh tortillas! Booya!

Hi Rick,  Thank you so much for sharing your recent experience with us! We're happy to hear you enjoyed our drinks, food, and service. We hope you stop by again and give us another chance to give you a 5 star experience.

The worst tourist food I have ever tasted.... It is not Mexican food, and I don't Â believe it is Tex-Mex..... You know it is for unaware tourists and locals who have never eaten ,"real" down home MEXICAN food. When a "MEXICAN" restaurant Â does not bother to serve Â "Chiles en vinagre".... or the hottest sauce they serve is as hot as diced tomatoes .... you know that grandma from Kentucky... or a young college student that cares more about slcohol Â than good food... are the target clientele.....
