My fiancÃ© and I came here one night during our vacation after going to the Contienetal Club, and we enjoyed ourselves immensely! The tacos and enchiladas were killer, and the casamigos marg was my fave! Kim was the best waitress--thank you, Kim, for making our night!!
Such a fun place to listen to live music- Sundays it starts at three. Â Would love to see the garden open an hour before the music starts :)

I wouldn't recommend them for food - though their chips and salsa are really good! The food was below average in terms of flavors, stuffing, taste. The hour-long wait is expected on a busy stretch. Service was okay - it wasn't attentive and diligent. The drinks were small and watered down. The ambiance and history are the only things saving this, besides the location win.

Hi Shradha, Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us. We're so sorry to hear that our food and drinks were not up to standards. We hope that when you're back in the area, you'd be willing to give us a try again. As a family run business, we continuously evolve from our guests and always appreciate feedback and will pass it along to the team.

"I'm not mad, I'm just disappointed." I'd say that phrase that every adult has to utter at least once in their lifetimes (and kids have to hear wayyyy too often) sums up my GÃ¼ero's experience. Was really looking forward to queso and margaritas while bopping along South Congress, and while that's definitely what I got from GÃ¼ero's, I left weeping like the skies above (it was a monsoon that day).  I knew it wasn't going to be mind blowing Tex-mex, but I passed on a bougier place down the street because I thought G's would at least be a little more gritty and authentic and that's what I wanted. Sadly, the queso and guac and margaritas, for that matter, were just ho hum. There's was nothing distinctive about them.  Things worth noting: -Service was fast and friendly -Chips and salsa flow freely (and are free) -They validate parking

Was soooo looking forward to coming to Gueros! "Our place"...maybe it's just the post Covid era...maybe we are just older and have become more picky? It was fun to "see" them still kickin it but everything was just I dunno ho-hummm. I can't believe I'm even saying it! This time we both felt they missed the mark. The food the service the drinks ...all majorly meh... Take aways: *Zero friendly service...I mean zilch!  *Waitress didn't give 2 bleeps if she was doing her job *Completely dead and on a Monday late afternoon, and we still waited 20 minutes for drinks!!  *Had to track waitress down to ask about said drinks *Super dirty area where we sat (which was right by a make shift bussing station in the entry way)...yuck. *Drinks were super watered down.  Overall felt disappointed... we've been coming here for years upon years for 24 years and it wasn't the same ol Gueros we've grown up with. Maybe this was a hit or miss day...dunno. But left feeling underwhelmed by everything.  Hope one day to return...and maybe we will find that sweet spot we once loved.

We still love coming here after 20 years! Â Yup, years after we moved away from Austin we always enjoy coming back to this little gem on South Congress! This place used to be our favorite tex-mex weekly staple for killer tacos and trustworthy chips n' salsa! Â They even serve breakfast all day everyday! Â We just ate here yesterday and brought the kids with us and it's as if nothing's changed. Fish tacos al'a cart still the bomb! Â Quest still killer and all the little salsas! (*note mix a few of them together for a real treat). Charro beans mixed with side of rice still send us back to 1997!! #perfection  Ambiance still has that cool to be "weird" vibe. Â Sometimes the traffic in and around the area can get heavy but just go knowing that could be the case especially on three weekends! Â But go grab a delish Rita from the bar or out door Gueros lemonade stand.  Hard to believe "our place" still has its touch and it's as yummy as it was back then! Â I love that even though Austin's so different and has grown sooooo much since the 90's it's nice to see Guero's hasn't gone down the franchise road or compromised on what makes them one cool place to visit when you come to Austin.  ***Casa Rita (aka house margarita) on the rocks is great so is the Tito Rita and The Don! Nothing but lots of love for this place.

The location is perfect.  Our server was Gabriel - he took great care of us. Our original server disappeared and he came and saved the day!  This is my first Â restaurant to visit on my Austin Texas adventure. I've heard some great things about this place. So I thought, why not check this out? We came in, and the man in the front was a bit rude and sassy, but it was busy and hot so I gave some grace (: We got seating inside (I suggest). Immediately we were greeted with chips and salsa. But it took time to order our drinks and food, about a 20 min wait. (Because our original server left) We orders the queso and guacamole which was delicious, so get that! Not even going to lie, the coke tasted fantastic lol.  We all ordered the El Pastor tacos, steak and chicken tacos.  *steak - BOMB * el pastor - BOMB  * chicken - good a little dry, but I think it's meant to be a a dry rub chicken  Over all 4 stars and happy I got to visit ! Check them out!

Hm.. not sure about the poor reviews on here because I LOVED my food and the service was great. We had to wait about 20 mins to get in (kinda says a lot about a place when it's busy like that) but once we were seated, were brought chips, salsa and water immediately and the waiter came by for our drink order right after that. I had the Chicken Al Carbon Taco plate which was delicious. I wasn't sure about the artichoke and orange juice marinade they cooked it in but it was really tasty! They even validate the parking if you park in the structure behind the restaurant. I'm definitely going back the next time I'm in Austin!

First off, the drinks here are INCREDIBLE!!! I loved how you could change up the flavors of the margaritas. We could have spent our whole time there just drinking and trying all the flavors. We did also order food but it was your standard Mexican food. Nothing rave-wrothy. My friend got the 2 chalupas plate and I got the 2 tacos plate and we both shared the chips and queso. Tacos were decent and the queso was pretty good, but I was more impressed with their drinks! Server was very attentive and all the tables were spaced out really well.

We sat outside at Guero's for the live music yesterday and had a very nice time! We started with some margaritas which were a little bit watery, but not so bad that we didn't have a couple more with dinner. My husband ordered some tacos which he enjoyed and I had a black bean tamale (the only vegetarian option). I liked my food even though it was slightly bland, and we loved the chips and guacamole we got to supplement. For what it is, Guero's does a great job. The atmosphere is very fun and relaxed, the band was good, and there was no cover charge for the show. The food and drinks were decent and very affordable. Not a bad choice for a chill night out!

The absolute worst! Should have read other reviews on here before walking in. Totally ruined our lunch with our parents from out of town. As other have said, the chips n salsa and the pleasant service was the only highlight. The food is just utterly horrible. Queso - watery Velveeta garbage. Every other entree we ordered was just bland, lacking in salt and flavor. Unbelievable they'd pass this as food let alone Mexican food.  And I don't think the owner or the management have any desire to do anything about their trashy food. Every reply the owner has left for a negative review here is just a standard lame copy paste job.  It looks like they'd happily bring in the floating touristy population here who don't know how pathetic their food is.  Stay far away from this place. Plenty of other restaurants in the neighborhood.

This makes us sad to read. We have been a family-run restaurant for over 35 years and we always try to make everyone's experience as best as possible. We clearly dropped the ball this time around, and are working to make it right. We see that you were disappointed in the flavor of our food and want to work on it. Thank you for bringing this to our attention - we plan on having a kitchen meeting to go over improving the flavor of our food. We would like to hear what entrees you ordered. If can please email us at  info@gueros.com  so we can work on improving.

I had excellent service with the host spotting us outside before walking in. The bathroom was clean and smelled of freshly mopped floors with fabuloso. My server was polite, attentive, and our food was out within minutes of ordering. My drinks were fine. My biggest problem was the food.  I guess I'm spoiled by living and eating Mexican food for 20 years in San Antonio. No, this is not a comparative analysis of Tex-Mex between SA and Austin. The green salsa was really well done, actually. But my macho taco was tasteless. Terey's enchiladas with beef al carbon were soggy wet blankets served with sweet beans. The windows at our booth were dirty, and the fly living there bothered us the entire time. Would we be back? Yes! But only for the margaritas.

Hi Peggy,  Thank you so much for sharing your recent experience with us! We're happy to hear you enjoyed our drinks and service, and will absolutely take into account the additional feedback you provided to better our hospitality. We hope you stop by again and give us another chance to give you a 5 star experience.

Taco Bell is more authentic Tex Mex than Guero's. If you're traveling in Austin looking for Tex Mex, keep going. This is not authentic Austin cuisine and is a tourist trap with piss poor service. You're better off going to a good truck.

We would like to make our service better. If you have time can you please email us at  info@gueros.com  about your experience so we can speak with our staff and management about specifics on how to improve in the future.
No.  No. No.  Consider yourself spared. You ask for a host or hostess & they look at you like you have a unicorn jutting out of your head.

Hi Kimberly. We're sorry to hear about your negative experience with our staff when you visited us. We always strive to provide a positive experience for all of our guests and we regret to hear about yours. Please know this is not the standard we hold. Thank you for taking the time to share your review, as they help us improve our services overall.

All four of us loved our food! Enchiladas, tamales or tacos. You can't go wrong. Fun atmosphere. After dinner, we went next door to the Guero music garden and listened to a well oiled jazz group. Could buy drinks and snacks. We didn't as we were very full from dinner. A perfect evening.
Everything I tasted here was amazing - from the chips and queso to the tacos themselves. When visiting Austin guero's should be a stop on your list for some truly authentic Mexican food.

Looked great from the outside, but it was a total disappointment. Service was very slow and chaotic, ordered a "The Don" margie, and it was very small for the price, and sour... with very little alcohol. Also a glass of Sangria was watery and not fruity, and had no fresh fruit either. The Mushroom tacos were dreadful - zero flavor or spices, and for $12 was only two tacos with no rice and beans or anything. Last and least was the poor excuse for black bean soup - watery canned and bland. If you come here - make sure to ask for salt and pepper! You're gonna need it!
Thank you for letting us know that you were disappointed with the quality of your meal. We are working on improving the flavor of our food and hope you can give us another try.

Visiting from Dallas. Â Seemed to be a busy Saturday. Our server was fine, but as mentioned she must have been busy, but still courteous. Food was good. Â Tacos a little too oily. Took a while to come out I felt. No worries, she restocked the chips and I had great company. I did like that, they had patio seating and the weather was nice and cool.

In Austin for a football game and grabbed a bite before heading back to Houston. Found this jewel and glad we stopped by. The parking lot is very small but there is street parking available, if you find a spot. We were seated quickly inside. There is plenty of patio seating but we had a lil one with us and it was chilly out. The service was great but it took a while to get our food after we ordered. I didn't mind because they have a salsa bar but it's 4 bucks per table, if decide to indulge. Not many choices on the salsa bar: spicy, mild and veggies. I ordered the street tacos Â and they were yummy. The meat was seasoned very well but it was something about the seasoning that was a lil different than what I've had before. Not a bad thing, just different. I would definitely come back again if I am back in Austin. The prices were reasonable and service was wonderful. If you're looking for a new place to try while visiting, give Polvos a chance.  Bianca

Pretty decent food here. The portions are pretty huge here which helps justify the pricing. I would say it is pretty standard good food but nothing super unique.  I would come here for the atmosphere and decor.

A couple of years ago, a friend suggested that I check out Polvos and then yesterday another wanted to check out Polvos so I went and had a culinary experience. As we traversed the parking lot and approached the entrance, our server Â Carlos N. came out to genuinely greeted us, asking if we preferred to be seated outside or inside, we opted to be seated inside. First order on this glorious day was Top Shelf Margaritas with a generous splashing of Grand Marnier that accompanied the chips and delicious salsa whilst waiting for the main course. The lite afternoon snack consisted of the Ribeye Fajitas served Â with rice, beans and tortillas and I do declare that my discerning palate was totally satisfied.  I must add that in lieu of dessert, Top Shelf Margaritas were ordered for digestive purposes only. I will definitely be back to tried some of the delectable delights that I eyeballed on the menu.

Polvo's is a classic Tex Mex with a heart-of-Austin vibe! The long and short is... Try it out! My order: - Chips and Salsa - I guess technically I don't order this because it magically appears at the table when you sit down but their chips are perfectly thick and salty and their two salsa provide excellent variety for all spice palates!  - House Margarita (on the rocks, no salt) - I LOVE their margaritas and they offer an excellent happy hour so I 10/10 recommend stopping by early in the evening to get the night going! - Enchiladas - I ordered a two enchilada plate this time with cheese enchiladas, one with carne guisada on top (HOLY CRAP WILL ORDER THIS AGAIN!) and the other with salsa verde (also wonderful but not as show stopping). The rice and beans are classic and always worth it! - Beef fajitas - My friend ordered these and MAN did they smell amazing the whole dinner! She said she was very impressed and will crave them! As I always say, there are so many Tex Mex restaurants in Austin that you have to be choosy (or not and eat Mexican food constantly like I do) but Polvos will not let you down!

I was recommended to check out Polvos while I was looking around for quality Tex Mex. the first thing that caught my eye when I walked in was the salsa bar. I was excited since I'm the type of person who eats way too many chips and salsa and then struggles to finish the entrees. The salsa was awesome and well worth the extra $3.50/table. It's a must get when you go here. I ordered a pitcher of margaritas for the table and the burrito compuestas for my meal. The food was above average but not worth the money. $18 for tex mex seems a bit steep for me. If you love Tex Mex then I suggest giving this place a try. Aside from the salsa bar there wasn't much else that stuck out to me.

We recently came here for a late night meal. The dish we tried was pretty good but the restaurant did not feel welcoming at all.  The options for food after 10 PM in this area are fairly limited but we found this place online. We showed up at 10:25 and were rather curtly told that they close at 11:00 (the hours on Yelp are wrong). I don't think that showing up 35 minutes before closing is that unreasonable. After being given a table we got water and chips but nobody came to give us a menu. Eventually we flagged down a waiter who just had us scan a QR code to get the menu on our phones because apparently printed menus aren't a thing anymore?  When our food finally arrived (we split an order of their Nachos de Luja) it was actually very good but the whole experience surrounding it didn't feel very pleasant. Prices are also very high compared to other Mexican places in this area.

Coming from Mexico City, visiting Austin my friends toke Me to have dinner here. U can imagine how doubting I was as a good Mexican I am very picky when I eat Mexican in USA. Â I have to say I am very very impressed with the food and the service ! Best best food I had outside of Mexico since I've lived in USA hands down. Brick was amazing taking care of us, very friendly and with a knowledge of his menu, he is truly what a server suppose to be, not just a robot taking orders. I will for sure come back for more and if you come to Austin; make sure you visit this place
The food is great and the restaurant is nice. My favorite are the chicken fajitas, they are SOOOO good!!! I would come here for dinner everyday if I could! 10/10 recommend:)

My husband and I came here on a whim with our toddler. We were pleasantly surprised with the warm complimentary chips and ordered guac ($16) to go with it. Because of Covid there's no menus so you scan a QR code at the table. And since we're all vegan it was easier to ask what we could have and modify it. If you have a dietary restriction they were very accommodating. We ordered 2 veggie fajitas ($22ea) which came with flour tortillas.  I'm not uptight about Covid but something a bit off putting is the salsa bar. There's 3 large bowls in the center of the restaurant where you go help yourself. That means a lot of people using the ladle all day. So skip the salsa.  The entrees were really good and we were happy. We didn't know the price until we got the bill. The guac wasn't that special and was spoonfuls scooped on a plate. The fajitas didn't even have tofu, just veggies, nothing warranted it being $22. I asked the server and she said they raised prices 3 days ago. We never paid this in NYC and we've had way better. We had a nice time and found the food to be authentic but it didn't impress enough to shock us with a $73 tab + 20% tip. This rubbed us wrong and we already said we'll never come back.

Maybe an off night, but the nachos were not very good- tortillas that were tough and chewy and could not eat. Â The small amount of guac on the side looked to be the kind you purchase prepackaged. Â We were also at a table near the kitchen so it was warm. Margs were good as was the salsa bar.

The best frozen margs ever! Â Service is fast and friendly and the food is delicious! Â Parking is limited so taking a ride share can be a real benefit. Â We like to go early as the place is popular and fills up quickly!

Came here after swimming at barton springs all day and it was a pleasant surprise because pretty much nothing was available on a Saturday night. I didn't come here prior because the reviews only gave it 3.5 stars but the food here is insanely good. It took a little less than 30 minutes to be seated but we weren't tripping since it was the only place without an hour long wait. Location is beautiful inside and i loved the decor. We paid for the chips and salsa bar which was like $3.50 which didn't make any sense to me since most mexican restaurants give complimentary salsa obviously. But their salsa was super good and SPICY , it tasted like authentic mexican salsa which is probably why they charge extra for all the extra ingredients that go into it , but still lowkey kinda expensive for something that should be complimentary. Anyways, food was super good and fresh. Service was super mid Â we barely got asked anything but oh well
Cane to this place cus it was my aunts birthday. My first time being there. It was delicious! And they sale a pitcher of maragrita!? Dont mind if i do!

I actually really liked the food at Polvo's so it was very disappointing that there service wasn't good. We ordered the beef fajitas and the tacos al pastor, both super yummy! The service was the down side. They never came over to fill our waters and brought our food over without silverware. We had to ask twice for silverware and waited over 10 minutes while our food was getting cold.  My sister also ordered an enchilada and that didn't come until we got up and asked the manager for it. By that point we were finished and paying the bill. Long story short, I'd stick to take out from Polvo's.
Love this place. Food and service always on point.  Mole enchiladas and flautas delicious.
The food is fantastic. Â Mole enchiladas.  Chile relleno. Â Great service. Prices very reasonable.

Been going here for years cause I live in the neighborhood.  The food is tasty if you order the right thing, but it's normal Mexican food. Their prices have Sky rocketed and don't seem to match the product. $11 for a bowl of cheese, and $4.50 added to your bill for Salsa bar. The exterior has plastic tables and blue encampment looking tarps as a roof. Â  Sorry Polvos, but I feel you have the attitude that No matter what you present and serve, people will come anyway just cause it's AUSTIN There are many other places In Austin I rather eat at.

Not a huge fan of how they make their breakfast tacos. Asked for bacon, egg, bean and cheese. They were excited to load it full of beans, though i have to dissect it to find the small bacon bits they put in.
Greatest margaritas in Austin 5 star for years. Â Pork great pastor. Get it. Â Thank me later

The food was good, but overpriced. Everything on their menu was a few dollars more than most other similar restaurants. Additionally, their salsa is not free. This would have been fine. However, it was brought to our table without us requesting it. I knew it would be for a charge, but this could easily trick an unsuspecting customer. It's only a few bucks, but a good business wouldn't need or want to trick their customers. My friends wanted to come here for dinner, so it was worth going to spend time with them, but I would be extremely unlikely to visit or recommend the restaurant on any other occasion.  I had the cerveza beef fajitas. They were alright. I would have liked to have an option with bell peppers instead of poblanos but fortunately the poblanos did not overpower the dish. I also added on an order or queso after I forgot that it was $10. That's almost unheard of! I cannot believe their guac is $15 and we certainly didn't splurge on that. A friend got enchiladas that had tons of onions. She likes onions but I could never eat something that oniony! Along with their salsa, they offered escabeche which was the only thing that made paying extra for salsa worth the charge.

Talk about one of the best spots for Mexican food, front their choriqueso to their fajitas. Even their special plates, such like the Chile rellenos or carne guisada. Never disappoint on taste and quality. Great for big groups of people or just take out.  I really enjoy everything you guys have to offer, just one thing I wish you can change. Splitting tickets!! When going with big groups, I thinks it's unfair for you guys not to be able to split our ticket cost. Y'all's plates vary in prices and it's a little unfair for someone who had a plate from $15.00 and someone who has a $20+ plate have to pay the same amount of money when paying. Just something I wanted to bring up to y'all's attention. Would've give y'all 5 stars but this really is a bummer sometimes for y'all's customer service.  Keep on doing what y'all do and for sure, I'll be back for more (Just not with my friends Lol).

Dined in on a weekend evening and seeing the parking lot full made us think we'd have a long wait so pleasantly surprised when seated immediate upon requesting a table. Wow!! Plenty of indoor dining and a wonderful patio with ample seating. Â  Great place, delicious food, prompt service, attentive staff, tasty drinks and great pricing. Â Will definitely be back.
Thank you for stopping by, Rachel! We hope to have you back soon.

Welllll, they certainly build up the expectation with their signage.... I ordered the special Asadero taco they glorified on the menu. Hubby had the brisket tacos.  I was sadly disappointed by the experience. The patio is amazing and I will pump that wholeheartedly - great outdoor seating ! And I will say the nachos were fabulous- think they were homemade!! But what they charge and how much they build up their ' award winning' specialty taco, was extremely disappointing. The meat was chewy and had SO Little flavor Â . The beans that come with it were flavorless. Except for the chewy meat that I literally spat out(gross but true) the ingredients were of good quality. And I just think if someone had paid attention, the meat would have eventually been tender.  The staff was plentiful but just didn't provide the service you would have expected for some many staff to be present. The brisket in my hubby's taco was tasty and the size was good. Both dishes were fairly costly. I'd def pay what he did for hubby's but I wouldn't pay $5 for what I was served. It's a great location, great outdoor seating and I wish I good do more for a better review but I can't sadly.

Kim, thank you for the review. I am glad you felt the brisket was well done. If you are not happy with your original choice, we are always happy to quickly prepare you something else. Next time, please ask to speak to a manager anytime your food does not meet your expectations.

salsa is good also got the chile con queso & what was funny is that i only got a bowl of queso no chile anyways got the tacos al carbon 2nd time getting this plate & 2nd time disappointed its good but not for its price like my friends & I would say its some mid & thats a compliment also charro beans are not good  drinks are good forsure
Edward, please know that all our entrees are 100% guaranteed. If you are not happy with your original choice, we would be happy to quickly make you something else!

It was very crowded! We sat at the bar and the bartender was great. I don't understand why the bragging about the queso, it was pretty terrible. Better if you mix it with the guacamole or salsa. Check out the picture- it's basically velvetta. Chips were ok, nothing to rave about and lots were too small to dip. The guacamole was delicious and had lots of big chunks of avocado (that apparently is a negative for some but I liked it!).

There are several quality Tex Mex establishments in and all around Austin.  The line of people waiting for a table was so long on a Friday night that we made it a point to return the following night earlier ( 5:00 pm) when the wait was manageable.  Was told the wait would be 45 minutes but ended up being closer to 30 minutes.  Our party of 9 enjoyed each and every entree we ordered.  From the tortilla chips, salsa, margaritas, and the various menu choices, this establishment will not disappoint you.  Our server Ed was top notch.  My carnitas entree was most flavorful and delicious. If you have a group of 4-10 or more I highly recommend this restaurant.
Dano, you're the best! Thanks for your review. I am glad your party enjoyed every entree! Looking forward to seeing you again.  -Paul, General Manager

Passed by on a Thursday night with at least 50 people waiting outside so decided must be great lets try! Since ive gone vegetarian, Mexican restaurants are not my favorite to go to due to VERY limited options and this place was no exception. I got a spinach/mushroom enchilada which i forced myself to eat. It wasnt really bad but it wasnt good either. The tortillas not my favorite. Our server was extremely lovely and even offered and changed my food for me. Plenty of space, outdoor too which is nice for friends to go maybe for margaritas or something. Overall i wouldnt recommend it for vegetarians but dont have a comment for others.

From the time we walked into this place, we knew that we were in for a treat. The restaurant itself is stunningly gorgeous as are the friendly staff and the utterly delicious food and drinks. Their queso is without any doubt the best ever. Their salsa is fresh and spicy, and their house made chips are sturdy enough for both.  Without question, this is definitely our new favorite for Tex-Mex.

This place is a hoot and a half. Feels like a Mexican resort and is huuuuuuge! Room after room after room. Came here with a party of 10-12 and the service was incredible, 10/10. The food is pretty good, not insane. But the atmosphere is so fun. It can get pretty loud here so would avoid for a date.

Laure, you deserve a restaurant you can count on for a good time! Thank you for spending your evening with us. We hope to welcome you and your friends back again sometime soon!  Best,  Paul, General Manager

Oh my gosh this was the best Mexican food I've had in a long time.  The service was great. Our waitress was wonderful.  The chips and salsa are to die for. I could have just had that for my meal.  I had beef Al carbon with rice and a cheese puff. It was so good I had the lunch portion and I couldn't even finish it. The plates are well portioned. We had plenty to take home for the next day.  I would recommend sitting outside. It was so nice. I loved the patio atmosphere. The weather was perfect.

Matts El Ranch is an Austin staple.  When someone comes to town and wants to know where to eat good tex mex this is where I send them.  The food is great, the drinks are great. The service is great.  I love that some of the meals come with complimentary pecan pralines.  My favorite thing here is the Bob Armstrong Dip, its basically a queso compuesto but theres just something about their cheese Â that makes it extra special.  They also have to die for Mexican Martinis and hella good margaritas.  I'm giving them an easy two thumbs up. Make the trip to Matts you wont regret it.

Steve, we appreciate you sending all your friends our way! You can never go wrong with starting your meal off with the Bob Armstrong Dip. Thank you for supporting our local business! We can't wait to whip up another Mexican martini for you soon. Warmly, Paul, General Manager

I usually love Matt's. I ordered to go while dining in. I was instructed to order my to go order from the host stand. I did . The manager told the Hostess to give me a big chips and salsa to go since I was dining in. I went to get my ($20 )to go burrito and there was one 2 oz. salsa and no chips . I asked for the chips and was told it only comes with the 2 oz. I reminded her I was told I could get more chips since i dined in. She then left and came back Â and was given chips and another salsa . When I got home I realized there was no ranchero sauce on the side as specified and listed on the receipt and the burrito was rather pathetic looking. Highly disappointed considering how much I go to Matt's and typically enjoy the food and service.

I'm not a huge fan of Tex Mex. Â However I was pleasantly surprised how much I enjoyed the food and experience at Matt's El Rancho. Â When we walked in, it was clean and the quality of the decor and furniture was at a standard above what I was expecting. Â They have a huge private parking lot. Â There was no wait time for Sunday lunch. Â  The waitress was friendly and got our order quickly. Â We ordered Bob Armstrong queso as our appetizer. Â They gave complementary salsa and chips. Â The chips were not greasy and the salsa was spicy. Â The queso was thick and gooey with sausage and guacamole. Â It was very good. Â Great complement to the salsa. Â For lunch, I got the Asadero tacos and my husband got the green enchiladas. Â We were served guacamole on the side. Â  The asadero tacos were the best! Â It's like a fajita but with more flavor from the beef and big chunk of cheese. Â It's very filling. Â I highly recommend it. Â The green enchilada was good. Â I suggested requesting extra green sauce. Â They used chicken breast which is healthy but can be dry. Â The sauce helps. Â Overall we recommend this place. Â This is a great place to bring out of town guests to try Tex Mex.

Chips were really hard but Matt's Queso was good.  Enchiladas were not that good and they gave us little bit of fajitas in the fajita plate. Tortillas were great and the margaritas were really good too but I wouldn't come here again.

Liz, you should love every aspect of your meal. If that's ever not the case, please let us know so that we can correct portions of your meal while you're still dining with us. We hope you can reconsider and give us another chance to wow you. Sincerely, Paul, General Manager

Honestly Matt's handled our large group like a bunch of champs! I'm fully aware that having a group of 20ish people can be overwhelming but they did such a good job. The Bob Armstrong dip was killer as always and the fajitas absolutely slapped. There's a reason why I always have to come here every time I'm in Austin!!!! Major shoutout to Matt's!!!

I'm not kidding when I say this is one of my absolute favorite restaurants in Austin. It's always packed and I can totally understand why! The margaritas and Mexican martinis are killer and nothing can beat the Bob Armstrong dip! You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu. They also have good lunch specials!!

Finally made it here! Matt's is a "must try" if you're going to be an Austinite. I've lived here since '92, and finally made it. Great atmosphere- this place has been here a long time (since 1952). You can feel the nostalgia in the architecture and the decor. I love a place with a rich history. It was packed for lunch with a 1/2 hour wait the day I went. I'd recommend an early lunch or dinner to get ahead of the crowd.  The chips are fresh and the salsa is flavorful without being too hot. The menu has lots of great food and drink options. My "go to" Mexican dish is usually verde chicken enchiladas, but I tried the el pastor tacos at Matt's. They were "okay"-maybe too much seasoning for my liking. My date and I shared a Matt's Mexican Martini which was perfect (not something I would recommend if you've got a Zoom call right after drinking).  All in all, Matt's is an experience- I'm all about the "experience" of dining out. It has to hit all the right buttons- service, atmosphere, good food and drink, and clean. I'll be back to try my "go to" dish. I hope you'll give this iconic place a try too.

Steffie, we're glad we could help you complete your Austinite bucket list! Thank you for trusting us to deliver on not just a lunch, but a complete experience. We look forward to whipping up verde chicken enchiladas for you soon and a Mexican martini to go with it! (As long as you don't have a Zoom call anytime soon after.) Warmly, Paul, General Manager

Matt's is a good dependable go-to spot for Tex Mex, drinks, and a little ambiance. Every dish on the menu is pretty what you'd expect, no frills here. Matt's is all about size. Size of the menu and size of the restaurant. Just about anything you have a hankering for will be on the menu. And you're practically guaranteed minimal wait for the size of their restaurant. We were able to sit on the patio and have a nice dinner next to the fountain. Really enjoyed the ambiance of that patio. We got a pot of queso which was pretty solid. I went with the Matt's special to sample a couple things and enjoyed. Again, nothing I can necessarily bad about this place. But nothing I'm going to rave about. Really good service. Worth going to if you want a casual Tex mex meal

Ryan, if you're craving it, we have it! We're so glad you got to enjoy a relaxing meal on our patio by our fountain. If there's ever anything we can do to take your meal to the next level, please let us know. We hope to really wow you with our Tex-Mex in the future!  Warmly, Paul, General Manager

This place is one of the last beacons of old Austin. The day Matt's closes their doors is the day Austin is truly dead.  Wife and I came for dinner after having moved to Cedar Park a few years ago (yay Austin real estate!). It had been easily 3 or 4 years since our last meal at this classic Tex-Mex spot. The chips were just as crunchy as I remember (they are lil thicker than the others), the salsa had the same heat, and the Grilled Old Fashioned Tacos were still on the menu.  Happy to be back, sorry it took so long.

Ordinarily, I try and go somewhere twice before reviewing, but I'm only in town a week for a work conference and won't be back. To be honest, probably wouldn't go back anyway.  Came here with a large group of coworkers attending the conference. For a large party, we were seated faster than we expected, which was nice.  I ordered the chicken fajitas, because I heard they were known for their fajitas. I'll be honest, there was some "sticker shock" when I first saw the price, but I immediately figured that meant the portion must be HUGE.  BOY. WAS. I. WRONG.  What came to the table was no where near worth the price. No way. And, the fajitas weren't any better than any I've had anywhere else. Disappointing. I left still hungry.  The only thing I appreciated was the service. Boy our server was FANTASTIC, especially considering the large group.  Apparently, this place is a big deal, but it wasn't for me. Do yourself a favor: if you do go here, pass on the fajitas.

Bailey, no matter how big your party is, you can always count on friendly, attentive service from us! We're sorry that the fajitas didn't knock it out of the park for you. If you're ever unhappy with your meal, please let us know while you are here so that we can make things right. Â  All ou entrees are 100% guaranteed. Â  If you donâ€™t love it, we are always here to quickly prepare you something else. Â  We hope you can give us another chance the next time you're in town to find you a meal that'll keep you coming back.  Sincerely, Paul, General Manager
No wait, excellent service, great food and drinks. Had the chicken flautas and Carne guisada. Both were great. Rancho margs were perfect. Parking was a nightmare but they try.

Clayton, we're so glad we could seat you right as you walked in. Thank you for trying out a few of our classics -- nothing like a Rancho margarita to wash down all that good food! We hope parking is a little easier during your next visit. Sincerely, Paul, General Manager

An Austin classic! Gotta always have the Bob's Armstrong dip....in fact it's perfectly acceptable if you come here only for the dip and margs. I had their fish tacos for my main dish, I liked how they grilled the Mahi Mahi. Actually I wish I can just order a dish of their grilled fish and rice. Their tortillas are good, I just wish I can customize them to be crispy. Staff are always nice here, and the place can get busy. Interior is super clean and their aesthetic is perfect for tex mex.

Alysia, some days just call for queso and margaritas! We're so glad you got to sample a main entrÃ©e while dining with us. Whether you're craving a full meal or just an appetizer, we hope to welcome you back again sometime soon!  Best, Paul, General Manager
Start your review of  Tacodeli .

Morning, noon, night. I could eat Tacodeli for every meal. My waistline is thankful that there's not one (yet) in Denver. But I do beeline to the closest location whenever in Austin.  The Otto breakfast taco is just the right amount of beans, bacon, avocado. And this time I tried the steak and egg brekkie taco as well.  And the queso. Don't even get me started on the queso. It's on the thinner side, which is much more palpable after a steamy morning walk.  Pro hangover tip: Mix the sparkling water with OJ in a cup. Helps keep the taste buds alive.

Came here on a Friday afternoon and ordered the shrimp salad. The line moved somewhat slowly, and the food also came out somewhat slowly. I enjoyed the salad and the queso very much! They also have 4 different salsas of varying heat intensity. The ambiance is casual, and it wasn't difficult to secure a table for 5 people at the time we went.  Overall the service was friendly but could have been better. My friend (the bachelorette for a bachelorette's party) ordered a swirled marg but it didn't come with a swirl. After bringing this up to staff, they simply handed her the juice for the swirl instead of remaking it. Now, for normal occasion, this would have sufficed, but I was disappointed to see that they did not show extra effort for such an important occasion.

THE BIG: This location is nicely tucked away in the South Austin area. Parking is tough especially during peak eating hours. THE BLACK AND WHITE: Fun fact, Tacodeli was my first taco joint I've visited in Austin and I have to say, their tacos are amazing! I came here with a buddy before going on a rafting trip and the breakfast tacos here held me over until late in the afternoon. I know! It's that hefty and delicious. I got the Jess Special, which had something called the migas. Apparently migas is just leftover corn tortillas re-invented into a delicious breakfast taco. Big fan! The Vaquero is also good. You can't go wrong with any selection here THE FINAL BAMBOO: Overall, two tacos was about $7. Not bad and I'll definitely be back again!

I ordered the most popular dish, the Cowboy Taco. The dry-rubbed beef tenderloin was very flavorful but could have been slightly more tender and juicy. The guacamole and queso fresco was the perfect amount of spicy to add just the right amount of kick to the taco.

Tacodeli is always so busy when I go, which is a testament to how popular it really is!  The staff are always so friendly and really go the extra mile to help. I got Frontera Fundido with shrimp - decent taco, i can't eat dairy so I got it without cheese but it honestly kind of lacked flavor.  Also got the vaquero taco - pretty standard taco, huge serving of egg.  I got the hot sauce with both, not spicy at all, would recommend the 4th spicy option if I were to come again.  Pretty good price for the breakfast tacos!

It was alright. I ordered a bunch of tacos and they weren't as memorable. I think the cowboy was the best out of the bunch. I tried the queso with chips. The chips wasn't fresh and I am not a fan of queso in general. The best thing about this location is all the different sauces that can match your preference of heat.

Went to Tacodeli today to eat tacos after hearing so much about the place. It was sprinkling a little bit when we went and there wasn't too much of a line which was nice. I ended up ordering: *cowboy - I liked this taco - all the flavors went pretty well together *frontera fundido sirloin - DIDNT like this taco - really lacked any flavor and the meat was a little tough *large queso - this was good and edible but not great. Don't think I'd order again - wish the queso was thicker for sure. Came with chips but wasn't fresh unfortunately  Overall I'd go to try the cowboy and maybe the Delhi belly which my friend said was good but other items were not yummy.

Shrimp taco with poblano pepper and onion rajas is very good: plump fresh shrimp. Salmon taco could be mistaken for meat because of its spicy seasoning. Highlight: refried black beans are really tasty.

Love love love Tacodeli! Easily one of my favorite places to get tacos in Austin. I live super close so I ended up joining their rewards program since it's so convenient and good! I always get the el pollosito, but this time I also got the carne asada. Both were really good, but the el pollosito will always be my favorite. I am also a big fan of their dona sauce!! This sauce is a must if you like spicy things! Back when we were in the office, we would order Tacodeli all the time for meetings. Breakfast tacos were always easy to get if it was a morning meeting and then chips and queso were a must for afternoon meetings! They have made online ordering and contactless pick up extremely easy during covid. Every time I have ordered online, it's ready within 10 minutes max, which gives me just enough time to order and then walk over to go pick it up immediately. While the indoor dining is closed, they still have a good amount of outside seating too!

Great place to grab breakfast tacos in Austin. There was outdoor seating here and it was dog friendly! No indoor seating when I went, but a very streamlined process where you'll go in and order, and your order will be called out for you.  Veracruz ends up tasting and feeling more authentic but this place is fun to check out as well!
Start your review of  Tacodeli .

Freshly, made to order tacos and some of the nicest folks you'll ever meet at this location. I enjoy coming here because of the service and consistency of the ingredients. Keep being awesome, Spyglass Tacodeli!

They feed me breakfast like 3-4 times a week!!! Thank you Taco Deli employees!! Only thing I wish is that they had more vegan options like JUST EGG and no butter in their egg tacos. But I adore Tacodeli. Thank you!!!!

The food is AMAZING!!  I don't like tacos, I went because my sibling wanted to and boy was it worth it!! The cashier at the front, I didn't get his name, was very friendly and informative. He helped suggested a few items that we loved. The other staff is very friendly and the whole place is very clean and has welcoming decor. Definitely a great place to stop by for any locals and travelers!
my favorite tacos in Austin! Simple and delicious tacos with the best homemade salsa Try the DoÃ±a salsa!

I do not know why this place has such good reviews. I mean given, the actual tacos are pretty good, but the breakfast tacos are definitely not. Literally just the most basic scrambled eggs, with meh toppings and unmelted cheese. It's not that it was super bad, it just tasted like a breakfast taco i would eat in a hospital. It amazes me that the line was out the door too.. Go to Veracruz or Tacojoint if you want some actually food bfast tacos
Tacodeli is the best In Austin. Â It's consistent. Â They have the most creative combinations. Â The service is always good. Â I'll go out of my way for Tacodeli.

This is my favorite Tacodeli location to date. Why? It's located right across the Spyglass entrance to the Greenbelt, which means, TACOSSS! After a few hours on the greenbelt, I am starving. Tacodeli has been my savior on more than one occasion. What's even better? Breakfast is served until 3 on weekends!  My all time favorite has to be the Migas or Jess Special loaded with La DoÃ±a sauce on the side. Unfortunately, you can't splurge and serve yourself like you would in the past due to coronavirus precautions.  Indoor dining is prohibited, but outdoor seating is available, along with social distancing guidelines.
Still operating during covid for take out or pick up curbside. I'm not a huge fan of any of the other tacos but the bean and cheese taco.

I don't get it. Extremely salty food. Too much salt in the tacos and salsas. Corn tortillas are not grilled very well.  I guess being from LA we expect a bit more from a taco and this was just not it. Might have been an off day but every taco was off. Hate saying this about a beloved establishment but my tongue is burning from all the salt on my food.  Maybe breakfast tacos are better. We tried: - POLLO ADOBADO (3/5) - dry, not a great chipotle flavor  - TACOLOCO (3/5) - the meat itself was tasty but the guacamole tasted bad and it only had one mushroom slice in the whole taco. The flavors didn't mesh well at all - TIKIN XIC - (1.5/5) - SO MUCH SALT that I had to spit out my taco because the amount of salt burned my tongue. The salmon itself was tasty once I wiped off the seasoning.  - SHRIMPOSITO - (2.5/5) - good portion of 4 shrimps in the taco but way too much adobo sauce and it overpowered the taco with a flavor that wasn't it to begin with.  Tried each of the salsas and none of them had much flavor or enhanced the tacos. Sorry Austin, this place is not it.

I wanted to try the bkfs tacos but by the time I arrived breakfast was over. I know.... Around liinch there was a looong line but it moved fairly quickly. The cashier was super friendly and helpful. As someone who does not eat meat,she Â recommended to order the taco with salmon ( Tikin Xic ) and the Heather. Both were good but I liked the salmon taco a bit more. It had a lot of flavors. There are three different salsas to choose from. All are really good. The tacos are very fresh.  I wish this place was close to my house...
Start your review of  Tacodeli .

Four little letters - Otto. Â One awesome salsa - Dona. Â These two things are magical. Â Everything else on their menu is very good. Â I've also had their catering. Â Other than cold tortillas, it's always excellent. I usually call my order in because at the right time of the day, it could take 30 minutes or more for your order to get made. Â They've got the pick up process down to a fine art. Â While I like talking to a person on the phone, their online ordering isn't a bad experience either. Their system shares data very well too, because while I go to this Westlake location the most, any one I call into has my info. Â The employees behind the counter also seem to be well trained. Â Tacodeli is a world class operation in my opinion. Â You can certainly go there half cocked and have a miserable experience though.

The service is so nice, the salsa is amazing and the food is very good. It's really not pricey at all either. I got 3 breakfast tacos for 9 dollars and I was able to customize them completely! If you are worried about wait time then I suggest ordering ahead. It is a garunteed way to ditch the line and wait time.  So many coffee shops in Austin sell TacoDeli tacos for a reason! I came to the store front because the shops I always go to have them sold out before 10. There is something for everyone!  The doÃ±a salsa is my favorite and highly reccomend it with the breakfast tacos! My breakfast taco order is papas, eggs and cheese or just papas and beans.

IF you wish to eat in this place, prepare for cold tacos and a long wait. They get a lot of togo orders , from all the door dash and uber eats of the world. and people who happen to take our time to go here have to get in line with them all. crazy thing is they make less money catering to these app ordering systems, yet the people who come here suffer.  I guess If I really want a hot good taco I'll go to taco flats. Taco deli is more Â or less now a take out taco spot.

Was a little disappointed after seeing the tacos. All the tacos were extra salty which is weird, for a guy who likes salty food. Not a value for money for the amount of meat in the tacos.  You can make it a meal (Blue Plate) which comes with rice and beans which is the most little beans and rice portion I have ever seen. On a positive note, the beans were tasty.  The sauces were decent but nothing that would standout and make you wanna get again.

So my original review stands. Â Just some COVID update info. Yummy Mexican food fast and hot. Â I still like that I can get retried black beans here, so it's a top choice for me for tacos. I don't go inside anymore. Â I strictly use curbside. Â It's so easy. Â I call in my order when I'm nearby, drive up, park in a designated numbered curbside pickup spot, text my name, spot number and salsa choice and they bring it out. Â SUPER EASY and Â fast.

Oh yummmy... Â  How did I not know about this place before 2019? Â One of the few places you can get refried black beans. Â And that queso. Â Yum!!! Call to order ahead of time or on their website. Â Walk out with your yummy tacos with virtually no wait.
Best tacos in the world. Period. Was told when I moved here from CO, "Go immediately to Taco Deli." Love so much I bought a house nearby.

In a world where Torchy's is going downhill as they sacrifice quality for growth, Tacodeli really seems to be pulling ahead in terms of quality, cleanliness, and even authenticity I am a big fan of the Mexico City tacos (either meat) on corn and obviously the dona sauce. Service is always good & friendly and appreciate that they give water cups while you wait. So I will say that i tried the dinner plate, and I think i prefer just getting tacos and the blue plate. Prices aren't terrible but higher than alot of the authentic mexican food trucks and/or stores, but I find myself hitting up tacodeli more and more.
Yum! I almost always get the same thing since I'm vegetarian. I've been getting the shiitake mushroom tacos lately and they are FAB.

I seldom find myself in Tacodeli, but when I do, I find their tacos absolutely delicious. Â Staff is great and efficient, and the quality of the ingredients is excellent. Â For my latest visit, I ordered the Shrimposito and a Pork Belly taco. Â The shrimp were marinaded well and cooked just right. Â The pork belly was nicely charred and had a good ratio of meat and fat. Â The sauces were addicting as well. Â And as always, gotta get that blue plate special cause you gotta get those rice and beans! Â I love the variety of their taco options, I should really stop by more often.

We have been patronizing the Gracy Farms location for many years and their tacos have always been Five Star quality. Today 10/21/21 we ordered our favorite tacos and they came on raw tortillas. BIG FAIL ! Â Please rectify this or we will become ex-customers.
Start your review of  Tacodeli .
Went for lunch. Tacos were salty. Food seemed very pricey. Salsa was good. Service was fast.
Still my favorite taco spot! So fresh and quality. I got my family to be favorites of this place as well.
The best to-go tacos I've ever had! Â The cowboy, akaushi, and scallops...all so flavorful! Â It was my first meal in Austin and enjoyed every bite of it. Â I went here twice in one week!

I love this location! We go here at least once a month. They even gave me a coupon on my birthday last year! The staff is so kind and personable and they get everything done so quickly.  The food is absolutely delicious too. I love the deli belly and the cowboy the most for the lunch tacos and the migas royale plate is amazing and very filling. The migas royale plate was the first real food I could eat after getting my wisdom teeth out and it was so delicious I cried. So it has a special spot in my heart always.  They have great covid policies in place with their curbside pick up and everyone is always in a mask and gloves so I feel very safe picking up my food.  Over all. Love this place!
Loved this place! Really great service and outdoor dining, and of course the food is great, too! Definitely will be returning!
Yummy Â it's not exactly the most "authentic" place in Texas to get your tacos, but I mean it's still delicious and decent for the price compared to other Americanized taco places in Austin lol
I literally ate everything Before I could take a photo! Tacodeli is probably the best tacos I've had in my entire life! If you do anything please get THE COWBOY! It's literally the best taco ever.
Well, the airport taco location tacos are awful. They need some true Mexicans up in there.. those tortillas are not properly or fully cooked..yuck! Very unappealing.
The yummiest! Friendly staff. I wish they would require workers prepping food to wear a mask with the rise in cases and the vaccine not 100% effective. Seems odd they don't.

Order online, pick up in restaurant is my favorite option. We love getting dinner tacos since now they're open until 8pm. My favorite breakfast taco is the Otto on flour tortillas. I love getting the cold brew coffee mixed with the horchata. Depending on location, they call it a dirty horchata. It's not on the online menu, so I've ordered a cold brew and made the request at pick up. I expect it's popular enough to put on the menu though.  We always come back. A personal favorite for quality tacos.

Eek, Â this is probably the saltiest food I've ever tasted in my life!!!!!! Â Like unbearably salty. Â The kids bean taco was the only thing palatable. Â I was so looking forward to the dressed-up queso in particular but I couldn't stomach it. Â  The salsa was tasty, pre-packaged chips were super convenient and the picnic table pavilion is cool... but that's about it. Â Buyers remorse.
Start your review of  Torchys Tacos .
They had me at chicken and waffle tacos.  We loved the creativity and everything we ordered tasted great.
Hi Inigo - Thanks for sharing the taco love! We always strive to please our guests, and we cannot begin to express our sincere gratitude for choosing Torchyâ€™s!

Torchy's is always a good time and bringing a couple breakfast tacos on the plane home is always the right move. You can even order online the night before and set a convenient pick up time for yourself. I really wish they'd open some in CA (though it does sound like they're expanding into the midwest).
Hi Misha - Thanks for sharing! Our team will appreciate the kind words and we hope to serve you some Damn Good tacos again soon!

I've been coming to Torchy's over the years at UT and in Rice Village. The tacos taste fine overall. My favourites are the brushfire and baja shrimp tacos. I think they're overpriced for the size, and the wait time to get your food on the weekend is sometimes 30-40 minutes, which is a pretty long time.
Hi Carrie - Thanks for your review! Our team appreciates it and we hope to serve you some Damn Good tacos again soon!

Simple place with excellent breakfast tacos. I tried the Migas tacos which was superb. This is a great place for tasty tacos. Soft tortilla was served open face in plastic basket and salsa in small plastic container. I sat outdoors at the small picnic tables and heard the steady stream of traffic pass by as I chowed down.
Hi Carolyn - Thanks for sharing! Our team will appreciate the kind words and we hope to serve you some Damn Good tacos again soon!

Torchy's is an Austin classic because of their unique tacos and delicious queso. They have a good variety of proteins and salsas. I have regularly had their Trailer Park, which comes with fried chicken. Solid taco.  The only thing that prevents me from being a regular is their pricing and the wait time. I do appreciate that they have good outdoor seating and about a dozen parking spots.  I'll probably come back here in a couple months.
Torchy's Tacos has my absolute favorite salsa on the planet(the tomatillo one)! I also love the Mr. Orange, because I love salmon, lime, and avocado.
Hi Abigail - Thanks for sharing the taco love! We always strive to please our guests, and we cannot begin to express our sincere gratitude for choosing Torchyâ€™s!

Uh, I love corn tortillas, but the ones they used here kinda really sucked. Idk if they were wheat or soemthing but they felt under cooked/ prepared. Unfortunately my love or corn tortillas had me or ding 5 of the 6 tacos I got with those tortillas and I was greatly disappointed. I enjoyed the one flour tortilla, but it was one of the few times I had Tex mex so I made that fatal flaw.
Great flavors, very fresh, very quick. Â Loved the friend chicken taco trashy style.
Hi Mighty - Thanks for sharing the taco love! We always strive to please our guests, and we cannot begin to express our sincere gratitude for choosing Torchyâ€™s!

Used to be a go-to of mine, but this location has seen better days. It felt like the place doesn't care about it's food anymore. Tacos took ages to come out and the Baja shrimp was cold. The trailer park(trashy)'s queso had already hardened from sitting, and the chicken strip was lukewarm at best.  I also had the green chile pork which tasted off, and I believe gave me and my friend a stomach ache. At least the Crossroads was still the same as expected and as good as before. Brisket was moist, and the taco was well-made.
Hi Alex - Would you like to tell us more about your recent experience, so we can follow up with you directly? Please let us know how best to reach you by going to  torchysfeedback.com

Don't waste your time making an online order here. I went up and they said it'll be a couple of minutes till it's ready and they'll bring it to me. Well I waited for 25 minutes and they never brought it to me so I went up again and it's been sitting there for 15 minutes.  My food was all cold and my order came out wrong. I was missing a taco and my other taco had green chiles when I specifically put I was highly allergic!! Terrible service as well don't recommend at all!!

Hi Victoria - We are incredibly sorry for the frustrating experience you had at our restaurant. Would you mind telling us a little bit more about your experience, so our management team can follow up with you directly? Please fill out our online form -  torchysfeedback.com
Start your review of  Torchys Tacos .

Line took forever. Food was what you get at Torchy's every time. The waiter was rude, impatient, and had an attitude on him. My friends and I were in line and the server comes the opposite way and says excuse me. Of course, we move out the way fast. After he passed us, he goes "Jesus Chris get the f*ck out of my way." Totally rude and uncalled for. We were just standing in line. The restaurant was very busy so we put a chair at the end of a table. There was still plenty of space to walk through. The same server comes by and tells us in a rude tone that it's a fire hazard. We try to talk to him and he just storms off. The thing that bothered us was that many of the tables nearby were doing the same thing. We think we were being targeted by this man. This is horrible customer service and Torchy's should really reevaluate their employees. I attached a picture of a table nearby that was doing the exact thing. I will not forget this horrible experience.
Hi Jared - Would you like to tell us more about your recent experience, so we can follow up with you directly? Please let us know how best to reach you by going to  torchysfeedback.com

The place wasn't terribly packed when I got there but as I was finishing my meal it filled up!  This isn't your traditional sit-down restaurant. You order at the register, take a number and they bring your meal out to you when it's ready. Think CiCi's pizza, kind off, sort of, not really. I was overwhelmed with choices which is never a bad thing. I told myself to pick a reasonable number of tacos. I also told myself Â I could always make a trip back before the end of myÂ vacation to try other tacos. I never made that second trip. In hindsight, I wish I would have gotten 4 tacos instead. I also wish I would have come back for a second meal. When I travel I typically eat less because I don't likeÂ carrying aroundÂ leftovers. It's a combination of that and the AirBNBs I stay in never have refrigerators in the room. (I feel weird going into other people's refrigerators.) What I ordered: Mr. Orange (Blackened salmon, grilled corn, black bean relish, cojita cheese, cilantro, lime wedge, avocado sauce on a corn tortilla) Brushfire (Jamaican jerk chicken, grilled jalapenos, mango, sour cream, cilantro with diablo sauce on a flour tortilla) Baja Shrimp ( hand-batteredÂ  fried shrimp, cabbage slaw, pickled onions, jalapenos, cojita cheese, cilantro, lime wedge, chipotle sauce on any tortilla of choice.) Street corn (corn topped with ancho aioli, cojita cheese, cilantro, red chile powder and a lime wedge.) This tasted like corn straight out of the can. I like crunchy corn and all the corn I got was deflated, for lack of a better word. I enjoyed the Brushfire taco the most! I ate it last because it looked the safest + in case I didn't like the other tacosÂ I wanted to make sure I ended with something satisfying. This also had a nice kick to it. It wasn't spicy to the point I couldn't enjoy it. I also automatically love anything with sour cream. The avocado sauce on Mr. Orange was very tasty. I'm not usually a fan of avocado "things". I'm not a fan of fried shrimp but I decided to give it a second chance. The shrimp on the Baja taco tasted rubbery. I wish I would have asked if grilled shrimp was an option. Overall, almost everything tasted fresh! I definitely prefer corn tacos, tastes more authentic. The portion sizes were hefty which I can always appreciate! I'd pick this over Moe's or any other chain "Tex-Mex" restaurant. However, I'd still pick authentic "street style" tacos over this any day.Â I wouldn't order the corn again. And I'd get a fountain drink because who doesn't love free refills? I definitely recommend checking this place out if you're ever in Austin or Texas! Bonus: They also have breakfast tacos!
Tried the new beyond beef tacos yesterday without spicy peppers, they were absolutely delicious. The price is a little steep but they are well worth your try
Hi Danielle - Thank you for taking the time out of your day to leave us a review! We really appreciate it!
For Tex-Mex tacos, I think the tacos here aren't that great and there are better options in town. Tacos were okay, but can't say I'd recommend.
Hi Kevin - We're sorry that your experience wasn't Damn Good, but we're listening and your feedback will help us improve.

Today is Feb 13, 2021. As Edwin and Joy pointed out, there are some rude employees working up in this place. I've eaten at several Torchy's restaurants in Houston and I've never been disappointed. First, my pops went to the bar to ask about drinks - the guy brushed him off quickly by handing him a menu. Second, when our food was delivered, my husband asked for some Diablo sauce which never came. Funny because the place wasn't packed. Lastly and the worst, I find a hair in my taco. This place can kiss our buns.
Really good tacos! The cashier helped us decide on which tacos to get. We also tried the queso. Soo goof
Hi Pamela - Thanks for sharing the taco love! We always strive to please our guests, and we cannot begin to express our sincere gratitude for choosing Torchyâ€™s!

Torchy's tacos are all over Austin. Torchy's tacos has an extensive menu of their specialty tacos. They are all excellent On this trip I had a shrimp taco with a complicated name that I can't repeat it doesn't matter just say I want to shrimp taco and all the rest came along. The Verde taco with a Chile Verde and a bunch of other stuff was also most excellent. We had a variety of tacos and they were brought to our table pretty promptly for such a complex order and while we happy. The gal behind the counter was extremely nice and extremely helpful. Although tortillas taco doesn't have become pie we were looking for pecan pie and astro she knew and she didn't but she looked things up and came over to our table later in gave us a report on what she found. That was definitely above and beyond by this nice young lady studying to be a surgeon at the local University. Back to torchy's tacos. The place has a lot of seating wide open a big bar lots of beer and is real hotspot for people who want to have a group get together. All I can say is go to torchy's tacos anyone gettin lis getting line and getting taco. Even at the busy times it's worth the wait and yum yum yum. On 2nd thought get a couple of tacos unless your really hungry and you'll know what to do. Enjoy torchy's I do.
My favourite taco spot in town! Disappointed that they stopped the independent Taco post covid but now i have the fried avocado as my vegetarian choice. Best chips and Queso I've tried so far too!
Great breakfast tacos. Â Good size, filling and great price.

lt is a tex mex modern play on tacos with an edgy grunge taste. I was craving tacos so Jon and I came here. I found the perfect taco! The ambiance of torchy's is super laid back and chill so you can come with your friends on a fun and informal dinner. I think it's a great place for a 3rd+ date. The drinks for sodas are really cool and austin-y aswell! Food came out fast and servers were friendly, it's a more "eat on your own" style. I got the Baja Shrimp taco. Jon got the Republican and Brushfire taco. My pictures don't do the tacos justice but they were AMAZING each so BALANCED in flavor and texture. The price for the tacos were good aswell! Each was about $4.50 and getting one filled me up (wasn't on an empty stomach). Baja Shrimp 10/10 I love the crunchiness of the fried shrimp but also the freshness of the pickled onions. The chipotle mayo was so creamy it balanced and flavored the whole thing! Also LOVE the CORN TORTILLA! It was so earthy and had a good texture, rough but soft. Republican 8/10 (Josausage was juicy and flavorful but Jon felt that the sausage overpowered the over components and it was a bit too cheesy. Lots of flavor but very one dimensional Bushfire 8/10 SUPER spicy but perfect amount of spicy since it's customizable. The mangoes was a good juicy and fresh relief from the fire!

SO GOOD! It is a tex mex modern play on tacos with an edgy grunge taste. I was craving tacos so Jon and I came here. I found the perfect taco! The ambiance of torchy's is super laid back and chill so you can come with your friends on a fun and informal dinner. I think it's a great place for a 3rd+ date. The drinks for sodas are really cool and austin-y aswell! Food came out fast and servers were friendly, it's a more "eat on your own" style. I got the Baja Shrimp taco. Jon got the Republican and Brushfire taco. My pictures don't do the tacos justice but they were AMAZING each so BALANCED in flavor and texture. The price for the tacos were good aswell! Each was about $4.50 and getting one filled me up (wasn't on an empty stomach). Baja Shrimp 10/10 I love the crunchiness of the fried shrimp but also the freshness of the pickled onions. The chipotle mayo was so creamy it balanced and flavored the whole thing! Also LOVE the CORN TORTILLA! It was so earthy and had a good texture, rough but soft. Republican 8/10 (Jon) sausage was juicy and flavorful but Jon felt that the sausage overpowered the over components and it was a bit too cheesy. Lots of flavor but very one dimensional Bushfire 8/10 (Jon) SUPER spicy but perfect amount of spicy since it's customizable. The mangoes was a good juicy and fresh relief from the fire!

Amazing value and great taste. Came in for breakfast and had some of the most tastey and budget friendly options. We had brought food for 3 people and only spent $30. 2 tacos per order might be a tip to be aware of so you don't end up like we did.  Coffee was a little sus, but besides that it was a perfect visit.
Hi Joseph - Thanks for sharing the taco love! We always strive to please our guests, and we cannot begin to express our sincere gratitude for choosing Torchyâ€™s!

It has been years since I first visited a Torchy's taco in Austin. On my most recent trip back for the F1 race weekend, I couldn't wait to come back and try their incredible food. My husband and I decided to binge on lunch - ordering queso and chips, guacamole and chips, Street corn, and multiple different types of tacos. Needless to say, we were way too full but enjoyed every last bite. I thoroughly enjoyed their queso and their guacamole was extremely fresh. Their street corn is out of this world! But the taco that stole the show for me this time around was the shrimp taco.  Worth the hype, worth the wait, worth the trip!
Thank you so much Courtney for your great review, it really made our day! We always strive to please our guests, and sincerely appreciate it when you choose to dine with us at Torchy's!

The tacos here are mostly $4-5, with the Tailgater (taco of the month) and Mofaux vegetarian (with Beyond Beef) a bit more. It's pricier than street tacos I've gotten, but are packed with meat, cheese, and the other listed ingredients and are generally delicious. I ordered the Trailer Park trashy-variation and Crossroads and found them both scrumptious. Ambience - 4.2/5 - fast food restaurant, pragmatic layout, nothing particular to note there. Restroom had black urinals and toilets, which was nice. Service - 4.5/5 - uses little rectangular trackers. The waitress awesomely brought all of our tacos for our group of eight! Quality - 4.5/5 - tacos are delicious! They were quite drippy though, especially with sauce applied, so a better way to minimize drip would have been great. One taco came with two tortillas while the other came with one, which was strange. My friends reported getting two tortillas per taco and using them take overflow (essentially making four tacos!) so I guess this was a bit of inconsistency. Value - 4.5/5 - more expensive than street tacos ($3 for not much less) and I'd personally prefer an In-N-Out double-double animal-style with chopped grilled onions and chopped chilis at the same price point. $10 for two tacos (600-800+ calories) is fairly filling though! Overall - 4.4/5 - It's great and I would come again for convenient and comfortable food. Solid and a favorable impression, but not amazing. Although I really want to try their queso before leaving Austin and perhaps bump to 5 stars!
Hi Haoyu - Thanks for your review! Our team appreciates it and we hope to serve you some Damn Good tacos again soon!

Overall decent tacos for a chain-style restaurant. Not the best I've had buuuuut when you're in ATX there is stiff competition anyways. So they do get the job done.  Definitely get the queso. And if you're here reading this during the month of September get the tailgater taco - out of the 4 tacos my partner and I ordered this was hand's down the best taco out of them all by a landslide.
Hi Jessy - Thanks for your review! Our team appreciates it and we hope to serve you some Damn Good tacos again soon!
Best fast-food tacos ever!! They have plenty of locations. I wish they open a restaurant in California.
Pretty good Tex mex food. Apparently it's a hot spot in Austin. There's lots of unique items to try. I really liked the salmon and shrimp tacos.
Hi Karley - Thanks for sharing! Our team will appreciate the kind words and we hope to serve you some Damn Good tacos again soon!

I love a good taco. Torchys has some yummy Â tacos and their chips and queso is the best. Always grab some chips and queso. This location was open and they follow COVID protocols. Â Sitting was open and it was nice to enjoy a meal at the location.
Hi Bianca - Thanks for sharing the taco love! We always strive to please our guests, and we cannot begin to express our sincere gratitude for choosing Torchyâ€™s!

Exactly what we needed on our way out of Austin. After moving away from Texas, we've missed this epic queso. There's really no word to describe it. Loaded with just the right spice and surprisingly delicious avocado! Tacos never disappoint.
Hi Aaron - Thanks for sharing the taco love! We always strive to please our guests, and we cannot begin to express our sincere gratitude for choosing Torchyâ€™s!

These aren't traditional mexican tacos and are more artisan american tacos but they are so good! My favorite is the republican with the jalapeÃ±o sausages but I also really liked the trailer trash. Their tacos are loaded with cheese and tomatoes. But the best part is the crema sauce that comes with it. I like that the meats themselves in all of the tacos are already seasoned nicely. Most of these have a kick to them!  Really delicious and worth the stop.
We're so glad that you're happy, Alice! Thank you for dining with us and see you again at Torchy's!

Oh. My. Goodness. This perfect little spot on Congress street is a must stop for visitors. I was slightly disoriented as a first timer because their system isn't a common one (in my experience). Stand in line at the front door, order, they give you an electronic looking coaster (I see them used while waiting to be called for a table or food, you get alerted when it vibrates and lights up), then go find yourself a table and wait. I was honestly confused, waiting for it to vibrate, but had no idea where to pick my food up. So I watched, and realized they used those to bring your food to you. ((Sigh of relief)). It was during lunch and busy, so I feel like I waited a decent bit of time for my grande burrito, but once it came, it was perfection. It was large and delectable. I was stuffed and practically had to crawl out after finishing it. Would def go again.
Thank you Sarah for the Damn Good review! Â We work hard to provide a great experience and can't wait to see you again soon at Torchys!

Some good some bad. For the price you pay for a premium taco I expect better execution.  Torchys is usually a solid place to grab some out of norm tacos and generally I like their menu. However we had some issue with the meal at this location. We had the Trailer Park "trashy", it is usually my go to at Torchys. I would recommend. The Brushfire is great in concept, however the chicken on mine was very dry and overcooked.  The Democrat, is another favorite of ours, however the meat was also very dry and overcooked. The Bacon egg and cheese was...bad. The bacon was sooooo overcooked you could not even eat it. Like there were parts of it that I could not bite through it was so hard. We also tied the Lil' Nookies. It was a hard pass for everyone who had a bite. Â It was just not a great flavor and I do understand that the texture is supposed to be cookie dough, however the concept fell a little flat without group. Also they forgot to bring them out we had to call down the runner and have them check on them.  Salsa was good. All in all I like Torchys Tacos in general, however this location could use some help in the kitchen. Cannot recommend this location.

Hi jason - Sounds like we have some work to do. Â We thank you for your feedback as it will help us become better at what we do. Â We hope that you'll give us another chance, and return for another visit soon!

I was with my girlfriend in Austin and she recommended this place from previous visits to the area.  The atmosphere seemed fast food-Ish with one line and a register to pay for your tacos that are brought to you.  The tacos I got were the Trashy, and the Democrat. I loved the double tortilla wrap and the sauce made the tacos taste a lot better but I will say that it was definitely a mediocre experience. It took having to put on the sauces to really make the tacos shine and even then they weren't the most flavorful. I will definitely come back but for now, 4 stars is the best I could give this place.
Hi Alex - Thank you for taking the time out of your day to leave us a review! We really appreciate it!

The Queso is the only reason you must come to Torchys. The tacos are unique but nothing that begs for you to come back. Overall,  Service 5/5 Atmosphere: 5/5 Queso: 5/5 Salsas: 5/5 Tacos: 3/5 Store bought tough tortillas: 0/5
Hi Shareef - Thank you for taking the time out of your day to leave us a review! We really appreciate it!

We ate at South Congress Street. Â Was great to sit outside. Â Tacos and guacamole were delish. Â Also the queso was very good. The only negative is the grackle birds are beyond aggressive and attack the remains of food at every table and it is somewhat scary and definitely unsanitary to have birds in the reusable food baskets, all over the tables and chairs. Â Staff was slow to clean unbiased tables and the experience was straight out of Hitchcock's "The Birds".
Hi Rebecca, we'll turn those 4 stars into 5 when you visit next! Come back again soon!

I gotta say this place caught me by surprise. My sister in law lives locally and told me I needed to give it a shot.
