One night, after wandering the city and needing a late night snack, we settled on trying this spot. It was about 30 minutes before closing but they were nice enough to let us order to eat there. I was set on the Trailer Park but as soon as I saw the special of the month, the Roscoe, I knew I needed to try that one too. We ordered a taco each and the special of the month to share. My wife and her sister ordered Trailer Parks with edits that added quest. We grabbed a table outside and set our buzzer on the table. A short time later our tacos arrived. The Roscoe one looked good right from the start. The trailer park one looked good but definitely not as good as the Roscoe. I took a few bites of the Trailer Park one and liked it. I took a few bits of the Roscoe and LOVED it. It was definitely sweet and not the same idea as the Trailer Park taco but worth every bite. Fried chicken strip, bacon, waffle and tortilla with a side of syrup. Drizzling the syrup on top was the icing on the cake.  I was impressed by this spot and if I had more days in town, I would have stopped by for another Roscoe.

As an out-of-towner, trying to pick taco spots in Austin is overwhelming! Â But we always make a point to stop at Torchey's at least twice! The queso alone is worth the trip - it is incredibly tasty, gooey, cheesy and they spice it up with some guac. It's a no brainer! The tacos are great too! Again, there are a lot of really amazing taco joints in Austin, and Torcheys is more of a chain/fast casual situation, but they have a crazy variety from breakfast tacos to veggie tacos that you can't go wrong! I went with the Mr Orange - which is a salmon taco and the #3, chorizo egg and cheese taco. In hindsight those plus the queso was more than enough food. I loved the Mr Orange! A unique flavor that was a variation off your classic fish taco, definitely one to try!  So when in Austin, get Torcheys :)
Hit the spot!  Loved the fried avocado but also go the chicken and Democrat.  Super fast and friendly service.
Hi Barbara - Thank you for taking the time to shoutout for our Damn Good team members! We are very proud of our team, and they will truly appreciate your amazing comments!

Torchy's has become a tradition whenever I come to Austin. We always walk to Torchy's for some breakfast burritos on our first day. These are not the most authentic tacos, but they're tasty and very filling. I've tried several of their tacos including the green Chile pork missionary style, the matador, Migas, and the wrangler. We usually order some chips and guacamole too. The tacos are massive and my eyes are definitely always bigger than my stomach. We end up ordering 2 tacos per person, but with chips and guacamole I probably only needed 1 taco. I just always want to try different tacos so I'll save the leftovers and eat them later. I think Torchy's is a spot everyone needs to try at least once, but just know there are tons of other better and more authentic options in Austin for regular taco dining.

Hi Alisa - We are so happy to hear that your visit with us was a damn good one - it was a pleasure to have you join us. We look forward to seeing you again at Torchy's and don't forget to check us out on Facebook too!

So good we ate there twice in ONE DAY! Got the Salmon for breakfast and the shrimp for lunch. The Salmon was the best. My hubs got the breakfast tacos for breakfast and the green chili pork and the trashy trailer for lunch. He honestly didn't care as long as he had diablo sauce. We even bought a bottle.
Hi Danica - we're so pleased you enjoyed your visit with us! Thank you for stopping by for some Damn Good tacos!
Took over 20 min for my food to come. After asking two staff, it finally arrived. Tacos aren't worth the money, and I'm annoyed I pre tipped. No real apology, meh. Avoid this location.
Hi Amber - Would you like to tell us more about your recent experience, so we can follow up with you directly? Please let us know how best to reach you by going to  torchysfeedback.com
Start your review of  Velvet Taco .

Highlights Elote, Paneer tikka taco  It was spring break and there was a big line for this place. We wanted to try the tacos here after seeing their reviews. We tried all vegetarian tacos and Paneer tikka taco is the best of all. If you like lettuce wraps then falafel taco is your pick but I am not a fan of it coz its dry. Elote is also a must try!!
Atmanand, thank you for your awesome 5 star review. We appreciate you taking the time to go into detail about what makes our food special and why you like it! See you next time!

The place is good but two things annoying about it; for a taco place, their menu can be easier to read just right to the point instead it's confusing and I end up going with kids meal to get exactly what I want. Second; they don't do breakfast tacos (egg bacon etc) which is super strange for a taco place. I def wish tourchy tacos was near..

A great place with tons of unique tacos. I ordered the chicken & waffles and Korean fried rice. I didn't particularly enjoy the chicken & waffles one but I think it was because I wasn't a fan of the sweet from the maple syrup paired with the savoriness of the rest of the taco. I would've also preferred a regular flour tortilla as opposed to the waffle tortilla. Now the Korean fried rice was on another level. The pork was so tender and so flavorful, I was really sad when I took my last bite and the taco was gone. Velvet is on the pricer side for tacos, but it is in a really trendy area of the Domain + they have interesting and unique spins on tacos.

Kaitlin, Thank you so much for the 4 star review. We would love to know what could get us that extra star from you? Very sorry the Chicken and Waffle wasn't your thing, but so glad you loved the Korean Fried Rice taco as it is very delicious! Can't wait to have you back for some other great tacos!

My favorite taco place in TEXAS. I have tried several taco places and none have come close to velvet tacos. If you are looking for traditional tacos - look else where. Here you will find amazing fusion tacos that will fill your mouth with flavors. We ordered the chicken tikka taco, shrimp and grits taco, nashville hot chicken taco (yes they allow you to mix and match protein and their sauce), falafel taco, beer battered cauliflower taco, nashville hot tofu taco. Honestly we loved them all but the chicken taco was next level delicious. We stopped byt several times during our trip to Austin since we craved their Chicken tikka taco. It is the best and so authentic the chicken tikka masala with the basmati rice is so flavorful. We also ordered their red velvet cake which is heavenly and tastes so fresh. What we loved about Velvet tacos - they have a huge variety of tacos for our vegetarian friends as well. They do have hot sauces around but honestly the sauce on the taco itself is so delicious, you dont need anything to elevate the flavors. This place is huge with ample indoor and outdoor seating. This place can get pretty crowded at any hour but the line moves fast. Highly recommend trying out Velvet taco while visiting Texas. I so wish they open up a place in Seattle.

Jane, we love this post! Thank you so much for the 5 star review. Can't wait for you to come back and have our delicious food again, or find a restaurant in the next city you're in. We are growing fast, so keep an eye out for us in more and more regions!

Normally has delish food, lots of close great parking, and great service. Normal a great choice for taco Tuesday solo or with a group. Great if you want to dine inside or sit outside. Dog friendly (especially outside).  Got here at 7:40 pm on 8/7/21. Parking was plentiful in the red garage and surrounding areas. My order was taken at 7:44pm.  I ordered red curry coconut queso, middle piece red velvet cake, #15 grilled salmon taco medium rare, and a frozen margarita with salt.  The queso was half the amount I have been served previously at this location and at the downtown location. When I inquired about it, josh rudely let me know that this is the appropriate measurement of queso. Today's queso was lumpy and chunky with a burntish taste. The chips were also super greasy. Normally the queso has been a creamy texture/consistency. I did not receive the middle piece red velvet cake. Instead I got Â an end piece, placed upside down in the to go box. The icing ended up stuck on one side of the box since it was upside down.    The salmon taco was very well done, cold, hard and tasted reheated.  The margarita did not have salt as requested.  When I asked for to go containers, an employee was dismissive and walked away. I did not get her name but she had pink highlights in her hair. Fortunately josh got me what I needed.  When I asked another employee about the specific names of who had served us, josh came out shortly after and wished us a great night.  The pros: Ample parking, prompt service, today the tables were wiped clean both inside and outside at this location. I have them a 3/5 because this is the second time in a row that I have received rude customer service at this location. It is also the second time I have gotten cold, hard, salmon.   I have also received great customer service several times at this location in the past. So, customer service is hit or miss at this location.  The downtown location has consistent great customer service, fresh salmon, fresh soft cake, and consistent on portions and full servings. The only downside with the downtown location is parking.
Caroline, thank you for the review and for the feedback. We will take this all to help better our service. Also want to thank you for being a regular at both locations.

Who doesn't love tacos? Velvet is on the pricier side for tacos but I'd say they are also pretty big. Their ingredients are very good and I like to stick to the basics.  I've tried some of their more fancy unique tacos in the past and didn't find them that good so am a big fan of sticking to what you know with them. Also takes them a little longer to cook than your average taco place. I'd say a 15 min wait from when you order so just a heads up.

Laure, thank you for the review and the feedback. We are hard at work at getting fully staffed and training our team so we can get those taco times down. Hope we get the chance to serve you up some of the basics soon! Cheers!

I was expecting more from this place I guess. The first time I attempted to go, it was overrun with soccer fans and it was so loud and chaotic my friend and I decided to go elsewhere.  The next time we tried it I ordered two vegetarian tacos. One was so greasy and messy to eat, my friend genuinely seemed worried for me. Ha! We both decided the tacos were OK, nothing special. I'd go back if I was at the Domain, hungry and most other places were closed.

Anjoli, I'm so glad you stopped to try out Velvet Taco! I do wish you left here having a different opinion. Please come back and give us another shot, and we would really like to assist you in your choices to help you decide what is best for you. Please reach out to us at  domain@velvettaco.com  if you are coming back to visit so we can show you a great experience.

So yummy!!! The tacos are super creative but you can pretty much add or remove anything you like. The Cuban is my go to - pro tip if you get to go - wrap it in some foil and pop in the oven for 10 mins or so Â  I also really liked the WTF weekly tacos - winner winner chicken dinner and chicken Caesar salad where my favorite. Oh and if you like adult beverages the margaritas are the best value and quality in the area.

We are so blessed to have the most amazing Tacos here in the Austin area. Just when I think I found THE BEST taco place, there's another one to one up and take it to another level. My new all time fav now is Velvet Taco. Get your napkins ready. Time to chow down on these delicious messy tacos! What I ordered: Elote 'gluten free' and 'vegan' corn. This side is a bit on the heavy side with lots of queso but that's what makes it sauncy and flavorful. Ingredients are - corn with queso listo, Valentina, crema, queso fresco, lime. Falafel Taco: It's spicy, tangy, crispy and super tasty! If you like falafel, you'll especially love this - tahini crema, arugula, tomato, pickled fresnos, avocado, pickled red onion, pea tendrils, lettuce wrap. Healthy AND delicious.  Chicken & waffles:  If you had only one choice, it HAS to be this. It's really Â really good! It's got a hint of sweetness, the waffle is amazing and unique! The chicken is lightly battered and not too deep fried. A very little hint of it tanginess. Delicious til the very last bite! I'd say this is their signature dish for sure. - crisp tenders, peppered bacon, peppercorn gravy, green apple slaw, maple syrup, red chile aioli, chives, waffle tortilla Grilled Salmon: The salmon is cooked to perfection and the ingredients all work well together to bring it a creamy and balanced flavor. Definitely recommend as well! - napa slaw, citrus lime crema, pickled fresnos, roasted corn pico, avocado crema, micro cilantro, corn tortilla Being a regular here at The Domain, I frequently see Velvet Taco and always intrigued but haven't tried because the long line is always a turn off. I decided to go here in early afternoon on a weekday and there was virtually no line at all.

Johnny, what an amazing review of our little taco shack! Thank you for all the detail and the time you put into writing a great 5 star review. I wish us restaurants could give our guest return stars, because you sir deserve a 5 star from us!!! Thank you for stopping by!

Super yummy tacos! Located in a hip area surrounded by unique restaurants and shops. We got here on a Sunday am around 11ish and made it just in time before the crowds. They have a nice covered patio dining area with plenty of large fans to help keep you cool.  Ordered a few tacos- brisket, picnic chicken, green chili pork .... Sooo deelish! They're a decent size and each bite is flavorful. Easy to eat a couple of them. I'll have to come back here next time I'm in the area!
Sabrina, Awesome review and thank you for the 5 stars!!
Start your review of  Velvet Taco .

Plenty of tacos to choose from. I like that they allow substitutions. I have tried all the vegetarian tacos and they were good. There is lettuce in place of tortilla in Falafel taco, which was something new to me and I was a little disappointed. But the falafel made it up for it. The service is fast and there are plenty of tables. The tacos are on a little pricey side for the quantity. But it is in the domain area so it is understandable. There is hardly any parking next to the restaurant but there are a lot of free parking lots in the domain area which are at walkable distance.  Sauce is very important for me in any taco. And I do not like any of their taco sauce. The sauce just feels like a thicker variation of Tabasco. They can definitely improve on that.

Tanmay, thank you the time to give us your feedback! We offer the lettuce cup for any taco on our menu as a sub if desired for your next visit. I'm sorry to hear do you didn't like some the hot sauce selections. Try our signature heat sauce I think you'll like that one or any of our house made sauces that go on many different variations of our tacos. Hope to wow you here at your next visit and please ask a Team Member or manager to assist you with picking out some complimentary sauces for your taco selections. Cheers!

I didn't do any research before coming here so I didn't know what to expect. The area is bustling and charming IMO, stopped in on a Saturday afternoon for a late lunch.  When you walk in, you order in a line. There is a pretty wide variety on the menu and prices are about 4-5$ per taco, mid range. I saw the #8 Korean taco was new and it sounded delicious per the description on the sign. I liked that the menu was easy to read and each taco had ingredients listed. This Made for an easy ordering experience which was quick and simple. Korean isn't usually a taco I'd order but I went for it. Also got a large hazy ipa and Mexican coke. Order came to $20.  We found a seat outside on the covered patio, and it only Took about 5 mins to get our food. The staff was masked and the place was clean inside, but the only open tables outside were dirty leaving us to clean them ourselves. Not a huge deal, but be prepared for a very casual environment. Â  Y'all. The Korean taco was BOMB. I had to remove the jalapeÃ±os, Â but this was a beautifully crafted taco. Â The flavor was vibrant and new, juicy and fresh. Â I ended up making a total mess of it but it was so delicious. The only thing wrong with this taco was that I didn't get two lol  we ended up splitting the red velvet cake which was also FIRE. I'd recommend splitting because it's kinda heavy. The icing was light and creamy while the cake was rich and moist. A total win for red velvet lovers.  I plan to take some friends back to this spot. There are so many tacos I need to try! A great experience at velvet taco. 5/5 recommend.

Allison, not only do we want to thank you for the 5 star review but also for your in depth review of your experience, which gives us the opportunity to improve. We appreciate you!! Come back and see us again soon!

Easily my new favorite taco place in town!  We tried their Â Mexi-Cali shrimp taco Â which was simply scrumptious bursting with flavor. The slow roasted angus brisket tacos were enjoyed by the three of us a close favorite. Don't miss the grilled salmon as it is also a spicy taco you won't want to miss. We happened to stop by on an Austin FC game day. There were lots of people grabbing a bite on their way to the game - give yourself a little extra time as it took about 30 minutes to get our food. Fortunately, we passed the time enjoying a Big Ass Margarita!

Rosa, thank you so much for the five star review! We are so glad you took the time to stop by and enjoy our tacos, and to write us a nice review. We hope to have you back very soon! Viva Velvet Taco!!!

Really cool little place right in the middle of Rock Rose. I've tried several of their tacos, but the brisket one is my go-to. Got to love the cheese encrusted tortilla and that spicy sauce! The crispy tots with egg is really good and an interesting take on loaded tots. And of course, the red velvet cake is a must. Staff is very friendly and best part is they are open really late. Only reason not 5 stars is that it's so small that it fills up really fast and the line goes out the door. If they had more space it would be perfect

If I had to use one word to describe Velvet Taco, it'd be "unique." Velvet is located in the heart of the Domain and offers unusual tacos... buffalo chicken, chicken and waffle, and bacon burger to name a few. But that adds to the excitement! I ordered two tacos, buffalo chicken and picnic chicken (pictured), which was plenty filling for a lunch. Each taco cost around $4 and were served in under 5 minutes. The tacos were definitely top tier, and I'd return to try their other options.  As for seating, there were a few tables inside along with bar-like seating where you could watch the food being made. The patio seemed nice but it's not well covered- we came on a rainy day and sitting outside was definitely off limits. On the downside, we waited quite a while to order despite there being a short line. Velvet Taco also doesn't offer many alcoholic beverages, just their house margarita (frozen or on the rocks) and a few canned beers in a cooler by the register. This would be a great spot to come AFTER drinking.  Overall, I'd return to Velvet! Definitely a twist on "tacos" but great nonetheless.

Best tacos i've ever had!! I wish they had something like this in LA. Â  Came on an anniversary trip with my boyfriend and we stopped by at the Domain and tried these tacos. Best decision we've ever made.  We ordered 5 tacos (spicy tikka chicken, buffalo chicken, chicken and waffle, korean fried rice, fish and chips), elote corn, and a frozen kiss ass margarita.  The food was delicious! Each taco had its own unique flavor and tasted amazing. The chicken and waffle had to be my favorite. so definitely recommend trying that one when you go! The frozen margarita was so refreshing, especially on a humid day. They weren't stingy with the alcohol either, so definitely worth it for the price! Will definitely be back here next time I visit Austin :)

Susan, thank you so much for taking the time write such an extensive review on our restaurant and the 5 star rating! Â We're so glad you enjoyed your visit to Austin and coming by and sharing the experience of our tacos with us, look forward to having you back next time you come to town or come across another Velvet Taco! Have a great day!

The food is great but to have 11 staff members working and only one register open with a line of people out the door does not seem efficient. Obviously a management oversight that needs to be addressed. Update: The other reviews about the queso are true. They will only fill the queso half way so it's like you aren't even getting what you paid for.

Benjamin, I'm sorry you didn't enjoy the experience, please reach out to me on our personal email at  domain@velvettaco.com  if you would like and I can discuss any issues with you. Thank you for taking the time to review us and bringing your experience to our attention.

WOW! While staying in the Domain, we stopped by to indulge in the best tacos in Austin!! Everybody was so friendly and all were following the current Covid safety guidelines! The food was absolute amazing, very filling... oh that that's not your average TopoChico you see in my pic, it's "RANCH WATER"!! Soooo good, a must try!

I had heard so much about velvet taco and I was super excited to try it out. Seems like a lot of other people made that same decision as me because it was very active within the restaurant. Enough so that it was a little tricky to get a seat. However, we were able to quickly order from their menu which had more than enough choices, I wanted to try everything! The tacos took a bit to come out, but it was understandable considering how busy they were, and you can see into the kitchen and watch the cooks, so we weren't sitting there bored. The tacos came out in little holders that were super convenient to eat from, and the tacos themselves were pretty decent. I wish portion sizes were a bit bigger but it was still worth. I highly recommend getting the elote style corn, even if you're just there for tacos!

Tacos are my everything (besides donuts). Â And I love love love the veggie options here! They don't just throw some veggies in a tortilla. Â They have hot crispy tofu as a base in one... so good! And another one, my favorite, has beer battered cauliflower. Â They are all so good. Â The service is always really great too.

Craig Hockenberry: Ninfa's on Navigation  I took my boys to eat here based on a recommendation from a local. Â It was in the top 5 best Mexican food I have eaten anywhere in the United States. Â the people made us feel like family, clean, great food, great drinks, and amazing atmosphere. Â  Craig Hockenberry Cincinnati
Thank you for sharing, Craig!

I finally got to try the famous Ninfas! I have tried coming here multiple times in the past but this place STAYS packed. This time I was smart enough to make a reservation!  My friends and I got a few pitchers of the Ninfarita to start off. Not the best margarita around, but they did the trick. For my entree, my boyfriend and I shared the medium beef fajitas and added quail and a chile con queso. This was more than enough for both of us and we had left overs. The beef was tender and juicy, cooked to perfection. The quail was falling off the bone, also cooked perfectly! I was very impressed. For dessert I ordered the tres leches and I absolutely loved it!  The only thing that was surprising to me about this place was the price. Be prepared to spend 100+ for two people. Although this place was completely packed on a Saturday night, service did not miss a beat. Our server was very attentive, we never saw empty glasses, and never had to ask for dishes to be removed from the table. I will be back!
Thank you for coming to see us, Alexandra!

This restaurant is a sad excuse for a restaurant!!! Very small, very tight and just needs to be remodeled!!! Â Very hectic and if you have to go to the rest room, you have to be a very small person to fit through the hallway, very narrow and unforgiven!!!   We ordered mixed drinks with rum and coke, the waiter charged us for the rum and coke as two separate orders!!! It is called mixed drink for a reason!!!  I felt like a sardine in a can!!! Mother Nina's Would be disappointed at the way customers   Tolerate this so called Mexican Restaurant  Top class!!! I will never return!!! What a disappointment!!!

Hey Raul, thank you for coming to see us! This is where it all started, where Mama Ninfa first stuffed chargrilled sliced beef into a handmade flour tortilla and launched the national fajita craze. We've done our best to maintain the character, and Mama Ninfa's touch that makes this place so special. We're sorry to hear you had such a disappointing visit, but we do appreciate your feedback and hope to have another shot to impress you!

I could not be happier with my experience. I was celebrating my birthday and had over 15 people. It was easy to make a reservation and they offered a fajita (chicken and beer) package that made it super easy. The wait staff was super accommodating and very nice! They brought us chips when we ran out and we didn't have to ask for them, which was nice. Highly recommend if you have a large party!!!!  (Plus, complimentary valet)
Thank you for coming to celebrate your special day with us, Francis!

Omg have you ever had real Mexican food if you haven't gone to ninfas ?!  If you're reading this right now please start heading over, you have to try this place!  I found out if you check in you get a free queso which is bomb!  I shared the beef fajitas with my friend and it was the perfect size. Super filling and cooked to perfection.  We also ordered margaritas and they were perfectly cold and strong.  This place get packed but we were seated immediately which is amazing.  This place is a much try + I hear it has a great history. I believe they were the place that invented fajitas WOW!
Thank you for sharing, Nicholas!

I came to Houston last month (June 2021) for a quick overnight trip. My hotel luckily was close to this iconic Houston landmark. It was on my "must" list.  With Yelp check-in, I got a free queso with chips. The queso was delicious, and the chips they bring out are thicker than the ones that come with the salsa. They scoop that queso with ease.  I ordered the famous Fajita Burger. First, understand that this restaurant claims to have invented fajitas as we know them today. A bold claim, but whether they invented them or not, they have them down pat. So when I hear from people and see on TV that the Fajita Burger is the ultimate here, I had to see for myself.  When you look at the pic I posted, it is hard to see any meat under that cheese. Trust me, it's there. My first bite rewarded me with that sort of satisfaction and surprise that catches your first chew for a second. When you stop and think about how damn good it is. This burger is one of the best I have ever had, and, my Yelpies, I have had some of the best.  The burger comes out with huge steak fries, a spicy ketchup (freaking delicious), and escabeche (a mix of pickled carrots and jalapeÃ±os). The food is a bit pricy, but well worth it. Expect a wait accordingly. I can't wait to come back here again for the food and excellent service.
Thank you so much for sharing, Ricardo!

Friendly staff, and the avocado tomatillo salsa was amazing!!! I got the salmon tacos which were pretty good especially on the corn tortillas that are a bit more like masa! The mole salmon was ahmazing! Ninfas however is known to introduce fajitas to Texas but found fajitas just okay! Would definitely come back but note that this place is pricier than your average joint!
Thank you for the review, Arshiya!

Everything the 5-star reviews say! Â I'm not Mexican and I'm from California. Â I wanted to taste authentic Mex-Tex and Ninfa did not disappoint. Â My waiter was excellent. Â I love seeing him wearing a guayabera and the girls in grades bordados. Â It's quite an experience in taste and ambiance. Â  I ordered the cucumber margarita (YUM!), and the Tejano Plate. Â Don't forget to order their pico de Gallo to complete the taste tour.
Thank you, Johanna! We appreciate you coming to see us and taking the time to share!

This place is as good as my mom said it was. She moved here in 80s ans said it was great. Glad to say she was right. I loved the fajitas margaritas were strong and delicious Tex Mex was all I wanted and more Fresh guac made up to my standard  I had the most wonderful time
Thank you for coming to see us, Bella! We're so glad you enjoyed it!

If you're looking for some good TexMex, this is the place to visit. We knew we had to get some while in the area, and several people recommended the Original Ninfa's. The area around the restaurant is pretty cool, but busy even on a week night. The complimentary valet made ease of the parking though! We started with some queso to go with the included chips and salsa. This queso seemed as it may have began life in a can, but was doctored up pretty good if that was the case. It filled our cheese craving regardless! The entrees were quick and hot on arrival. She ordered the Del Mar enchiladas, which were very cheesy and had a good amount of the crab and shrimp inside. The chipotle sauce had a good flavor, and wasn't too spicy (even for her haha). I went with our waiters recommendation of the Tejas Combo with beef. The beef fajitas was perfectly tender, seasoned well and a real highlight of the dish. The beef taco and cheese enchilada were also very tasty!  Overall, the food was good quality, the drinks are on point and the service was top notch. Ninfa's will be a favorite for each time we visit Houston!
We're so glad you enjoyed it, Nathanial! Thank you for sharing!
1 free small queso

OMG! If your in Houston and love Mexican food you must go here!  Parking was crazy, we had to wait a little while to find parking, Â but it's so worth it. You can also valet. Staff is so friendly, we were seated right away and got a basket of chips and salsa. All good! I got the classic frozen margaritas, delicious!! I ordered the pork tamales. Oh my gosh! It was the best tamales I have ever had! The outside just melted in your mouth. Pork is tender and flavorful. Black beans and rice came on the side both are good. Awesome food!!
Thank you for sharing, Theresa!

So fire! When I read that The Original Ninfa's on Navigation created fajitas by "Mama" Ninfa Laurenzo in 1973, I knew this would be our Tex-Mex experience in Houston. Â Ninfa started selling cut grilled skirt steak in a tortilla and called them fajitas, she is known in Houston as the inventor of Tex-Mex cuisine. Â They are the gold standard.  We ordered three plates of chicken fajitas with a side of rice and charro beans. Their tortillas are handmade, just like their tamales and the masa flavors are fresh! Their grilled chicken is seasoned well, tender and juicy with those amazing grill marks and flavor. The rice and charro frijoles were top notch stewed slow beans.  The service was excellent and everything was overall great! Super causal with amazing food!
Thank you for the great review, Natalie!

Found myself in Houston for a volleyball tournament and this place shows up on YELP. Â Naturally I'm always down for any eating spot with a story and good reviews. We pull up and there is a wait. Â We give them our number and take a seat outside. Â I've said this before and I'll say it again. Â While some my frown on waiting for good food, I welcome the wait, especially if the food is worth it. Â If people are THAT desperate to get in here and eat, it must be good. We get the call and head in, we are seated quickly and our server brings us water. Â Upon our initial drink order, my son decides he wants to try an original Mexican Coca Cola. Â I order a beer and my wife orders a Sprite. We're asked do we want appetizers, so I ask the server what's a good appetizer? Â The server suggests oysters. Â I'm not an oyster fan, but what the heck, I order 2 of them since you gotta try new things. WOW WOW WOW!! The oysters were nothing short of INCREDIBLE. Â I mean they were so good my son ate more than my wife and I. Â It was incredible and every bite and chew was fantastic. When it came time to order our meals, I ordered the mole enchiladas, my wife ordered the Fajitas and split them with my son. Every part of the meal was delicious, even the chips and salsa were unique and wonderful. I don't head out to Houston often, but when I go again, this place is first on my list.
Thank you for the great review, Desmond!

Service was decent Â . However our food was awful . Caldo was bland . Looked like just plain broth and bland chicken . Beef fajitas were over cooked and tasted so charred . Drinks ... HOT . The whole restaurant was SO HOT. I shouldn't be sweating at dinner . When the server came by and saw my friend hadn't eaten her soup he asked if she liked it and she replied no. Didn't offer her another entree or to remove it from our ticket . This place has gone downhill ...

. Our server took forever to bring drinks . Took forever to take our order and of course was nowhere to be found when we needed our ticket . The food is just not the same Anymore . To go along with Â the bad service it was so ridiculously hot In the restaurant ! Like the AC HAD BROKEN! It's too hot in houston for there to be no AC in an establishment .

Hate to leave a very average review but i have to be honest - I'm a little confused but the glowing reviews I see here.  We got the steak and chicken fajitas. The chicken was very tender and the beef had good flavor as well but unfortunately did not live up to the hype that we've heard. 1 large and 1 medium size is really plenty for 5-6 people.  We also tried the queso and I would definitely not order this again. It was like the cheese you see at movie theaters. The salsas were also pretty bland and the tortillas tasted far from fresh...Again, hate to leave a very average review but i have to be honest - I'm used to more flavorful Mexican food! Especially in Texas.
Thank you so much for your review, Anitha. We appreciate your feedback and hope to have another shot to impress you!

Pretty classic staple in Houston. We came here on Cinco De Mayo. Plenty of parking available.  Orderd fajita platter and it was solid. The other combo dishes looked great as well. Desserts were also very good, especially the flan and sopapilla. It's the 2nd time here and the food here is great texmex both times.
Thank you for sharing, Jason! Come see us again soon!

Honestly.... Wayyy better than I expected. We ordered the the El Henry, Fajita burger, and flameados... all were very very delicious... fresh made tortillas, sauces, and chips. This is the spot for great Mexican food. You can tell the food is freshly made. One of my new favorite spots... Hands down! Just go, don't second guess it.
Thank you so much for sharing, Brittanii!

I love the look and feel of this location. The neighborhood is fun to walk around as you wait (~45 min on a Friday night). The dishes themselves were fine. The rice on the side was pretty different from other Tex Mex places I've tried (contained potatoes and spiced carrots) and the enchiladas filling was made fresh.  We ordered: Carnitas Enchiladas - Fine Tejas Plate - Would order something else next time Tres Leches - Best Tres Leches I have ever had!
Thank you for taking the time to share your review, Melanie!

While in Houston we had to stop by the original Ninfa's. The server took a while to come but afterwards was very attentive. We had the mixed fajitas. Lots of meat but very little bell peppers. The flavor was great. We added on the Tampico Shrimp which was also very tasty! The margaritas were cold and delicious and during happy hour $5 to boot! We tried the chocolate cake for dessert we weren't really fans as it had a very coffe-ish taste, but that was just preference. The plating and presentation was superb. The green salsa is my favorite thing here and I ate enough to tide me over til I can get back to Houston. We will definitely stop in again!
Thank you for coming to see us, Megan!

My favorite tex mex place in town! Over the years we've tried a decent amount of items, but the combination fajitas, Chile con queso, quail, and TORTILLAS of course, are my favorites! The service is always great! The margaritas are good too, but be sure to differentiate if you want frozen or on the rocks cause they default to frozen. I would highly recommend making a reservation since they fill up fast and there's usually a wait on the weekends. I also prefer sitting in the outdoor patio since covid, but it looks like they've expanded their outdoor space so kudos to Ninfa's!
Thank you for sharing your review, Liz!
1 free small queso

Hugo's seem like a very classy place - simple and elegant. I stopped by for brunch with my friend and we ordered chilaquiles, chicken enchilada, and Chile relleno pork, and a small plate of octopus.  I was a bit skeptic of the chips in chilaquiles being soggy but when it arrived, the chips were still crisp and tasty. The green salsa was very delicious and the chicken was so tender that it was falling apart if you stick a fork or chip in it. It's served with 2 sunny side eggs and feta which just enhances the whole taste to another level.  We got the chicken enchiladas with the mole sauce and it was tasty as well. I really liked the tangy and sweet-ish taste of the mole sauce.  My friend who got the octopus was also happy since it's served with 4 small tortillas and salsa, so you can make four small octopus tacos from it. He really liked it and it's one of the dish Hugo's is famous for. Finally he really liked the pork Chile relleno as well, it was huge. Most of the entrees come with a small serving of rice and beans.  My recommendation is to make a reservation before visiting.

Hugo's certainly has great upscale Mexican food but I would prefer it's relative restaurants.  The food: The food tastes great. There's a decent variety of options to try and most things are good. I do think that their portioning is kind of all over the place. I've had a meal here and left feeling stuffed and another one where I was left hungry. I really like the braised ribs and then tamales (which they do not always have).  The space: Its pretty nice, a bit dimly lit. I enjoyed sitting in the curtained area because the main room just kind of gets too busy. Overall as a more expensive restaurant I kind of want to be wowed more.

I usually don't write reviews of this nature because I check the restaurants pet policy .  We were asked to walk out of the restaurant today (11/11/2021) because we had two little dogs both in a carrier. Â   We checked the pet policy on their website in which they are encouraging to bring Fido along. Â When we entered the restaurant we asked the the receptionist if dogs were allowed and she said it was ok.  After we ordered our food the waiter came back and said we had to leave because dogs were not allowed and that he did not know why.  Please change your website and train your staff to avoid future embarrassment to people. Â   Not coming back to this restaurant.

Definitely had to give Hugo's a try for Houston Restaurant Week! I've always heard so many delightful things about this restaurant.  For the first course, I went with the Enmolada! It came with a savory corn tortilla with the most delicious crema fresco. Second course was the Garnachas De Tinga De Pollo. Delicious masa cakes topped with a delightful chicken stew. For the third course, I tried the Costilla De Res. Short rib cooked to perfection! The meat was practically falling off the bone. The ending desert was the highlight of the entire meal. The Tres Leches was one of the best cakes I've ever had. The combination of the three milks made it perfectly moist.  An unforgettable experience! Service and food were top notch! The only downside is parking can be difficult at times. You won't regret this choice!
We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for supporting HRW!

A bunch of us came here for lunch and we thoroughly enjoyed the restaurant. The food was presented beautifully, it was clearly very fresh and thoughtfully prepared. They also offer a dedicated vegetarian menu which was handy. The service was a little slow but the staff were very friendly, at the end, the host waited around for us and chatted for a while, giving us some context on the restaurant which was a nice touch.
We are pleased to hear that our team made your experience pleasant and you approved of our services!

Would highly recommend Hugo's for brunch. The service was great and the ambience was wonderful. I don't love their parking situation though. If you're going to have valet, they should take non cash options such as Venmo or Cashapp too.

Im starting to really find love for Mexican food and this spot helped in a big way. Went for brunch and had the chicken chilaquiles which wasn't over sauced and had a tasty salsa verde. The grilled octopus was amazing. Perfectly grilled and seasoned with a lil heat. I could have easily ate another order of that. Octopus was tender and nicely charred. Oddly enough the star was the table made hot chocolate. Ive never had hot chocolate until i had this. Please do not leave without trying the hot chocolate. Buen provecho!
We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for joining us Chris!

The food and service are top notch. This is our favorite (not Tex-Mex) Mexican restaurant in town. Everything we've tried is consistently great. Highly recommend Hugo's, and all the other restaurants in their family.
Delightful dinner out, a delicious healthy meal. Highlights from the Pescatarian 2021 Houston Restaurants Week menu at Hugos.  #hrw2021  #foodbliss
That is really great to hear. Thank you for supporting HRW!

Sometimes, in the morning you might feel like eating Mexican food and when I do, I love coming to Hugo's for a delicious meal. It's the perfect spot for brunch and their omlettes are spectacular. For lunch, I enjoy munching on their lobster tacos because their lobsters are seasoned with cajun and taco seasoning. If you have a chance to spend a little more, try their clams because they're really fresh. If you get there early before dinner rush, you can catch their happy hour, which serves amazing dishes like ceviche and their various tacos including fish, pulled pork, and steak! All three are so good I can't choose a favorite. The fish was fresh, the pulled pork was fatty, and the steak was cooked medium rare and perfect for taco night.

TL; DR: Absolutely remarkable ceviche.  Who hasn't been to Hugo's? Restauranteur turned a full-on group, Hugo (I want to say his last name is Ortega) has been elevating the Houston food scene for multiple decades.  But I had been here only a couple of times for brunch and even that was almost a decade ago.  So we decided to give this oldie but a goodie a try for my birthday.  We tend to eat early and had a 5pm reservation through the link on the website. We were happy to find that the Happy Hour menu is extensive. Weekdays until 6pm.  Gil was our server and he's such a gentleman. Attentive without being overbearing. We appreciated his measured politeness and kindness.  I had chosen Hugo's wanting to try the whole fish but my mom made an awesome grilled barramundi earlier in the day so I decided to switch things up.  The cocktails apparently allow no substitutions so I held off, but we got: Happy Hour menu: - Ceviche tradicional - Aguachile de camarones  - Fish, pulled pork, and steak tacos  Regular menu: - Pulpo al carbon (grilled octopus) - Chile relleno (stuffed pepper) I almost always get the octopus when I see it on a menu, and unlike the one at Oporto (I have yet to see an octopus in Houston beat Oporto's - if you have a challenger, please let me know), this one was a letdown. It came cut, and the pieces (and the whole plate) were itty bitty - the plate itself was smaller than my palm. The flavors were ok. 2/5 The tacos were a bit pricy at $4.50-5 per taco even during Happy Hour, but they were stuffed and filling. I had the fish taco and a bite of the steak taco - the fish was lightly fried and on a pillow of cabbage, and the steak meats were chopped too small for me to actually enjoy its texture but were delightfully chargrilled. 5/5 for the fish and 4.5/5 for the steak.  The tacos and the crudo got us full so we didn't try the stuffed pepper and took it to go, but from the bite of refried beans I have had, my guess is that there must've so much pork fat in those beans - it tastes like pork in lard (not necessarily a bad thing). The sauce atop the pepper was a nut purÃ©e - judging by the color, pistachio.  So onto the crudo.  The flavors of the shrimp aguachile were spot on as well but especially after the beautiful ebi aguachile at Mastrantos last week, the shrimp here was severely lacking in both quality and amount. 4 tiny shrimps for $8. I'm glad to have tried it but I wouldn't get it again. 3/5  But the highlight: el ceviche tradicional.  This dish alone would have me come back just so that I can have two or three of this dish. It's beautiful to look at and even better to taste. The brightness of the citrus and the salt is perfectly balanced, and the catch of the day happened to be snapper - the perfect fish for its chewy texture, cooked slightly by the lemon. It was perfect. 6/5.  All in all, this was an unexpected revisit and find for Hugo's to reign as one of the top happy hour spots in my book. It's a bit loud inside but coupled with great service and comfortable, distanced seating, it's no wonder why it is a rooted establishment in the Houston food scene. Enjoy!

This review is for HRW 2021. Not my first visit here. And in the past I have enjoyed. But this experience was very underwhelming. All of the dishes sounded good on the menu, but ended up being lackluster. We tried the Menu Entre Las Olas and Menu Vegetariano. They both had bold colors and phenomenal plating, but flavors were lacking. My first course was lukewarm. The tostada de atun was the size of a tortilla chip. And the cauliflower steak was literally grilled and placed on the plate. It wasn't even seasoned and there was barely any sauce. Cauliflower only costs 97 cent! Nothing was bad, it just wasn't great. We left still hungry. At these prices, I cannot recommend. Drinks were good as usual. And I am a big fan of Hugo Ortega and his restaurants. But today I was not impressed.

Thanks for telling me this. I am so sorry you didn't enjoy your meal Lorece. I will let the chefs know. I will check on the cauliflower steak in case we have gone astray in their preparation. Thanks for joining us!

Does Hugo's even need another review?  My favourite restaurants by this group are Hugo's and Caracol- delivering solid quality food every time. My only missed mark would be on the cocktails- maybe I chose wrong but I wasn't that impressed.  Went for HRW with some girlfriends and enjoyed the meaty menu. The short ribs are the way to go for sure! So tender and juicy, and the salsa verde they rest on brought the right amount of acid to cut the fatty richness. You won't be disappointed! Pro tip- street parking is hard to come by- but if you venture out closer to the park a couple of blocks down, you'll probably find something.
That is really great to hear. Thank you for joining us Lalanica!

I don't know how we went so long without knowing about this place... I ordered a spicy margarita and chips and salsa to start off with. Â The salsa is some of the best salsa I've ever had! We ordered a bunch of appetizers as our dinner and they were each amazing in their own way .  The service was a little slow as they were busy, but overall it was a great dining experience.

I had some heavy debates on whether I should come here. This was THE Mexican place that showed up on my radar while in Houston every time I looked. From what it appears, this is an OG establishment that's been around before modern mexican food even had much representation. This aint your typical tex-mex menu, but rather, a more sophisticated approach with some nods to tex-mex (like the taquitos). Although I wish I had more of a appetite to have some of their main dishes, Id say its worth eating here. Its not cutting edge compared to the rest of whats on Montrose, but its still worth being brought up in conversations for great places to eat in Houston, based on two dishes I had.  This place is beautiful, inside and out. There's an elegance to it that feels old and new at the same time (perhaps it's the art deco influence that helps with that). Not overly noisy inside, but definitely not quiet. I was able to sit at the bar, and luckily there were a few seats available. The bartender was attentive, but certainly not there to have a conversation. He was quite busy as lots of people came his way.  The taquitos are damn good. I don't normally get excited over chicken, but this was actually moist and had some grilled flavor to it. They deep fry the suckers fin house, and I can tell by the corn oil that its quite fragrant. They give you a generous amount of guacamole and queso fresco for this dish, so I definitely cant complain.  The ceviche with snapper was good, but not a must have. This was the least lime driven ceviche I've had (and that's a good thing). The olive is the blessing and curse of the dish. While the olive grounds the dish, it also caps the ceiling on the high tones more than I would like. The lime, jalapeÃ±o and cilantro can never really stand out to its heights with the olives present. Â This is still a great choice for anyone who doesn't want to feel bloated after their meal.
Thank you for taking the time to leave this review. I will go over this with the chefs. Thanks for coming Gill!
Wonderful dining experience. It was my first and won't be my last. Customer service was amazing. Server was knowledgeable of the menu and assist us with pairing our meal with perfect wine.
That is really great to hear. Thank you for joining us Divine!

Surprised this place doesn't have 5 stars. Absolutely LOVED the lamb tacos.  It's nice they have a valet outback. A calm patio. I took a recommendation coming here and even on the food.  Very great experience!!!
We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for joining us Corbin!

Unbelievable experience! My husband and I came to Hugo's after hearing so much about it for our anniversary. There was excellent customer service. Everyone was so friendly and they gave us free champagne and dessert for our anniversary. We ordered the ceviche tradicional which was very fresh and acidic. So delicious. The scallops were my favorite over a bed of soft, creamy cornbread, and my husband loved his rice with seafood. It was a beautiful ambiance and the staff was consistently masking. Tables were spaced out with good distancing.

We came here for my friends bday! Love the atmosphere and loved the food. However, I found out that halfway through my meal,!8 was given the wrong one. Obviously I never knew since it was my first time there. I mean it still tasted great! Just wasn't what I apparently ordered. The staff kinda just threw the plates on the table and didn't check to see who was given what. But the food was good! Lastly, I am not sure what what was going on, but there were more flys inside than there were outside. And they weren't small. Super big annoyance. Other than those two issues, I loved the food and I WILL BE BACK to give this place a second chance.

Tim, we are throwing everything we've got at the fly problem. They are particularly bad this summer. I am very sorry they pestered you. Their "season" will soon be over, thank goodness. Thank you for telling me about the service, I will review this with the managers and we will address this in our staff meeting.

Incredible birthday brunch at Hugo's! Clean, beautiful ambiance. My favorite dishes were the lechon and lamb barbacoa. The sauce for the lechon was absolutely delicious, great flavor and a good amount of heat. I actually really enjoyed their tortilla chips and salsa, very fresh and you can tell they're homemade. Don't skip out on their cocktails either! Will be back very soon. Great great meal.
We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for joining us Tuong-Vi!
Start your review of  Caracol .

*BRUNCH REVIEW* During a recent visit to Houston, my friend picked Caracol as our Sunday brunch spot and it was a selection that absolutely knocked it out the park.  The service as absolutely superb. Everyone we interacted with from the Valet to the hostess to our amazing server - was efficient, friendly, and completely accommodating.  More importantly, however, the food was AMAZING. It took me a while to decided on an entree because there were SO MANY options that sounded amazing. And every dish I was being served at tables around me looked absolutely delicious.  After much deliberation I settled on the Pollo Pibil dish and my friend the Arrachera con Huevo dish with a shared flan dessert between us. When I say the food was AMAZING - it's no exaggeration. My chicken dish was hands down one of the best meals I've had a Mexican restaurant. AND the serving is so huge that I had enough left over for dinner later that night.  Add Caracol to your Houston dining list. You won't regret it!
We really appreciate your kind words and support. Thank you for joining us Brandy!

A fancy spot just on the other side of a shopping plaza! Upon arrival, we were seated right away (made reservations for 6pm on a Saturday) and they had very tasteful decorations (a few weeks before Halloween). The service was awesome - we were offered the choice of still or sparkling water upon seating.  We took advantage of the HH and ordered some items from the HH menu and appetizers from the main menu.  Started off with a half dozen of Ostiones En Su Concha, raw oysters. They were okay! To be fair, we recently went on a trip to Cabo and had really delicious oysters so it was not a fair comparison. However, we were telling our server of a habanero sauce we had in Mexico and he brought a little dish out for us to try. I felt these were a bit on the small side but nothing we can do about it!  Tostadas de Campechana - I thought these little shrimp tostadas were excellent! It was a big pile of seafood on a little chip so upon first bite, everything fell over but the flavor was so fresh, I liked it a lot.  Ceviche de coco - a unique ceviche dish in a half coconut shell. The snapper was soft without being so soft I fell apart when it was picked up. The tangerine added a tang that cut through the coconut cream. Yum.  Tostadas de atun crudo - refreshing little bite but with a big ol piece of tuna atop. It was a fresh bite with flavors that complimented the fish well.  We asked our server what tapas style dishes we had to try on the menu and he recommended the ceviche de coco and the ceviche de Chile Canario so we got that one as well. The sauce in this dish was awesome, I used the chunks of snapper to sop of the sauce. The bites of tomato and cucumber added a pop of freshness to the creamy sauce.  We finished off the meal with a great slice of.. I believe it was a tres leches. I honestly can't remember the name but I know it was delicious.  The menu had a great variety. Service was on point. I would recommend for a special occasion or a nice dinner!
Thank you for taking the time to leave this review. We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for joining us Jessica!
Delicious! Didn't remember to take pics of everything. Really wishing they still had a Sunday brunch buffet so I could try everything!  A bit on the pricier side but enjoyed everything we ordered.
That is really great to hear. We are planning to go back to having buffet but are waiting for more guest to be fully vaccinated since people do crowd around the table. Thank you for joining us Kelly!

Caracol is a costal themed Spanish Seafood restaurant in the Houston Galleria area. The costal theme can be seen in the sleek modern decor and the blue umbrellas situated in the patio area. The place seems to be busy, so reservations are probably necessary if you do not want a long wait!  My boyfriend and I came for restaurant week and ordered a slew of food so on to the review! Our first appetizer was a masa pancake with what I believed to be mushrooms, mole, queso fresco, and some type of sauce. This was exceptionally good and had great Spanish flavors 4.5/5 Next, we ordered the raw oysters, which in my humble opinion was the best thing I had at dinner. The oysters were HUGE. They also had a Spanish twist and was served with blue corn tortillas and a pico de Gallo garnish. 5/5  Also had the grilled oysters that were topped with bread crumbs. Not sure if it was due to the Houston restaurant week menu but these oysters were really small but had good flavor. 3/5  I had the shrimp and cilantro rice. To be honest this was nothing exceptional and I was slightly disappointed with this dish. The shrimp were good but it seemed like an element was missing from the dish (maybe a sauce?) 3/5 My boyfriend had the pork wrapped with bacon and grilled vegetables. This was done so well and the pork fell off the bone with just a swipe of a fork. This was served with fresh corn tortillas that really pulled all the flavors together. There was also a sliver of sauce neatly tucked away under the delicious meat, oh how I wish I could have swam in that sauce, but sadly there was only a little so I had to ration it out with each bite. 4.5/5  Eh the desert was a little too many flavors and textures for me. I feel like there could have been some editing done when it came to the desert. I had a pistachio cake topped with grilled pineapple with condensed milk and drops of caramel; this was accompanied with dollop of mint ice cream. 2/5  My boyfriend had the chocolate mousse cake with a orange filling. Extremely chocolatey rich cake but the orange fell short for me and didn't pair well. Just think these flavors weren't for me. 2/5  Last but not least the drinks were good but not exceptional. I had the blackberry monito which was good but I would have preferred it to be more sweet. My boyfriend had a Michelada that he said needed more Michelada mix. 3/5 I would like to come back again and try more dishes that aren't on the Houston restaurant week menu.

I am looking into your observations with the chef and managers. I will also go over this with the bartenders and check the drinks incase we have gone astray in their preparations. Thank you for taking the time to leave this review.

I am very picky when it cones to Mexican restaurants and Caracol surprised me in a good way. Real Mexican modern cousin in a good location. The only improvement i can suggest would be to include in the menu few Mexican craft beers.  The Ceviche and the deserts were fenomenal
We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for joining us Roberto!

Delicious dinner - too many dishes to choose from! Wish I could have tried everything. Tasty margaritas. Recommend the scallops as they are perfect! Tamals were great, the Brussels sprouts were to die for. Highly recommend
That is really great to hear. Thank you for joining us Debbie!

While in Houston with family, my sweet sister in law made a dinner reservation for us at Caracol. Â Thank goodness she had the foresight to reserve a table, because this is a hotspot. Â  We valeted and made our way inside. There is indoor and outdoor seating, and as it was a little chilly, we chose to sit inside.  The hostesses were very welcoming and our table was ready so we were seated.  The food: We ordered the crispy roasted potatoes and they were delicious!! I could've eaten the whole bowl! Â We also ordered the roasted Brussels sprouts. Â They were very good, but were sort of basic. I decided to order an appetizer - campechano estilo - good, but I found the sauce a little sweet, and a small plate - calamar y pulpo ahumado - delicious! Tender calamari, octopus and other yummy grilled seafood. Â And the house made tortillas were killer good. Oh, and it was happy hour too. Â There were several small bites and cocktails on the menu that sounded amazing. I went with a $7 mojito. Â I love a drink special, especially when it's this refreshing. This place is hopping for a reason. Good stuff.

Came her for an early dinner on a Saturday afternoon - at 5pm. They were having a happy hour on Saturday which is awesome. Pretty solid wine list with some options for Latin America - the sparkling rose from Argentina was really good as was the rose from Mexico. We got two different ceviches which for six people was a little on the slim side. Both were really good! One was a coconut ceviche and was unique, very good coconut flavor.  If you ask they can provide a vegetarian menu - lots of veggie options. I ordered the verdes enchiladas. It was okay, it tasted healthy - could have used more sauce and cheese for my liking. Enjoyed that it was filled with lots of nice veggies.  We tried different desserts. One was the El Coco that you got to crack open with a mallet which was fun. It was really good, lots of coconut flavor! We also tried the tres leches which was good, some in the group thought to be the best.

Date night for the hubby and I, boy am I so happy he chose this restaurant! All the food we ate here was out of this world!  We started with the popular Ostiones Asados (wood-roasted oysters) and the ceviche for our appetizers. Then for our entrees we split the Mariscos Al Ajillo and the Callo de Hacha (scallops). Everything was so tasty and super fresh. The sauces in the dishes complimented the seafood so well. For our dessert we chose the churros; best churros I've had in years. And to make it even better it comes with the Mexican hot cocoa!  I really like the concept of this restaurant; Mexican Seafood. You won't find this just anywhere you go. Everyone has to experience this at least once. I can't wait for another date night here.  Tip: Parking is free with validation.

Had an amazing dinner on the patio. Â We have been here before and it has always been very solid but this time was amazing. Â The food was spectacular - after starting off with the tuna taco appetize (rare with a nice sear, even the guacamole was good and I am not a fan of guac) I had the bass and my wife had a vegetarian dish (MOLE AMARILLO CON HONGOS) that was mind blowingly good. Â We ended with the chocolate mousse cake. Â We are not big drinkers and like different wines - so the nice selection of the wines by the glass were a plus. Â Service was perfect. Tip: If you don't mind a wee walk or don't like valet for the principal there is free parking in the garage above the restaurant with one flight of stairs or elevator right to the restaurant.

Been here a few times and it seems to have its ups and downs. Â For Valentines we had a perfect meal. Â This last time we went for Houston restaurant Weeks. Â The service was not great (forgot my wine, my coffee came after my dessert when I explicitly requested it with my dessert). Â There were 4 HRW menus to chose from - but I actually chose the special menu that night and my wife and friends chose the HRW. Â the fixed menus were rather heavy on meat. Â You can swap items - for an extra $5. Â We all thought the food was very good to great. Â Note - you get free parking in the attached parking garage (don't need valet unless, well 20 feet is just too much for you to walk).
Start your review of  Caracol .

Still amazing place, we went a couple weeks ago to celebrate my friend's birthday. Service nice as usual, food amazing, however their margaritas are a big NO. My husband had to overpaid for a Margarita to actually taste good $29! Â Their original Margarita is a big NO. You should revise this recipe please.  Since Hugo's is same chain, theirs are way better. It was your I think Caracol Margarita he ordered two, then they brought him another one that he can't remember and he ended up ordering the $29. He paid for every single one of them. We told our server so she could tell bartender

Thank you for taking the time to leave this review. Can you tell me what margarita was not to your liking? I would like to go over this with the bartenders and check the drink incase we have gone astray in their preparations.

We went to celebrate my husband's bday with friends. Had a reservation  We had an amazing time, and the food!! Amazing. Hugo's chain never disappoints  Excellent service, servers are knowledgeable. Only thing My friend and I had the seafood plate, which Hugo's used to served. It was my favorite entree, but the scallops on my friend's dish tastes a bit funny. We told server and they took it out of the bill, we didn't expect that, a high class quality restaurant takes responsibility for their actions. We will definitely come back

We had a delicious 4 course HRW dinner at Caracol for 2!  - Parking: There's an adjacent parking garage. Parking is free after restaurant validation, so make sure to bring your ticket inside to the restaurant! Plenty of parking w/o the stress of parallel or street parking  - Reservations: We had a reservation at OpenTable for 5 & were seated immediately. Would recommend making a reservation as it gets super packed around prime time especially if you want indoor seating at the peak of Houston summers.  - Menu: The HRW dinner menu is tailored with 3 fixed options from 1st-4th course. Was kind of bummed about this b/c there's less freedom to pick exactly what you want but it all turned out great. 2 meat-menu options were $49/person, and there is a vegetarian option for $35/person. We got the 2 meat-containing options.  My favorites: 1. MEMELITA (1st course): So good. Crispy tortilla texture was perfectly paired with the mushrooms. Loved how warm this was & the mole was to die for!  2. Ostiones asados (2nd course): 3 gigantic oysters with a delicious cheesy bread crumb topping. The touch of lime w/ pink salt was incredible and soooo yummy!  3. Canita de puerco (3rd course): This pork chop wrapped with bacon was HUMONGOUS! The pork melts right off the bone, and the mole with surrounding crisp veggies was heavenly. This was an enormous portion and so worth it.  4. Camarones a la talla (3rd course): Crispy shrimp & delicious rice! Definitely more simple and lowkey than the canita de puerco was still good.  The desserts were alright but definitely very rich. I found the ceviche (2nd course) most disappointing b/c it wasn't as fresh as I anticipated & that was one of the dishes I was looking forward to most.  Overall great dining experience and an impressive selection for HRW! Our service was also very personable and the music selection was great. Will come back again!
Thank you for taking the time to leave this review. I will check on the ceviche incase we have gone astray in their preparation. Thank you for joining us Ann!

The best seafood we have had in Houston! The oysters were plump and juicy, the Pescado was delicious, and the deserts were scrumptious. Best of all was the top of the line service! Definitely our best dining experience in a very long time.
That is really great to hear. Thank you for joining us Kevin!

The happy hour oysters make this place worth it alone. Delicious gulf coast oysters you can't resist. The happy hour menu also has some other bites and libations to get your fill. I've also dined off the regular menu. They have beautiful entrees that are pretty good, but I wouldn't necessarily come here frequently to eat them. Valet available in the front or self parking in the garage behind the restaurant.
That is really great to hear. Thank you for joining us Erin!

The food was absolutely amazing! We got ostiones asados, mariscos Al ajillo, papas martajadas, scallops, and this one other appetizer, it was rice and beans wrapped in banana leaf. The appetizer was such a unique concept and tasted fantastic. Everything tasted so so delicious! We also got the churros and the French toast for desserts. Again, everything was just mouthwatering. It's the perfect date night restaurant. The ambience and music is very romantic and up beat.  The one thing my husband and I did not appreciate and the reason for 3 stars is because our waiter literally left for a good 30 min to introduce some guy to two girls sitting at a table across from us. It's inappropriate and unprofessional. As a professional on the job, this should not be allowed especially at a high class restaurant as such. It took almost 20 min for us to get our bill. Not to mention the guy looked 50 and the two women looked like they were in their thirties.
One of my favorite restaurants in Houston. Â And they have terrific vegetarian options. Â Service is, as usual in a Tracy & Hugo enterprise, brisk and friendly. Â The happy hour is a good value, too.
That is really great to hear. Thank you for joining us Laura!

I recently visited Caracol for happy hour and was very pleased with the few cocktails we tried! Love the ambience of the restaurant -- both the main dining area and patio. Ample parking in the garage. Only knocking 1 star off due to the music in the restaurant being loud; it was difficult to have a conversation.
I'm so sorry it was loud, I will get with the managers and have it corrected. Thank you for joining us Hillary!
It has been on my list to try. The food is pretty decent but not highly memorable or outstanding. Service is great. I'll give it another go next time. Might have just ordered the wrong items.
Thank you for joining us Michael!

Taking some time out of Dallas, and thought I'd start with some seafood. Caracol was phenomenal! We got a bunch of dishes that we shared and everything was excellent. We got oysters, squid, and the Pescado Zarandeado. They even gave us a small lobster taco dish on the house! We had wanted ceviche but they were out :(. Excellent food, great service!
Aradhna, thank you for taking the time to leave this review. We're glad you enjoyed our services.

Drinks, wood fired oysters, guacamole, Â and their vegetarian dish with mole are some of my favorites here! Love this place, love the service, love the environment. For a more casual easy going vibe, I love to sit at the bar. Definitely worth checking out if you like sea food and get sick of the greasy, cheesy Tex mex food you find at almost all the "mexican" restaurants in Houston. This place is one of the more authentic restaurants to eat. I have to say I have had better ceviche in Mexico City but the ceviche here is a solid 8/10 and as good as it gets here. Also, I tried their chiles enogadas and again, the one i had in CDMX was way better but if you've never had this traditional dish, it's worth a try to taste them at Caracol.
We really appreciate your kind words. Thank you for joining us Mariana!

Update: Went to Tacos Tierra Caliente again. And wanted to include my thoughts on my more recent experience. This time, we ordered the Beef, Chicken, Trompo, Chicharron and the Veggie tacos. (We would have ordered Barbacoa, but they were out!)  By far, the best tacos were the (1) Beef and (2) Chicken (and based on my previous experience Barbacoa as well). Next time, I will be sticking with those. The green salsa is awesome, and next time I will ask for extra!  P.S. The prices are now $2.00 for Corn, $2.50 for Flour tortillas.

Every Houstonian should come here to try the tacos! The food is made very very quickly and comes warm and fresh! $1.50 for Corn Tacos and $2.00 for Flour Tacos They have a good variety of proteins: barbacoa, fajita, pastor, lengua, chicharon, pollo. My favorite are barbacoa and pastor! Get those! Green Salsa is SPICY and very good. Ordering 5 tacos is a dinner-sized portion. 2 tacos is a light snack. Great location, right on West Alabama next to the West Alabama Ice House.

Tacos were very cheap and decent. You may need to speak up and repeat yourself because our orders were a little messed up. I ordered the Trompo, Barbacoa, Chicken, and Beef, and didn't get the beef.  Trompo was very meh, a little dry honestly. Chicken was good, more moist. Barbacoa was very moist, the best of the bunch. The corn tortillas were a little soft for my liking but had a good chew to them.  I'd probably give this a 3.5 but pricing makes this a 4.

Cash only!  The meat can be a hit or miss, it can be bomb as hell, or it can be a little tough. They are open for breakfast tacos, and the green sauce is good and spicy!  I usually park on the street, and grab drinks at the convenience store it is in front of.  See ya there!

TLDR: come for simple pure Mexican street tacos!  Barbacoa was especially top notch.  Beef was not stringy or chewy like some places tend to be.  ChicharrÃ³n is never for me, so will encourage newbies to stick with other options.

I think this place has the best street tacos hands down!! I brought 40 tacos to a party and they were gone so quick and everyone enjoyed them. I also like their sauces and the fresh toppings. The ladies who work there are super sweet and it seems like a family owned place. Don't forget to bring cash as they don't take any cards. But we were able to get cash at the mini grocery store right infront.

The skinny: Amazing authentic tacos The food: amazingly delicious and authentic tacos. The green salsa had an amazing kick as well. Went there and ordered one of everything to try. A favorite was the Lengua. Everything is no frills just as it should be. Tortilla, meat, cilantro, onions and salsa if you want. Do yourself a favor and swing by! Value/cost: $ Cheap tacos, authentic so on the smaller side. Cash only.  Ambiance: Unassuming food truck in a parking lot. No seating nearby so make sure you are aware of that. Don't let that stop you - the food here is amazing. Quick service.  Would I come back: Yes! Amazing tacos, drooling just thinking about it.

Not bad, we got 2 of each off the different types of meat and 1 lengua quesadilla it was only less than $25! So inexpensive! The quesadilla however was too salty to enjoy unfortunately. Really enjoyed the Al Pastor out of all of them. The chicharron was too jelly for me, needed to mix my fajita with it for texture. Had everything on corn tortilla which was perfect! Food trucks was easy to find but parking was a little random. Ended up parking in front of convenience store briefly.

Places like this do not exist in a vacuum. They share a symbiotic relationship with other stuff that's around, such as the Alabama Ice House across the street. And what beautiful symbiosis it is. Anyways, the barbacoa is particularly good so get stuff with barbacoa. Then take it across the street and get some beer.

We were so excited to try out this taco truck because of all the positive things we've heard from our friends. We have two trucks we frequent often and wanted to add this one to our rotation.  The first thing I noticed was the new prices, most items have gone up about 50 cents up to $2 for the tortas. I did my research and was excited to see some reviews stating they have complimentary avocado, however, that was not the case when we went. I also saw their tacos were small so I ordered 6 just for myself which was a good idea because I ate them all. The new menu doesn't have pastor listed as a meat but I asked the worker and they did have it. The pastor was really good especially with the pineapple. Barbacoa and fajita were solid but not the best we've had. I would skip the chicken. The two sauces were good but watch out for the red sauce, a few drops goes a loooong way.  Overall, the tacos were good but not the best I've had. They also were a little pricey for their size. I would come again for the pastor but prob won't be stopping by too often.

We were so excited to try out this place because of their outstanding reviews and we love taco trucks, but some items were very disappointing. To start we tried their beef torta, the meat was ok so we mostly tasted the bread. I wouldn't suggest getting the torta here. We ordered chicken quesadilla, but they gave us beef so that was already disappointing. The beef quesadilla was ok too, the beef meat was a let down for both. The two tacos we got were the best things we ordered. We ordered the beef flour taco and a barbacoa corn taco. Both were delicious and the spicy green sauce was amazing! The tortillas for both were soft and yummy. I'd order strictly taco if we were ever to come back again.
Seriously the best. I try other places and the next day I'll be craving tierras. My fav is pastor tacos but the chicharron, barbacoa, fajita are good too.

The wife and I visited Tacos Tierra Caliente to review them as part of our "highest rated" YouTube series. They are the highest rated taco joint in Houston according to Yelp, so we had to check them out! I got two tacos de al pastor and one barbacoa, all on corn tortillas. The wife got two fajita and one chicken, all on flour. We asked for tomatoes, cilantro and avocado on all. Each time the lady repeated the order, she left off the avocado, and I added "and avocado." She'd simply nod and start over. The order came out quickly (within 5 minutes) and we were off to the car to film our "eating show." We discovered really quickly that something got lost between my placing the order, her writing the order, and her relaying the order to the cook. I got my 3 tacos but my wife ended up with 5, which included one al pastor and an extra chicken--both on corn tortillas. And none of them had avocado. The tacos were so delicious I won't even trip about the avocado, but will just add that if you don't have avocado, just say that! Â :-) So yea, the tacos were delicious! The chicken was meh, but we've learned that authentic Mexican joints don't really do chicken tacos. I guess no one really orders them so they don't put much effort into seasoning them. But all the herbs, veggies and salsas made up for the lack of seasoning on the chicken itself. Great tacos!

I was visiting from Atlanta on a work trip with my co-worker. Â  We decided to go taco food truck hopping the first night we arrived. Â This was the first spot we hit. Â Little food truck tucked on the corner of a small shopping strip, right next to a popping bar (Alabama Icehouse or something). The menu looked a little slim, but my co-worker spoke fluent Spanish and asked if there was anything else not listed...YES, THEY HAVE MORE! Â  We got several tacos, the al pastor rocked my socks off. Â These were street style tacos, smaller. Â Ate them on the back of the trunk with a few glass cokes bought from the convenience store, they didn't have drinks at the truck unfortunately. Â  We were in Houston for three days and ate at every taco truck/bar we could find, this one was the absolutely BEST. Â We managed to hit this spot a second time on our last night after being disappointed by a different place. I will be back next time I'm in H-town! Hands down, delicious!

This unassuming food truck has some of the most perfect tacos I've ever tasted.  I got a beef, chicken, and barbacoa. They swapped my flour and corn tortillas, but the tacos were so insanely delicious I didn't even care.  The meat in all was wonderfully flavorful and perfectly moist and tender (you can't tell by looking at them!), and the salsas just took it over the edge.
