As you can see there really wasn't any onions or cilantro. I paid for added guacamole which also wasn't included, however I did get my refund. I requested the sauce on the side so that it did not get soggy. It was decent, definitely missing the refreshing balance of cilantro or onions. It just feels too heavy and salty, unfortunately not anything special. I included a photo of how it's described and shown. Obviously I don't anticipate my food (especially when delivered) to be just as shown, but this is to show the description and what's clearly missing.  This was also missing the side of beef consommÃ© as described by the Uber Eats menu. However I did receive the sides of salsa I requested.  Carne Asada Fries: This hit the Mark a little more. It could have used the guacamole or something like radish to pull it all together.

Since there isn't a Yelp for their taco truck I'll just review this on their main page.  Stopped here on a trip to the Towson area where their truck was set up.  My main concern is that there isn't an option to do online ordering for the food truck so you have to go and stand in line for 20-30 minutes depending how busy they are. Definitely need to have online ordering ON.  Ordered 3 carne asada tacos, along with an order of the street corn.  The steak was good - very tender - and the sauce was good. I also really liked the taco shells themselves.  The street corn was okay - the corn kernels were somewhat wilted and didn't look too good - but the sauce and cheese was very good.  Overall I liked it - would rather go to a sit down version and try it.

What you see is what you get at Little Miner Taco. In other words as it is advertised is what you get so if you want salsa or any other type of sauce/condiment include it with your order and expect to pay an extra dollar or two. That isn't a problem at all just a helpful hint. Now I have been on the hunt for a "slap your mama" it's so good Taco for some time and today I can say I still haven't found it. Though the tacos were average to good, they were not great or the best I've ever had. The tacos were very fresh tasting which I like. But they were lacking the flavor of a really good taco.  As for the street corn....yes!! Get it, taste it, you'll enjoy it! And the Queen Wrapped Burrito is delicious. If I had only ordered the burrito this would have been an easy 4 rating...if not a low 5. The kid's meals are free and they are good as are the fries.  Would I go back? Yes, why yes I would after all I haven't tried all the burritos. New Name Alert "Little Miner Burrito" because our tacos just aren't that great.

I picked up the Birria de res Quesotacos from here and they were delicious! I ordered the guacamole and it was really good, lots of flavor.  I recommend getting 2 orders of guacamole since it's small & not ideal for sharing. The restaurant is located in a food court. There is seating available and a few parking spots around.  Ordering online through their website was easy and my meal was ready when I arrived.

I'm blown away - the birria tacos with broth was the most delicious food truck fare I've had in a very long time.  I eat red meat maybe twice a year, but I'm pleased with this exception to my normal pescatarian diet! The beef was tender and crazy flavorful, not to mention very fresh and well crafted. Crack!!!

The birria tacos are the bomb! That's it and that's all. Soo good! I'd suggest ordering online and doing pick up just to avoid waiting outside. We actually walked in and placed an order. It was contactless, you place your order on the monitors and make your payment. You'll receive a text when your food is ready.  The tacos are so flavorful. Can't wait to go back!

Ordered curbside pickup on a weekday afternoon. The estimated time was accurate and the link to notify them you're outside was easy to use. The tacos...it was my first time having Birria tacos. Believe the hype! It was exactly what I expected, and my expectations were high. The lime and the onions are a must. It all blends so well. The broth had a great taste to it. I love that this restaurant has multiple locations. Can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu!

So good. This spot is located on the main floor of what looks like an apartment complex. There is limited parking, which may require you to be a little brave when it comes to parking. When you walk in, there are social distancing stickers on the floor, you wait in line until you go up the the front, where you use an iPad to make your order. You are then texted when your order is complete. We ordered 4 birria tacos and carne asada fries, which took about 15-20 min. So I would recommend calling ahead if possible.  When it comes to seating, there are tables and a bar inside, but no seating outdoors. So we ended up taking it to go.  The food was so bomb and kept well for the 20 min car ride back home. Will definitely go back.

Have been seeing this place on social media for a while and finally decided to give it a try.  Order was not correct and had to drive back (25+ minutes) to get the correct order.  Tried the birria with consume. No different from any other taco place in the area. Â Liked that they put extra onion on the side. Street corn was different, have never had it not on the cobb. Liked the taste Unsure if I would return if I was in the area again

This was my second time having Little Miner. This was my first time trying their food truck. I must say I like the Brentwood location better. I ordered the carne fries and it was mediocre. It had a salty taste to it. The fries are like thick cut/potato wedges. My cousin tried it and loved it though. If you follow their IG you can see their schedule of where they will park the truck.  I ordered online and scheduled my pick up. Pick up was super fast. I would eat there again, but will make sure to go to the restaurant location.

Absolute Aces in my book! We got two queso burritos with carne asada and birria beef and a bulgogi beef burrito. The birria beef burrito was the best IMO so packed with flavor and I would compare it to have beef stew in a burrito. All the flavors really come through with it. The carne asada burrito was exactly what I was expecting with it being well, chopped up steak. It's not what I was in the mood for today but my coworker liked it. The bulgogi beef burrito was a different breed. It had kimchi fried rice, a different sauce and Korean sauced beef. Really good but it's a bit weird to me. I would expect this on it's own and on a plate but not in burrito form. Definitely worth a try for the people that like that kind of tangy korean flavor. There's a lot more to try here. I'm looking forward to going back for their taco Tuesday and oyster mushroom tacos.

I love this place. I'm pretty sure I've tried the whole menu but my go to's are the veggie burrito, chicken burrito supreme, and beef tacos (sooo good). Â Not sure what people are talking about with the bad service reviews. I've always been treated kindly and had great service.

Super disappointing... Maybe I was spoiled growing up near Jackson Heights in Queens. Perhaps I was too coddled in Hartford & New Haven Counties during my twenties while residing in CT. I've even had SoCal tacos so my taste buds aren't completely East Coast biased. We ordered lengua (tongue for you uninitiated), cabrito (goat), chorizo, pork and two pupusas (one beans and the other herbs).  Let's start with the main reason we went to this spot, . Â These are some of the worst tacos I've had in my life. From the double tortillas, to the meat, toppings and sauce on the side, nothing positive can be noted. Why are the tortillas burnt and crisped up in oil? Why are there two? Why is every meat seasoned exactly the same way and with too much salt? As someone who loves authentic Mexican food, it was insulting to see scallions, iceberg lettuce and wilted cilantro in my taco with tiny shreds of radish. But to make matters worse, there was no respect for the distinct flavor that each meat holds. A properly, pressure cooked lengua should never taste the same as shredded goat or pork. The end result is an aftertaste of fat mingled with the residue leftover of saltiness. Lastly, the sauce which is meant to breathe in the final notes of acidity, heat and seasoning into the taco was a watery mess with a kick but 0 flavor. The pupusas were the only saving grace due to their flavor although they too could have been improved by a higher ratio of masa to filling.  Thirty minutes later, I am sick to my stomach. I do not recommend and I will not be going back.

Still going strong! If they cleaned up the front of the shop and the kitchen a bit, I'd elevate to 5 stars. The proprietor isn't super big on cleaning, but that's how it goes sometimes. My current favorites: -goat burrito supreme -chorizo tacos -homemade hot sauce

Maybe not "authentic" as some have said, but still an outstanding take-out place with reasonable prices and quick service. My favorites: Â goat tacos chicken fillet sandwich, beef tacos. Keep in mind that it can get very busy at certain times of the day. Â Parking is limited and so are the stools inside. Â Most people end up getting food to go.

Pupusas were horrible. They were just dough nothing inside and horrible after taste. Looked like they were pre-made. Steak tastes like it warmed up and not fresh. Bad portion of chicharrÃ³n to yucca. Will NOT go back!! Â Plus guy at counter was in his phone and no one was wearing a mask!!

This place is a Â neighbourhood gem! The owner started from a truck and worked his way up to a great restaurant. I like the fish burger and the tacos are very good as well. I highly recommend this spot if you are in the mood for tacos or pupusas done right!

The tacos here are amazing!!! They tend to use a lot of green onion which may not be for everyone, but I love it. The homemade salsa there is so incredibly flavorful as well! There is limited seating and it's cash only. Check this place out!

This used to be one of my favorite places to go to a while back.  Their tacos and pupusas were the best and I'd take every chance to go there.  However, I just went back after sometime, and the food is totally different. It barely has any flavor.  Maybe a portioning issue? And to top it off, there is a big sign on the door stating "you must wear a mask" which I think is great for the safety of everyone, but when you walk in, you see the person at the front counter without a mask taking your order and talking to people as they walk in, this becomes an integrity issue. This is a behavior that, to me, relates directly with the food integrity as well. In my opinion!

El Charrito may not be the best Mexican ever, but it is the cheapest Mexican food I have ever encountered. I always get the Chicken Burrito Supremo ($4), which comes with beans, cheese, rice, and lettuce. It has just the right amount of chicken, is super filling, and tastes delicious. Plus it's so cheap! I still want to try the pupusas and tacos.  My colleague has always brought food back so I have never been here, but I'm always excited when it shows up.

Awesome place to to get your taco fix! My tacos were sooooo good and normally I dress mine up with cheese and salsa but these amazing tacos don't require it. They add their own toppings and a side of their own sauce. I loved every bite , definitely would come back here. This is how tacos are supposed to taste.  Heads up, they only accept cash

I grew up eating here. It was just a few blocks away from my childhood home. I absolutely love this restaurant-- authentic, affordable, and absolutely delicious food. All my efforts trying to find a place like this far from home have proved unsuccessful. No restaurant ever has and ever could possibly be better than this one. My favorite thing to do in my hometown is come back here and order some beef and lengua tacos with the "white drink," formerly known as the "pink drink." Truly delicious and never disappoints. You know from just looking at this place that the food will be amazing. You'll never have to pay $14 for a burrito bowl at Chipotle again after tasting these AMAZING tacos. I've eaten at Michelin Star restaurants and none top the flavor of the food at El Charrito Caminante. Also a great place for takeout! The Cheese Pupusas were the epitome of my childhood. My dad would pick them up from work with a pink drink to surprise me and it always made my day. The yucca they make here is excellent as well.  This is the best Mexican restaurant you'll ever go to & I promise you won't regret it!
Start your review of  El Charrito Caminante .

Overall it wasn't that great. The prices have been raised so it's hard to let things slide. The pupusa revuelta was lacking in the meat and cheese. The yuca con chicharrÃ³n only had about for tiny pieces of chicharrÃ³n!! Four bite size pieces! The tamal de elote was a bit dry. However the tamal de pollo was delicious. It was not the best tamal I've had and I'll say that it is Salvadoran tamal and not a Mexican. In addition it's a cash only establishment. Finally, the service isn't friendly. Parking however is easy to find.
We absolutely love el charrito. Everything there is authentic, delicious, and you can't beat the price.

We stumbled upon this place and it's a hidden gem! FYI it's small, 5 barstools available, and they only take cash (there is an ATM inside). They have so many options but also have combos which is what I got. They give you so much food for $7.50! I got a pupusa (soooooo good), quesadilla, and yucca. But with the combo they also give you rice and beans. Such a good deal and big portions!

Was very thrown off by the steak and cheese, sandwich was extremely soggy, all the contents fell out, who the hell puts mustard in steak and cheese? Was very disappointed by the steak and cheese as it was my first time. Pupusas were mediocre, nothing out of the ordinary, tacos were pretty good however. For the pricing it was great but being a steak and cheese fanatic i was highly disappointed.

It's the hole in the wall type of gem That ARLINGTON doesn't like sharing with all the tourist and random people who drive through the area.  Tacos papupas carnisada u name it they got it! And it's decently priced and good portions!

Ok this place is a hidden gem. Their food is amazing, it's cheap, and the staff is very friendly.  I def recommend one of the combo meals. They come with rice and beans. The tacos and pupusas are by FAR my favorites. 4 stars because 1) I believe it's CASH ONLY and 2) I wasn't really impressed with their tamales (unfortunately I love tamales so this was a big letdown)

Different kind of Burritos. Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Unlike burritos that we're familiar with everywhere, the shapes of their burritos are folded instead of bundled and sealed on both ends. Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  I ordered Burrito Supreme Cabrito (Goat Burrito Supreme) and that costs $5.00. Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Good price for a decent size burrito. Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â   I didn't taste Mexican in the burrito (dense, black or pinto beans, spicy, lime) like when I get them anywhere in California, this was more like an El Salvadorian style of Burrito. Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  It was like eating a large folded goat pupusa instead of a burrito. Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  adjust your expectations accordingly, it's only $5.00 and you're not in California.
They are the best taco's in NVA except for the taco truck located on 14 street between courthouse and Rosslyn
I normally go there at least once a week the tacos are very tasty, the service is not best the guy seems like he is angry all the time. That is why I don't give the 5 stars.

I am dealing with some serious taco cravings lately and this was yet another stop to get my fix. I was in the area and my Yelp Nearby found this place. And I am glad it did!!! We were lucky to get one of the coveted parking spots. There are quite a few but it is luck since it is a sheared lot.  I had the pork taco, beef taco, and queso papusa. It was too much food! Next time I would get two tacos and split a queso papusa. This place is small. And very, very casual. Really more like a takeout joint with some stools lining the counter. There were a couple of free stools on the end of the bar to sit. I sat while my friend placed the order. The other stools were taken. We were the only ones speaking English. While we waited, many men came and placed to go orders. Families started to pile in mid afternoon. Tacos were delivered to us.  Both tacos were flavorful. The queso papusa was also very good. Everything was made fresh. Â There was a bottle of a hot sauce that got passed up and down the bar.  I would stop in here again to get my taco fix.
Start your review of  Super Tacos & Bakery .

Looking for authentic Hispanic food? I'm talking mariachi band on your tastebuds....Well what the heck are you doing at Taco Bell? Super Tacos & Bakery in Adams Morgan is where it's at!  Food: they have an extensive menu from tacos, burritos, chimichangas, flautas, etc. In addition to food, they also have a few dessert options including tres leches cake, churros, etc. Most meals come with beans, rice, and salsa. Between my husband and I, we've tried the hard shell chicken tacos, nachos, and flautas- all of it was tasty with the exception of the rice. We've had 3-4 experiences of the rice being hard and not all the way cooked.  Ambiance: it's a very small restaurant with very little indoor and outdoor seating. Very colorful inside. Most times that I've visited, there has been Hispanic music playing (almost too loud). Service: I don't have much to say here as I usually order via phone for pick-up. However, the last time I ate here I was pissed about my rice being hard again, so I called and asked to speak to the manager. When I asked for the manager, the woman on the receiving end just asked what was wrong, so I'm not even sure if I got to speak to the manager or an imposter.  Value: Great pricing for the amount of food you get.  Location: Located in the Adams Morgan area of Washington, DC. If you're not from the area, just know that locating a parking spot in the area can be a hassle.  4 stars because the rice isn't good and who wants refried beans without rice? Not I.

I've gotten takeout from Super Tacos a few times now, and each time it's been pretty good. I like that I can order online and by the time I get there to pick it up, it's ready. The tacos are always good - I haven't had one I didn't like yet. My fiancÃ© recently got the chimichanga and said it was good too. The only thing I didn't love was the sopes. It was just too much onion and cilantro for me. Oh, if you don't like your guac chunky, you won't like it here. It's got loads of onions, tomatoes, and cilantro in it. I'll continue to get takeout here for the tacos and the salsas; they're ready quickly, reasonably priced, and delicious.

D.C. is definitely known for the jumbo slice, half-smoke, and wings with mumbo sauce. However, I've heard peeps complain about the lack of a decent taco joint in these parts. Are you kidding me? Apparently these naysayers don't know about Super Tacos & Bakery in Adams Morgan! Listen, don't sleep on this hole in the wall. I'm no taco aficionado, but Super Tacos can dish out a damn good taco. Talk about a fiesta for the taste buds. I always get the carnitas tacos...think tender, flavorful pork stuffed inside of a pillowy taco shell. FYI: They always add tasty toppings (small containers of pico de gallo, hot sauce, and pickled red onions) to my order. Now, let's talk about the refried beans. OMG! What a perfect side! Tastes like a concoction of homemade yum for the tum. No straight out of the can tomfoolery here. These refried beans are the real deal! Special mention: The menu is EXTENSIVE! There are lots of options to choose from...burritos, quesadillas, chimichangas, tortas (sandwiches), and sooo much more. For those who have a sweet tooth, there are dessert slices on deck. Need a cake for a special occasion? Look no further than Super Tacos & Bakery. Limited indoor and outdoor seating. You can do takeout or delivery. Personally, I prefer takeout. Extremely friendly and efficient customer service!

This was a cute shop by my Airbnb. Loved the selection and the service. I ordered the Pork Combo with a Jamaica as my drink. The Jamaica was great. Loved the Carnitas and Pastor Taco. The Chorizo was missing the spice but still a great taco. Would recommend if you want a filling and solid taco.
Kinda just middling. Had a mole tamale, a chicken taco, and the flautas. The flautas came with a red sauce with a kick, but the tacos and mole tamale were super bland.
Probably the best place ever. They treat everyone like family, and everything is just amazing.

I order from them monthly because the food is tasty, reasonably priced, and always arrives hot. Â The serving sizes are large. Â The tacos are flavorful, illegal burrito filling, and my fav, the chicken tamales-totally filling also. I grew up in LA and my family went to Mexico all the time, and could also easily find authentic Mexican food all over California. Â This little place takes me back to my childhood and trips to Mexico. Â  Super Tacos is a little place where you can find really good Mexican food at a reasonable price in DC.
Thought the Al pastor tacos were just okay, they lacked flavor and we're soupy w liquid

I come here to pick up a carnitas, chicken, or steak burrito occasionally, it is always very good. They give me chips with queso and salsa with it. I haven't Â been there for awhile , but it is a tasty burrito, I'd say one of the best burrito in DC I've had, not fancy at all just good fast food.

If you are looking to try different local Mexican food, I highly recommend trying Super Tacos! Their food is delicious and very affordable. Their ordering platform was very easy to navigate, so that also helped to make the experience very convenient and easy.  Onto the food! We ordered the Burrito Ilegal, Carne Asada Tacos, and the Nachos to share. The burritos were packed with fillings and flavor and were the perfect size for one person. They even came with a side of chips and cheese. The steak was cooked to perfection! It was definitely the highlight of the entree. As someone who likes smothering their food in sauces, I used the salsa verde and roja to drizzle some more flavor onto each bite. Overall, it was an excellent choice. The tacos, which were given in TWO tortillas, were the perfect street taco stuffed with plenty of fillings. Although I have to admit, the meat was overpowering the taco as there was not much else to it, and I am usually one to prioritize filling variety. However, the simplicity of it added to the deliciousness, and once again the meat was soooo good. Lastly, the Nachos were a perfect appetizer to split! The cheese was melted so perfectly onto the chips and spread evenly throughout, something that is so rare with nachos. They were a bit on the soggy side since they had been delivered, but personally I prefer it this way.  In addition to the amazing cuisine, they labeled all of the food so it was easier to divide our food. They also fulfilled the special requests we had indicated on the online order, which was very nice of them. Also, since there was WAY more than we can eat, we had plenty of leftovers, and the food reheated very well. Made for two great meals! Would highly recommend ordering from this place.
Start your review of  Super Tacos & Bakery .

Love this secret little DC gem. Long before great taquerias like Habanero and Xochi, this was my go to spot for authentic Mexican street tacos. Love their tacos, burritos, and tortas. Glad to see they're still doing well during the pandemic!
Autentico! Taste of real Mexico. Fresh ingredients, no foofoo fakey fancy American-style things on the menu. Habanero sauce especially tasty! Thumbs UP!
Excellent food, each bite was full of culture and flavor. I absolutely would recommend to anyone looking for a hidden gem.

As a transplant from San Diego, my taco and burrito benchmark is unreasonably high. In a year that's been unequivocally dumpster-fire-esque, Â I have no tolerance for stale corn tortillas that break when you fold them. Miss me with "salsa" that's watery with mushy tomato chunks (if you're gonna do pico de gallo, do pico de gallo). And if you stuff my burrito with 80% rice, we can't be friends. Super Tacos & Bakery is none of the above. They're the closest thing to San Diego mexican food that Ive found in my 2 years of searching. The chicken tinga taco tasted like home -- well seasoned meat with corn tortillas that were so fresh I almost cried. The ilegal burrito had the perfect steak:rice:sour cream ratio and, once slathered in their habanero salsa, was the ultimate hangover cure. So happy to have found this oasis.

Super delicious, ordered the 1lb of carne asada taco, flautus, carne asada chimichanga, and a tomal verde. Everything was packaged really well and stayed crispy. Appreciated the variety of sauces provided.
Best Mexican food in DC hands down!! We've tried the tacos, flautas and most recently the torta cubana...AMAZING Â Highly recommend!!

So I came to get my tattoo done nearby and realized I didn't have breakfast. Well, I needed a quick bite and this place was downstairs so my choice was easy. I went ahead and ordered the al pastor and carne asada. The food was made super quick (like within 8 mins of ordering) and I wolfed it down fast. Both tacos were delicious. Each came with a good amount of meat, and there was plenty of flavor in both items. The price was also fair and there were enough seats in the tiny shop for me to sit and enjoy my meal. The bakery part interests me so I gotta try something sweet next time.
Ok, the nachos and the al pastor tacos were just ok (not up to Pica levels, and those still are not perfect). All of this is to say, come here for the Chilaquiles which do not disappoint!!

Omg when will the gringos stop whining about 'service'?! How much emotional labor do you need to go with your $3 taco or, in my case, massive $12 chilaquiles plate. And speaking of, the chilaquiles plate here is damn good, a hot steal at $12. The chips are crisp and fresh, the sauce spicy, the eggs runny, and it comes with a side skirt steak (carne asada). I usually share it with my partner cause it's big. Eventually I need to try the asada and especially pastor tacos-both also look solid.

AMAZING place to get cheap authentic tacos!!! It right below Embassy Tattoo, and I've been there many times. Glad that someone recommended me this place after my tat appointment! It wasn't busy on a Tuesday afternoon so our food came out pretty quickly. The tacos are a good size and only about $2.75 each. Comes with corn tortilla, cilantro and lime. Really enjoyed my chicken and al pastor especially. Put the sauces on for a kick!!!! Also tried the gordita which was also delicious. Will be back when I get another tat/piercing hehe
I orders Pasole I was disappointed on how The serve it and how super greasy it was. FYI if you looking for a Mexican delicious and tasty MEXICAN posole " Super Tacos & etc. is not The place for you.

My new favorite brunch place in the city! Crispy churro, sugar, fried chicken, tangy slaw, what's there to not love?? The combination of these ingredients brings the party to your mouth. I can't think of a happier way to start off your day other than a perfect tasting brunch. The price is so so so reasonable and quality of the food is outstanding. The moment when I took a bite of my churro chicken sandwich, I knew I would definitely return. The texture is unforgettable and bursted with flavors. The hot chocolate was super thick and creamy, even though it didn't have any milk in it. Churros were hot and fresh, pistachio was our favorite.  Thank god I live not too close to Xoco, or else I would've been 30lbs heavier after a month.

My husband and I have been customers of Xoco for many years, but I'm not a fan of recent changes they've made. They did away with counter service in the evenings and replaced it with table service. This table service is not up to par. The waiter who took our order did not repeat the order back to us and he failed to submit one of our dishes. At the end of the meal he didn't offer us any dessert. I would have much rather ordered at the counter for this meal. They've also removed the Sikil Pak from the menu. That was one of my favorite items! I guess I'll have to learn to make it myself at home. I hope Xoco can eventually return to their pre-pandemic level of service.

Went on a Tues at 5:30p and barely came in time for seats for 2 on the counter top by the entrance. Service was quick and friendly! Food: started w the chips and guac from the happy hour menu since it was ending at 6p. Can't complain. Got the pozole and friend got the carnitas tacos and it hit the spot on a chilly evening! Drinks: from the happy hour menu, got the margarita and michelada. Def got us a good buzz during dinner haha Dessert: got the hazelnut and pistachio churros and I can confirm the pistachio stole the show!! It was a combo of flavors you wouldn't expect. If anything PLEASE try the desserts here!!!  Would definitely come back once I visit!!!

Churro chicken sandwich (5*): So crunchy, and surprisingly it didn't feel too sweet. The chicken cutlet was cooked perfectly as well, juicy yet crunchy and the slaw and spicy chile sauce were a match made in heaven. I was almost wary of ordering a novelty item like this but it blew me out of the water Pozole soup (3.5*): The pork carnitas were fatty and delicious, and I love pozole but there was a warming spice flavor in the soup that didn't jive with me Churro (5*): they've perfected this, so crunchy and tender on the inside Chocolate hazelnut cookie (5*): Lots of good quality chocolate and hazelnuts, the combo reminded me of an elevated Mrs. Field cookie, I would get this again in a heartbeat

Nicely done Mr. Rick Bayless this place is great!  I stopped in on my way to a friends and ordered the steak torta (Friday special). The meat was tender. The bread was wonderful, and the green sosa was spot on. Not a huge torta but a very tasty one. Service is impeccable with everyone being very classy and attentive. Big props to them.  Overall this was similar to frontera tortas. I am Mexican born reviewer and Rick knows Mexican food . Try this place

My boyfriend and I stopped by here the other day and picked up some food to go since it was close by and had heard good things. However, after getting home and looking over everything, it wasn't the stellar experience we were hoping for, but wasn't terrible. Chips and salsa- 2/5: honestly, we were both a bit surprised by this. First, we had ordered extra salsa with the order, but they only gave us one of each. With that, they were extremely small, along with the chips that came with it. The red and habanero salsa were good, however, the green lacked flavor. Chicken Milanese Torta- 1/5: Â we got this based on a recommendation and were really disappointed. The slaw that was on the sandwich was very tart, with that, the chicken on the torta was extremely dry, which made the whole thing hard to eat. Gringa Torta: 4/5: Now, this is a seasonal special, however, if you are stopping by I highly recommend getting this one. The pork was cooked very well and everything that came with it was fantastic. Honestly, I would go back for this Torta only.  Overall, Xoco is nice to have by and the food is decent, however, I just think we got a bad batch of a few things. I will probably give it another try since it is so close by.

We ordered takeout and will definitely be coming back! The tortas were are exceptional. So much flavor! We ordered the Cuban and milanesa. Both outstanding!  The Cuban has a very smokey, BBQ flavor that pairs perfectly with the freshness from the avocado and the sauce.  The milanesa is much lighter. The chicken is juicy and lightly crunchy with the perfect spicy kick from the jalapeÃ±o.

I ordered delivery from Xoco as several people recommended the restaurant. The Tlayuda was a standout - think of a giant tostada with just the right balance of beans, melted cheese, veggies, and salsa. It's large enough for two, but gluttons like myself can probably devour one on their own. I was less impressed with the Milanesa torta. Sure, the ingredients were higher quality than a torta you might find elsewhere, but for the price it was nothing spectacular. Still good, but for a restaurant that focuses on tortas, this dish played it safe. Overall Xoco is a good spot to grab a bite to eat if you're in the area, but the torta I had left something to be desired.

This amazing place was the best find because I had an amazing chicken sandwich!! The chicken was so perfect and spicy and the spicy Mayo on it was just perfect but on top of that it came on a Churro Bun which was soft and delicious!!!!

Great spot for a quick bite! I stopped by here after work one evening and was pleasantly surprised. It's a pretty chill environment, good for a quick bite alone or a drink with a friend. There's plenty of seating inside and they also have patio seating.  They have a solid happy hour Tuesday-Thursday from 3-6pm. I got the XOCO margarita ($6) and the XOCO guac ($5). The marg was very good and the guac was delicious.  I highly recommend the Milanesa torta! It was very flavorful and yummy - the chicken was great and the pickled jalapeÃ±os give it a nice kick.  Would definitely go back to this place again and try out another dish - they have quite a few items that look great!

So I came back here when we needed to get breakfast but were pressed for time. We were passing through the neighborhood and hastily grabbed some churros and chocolate coffee. The first bite of churros told it all: they weren't overly sweet, and the coffee con chocolate was well-balanced. I had a rocky start with the hostess, but the manager quickly rectified the situation. He remedied the situation and went out of his way to make our take-out experience good.

The food was delicious, and the service was excellent. They were very friendly and helpful in recommending what we should order for takeout. Health protocols are strictly enforced. I recommend visiting Xoco!

TLDR: Fantastic quick service Mexican eats with a great happy hour. Strong margs and amazing tortas. Vibe: 4/5. Limited seating inside and outside (mostly counter style seating) makes this place good for groups less than 4. There are a few 2-4 tops, but are sought after during peak hours. If you taking to go, walk up style ordering is available as soon as you walk in.  Service: 5/5. Staff is prompt to take your order with a very fast turn around in the kitchen. Servers Â use handheld POS so getting you check is quick and easy. Currently they are taking an automatic 15% gratuity, but it is heavily advertised.  Food: 5/5. Some of the best quick service food I have ever eaten. The tortas and corn tlayuda are amazing, using only the freshest ingredients and providing an experience well worth the price. Happy hour also has some amazing deals on food and drink making this place even more enticing.

This is a great place for delicious Mexican street food. One of the many establishments by Rick Bayless and the most casual. Post-pandemic you find yourself waiting in line to be seated once you are at the entrance. A QR code to get menu access. I ordered the classic margarita which was delicious. My friend ordered a hibiscus one...there were a handful of flavors. The loaded guacamole was delicious with so many toppings. For my lunch I ordered the short rib sandwich. It was good but not the pop of flavor that I was expecting. Quality bread with a good amount of meat and cheese. My friends ordered the Cuban sandwich and short rib tacos. Both were enjoyed. A great fast Â causal dinning choice with delicious drinks and authentic Mexican fare.

I'm impressed by the Spicy Churro Chicken Sandwich. As someone who shies away from mixing sweet and savory flavors in a single meal, this was the most unexpectedly great food of the day. My friends and I dropped by here just a few days after the city fully reopened . We originally meant to go to another restaurant in the area, but couldn't go to the other one due to the crowd. This proved to be a great alternative. Somehow, neither the sweetness of the churro nor the savoriness of the chicken (and the spiciness of the sauce) took dominance in the final taste. All parts worked together harmoniously to create an amazing meal. There's really nothing else I can compare this to--you just have to try it for yourself. Thanks for the experience, XOCO!

Jus a lil' shout out to Xoco. Â Don' mean to sound like a broken record or any such thing. Jus'' wanna say best.. taco.. ever.. Chorizo and other stuff taco and 6 dollar margaritas. So what you need right now, my friend. 3-6 m-fri. Go here. Â You will be hungry at 10, but it's worth it Â  Ok? Â Anyway, sheesh, was good.

Hooray. Â ''Twas the anniversary of my birth and I had decided to use this to my advantage. Â We ventured out on this cold winter's day to obtain some of the finest provisions in the city, if not the galaxy. We ordered pickup so we could enjoy our vittles inside of our buggy, and out of the freezing and damp kiss of winter in Chicago, since indoor dining was not viable. ''Twas difficult to manage not spilling salsas on the finery of our Honda. Â But, holy bovine, "''twas worth it. Â We had the carnitas tacos, shrimp torta and Â fully dressed guacamole, which I probably should tell you. Â Xoco has not missed a beat, even during these unusual and challenging covid times. Rick Bayless, you are the king.

Oh my gosh. Â Rick, Rick, Rick, Rick. ( I think that was an SNL sketch, too.) Â  The tortas here are absolutely the best sandwiches known to mankind. Â There is definitely a reason he won Top Chef Masters. Â There's sometimes a wait, but who cares? Â  The food is sublime.

I came to Xoco while on a trip to Chicago and had an excellent dinner!  To start I had the Margarita of the Day, which had melon in it - it was so refreshing! I also got the Almost Naked Guacamole which was roasted garlic-tomatillo guacamole with your choice of two toppings (I got queso fresco and grilled onion), tomatillo salsa, three chile salsa, and chips. It was some delicious guac!  I also got the Golden Eggplant Torta (crispy eggplant, roasted tatume squash, smoky salsa negra, arugula, Artisan jack cheese, queso aÃ±ejo, and black beans). Holy cow, it was amazing. It was sweet/caramelized somehow (the eggplant? the smoky salsa? no idea) and it was INCREDIBLE. The portion sizes for everything were very generous, such that I had leftovers for another meal. My only complaint - it took me forever to get seated despite the empty seating! But for the delicious food and attentive service once I was seated, I can overlook the wait.

We we're not in Chicago as often as we'd like to be. Ergo, this was only my second visit here. My wife had the baja chicken tortilla, while I had the torta ahogada.  The rolls are amazing. They are just crispy enough on the outside and soft on the inside. These rolls are light enough that allows the fresh ingredients on the inside of the sandwich to shine through. Both tortas were delicious yet very different. The chicken was tasty and balanced with slaw to create perfection in every bite. The torta ahogada had delicious carnitas inside. The broth made this sandwich an even better treat. Â  I can't wait to return and try more from the menu.

I will forever dream about the golden eggplant torta. Absolute deliciousness! Â I was only visiting Chicago for a few days, but if I had more time I would def try more on the menu. Â If a meatless menu item tastes that could, I can't even imagine how incredible their other tortas would be!

I have had traditional tortas from mom and pop shops out of Brooklyn but if you're looking for one step up, this is the place to check out! This fast casual really knows how to crank out delicious food and fast! The service is amazing and so friendly and the happy hour deals aren't bad either.

Wow! This place was down right delicious. Everything we had was awesome, no lie, and the service was great. We came because we were enticed by the spicy chicken churro sandwich, but the guacamole was also so yummy and the torta we got was savory and cheesy and amazing. HIGHLY RECOMMEND giving this place a try!

Frontera Grill was a must stop on a trip to Chicago this summer. The service was lively, warm and top-notch. We ate out on the patio (which was added to a street closed to vehicle traffic). The umbrellas provided nice shade and it was a perfect day. My dining companions were two girlfriends. We had a few starters and enjoyed our entrees. Portions were nicely sized and we were all stuffed at the end of our meal. Perfect for a first day in the city!

We got lucky on a Saturday afternoon and were seated immediately at the bar without reservations. This place is delicious! The corn elote stole the show for me and was some of the best I've ever eaten (sorry LA!). The smoked chicken taquitos were perfectly cooked and the duck carnitas was an awesome way to end the meal.  If you're craving something a bit elevated but still approachable, this is a great spot.

A marvelous meal from start to finish. The appetizers of tortilla soup, queso fundido with homemade chorizo, the whole roasted corn with crema, chile, and spices were each superb. The tortilla soup was rich and delicious with a smoky subtle spicy flavor. The queso fundido was good but made exceptional by the house made chorizo that didn't have the strong vinegar taste of comercial chorizos. The roasted corn was Â perfectly prepared with a nice char but no burnt flavor. The entrees were equally exquisite. The three meats of tender, moist, and delectable chicken, pork, and skirt steak with onion bulbs, and grilled peppers was scrumptious. The chicken enchiladas with poblano mole were ambrosial. I've had mole across they country and with the exception of hole in the wall joints in Las Vegas and Sonoma. This is the best mole by far - excluding my mothers mole. A great mole should have an addictive lip smacking quality and that's evident in this dish. The Oaxacan carne asada was one of the best ribeye steaks I've tasted. The red Chile marinade added a slightly sweet carbonized glaze that was incomparably delicious. The service was excellent, and it better be with a right off the top 20% service charge. The decor is stylish, tasteful, and welcoming. A great dining experience.

I love Ricks shows and cookbooks so I had to visit while in Chicago! Wowza!!! The food was shockingly perfect. The queso fundido was perfect. It's made with a fresh house chorizo that doesn't overwhelm my cheese! The tortilla soup was creamy and perfectly delicious! The summer margaritas were a shocking surprise that lasted for a while carafe! The the roasted corn was the prettiest presentation. The corn was sweet and perfectly roasted. The mole was the best I've ever eaten. I really have tried it in many paces and this was so good! The the tres cranes had skirt steak, chicken and pork. Each were moist and flavorful. They also had black beans and fresh guacamole. The ribeye was so perfectly spiced and cooked! The servers are attentive and friendly!

I went because of one of my favorite tv chefs Rick Bayless. I love his show on tv about MÃ©xican cuisine. When I went to the restaurant I was impressed by their twist on MÃ©xican food. My favorite was the tortilla soup that was hand served by one of the waiters. It was so yummy I would go back for that soup! I e of the waitress was very rude to us and rushed us to order. The place was not packed so I don't know why she did that. Do not recommend

I am VERY, VERY disappointed after over 30 years of patronizing Frontera Grill to see a 20% "service charge" added to our check. Lived in Chicago all my life and never scene anything like this. How do you personalize the service you have received from your server. It is the most awkward feeling to not leave your server a tip, instead leaving the restaurant a tip. Sadly, we will think twice before returning, if ever.

It's rare to find a restaurant where every dish blows you away, but our meal here did just that.  We started with the grilled asparagus with garlic chive adobo, and more or less inhaled the dish. It had a beautifully grilled flavor that was accentuated by the garlic, and I wish I could recreate this dish at home.  For our mains we got the Tacos Arabes (grilled spiced pork collar) and the shrimp tacos with coconut-poblano crema. The Tacos Arabes were very moist and perfectly seasoned, with the various spices blending well with the pork flavor, all without feeling too salty. The shrimp was also amazing, and almost tasted like a thai curry, but with a Mexican twist. The shrimp was cooked well and had a great crunch, and we could not get enough of the crema.  Even though we were stuffed at the end of the meal, we had to try their dessert and were not disappointed. The classic flan was so creamy, but not too rich and not overly sweet either. It was definitely a fight for the last bite, and to make things even better, it was incredibly inexpensive at only $5!  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal here, and will definitely be back to try some of the other dishes on the menu (though it will be hard not to order the same things again).

Full disclosure, I am a sucker for Mexican food and will love a corner taco stand as much as a fine dining establishment as long as it tasty and comes with rice, beans and guacamole. Â But Frontera Grill has crossed over into a new level of reality for me due to three words: crispy duck carnitas. Â If you had ever told me that I could love a Mexican dish that didn't have pork in it, I would have called you crazy, but man this dish took me to another level, it was life giving and I am still having dreams about that dish. Â So much so that I will be going back this month to get it again. Carnitas means "little meats" in Spanish, but I know it as a delicious and succulent pork dish. Â So my curiosity was piqued when I saw the Crispy Duck Carnitas on the menu and it did not disappoint. Â I can see that Bayless stuck to the literal translation of the word, focusing on the little meats part instead of pork. Â The duck was from Gunthorp farms, which is known for its pasture-raised ducks, pork and chickens. Â The duck was beautifully presented with a charred tomatillo-serrano chile salsa, chiles torreados, black beans, guacamole and tortillas. Â The chiles torreados were too hot for me, so those were given to The Queen to eat as she is about all things spicy and hot. Â I got a side of rice to go with the entrÃ©e, which was perfection for me. Â I ended up not finishing the entrÃ©e because I had a starter beforehand. Â The Individual Appetizer Sampler was a perfect taste of Frontera's MichoacÃ¡n guacamole, tuna ceviche, Mexico City-style cheese quesadilla, crispy chicken taquito with homemade crema & fresco cheese. Â I love having a taste of everything and this was a great way to accomplish this. Â Because I couldn't finish the duck carnitas, I had leftovers for breakfast the next morning and man it was great. Â I had some apple strudel toast and mimosas because it was breakfast, but that duck maintained the integrity and flavor of the dish. The BFF got the Enchiladas NorteÃ±as (heirloom corn tortillas, braised Creekstone Farms beef short rib, roasted tomato-serrano sauce, Samuel's artisan cheese, black beans). Â I had a bite of that dish and it was also very good. Â I love beef short rib meat and this was a nice complement to the corn tortillas and sauce. Â I could see myself getting this as well on another visit. Â  The Queen is all things seafood, so she got the Veracruz Seafood Pozole (Sinaloa shrimp, squid, Hudson Canyon scallops & pozole corn braised in guajillo chile broth). It was topped with a fresh garnishes, tostadas, lime, and Mexican oregano. She normally ends up taking food home from her meals, but this dish became a member of the Clean Plate Club. I tried some of the squid and it was very nice, not overcooked. Â  The Doctor got chicken tacos and the tortilla soup. Â The chicken was cooked nicely, you could taste the wood-grilled flavor. Â The soup I didn't try but it was interesting as it was a dark brown broth with pasilla, grilled chicken, avocado, artisan Jack cheese, homemade crema, and tortilla strips. We didn't do dessert but I did have bubbles with dinner (2018 RaventÃ³s, Blanc, Blanc de Blancs, Conca del Riu Anoia, PenedÃ¨s, Spain). Â This was a nice complement to the meal and at $55, that is not bad for a downtown restaurant. Â For me, this meal was Mexican food on steroids. Â I loved every bite and it was just as good the next day. Â Now will I stop going to the corner taco stand? Â Nope. Â But I have been to the mountain as far as carnitas goes and my eyes were made to open to a new way of thinking about carnitas, so there is no turning back from that. Â Pork, I am still madly in love with you, but from time to time I am going to cheat on you with that damn crispy duck from Frontera Grill.
The manager should be fired. We have never had worst customer service from a manager. Â She was rude, argumentative and completely condescending.

I was so excited to be on vacation and finally eating at Rick Bayless' place. It did not disappoint. It took some time to get the cocktails and the appetizers, but everything was well worth the wait. The sopecitos were amazing and the dessert... OMG the dessert. The apricot gelato was one of the most divine things I have ever had. Then you get a bite of the sweet corn ice cream and it is just the freshest most surprising flavor in a dessert and it was delicious. I think we licked the bowl. The pictures dont do this food justice. Cant wait to get back to Chicago to try it again and again!

Frontera Restaurant Week 2021 did not disappoint!! The margaritas aren't very large, but they are so tasty/fresh and shaken tableside. The appetizer options (ceviche, corn masa quesadillas, and tamales) were all incredible and started the meal on a high note! The Skate Wing and Carne Asasa Brava entrÃ©es were so delicious. And the meal was perfectly complete with the dessert choices, both of which were phenomenal (Oat Milk Flan and Chocolate Tres Leches). The Tres Leches has a topping that was like marshmallow fluff- yum! While I do wish the portions would have been a bit bigger, it was overall a lovely meal. The ambiance was okay. We were outside in the tent and the heat lamp was definitely broken/off (even though the hostess told us it worked), so on a chilly and rainy evening it wasn't the best spot for dinner. They also still have Christmas decorations (like Santa, Christmas Trees, etc) hanging inside the tent, which was weird.  *Oh, and they do add a 20% Service Charge, so just keep that in mind when you get the bill*
Everything was beautiful and delicious: Guacamole, Oysters, and my favorite was the perfectly cooked Carne Asada. So flavorful!

I'm just a girl on a solo trip weekend getaway and they were so sweet to give me a birthday surprised.  The food was amazing. The waiter is attentive even when I'm sitting outside in the patio. Thank you Frontera! I will definitely be coming back

I was here recently for lunch. The service was perfection. I think they share tables because a few different people came by to check in and they were all very friendly. I ordered the limonada, sopecitos, chicken taquitos, and the carne asada brava. The mashed potatoes are amazing. My steak was undercooked and they fixed it for me quickly. The tomato pepper sauce that comes with the steak is very spicy, a little too much for me, but the quality is good. I love this place still and look forward to returning. I stopped in again for lunch and sat in the bar area. I tried the tortilla soup, the little gem salad, the pork flautas, limonada, flan, and ice cream with hot fudge. I did not love the dressing on the salad and the flan was bland. I liked everything else. The flautas need something to balance the spicy red sauce though, like crema or guacamole. The scoop of ice cream was tiny but the chocolate was very good.

I was here recently for dinner with my bestie. Overall we loved the dÃ©cor, the service, and the food. We started with the flavored water, which was much more flavorful than we expected. We also got the lime drink, which is very fresh and sour, but you get used to the flavor. My friend got the chicken quesadilla with vegetarian black beans. I got the carne asada tacos with the pinto beans and guacamole. We liked the black beans better. The cheese tamale was good and we loved the plantains. We liked the chips and salsa but would prefer more user friendly salsa dishes over the tiny square ones they give you. Overall we were very happy and will return. I think Xoco next door is equally good at a lower price point if budget is a concern.

Great food ! Â  Frontera's has a program where they let you order food and then on a certain day they deliver it to the northern Chicago suburbs for you to reassemble in their dinner kit. Â We did this and got our bag of food yesterday and it was great! We started with tostadas (pictured here) and they were easy to heat, assemble, and they were fantastic !!! Â We would definitely get this again. Â  Next we got the short rib enchiladas and they were really good. Â I didn't take Â a picture but it was great. Â   Lastly we got the Â topolo margarita and it was very good. Â They don't include any salt but we had some so no worries.  It was a great experience and the instructions were laid out well and easy to follow.

The food was great. Unfortunately their service is lacking. As is the world in Chicago today, we had an unfortunate incident with a mentally ill gentleman screaming at our table and the table next to ours. We resolved the issue with no help from multiple onlooking employees, but later wanted to make the situation right for the table next to ours. The manager refused to help with the situation and would not allow me to buy a round of drinks at the bar for the table next to us. After assuring us that she would handle the situation, she did not address it. The establishment serves great food, but does not care about the diners experience. We saw multiple other disappointed guests. I guess you can do that when you are in downtown Chicago. Others may dine in the future, but you will not see many return guests...

Rick Bayless who introduced America to the Oaxacan Â kitchen still runs this awesome source for excellent dining, very causal, still very good and still standing strong. During Chicago's much stricter protocols than Los Angeles, FG is open for outdoor covered and aerated dining (one side of the rectangular outside dining room is open, facing the restaurant -- less chance of frigid wind blowing in). Â Other restaurants are following suit.  The travails of the restaurant scene in Chicago can be sensed here: digitaledition.chicagotrâ€¦ We had the smoked chicken tacos (a signature treat), guacamole, salmon, carnitas and much to our expectations the food was as I remember: original, delicious and authentic (Rick Bayless was an anthropologist studying in Mexico when he was smitten by authentic cooking history and products). Â For a non-native I appreciate his respect to authentic Cooking traditions.  Loved the food, loved the service. Muchas gracias SeÃ±or Bayless for staying consistent and serving food I can revisit over and over again. Â  Tip: Adjacent to Â Topolobampo. Â  He opened a causal tortas, churros, joint next door to that called Â Xoco that serves signature tortas at his outpost in ORD. Â Love the churros and tortas here also.

I went out to Frontera Grill today where they offered indoor seating (due to the new Chicago guidelines). On a Saturday night it was pretty full, so I would recommend making a reservation on their website before going. The food was great at a reasonable price and the service was excellent.  We got the Friday/Saturday special which was baby back ribs with grits and mango slaw. The seasoning on the ribs were great but it was a little dry. I also thought the grits were a little too sweet. I also tried their little gem salad which was fine but nothing special. We also tried the cheesecake with grapefruit on top which was fantastic. Perfectly sweet, tangy, and sour. The cheesecake was the star of the show!

TL;DR: the service sucked, but the food was great, which was the saving grace.  We made a reservation for 7:30 pm yesterday. Arrived like 5 minutes late, but still had to wait around 20 minutes. It happens.  It took a good 10 minutes just for our server to come by. We ordered margs... one person asked what kind they have, they picked cucumber, he warned them it was spicy, so they said n/m, I'll have a regular. Apparently that meant they don't get a drink, because only 3 margs came. It took 5 minutes for us to get his attention and he said they didn't want the spicy one.... Huh? We also ordered apps.. chips and salsa, tortilla soup, and the quesadillas. All were delicious.  It took a long time for us to get any attention after that. I had to flag the waiter every time I needed something. Like... our drinks are literally empty and the ice is almost melted, can you come by and offer us another drink? Finally, they come by to ask for our entree orders. We ordered skirt steak tacos, both enchiladas dishes, and carnitas tacos. All were delicious. Food was great.  Then when it came to check time, the servers disappeared... we waited probably 20 minutes just to get someone to get us check. We were tired from a long day. We waited 5 minutes for the check and nearly 10 minutes for our cards back after.  And for this great service, we were forced to pay 20%. As much as I wanted to love this place, I won't be back... I've had better service at Tacos El Norte. It's a shame, because the food is delicious.

I went to Frontera Grill once many years ago and had such fond memories of my experience there (it's the only restaurant I can ever recall, literally licking my plate). So of course I was excited to come back and try this place again, but for takeout. Needless to say, I was very disappointed. I paid $24 for a salad (with chicken) and an appetizer. Everything felt just OK. But I felt that they were very stingy with their ingredients. For $16, I got a salad that consisted mostly of lettuce, a tiny container of dressing (that, tastewise was just OK), and a fairly paltry portion of chicken. (The chicken is an extra $7; the salad without is $9). The other appetizer was also OK and honestly tasted like it could have come from a supermarket. I probably won't be coming back.

Went here for a friend's pre-birthday celebration so let's just say there were lots of drinks and some food involved. Upon entering, I was excited to be seated in the restaurant which seemed buzzing but we were sat in the lounge downstairs. It was a decent lounge but the upstairs bit caught my eye a little more. For drinks, I started off with Misty's Sleeve because I love me a good sour cocktail, so I asked out server to amp up the sourness and dial down the spice of this one. Really enjoyed this cocktail but we were all here to have a good time so none of us were stopping at one. The next couple of drinks I ordered were the Passion fruit Margharita which was pretty sour and sweet hence quite perfect.  To accompany the drinks, we shared a trio of regular Guac and chips which was very enjoyable and went down rather quickly. To have something more substantial, we all shared literally all the tacos on the menu. My top three were the Shrimp, Chicken and Pork Tacos. Should I go again, I would only order more of the Shrimp tacos because that won it for me. We also got a couple of shots since the occasion was celebratory. Even though the night ended up hazy for the alc consumed was high in count, the Mercadito experience was a memorable and positive one.

Five stars for our server Genesis, super sweet and gave great drink recommendations. We got the watermelon margaritas, so good!  My Baja fish tacos were okay. I would like to try something different next time because my friends seemed to really enjoy their food.

I've been wanting to try this place ever since living in the River North area and was finally able to try it this last weekend!  I love Mezcal but there was only one drink on the menu with Mezcal which didn't sound the best to me. The bartender quickly suggested adding Mezcal to the Pepino and it was delicious! One of the best drinks I've had in a while.  We started with the seasonal guac which was delicious and included pomegranate seeds. For our main meal, we got Mahi Mahi tacos were were similarly delicious. The exterior was deliciously crispy and the inside was tender and juicy.  I will definitely be back! On a Friday night, it was definitely a little noisy so probably not the best spot for a first date but otherwise is a very fun atmosphere!

Mercadito was SO MUCH FUN! I went with a few friends over the weekend and thank goodness we made a reservation, because this place was buzzing. We were seated shortly after arriving and were greeted by our fabulous waitress, Constance. She informed us right away about the 90 minute reservation time per table, which was really appreciated. She knew the menu Â well and had wonderful suggestions for all things food and drink. Myself and a friend started with the spicy aguacate: a spicy avocado margarita. Oh my goodness, this was one of the best margaritas I have EVER had! Perfect amount of spice, lots of salt, and just so flavorful. My other friends went with the amiga sandia, which is a watermelon margarita with basil. This was so, so good too! I cannot emphasize enough just how much we enjoyed the cocktails here. We decided to each place an order of tacos and share since they come with four each. We went with the baja, carne asada, pastor, and pollo. All the tacos were fresh, packed with flavor, and filling!  I was truly impressed with the ambiance, service, food, and cocktails here. I can't wait to come back bring more friends and family. I now understand why it's such a busy spot!

The stars are solely for the service which should receive 5 stars for the incredible bartender who made our first margs and our awesome server!  The food here doesn't deserve even 2 stars.  Chips seem store bought- not like what I remember from our first time here. We got 3 different salas all of which were not good. I LOVE spicy but two of them were actually TOO spicy and no flavor. The green is normally my favorite and this one had zero flavor. The server brought out a 3rd salsa after I requested that resembled thousand island dressing. I was very confused if he brought actual salad dressing or salsa. We got guacamole which also had ZERO flavor. Not to mention it's a tiny serving. All four of us ordered a different kind of taco plate. I'm usually the most basic and get chicken, it's just what I like. These were the most basic chicken tacos I've ever had in my entire life. They don't have pickled onions- only raw!? Wtf how does a Mexican place not have pickled onions!? So basically my chicken tacos were just dry chicken on a shell.  Brisket tacos- good but nothing to it other than brisket and a shell. Steak- best taco but still not amazing. Pork- kinda dry and also nothing to it. Brussel Sprouts- Tiny serving and they seem like they're drenched in some type of mayonnaise sauce. No clue but they were kinda just a soggy weird mess. I would not recommend this place to anyone! If you're in the area already go to Barrio which is right across the street. Antique tacos easily blows this place away! Also there are about 20 other amazing taco/margarita spots in the city to try! Sad we wasted our Friday night time & money here.

Thank you for your detailed review and your praise to our service! We are very sorry to see that you did not enjoy your meal. We would love to connect with you privately regarding the details of your meal to understand what went wrong. All of our tacos are presented with various toppings and fresh ingredients, and we are confident that if you gave us another try you would enjoy a dining experience more akin to the lofty standards we hold ourselves to.

So I stopped by for drinks here, did not try the food. I was blown away by their delicious cocktails. The bartender seemed a pinch grumpy but the drinks made up for it. The Avocado cocktail was my favorite.

Awesome service!! Awesome food!!! Awesome drinks!!! You will not regret it!! The waitress was very friendly, answered all my questions and was able to accommodate one of us with the food (she doesn't eat spicy) he made sure she was happy with her food. Overall every was GREAT!

Great place for tacos. Tried the pastor and the pollo tacos. While both were great, I preferred the pastor tacos because they had more flavor. The drinks were also good, tried the amiga sandia (watermelon margarita), pepino el pyu (cucumber marg), and the classic margarita. We also tried the Mac and cheese which was below average, but this is a Mexican restaurant so I'm sure it's not their specialty anyways.

I've had not been here in a few years but since i was going to be in the area a friend and i decided to dine here. I made reservations a few days prior. Reservations HIGHLY recommended! It's a popular summer spot. I decided to sit at the the outdoor patio.As inside is the hot spot it's loud, music and busy.About 95% of people did not have on a mask so you can decide if that's a place for you. The food was good and tasty i had the chicken tacos and a mango margarita. I give both a thumbs up. I also tried the papas with the spicy alioli sauce i think, pretty good also. Definitely a place to try!

Not a huge fan of this place. For starters, we tried to go here shortly after the city began reopening after COVID. They did not follow protocols (distancing, enforcing masking) so we skipped our reservation. Tonight friends picked this place and we didn't have a say. The place is super loud, making it very hard to have conversations. They shove soooo many people in and don't adhere to reservation times. We had a reso for 8 and didn't get seated until 9:15. Truly insane. The food is overpriced. I will say that the tacos were really good, but $17.5 for four small tacos is ridiculous. I was DD tonight but the others in our party said the margaritas were really good. They do get 2 stars for that and for the service.

Hi Mandy, Thank you for your review - we are so sorry about the wait time and would like to chat with you privately to connect about the issues you had as well as invite you back to join us again for a really great experience. We will be messaging you privately.

We made a reservation for restaurant week last night. We didn't even wait to be seated. One look at this place and they are clearly not taking COVID restrictions seriously. The tables are absolutely not 6 feet apart. Customers aren't required to put a mask on when servers approach. There is no protection for the bartender or patrons at the bar. Those waiting are allowed to congregate at the entry. And there is no way they are operating at less than 50% or whatever the current allowances are. This looks like pre-COVID operating. I get that restaurants are struggling but I can't imagine being a staff member here. We cancelled our reservation. Nothing about this experience looked safe. No food is worth contracting COVID or spreading it to those who might be more vulnerable.

I will say I enjoyed the food here. I was able to get a variety of tacos with someone and also the corn and the guacamole dip. We also enjoyed some margarita drinks which you can never go wrong. One thing that did make us uncomfortable was our waiter standing over me while I paid for my food and left tip. I'm not sure if this is policy or if this was just that one night and that one waiter. It just felt awkward to have someone over your back paying and putting in the tip. The tip and payment is put into a tablet by the way, so as she handed it to us to pay she waited there for us to be done and that's why it had to be done right there. Really turned a good outing into a weird one right as we were leaving.

I came here for a birthday dinner with friends, and it was definitely very busy on a Friday night. Even though we had a reservation, it took us a bit to be seated and served. The service was pretty slow because of the amount of people, and it was difficult to get our waiter's attention. Other than that, our experience was very fun and enjoyable.  The margaritas are delicious, and the guac and salsas were tasty but small. I loved how I could get the fish tacos in lettuce cups- these were fresh and flavorful. The Brussels weren't crispy and a little disappointing, but the potatoes were tasty as a side. Overall, this is a nicer Mexican restaurant for a night out, and the ambiance is fun. The portions are small and service on the slow side but expected in the river north area.

Loses two stars for adding a four percent covid surcharge. News flash, pandemic is over, restrictions are all lifted. Â Raise prices if must, ok. Â Adding surcharges is bs. Are they going to remove it one day? Â Of course, not. They have had it now over twelve months. Who do they think they are fooling??! Â Their competitors don't pull this garbage. Â Add this surcharge to tax and tip, and price you actually pay is over thirty percent above listed menu price  Lose another star because portion sizes are tiny for prices they charge. Too many better alternatives. Â Go elsewhere.
Hi, thank you for your review. We no longer collect any COVID-19 tax and have not enforced this surcharge in quite a while.

Went here for a birthday lunch with my friend. It is easy to miss from the street. It's a really small hole in the wall place from the outside, but the inside is absolutely beautiful. We ordered the crispy chipotle shrimp to share. It was amazing! The flavor of the chipotle is sauce is perfect!  Then I ordered the camaron tacos and my friend ordered the carne tacos. Both were incredibly tasty. The camaron tacos are very liquidy due to the chipotle sauce inside but I think they were still amazing. Just be forewarned if you are sensitive to texture.  Overall, loved my experience and the food!

Went on a Thursday evening , was lucky enough to book a spot for 2 +1 yr old just two hours before our dinner time so that was nice. Â But they were definitely busy, trying to get you in & out - which was good bc our food was speedy quick to arrive but the waitress/waiter was definitely trying to get you through quickly. They were great at refilling waters though, always asked if you wanted something more to eat/drink. Food was great as well too! Â Not cheap, but the (carne) tacos were stuffed full and super fresh tasting. My husband didn't love his mahi-mahi tacos and they were a little skimpy on the flavor & amount of stuffing in those ones. The guac was a hit (extra, but complimentary), especially with our 1yr old.

Nice taco place in a good location. Parking isn't hard to find. There is a parking garage across the street, or you can try and find street parking. The margaritas were good. I really enjoyed the parajo loco, great for pics. The guacamole was ok, we just had the traditional. I had the shrimp tacos, very good. The shrimp came in some type of garlic sauce, which were the only 2 things on the taco. It comes with 4 small tacos, so if you're hungry order a side. I also tried the street corn, it was pretty good as well

Visited Mercadito for drinks and appetizers! Fun and lively atmosphere! Queso was delicious, make sure to ask for tortilla chips for dipping (in addition to the flour tortillas it is served with)! Service was average.
The food was great, great atmosphere, however I do not recommend coming here for a birthday or with a group larger than 4 people. They do not split checks and leave you to do the the math.

Thank you for your feedback and we are so glad you enjoyed the food and atmosphere! We are very sorry about your experience with how the bill was handled. we'd love to invite you back for a discounted meal so that we can make this right, and will be reaching out privately. This billing policy is currently under review by management. We hope to see you back soon!
I recently went there and saw so many amazing products. The food was great and affordable. I would definitely recommend this place!

While spending labor day weekend in Chicago (being a tourist in our own Chi town), we came across Mercadito and it didn't disappoint at all. While most restaurants were buzzing in River North, this one seemed a little less busy and off the main grid, Â we were a little unsure of what to expect! Mercadito was a pleasant surprise to our expectations and we had one of the best 'from scratch' tapas style meal. Their street quesadillas were our most favorite dish, Â other items such as flautas, chicken tacos and fish tacos were equally delicious! Their habanero salsa was more flavorful then most other places we've tried (there's a $3.50 upcharge for salsa, Â which I didn't like). The food was delicious and so was their customer service. Â Highly recommend trying this place out and it will for sure exceed your expectations!

Finally stopped into this place after passing it every time I walk down Milwaukee! Very delicious tacos and price was reasonable. I got a special taco (Chica.. something, I can't remember), the Garlic Shrimp and Crispy Fish. The special and Garlic Shrimp were so good! Crispy Fish was just okay. My roommate got the chips and salsa and both were great!  Would recommend and would come back!

I had no idea this place existed until my husband casually mentioned it. I am so glad he did! We tried the Potato and Poblano tacos. The sweet and spicy chicken tacos, the crema de elote, and the Horchata milkshake. Potato-poblano: AMAZING!  Sweet and Spicy chicken: tastes like a Mediterranean taco...not my favorite. Something was missing...it was a bit dry.  Crema de elote: Great, loved the flavor and the chips that go with it are authentic, crispy, perfectly salted.  Horchata Milkshake: DO NOT SKIP THIS! I would come back just for this shake. It's the perfect amount of sweet, surprisingly refreshing, and the perfect amount of richness.  Definitely coming back. We ordered our food to go so not too much staff interaction but they seemed very nice.

Sweet and spicy chicken taco was my favorite. The beef is good too, not too spicy if you avoid the peppers. And their house chips are amazing. Staff is very friendly, patient with all my questions about ingredients (because I'm allergic) and masked up of course. The park benches outside are ideal on a nice day.

Found myself in Wicker Park on Sunday and we were wandering up and down Milwaukee looking for a place to grab a quick bite. I'm so happy we landed on Antique Taco! The set up is easy enough- order your tacos at the counter and grab a table. Since this was my first visit here, I went simple and got the steak taco (my go-to anywhere) and the crispy fish. The crispy fish actually ended up being my favorite! I loved how the smoked cabbage complimented the the fish (that was ACTUALLY crispy). The steak taco had a lot of good flavor too and I loved the queso that came on it. The tacos are decently sized, but at $5(ish) a taco, the price is definitely up there. The quality of ingredients definitely makes it worth it in my opinion though! My husband got the fried chicken burrito. He LOVED it and has brought up going back multiple times since sunday LOL. I kept stealing the chips the burrito was served with because they were so tasty. Since we were in and out pretty quick, we didn't get the chance to try some other menu items. Really looking forward to another visit and trying the chips/salsa and the horchata milkshake!

My Chicago taco search has been dreadful... Antique was next on my list to try.  The service:  I can't speak to this much. I ordered to-go each time. There are always adequate napkins and they give you salsa, and the people are kind.  The food:  I tried the pork carnitas, garlic shrimp, grilled steak, and the crispy fish.  The pork carnitas is delectable and there is a slice of bacon to top it. The carnitas with bbq sauce is well seasoned.  The garlic shrimp is the least of my favorite, but still good. The elote cauliflower adds a different taste. I am not certain I like the kale with this taco - it stands out more than it should.  The grilled steak is one of my favorites. The flavors go really well together and the steak is SEASONED and tender. It doesn't require the other taco dressings to pull it up (like many tacos I've had around Chicago).  The crispy fish taco is a welcomed surprise and it is also another favorite. The smoked taste of the cabbage and the spicy tartar sauce stand out. Cod is such a light fish, but still stood out and was nice and flaky. It is a good combination of flavors! I finally have a trusty taco place in Chicago. I've tried many - I just like seasoned food, down to the meat, which should be able to stand alone. *I will be back

My go-to is the Antique Taco Salad, add chicken. It's so filling and tastes great but still seems healthy. Always comes with a generous portion of strawberries! Just had the fried chicken burrito for the first time and it was so good. Had a nice little kick to it too.  Tacos are all solid - I haven't found a favorite yet but do chicken and shrimp most often.  Nice outdoor seating off the main street. Simple seating indoors.

Ate lunch here a couple of weeks ago. Greeted at the counter by a very friendly, helpful young lady. Best tacos I've had in many years. Between my husband and I, we tried the steak, pork, chicken, cod (with smoky cabbage) and shrimp tacos. All fantastic in their own way. Also had their elotes which was so good, we got another container to take home. I tried their strawberry basil margarita which was obviously hand-crafted and one of the most delicious cocktails I've ever had. Good thing we don't live closer or we'd be broke from wanting to eat here all the time.

Came to check this place out for lunch and it was amazing! We literally ordered probably everything on the menu hahaha and had drinks soooo good! If ever in Wicker Park in Chicago this is another great place to check out for tacos, margaritas , and more. Definitely did not disappoint l!

Such a delightful place! I have Crispy Fish taco, Grill Steak taco, and Garlic Shrimp taco for to go. While waiting for the meal, I took several pics for their cute mural and that made my day. Needless to say, their tacos are in such a beautiful traying, it's colorful, healthy, Â and absolutely tasty!  Personally recommend:  Crispy Fish: fried fish, red cabbage with spicy sauce  Garlie Shrimp: crispy kale with seasoning shrimp

Tried the garlic shrimp, carnitas and the special mushroom fajitas tacos. Annnd wow so flavorful. I didn't even want to put salsa on them.
