But i did because I had to try it so ate each taco half with salsa half without.  Each taco was felt light but rich with flavor and a pretty good size. The tortilla has good flavor and holds up. No breaking even after scooping some thick salsa.  Garlic shrimp was incredible. I kept stopping to think what flavors I was getting because each bite was almost completely different. I think my tastebuds were just exploring everything on that taco.  Carnitas taco was good. Almost a lighter and fresh version of a pulled pork sandwich.  Mushroom fajitas taco was great as well. If it wasn't for texture you could have fooled me and told me it was steak. Also the toppings that just make all these tacos complex and delicious.  The spicy salsa wasn't spicy, it had a little kick but it was delicious. I'm curious to how it was made. I got some butternut squash flavor. And it was a bright burnt orange color.  This is definitely a place where you can enjoy some tacos and eat them like if you were a sommelier.

Food: I got the shrimp taco, pork and steak. Pork and steak one's were off the charts good. The shrimp one was also fantastic, but it felt like an exploration taco (kale, eggs, shrimp).  - Also make sure you get their hot sauce and salsa. Vibe: natural sunlight, wood tables, good place for lunch Service: Â fast and nice

I am in LOVE. Antique Taco, don't ever change.  I ordered delivery through DoorDash, full well expecting that the food would not be in its prime. But if this was not its prime, then what does the fresh version taste like?! The chips are not too thin and not too thick but fried and salted flawlessly. The creamed elote was creamy, spicy perfection with both tapatio and tajin. But the best part? The homemade tortillas for the tacos. They were on par with those I've had from a true, Mexican home and I'm downright obsessed.  I've had more than my fair share of Mexican food, having married into a Mexican family and lived in Los Angeles. And Antique Taco is Mexican food perfection I thought only existed in my head. There's not even a hint of "too trendy" or "over hyped here." It's an elevated authentic, and I can't wait to order more on the menu. You can't go wrong with this spot.

The tacos were good but overall a bit pricey for me. I'd be happy to eat Antique Taco again though.  We did delivery during covid. Everything was neatly transported and I'm glad they threw in some salsa as well.  We started with a tortilla soup which was just ok. I wouldn't get it again. It was a bit bland and was crying out for some chicken or something more. I was glad to have the cheese and tortilla chips sent separately.  We also started with some elote which wasn't quite elote. It was tasty but it was technically like creamed corn with elote seasoning. Definitely not quite what was expected. I did like the roasted salsa quite a bit though. Oddly it was like a hint of creme was added to this as well.  Not a wide variety of tacos, the classic options, all done right. The pork was the best, most heavily seasoned. I would definitely go for this again. The chicken was a bit average but spicier than expected which was nice.

I've heard great things about Antique Taco, so when the craving for tacos hit, I knew I had just the spot! A Sunday afternoon delivery order was fast, food was warm, and everything was packaged well. I ordered three tacos (pictured) and my boyfriend got the Fried Chicken Burrito. We had to order the Creamed Elote after hearing rave reviews, too! Glad we ordered it becuase it was my favorite part of the meal.  With tacos priced between $4.95-5.50, there are definitely cheaper options out there, but the interesting flavor combos at Antique Taco and quality of ingredients seem to warrant the price. However, I was so disappointed in my Grilled Steak Taco. The meat was SO dry and chewy, it hurt my jaw to chew through a bite. There weren't many other flavors or textures on the steak taco so I dumped my salsa on to salvage the priciest taco in my order. Maybe it was an off day for steak? The Pork Carnitas and Sweet and Spicy Chicken tacos were good, Pork being my favorite. I'd be willing to give Antique Taco another shot with a few order modifications. That Creamed Elote was just too good to forget!

One hit and one miss on my test run for Antique Taco. I was looking for a new taco place and tried the two on the menu that by far looked best to me: steak and fish. The former was great, but I could barely stomach the latter.  The takeout process at the side window was efficient and friendly. When I got home and opened my container, the smoky smell of the sauce on the fish taco was overwhelming. I gave it a chance, and unfortunately it just wasn't for me: the sauce overwhelmed it and made the fish taste off. It might have been less overwhelming if the ratios were better: lots of sauce and cabbage, but the piece of fish barely stretched half the diameter of the tortilla.  On the brighter side, the steak taco was outstanding! It had a very generous amount of flavorful and nicely cooked steak, and a pile of arugula to provide some freshness and bite. The salsa that came with the tacos was very tasty but unnecessary given how much great flavor this one had.  So, the best I can do is three stars for this visit. I'd order the steak taco again in a heartbeat, but I'm skeptical about the rest. They have more creative combinations than most taco places, but I think it's just not for everyone.

I've been here twice, but the most recent time I was most impressed. I got the fried chicken burrito, and it was so good! They definitely don't try and be authentic, but the flavors were all there. I like how they added some greens to contrast everything else that was fried. The burrito was also a better price point than the tacos. I don't remember which tacos I had gotten the time before. I remember liking them, but I don't remember exactly what was in them. They have a window where you can order outside, which is nice for warm summer days and covid precautions. I've never seen what the place looks like on the inside because I'm pretty sure it's been closed since I discovered the place.

Stopped in Antique Taco in Wicker Park this past weekend. Â We ordered the Taco 10 Pack to go. Â The tacos were packaged well and made it through our travels home. Â We ordered the Sweet & Spicy Chicken with jalapenos on the side and the Pork Carnitas . The chicken was not too spicy , and the pickled onions and cucumbers added a bit of spice . Â The pork was very good. Â It came with a full bacon slice on top, along with avocado , onion, queso and spinach. Â The spinich was not necessary and did not add much flavor. The pork carnitas tacos were so good and all the flavors were a perfect blend. Â Would definitely try again.

DELICIOUS TACOS! It's a little on the pricey side for tacos, but it's well worth it. You must try the habanero salsa. It's not terribly spicy, but incredibly tasty and smoky. The elote side is a must to share for the table. Adorable space and very eco-conscious!

OMFG, best steak tacos I've ever had, and I spent 20 plus years in Southern California. Beats Big Star by a long shot. Huge tacos, that include onions, what I believe was arugula, and a side of hot sauce that is the perfect amount of heat. Two and I was full!

The tacos were pretty good in taste! We got the potato poblano one that's on the menu and 2 others that were on the specials. I just wish they had more than 1 vegetarian tacos on the main menu! Â We got lucky because 2 of the specials happened to be vegetarian. They have few benches outside for seating which is nice in the summer!

I've walked past this place a bunch of times. Finally my brother and I decided to check it out.  The atmosphere is awesome! Great Latin decor combined with perfect tempo music. It makes you want to try everything and dance while you do so.  My brother ordered the torta which is what I intended to. Unfortunately, I decided to go with the Jibarito. While it was pretty good, it paled in comparison to his. The combination between really dry plantain flour(?!) for the breading, the moist chicken breast, and the raw vegetables made for an impossible-to-hand-eat mess of a sandwich. The flavors weren't a bad combination when I could get them all at once just not what I had in mind.  Again, I mis-ordered so this is still a five star place. The food my brother had was amazing, the rice/beans side dish was amazing, and the drinks were mixed just right. I'm looking forward to returning to try anything else on the menu!

This is a favorite spot in my neighborhood, with fast and friendly service, and delicious food.  Most recently my friend and I went here for brunch on a weekday. It's exciting to see a local business so busy and energetic even on off hours! The place was busy but we were seated pretty quickly and both had egg based breakfasts (she had an omelet and I had one of the rice and beans and eggs options). The food was great, as was the iced coffee.  One thing to note- it's a very small space so probably not ideal to bring strollers into, and may require some maneuvering during busy hours with wheelchairs. I'll definitely keep coming back and enjoying this local gem!

Overpriced the entire menu This isn't TimeSquare or Downtown Jibarito should not cost +$14.95 and EXTRA FOR CHEESE!!!!! Some of the dishes lack flavor including the Jibarito. 4oz of Wine $9.00!!! Stop it please stop it.

Disappointed. Embarrassed. Â I eat here 3x or more a week, going on 3 years... work schedule. Â  Anyhow, Â I showed up with family and friends and was told I couldn't get a table until everyone showed up.... but tables were empty?! Â Almost everyone including owner see me weekly! The staff is also trained to quickly remove your plate if it looks half way empty. Â They don't ask you, Â they take it! The waiter was so annoyed that we kept on ordering and wouldn't close our check. Â  Food is ok but def not a 4 or 5 star so please.... I struggle to return and see customers leave dont continue losing customers. Â There are many great places in the neighborhood that will easily wipe you out. Revisit your strategy. Â Perhaps start a reservation system. Â Waitlist. Open table. And let me/us enjoy my $200+ tab, Â family, Â food and moment.

This place was suggested to me by a friend and Definitely now is one of my favorite places to go to. Love the food, fast service. One of my favorite dish here is Chilaquiles Verdes. Highly recommended

Amazing food, drinks and service. The food came out fast and was fresh, generously portioned and piping hot. I got the huevos con bistec and would highly recommend. The cafe con leche was also perfection and the freshly squeezed orange juice was both refreshing and delicious. I will definitely be back again.
Wow wow  Latin food  Puerto Rican  Mexican food  Cuban food  Triple threat  Lol My kinda restaurant
Got takeout and the food was Great. Good size portions especially the burrito. Â Came fairly fast as well

Went here this weekend with my boyfriend. I got the chilaquiles verdes, which came with rice and beans, and my boyfriend got the chorizo and avocado omelet which came with potatoes. We got empanadas as the starter and they were so good! The chicken tingga ones were our favorite! Horchata and the cafe con leche from here were really good too! Friendly staff and cool area! Would come again!
Excellent Chilaquiles Verdes with a side of avocado and cappuccino. I enjoyed this while sitting on the sidewalk, watching the world go by.

We really enjoyed our dinner here. We had a reservation, and was given a table right away. They did take a little long to take our order, and once the order was taken, I had to wait patiently once again for my drink to arrive. But other than that their service was flawless.  I tried their house margarita for $6 during happy hour. Regular price is $10 so I jumped on that real quick. My wife ordered their Ropa Vieja sandwich and I ordered their Asada Enchiladas once I noticed that they are served with skirt steak.  The Ropa Vieja sandwich was served with rice and black beans. The sandwich itself was delicious. Shredded braised beef served with cotija cheese packed in between French bread.  My skirt steak enchiladas were amazing. The skirt steak was diced and covered with salsa ranchera and crema. The steak was perfectly cooked but would have preferred the salsa to have a little more of a kick. It was still flavorful and served with a side of Mexican rice and retried beans.  You can't come to Cafe con Leche without actually ordering some Cafe con Leche. It was delicious and large so leave some room for some after dinner sipping.  We wanted to try some dessert and were shocked to see they actually offered Capirotada. I've never seen Capirotada on any menu ever, so we had to get it. You get a slice of house made Mexican bread pudding made with chocolate abuelita, piloncillo sauce topped with vanilla ice cream. It was very filling and you could tastes hints of that abuelita.  Overall, I really enjoyed my entire dinner and wouldn't hesitate returning. And they have parking in the rear which is a huge plus. I will be definitely back very soon.
50-60  mins

Last time I trick myself into thinking "this time will be different". Every single order regardless of delivery time is a soggy flavorless mess. This is the third and final time we order from Cafe con Leche. Avoid.
Had dinner recently ordered tapiqueÃ±a steak the meat was very tough and hard very disappointed. Please tell your chef tto marinade and season the meats. I will give you one more chance to come back.

This spot was cute and cozy!! The staff was amazing and we got our food right away for breakfast on a Monday ! Make sure you get the cafe con Leche it's such a yummy drink, not too sweet not too bitter. It's just right
Bistec sandwich we'll done is amazing 10/10 Enchiladas 7.5 /10 Big coffee / expresso selection The owner is super friendly. Takes care of the place very well

One would think it's a small restaurant but there are more tables and seats in the back. They were pretty busy when we came but since we had a reservation, we were sat down quickly. The menu we received did not have horchata in it but luckily, they have it! It was so refreshing and delicious! I have not had horchata in ages and this beverage definitely filled that void. It was not overly sweet, and just a perfect touch of cinnamon. We ordered a bunch of appetizers and dishes. The ceviche and empanadas were delicious. We had some plantains but I did not find them memorable. We also got chimichurri steak and steak jibaritos. Everything we got was tasteful and cooked on point. We also ordered caramel flan which was a perfect balance of sweetness and creaminess. One thing I regret is living too far from this place! They also have a parking lot in the back for customers!

This is one of those places I have often heard about for years and have walked past, but never made it inside. This past Saturday, I had the opportunity to swing by as a friend suggested we go for breakfast. I beat her there and knew we were gonna sit outside so they asked front or back. I didnt know there was a back patio and figured it would be better than the front and it was more than enough space back there. The woman controlling the seat situation told me they dont normally seat people that dont have their whole party there. Out of around 15-20 tables, only 3 were occupied so she figured it made sense to seat me at 9:30 am as it wouldnt have made any sense to have me standing around. Once seated and waiting for late ass, I decided to order a pineapple mimosa which was good. One she showed up, we ordered and I went for the breakfast burrito with chicken. I expected so much out of it and I just wasn't that good...lacked flavor. I assumed the refried beans and rice would be on the side, but it was in the burrito. Sauces didnt do much for it either.  I would like to try again for lunch or dinner, but not sure when.
I went here so many times for different occasions! Everyone loved the foods, drinks, and ambiance. The wait staff is so friendly and the food is delicious. I enjoyed the Cuban sandwich and breakfast!

Today, Sunday Jan, 17th I came to cafe con Leche for the first time. Â Very disappointed. This place has no taste in their food. Very simple and pricey for the amount of food you get. My server was not nice. I place my order, 3 empanadas. Two tinga and one beef. I shorty not even a min later called the server to change it to one of each, and he said "sorry I placed the order already" Â did NOT care to change it giving the fact that it hasn't even been.one min, I didn't think it was gonna be a problem. I was surprised the effort.they give to satisfy the customers. Â  My food was not tasty at all. The quality was very disappointing. There omelets don't even come with pancakes, everything is separate. Please check there menu before coming in here.

After a good morning run, my friends and I were looking for a good brunch spot in Logan Square. Â When we saw that this place had good breakfast burritos we were sold. Â To the surprise of none of us, the burritos were fantastic as advertised. Â Be sure to use the sauces they give you on the side to add some extra flavor and spice. Â The side of potatoes admittedly leaves a little to be desired from a flavor perspective, but besides that it was a fantastic meal. Â With outdoor seating both in front and behind the restaurant, this is a great option for your summer brunch.
I'm afraid of posting a positive review because if more like me post them, I'll never get a seat at this popular place.
50-60  mins

This place is such a comfort food place: quick, delicious and great portions! You order at the cashier and then like 5' later they bring out your food. I am not even kidding-- that was how fast they are! We ordered Korean pork BBQ tacos, Bulgogi "banh mi" and a small fries (not the Kimchi fries). Everything was so yummy!! Portion size is reasonable, not too small, not too big. If you know me, you know that I like to break down different qualities to review :)) Overall: 4.5/5 1/ Location: 4.5/5 Nice area, near a bunch of dessert and coffee places so you can walk around and get a few treats easily! Parallel parking, so at times it can be tricky. 2/ Food: 4.5/5 Food was delicious! My BBQ pork was very good, and the bulgogi on "banh mi" was a nice touch too. For the tacos, the cabbage was mixed in with the pork well (and the cilantro too). I think I might like some fresh flavor/ingredients sprinkled on top to make that the perfect Korean taco for me! 3/ Price: 4/5 Reasonably priced for the area. I wouldn't say they are super cheap, but based on location and portion, that was a decent price. I would recommend anyone who likes some Korean fusion food visit this place when you are in town! I had a great experience! The place is a little small though, so you might be sitting very close to another table.

Was in town for a concert and dined-in here before making my way to Lincoln Hall. The food was great! I ordered the shrimp banh mi (which I devoured before I got the chance to take a picture) + a kalbi taco and got both in less than 15 minutes. The staff was kind and helpful.  The shrimp banh mi was amazing. There were lots of good flavors that went well together, they surprisingly didn't overpower each other. Some very minors things though: the sandwich wasn't cut in half when served and it was pretty saucy so it wasn't the neatest eating experience. I'm not sure if shrimp banh mis are easily findable around the area, but as a New Yorker it was a nice surprise menu item that I don't see often enough. Definitely recommend!! The kalbi taco was filled with a generous amount of marinated meat and veggies. It was a tad on the more flavorful/slightly salty side, but was still pretty solid. Utensils and drinks are self-serve and the food is brought to the table (please clean up after yourself!). The place was not the largest which made it a little hard with the self-service, but it is definitely worth it because the food and staff. It seemed like a popular place given the amount of people going in and out. Hope to come back again when I'm in town!

Amazing Korean food, definitely try the shrimp or kalbi tacos, the tofu hotpot and fries are great too. Korean flavors with a modern twist, love all the food here. Shrimp, kalbi, fish tacos are a must try. The tacos are very loaded, meats and veggies all taste fresh and the flavors are rich and satisfying. They all do use a spicy mayo which is a little bit of an easy win but the food is executed well. The fries are some of my favorite from anywhere. Thin and crunchy with a creamy yet light dipping sauce.  I very pleasantly surprised by the tofu hotpot. the portion is bigger than other Korean places and comes loaded with a lot of extras like shrimp, clams, a mussel, and some meat. As well as I think two eggs vs the normal one. They all come together for a very filling and satisfying meal. I wish it could be spicier, so I'll try to ask for extra spicy next time. Utensils, water are self service, you order and they bring it out to you. atmosphere is nice and modern but the space is a bit cramped. Price is good, especially with the crazy inflation we've been seeing lately. This will definitely be one of my go to restruants and if you have the chance, definitely give them a shot!

We live so close by and this is a wonderful grab and go place with decent food and fast service. There are other Korean fusion/street food places in town, but somehow this place has more substantial menu items. It's definitely more friends hangout place rather than sit down dinner restaurant.

Definitely my favorite spot to get quick and tasty meal. I have been coming here for quite some time now. The taco and bibibum are always good choices. They also have bento box, which comes with rice, a salad, and choice of meat, and its huge so super filling.

Parking is non-existent, so save some time and commute/walk here and explore the area while you're at it. Plenty of seating inside and a few seats outdoors. Can get packed, but clears out quickly because the food comes out quickly! Order at the counter and they'll let you know which table to sit at. Someone will bring the food to you, but be sure to clear your own table! You can't go wrong with any of the tacos, but I would definitely focus most of your energy on the bentos or soups/hot pots. The tacos were underwhelming- fish could use a little extra seasoning and kalbi was too heavy-handed on the toppings. Â The star of the show is definitely the wings! It's 8 lollipops per order, perfect to share between two people. So crispy and the sauce is a perfect blend of sweet and (mildly) spicy.

This place was great just reading and watching how they have patrons assisting the staff in keeping the restaurant tidy. They have a list of rules on the table that mention things to follow. You basically bus your table for the most part. Getting into food, the Kalbi taco was something I wasn't expecting, the short rib meat with the slaw and and relish had an uncanny match, it was sweet and savory, but I wasn't gonna spend too much because each taco is 3.50. The OG chicken is definitely a share size and 1 serving can take care of 2 people easily. Would visit again.

All really good food in a a casual spot. Love that they have some classic Korean dishes but also modern takes on Korean food too. Ordered at the counter and was given a number where we were served pretty quickly. The food was great!! Really loved the bibimbop in the stone bowl - the rice at the bottom got nice and crispy so after mixing it up, there were wonderfully crispy bites throughout.  My partner really loves their tacos and said they didn't disappoint so I'll go with what he said! The kimchi fries were also good if you like kimchi :) surprisingly stayed crispy even under the veggies and sauces.  Definitely will come back here!

Best fusion for the right price. Del Seoul is playful with Mexican and Korean food and came up with an outstanding fusion menu.  Since there are plenty of Yelp reviews. I just give you my recommendation - go for tacos, you can't go wrong. If you are conscious of calories, skip the kimchi fries. Â The four of us ate so much yet we walked out spending less than $20 per person, drinks and 18% gratuity included.

Easy and convenient Korean food, served street style. What isn't there to love?  We came when it was close to closing time, and felt sheepish for eating within an hour of when the employees might be trying to get customers out. However, the service was friendly and efficient, and I didn't feel rushed to get my order in.  I came with a small party of 4, and we each ordered something different. Unlike a Taco Bell, everything tasted different from each other and had distinctive fusions of Korean flavor.  I got the Bulgogi Banh Mi. I was pleased with the tall mountain of fresh vegetables and picked vegetables on my sandwich, but the bulgogi felt a bit tough. I was expecting the meat to be a bit more juicy and filled with sauce, but it was on the dryer end (probably because it was closer to the end of the day). I wish they had added some sauce of some sort because it was all rather dry in my mouth, but everyone else's orders had no problem.

Came from Texas , found this gem on yelps, look so interesting about their Korean tacos, so we wanted to give them a try. Simple menu, easy choices. Not too pricey for Korean food. We wanted to try everything on the menu. We end up order hot stone bibimbap and bulgogy bento box. Very yummy!!! Another delicious food we explore here in Chicago not a big restaurant fir you to hang out with large group , but definitely a great place for your tummy if u love Korean simple food.

I don't know how many times to say this but the shrimp tacos at this restaurant are amazing! I've been eating these tacos for like six years every time I visit the city and it exactly hits the spot every time! The gamja fries are not to be forgotten too! The restaurant is super casual and they suggest to sit at the table for 60 minutes.

Ok I know the wings are supposed to be the star of the show... but the tacos here are the best I've had in the city! I LOVED them. My husband liked them but wasn't as thrilled as me. We came for the wings for him. He enjoyed them and the sauce but said they could have been crispier and we agreed, they could use a little more heat for our preference. I ordered the shrimp and the carne tacos and I loved them both. One of the best shrimp tacos I have ever had. I would definitely come back just for the tacos.

My friend said "this is the best restaurant in all of Lincoln Park". A bold statement but I'm not going argue! I can't believe I've lived here for 2 years and just came here for the first time, I could eat here once a week and be so happy.  Top favorite items include: Shrimp Tacos, Bulgogi Bento Box and the Bulgogi Sandwich.

Wow. Where have I been. I can't believe I haven't checked this place out until now. We arrived right right when they opened up. The line started getting pretty long after we placed our order and sat down. The guy that took our order was great. Very welcoming and assigned us a table once we were done ordering. About half of the people sat down and the other half were call in orders. This place was jumping!  I ordered their sesame-chili shrimp tacos, bbq pork taco, and their Kalbi Taco. The shrimp taco was my least favorite. It was very tasty, but my wife makes something similar at home and just didn't feel unique to me. TAnd I probably wouldn't order it again because of that reason. I would still highly recommend it though. It came with sesame chili aioli, onion/cilantro relish and their secret slaw. The bbq pork taco was my 2nd favorite. It tasted similar to al pastor but not quite there. Would order it again. My favorite was their Kalbi. The beef was tender with a hint of sweetness. It's marinated in sweet soy, and served with their onion/cilantro relish and their secret slaw.  The cool thing about this place is that they have a lot more to offer than just tacos. I'll definitely be coming back. They have wings that I want to try and we'll as their bento boxes. Can't wait!

LOVE this place!! Not the fanciest by any means, but anything you order will be amazing. It's the perfect lunch spot! Indoor and outdoor seating available. My husband and I always order the sesame-chili shrimp tacos and split the seasoned gamja fries. We each had 2.5 tacos and were content with the portions. My only critique is that the fries could have been seasoned a little more. Otherwise, be sure to check out this place in Lincoln Park!

The service was fast and great. The staff were very very friendly. I had a hard time finding a parking spot, but I also don't live in Chicago, and was only visiting. I would've given 5 stars, but I just wasn't a fan of the tacos. And to be fair, it might've been my own tastebuds that didn't agree. However, I did love the fries. Masks are required at this location. I would visit again for the Kimchi fries.

Missed dining here so much! I've been craving for the shrimp tacos and kimchi fries so finally had a chance to dine back at Del Seoul. I called prior to dining to make sure they were open. I was told it's first come first serve, and that indoor dining is open. There seem to be less tables than before with some space in between the tables. I felt safe dining there since it wasn't a full house on a Friday night.  Ordered shrimp tacos it was exactly what I remembered. They were really good! Kimchi fries- absolute must, my favorite!!!  Fish tacos- I think they're my new favorite! Definitely going to get them next time!  Kalbi tacos- it was more like bulgogi tacos to me... I wouldn't order again only because I'd rather have shrimp & fish tacos! BBQ pork tacos- I wasn't a fan of them. I wouldn't order again.  K-town chicken wings- they're lollipop chicken wings. I enjoyed the flavor and the size of the wings Service was outstanding. Restaurant was clean. I sat next to the large window that was open. I can't wait to go back and enjoy some more!

Forgot how good this place is! Easy and convenient Korean style street food. Prices are incredibly fair and the variety is definitely there. Typically I get the bibimbap bowl in the hot stoneware. However, wanted to try the Bento box and tacos (was just as good). They are following guidelines - mask wearing when you are ordering, but if you are sitting you can remove. Felt safe eating there. 10/10 recommend!

Admittedly, I don't LOVE everything on the menu but let me do enlighten you to the best I've tried. The shrimp taco, fish taco and kimchi fries. You will not be able to find anything like them in any other fusion restaurant. They are some of the best tacos period that I have ever had! I wish I was back in Chicago so I can get me some more of these!

First I ordered shrimp tacos, kimchi fries, and bbq chicken tacos. The shrimp taco was unique and the sauce was delicious. Each bite had sauce and plenty of it. The kimchi fries were great as well. The bbq chicken tacos were a little too salty for my taste and less unique than the shrimp tacos. Walking in I saw all the bentos and vowed I'll be back to try them! All decently affordable, good portions, and very delicious looking.

Amazing flavors!! Loved everything we tried and we ordered a lot thinking they would be bite sized.  BEWARE: Their tacos are large and filling. 2-3 per person is more than plenty!  Chicken tikka, Nashville hot tofu, falafel, battered cauliflower, brisket, shrimp and grits, Cuban pig - wonderful flavors and textures  You will not regret eating here
Sonia, we love to hear that! Thanks for stopping in and we hope to serve your favorite tacos again soon

I love Velvet Taco because they stay open late and always bring out fresh food! My go-to is the Nashville Hot Tofu, which is absolutely amazing. The Korean Fried Rice taco is okay, definitely not Korean but still tasty. Their tater tots are good but not wow-worthy.  The service is fast and I love how the place looks inside. Perfect place for a quick snack or meal!
Sarah, we love to hear that! Thanks for stopping in and we hope to serve your favorite tacos again soon

I feel like fusion tacos can be hit or miss, but I was pleasantly surprised at how the tacos here were actually pretty tasty. A friend highly recommended the brisket taco and it was definitely a must-try, really tender and juicy. I also tried the spicy tikka chicken taco and shrimp and grits taco, and those had so much flavor. The picnic chicken taco and korean fried rice taco were meh though IMO -- you couldn't taste any potato salad in the picnic chicken taco (I was looking forward to that part specifically), and the korean fried rice taco didn't have as much flavor as the other ones.  Service is pretty quick here and prices are not bad either.
Iris, we appreciate the 4 stars and for joining us! Glad to hear you enjoyed the #12 angus taco and we canâ€™t wait for you to enjoy our tacos again

So pleased with our visit! I enjoyed two tacos (friend paneer / Nashville hot tofu with a yummy ranch. I loved both of them and they were both super flavorful. Friends also ordered the 2 other vegetarian selections beer battered cauliflower/falafel and 2 pork tacos and everyone was in love with their taco choices and can't wait to go back! There is limited seating, but the vibes are right here from staff to music and of course tacos!

The tacos you probably haven't had before. TACOS WERE DELICIOUS! Each taco was unique varying from American, Indian, to Korean flavors. It's worth the visit when in Chicago. Seating was very casual and first come first serve.

I arrived in Chicago on a late flight and wanted something quick so I ordered online to pickup when I arrived (make sure to order on their website! Not through a third party to pay regular prices). I ordered a Rotisserie chicken, a Nashville hot tofu, and a Korean fried rice taco. They put cholula and a special hot sauce in the takeout bag. These were packed well so on my 10 minute walk home they did not spill or anything! My favorite was the Korean fried rice - it had the most flavor and texture. The rotisserie chicken tasted a tad dry, but was good if you add the special hot sauce they give you. I liked the flavor of the Nashville hot tofu, but the tofu was softer than my liking and with all of the sauce it was a little too rich/fatty
Hi Laura! Â So happy to hear that you enjoyed the variety of tacos we offer. Â We hope to see you again soon to enjoy some of your favorites.

We will be frequently visiting this place during our stay in Chicago. It's next door to out hotel and has solid food.  My husband had the jerk mango chicken taco. He enjoyed it. I had the mexi- Cali shrimp taco. I really liked it as well. The queso Blanco with the various salsas in it is definitely worth trying. Â The hot sauce is done very well. Â It has a smokey flavor to it along with a little kick- definitely ask for it on the side. Â The kick ass margarita is sweet but good. I didn't have much hope for since it was coming out of a machine but it was solid. Not to mention, I love the name- the velvet taco!

I was really impressed with this spot. I love the concept and think it's executed pretty well. There's a wide variety of tacos, and a few options for vegetarians. It also looks like a lot of fun for a night drinking.  My favorite was the chicken and waffles taco. The waffle was cinnamon-y and it truly felt like brunch in a taco. They've got three vegetarian taco options (falafel, Nashville tofu, fried cauliflower) and tater tots too!
Sophie, thank you for the rave review! Â We are so happy you enjoyed your tacos and the experience you had. Â We can't wait for you to join us again.

Carryout Order: Picnic chicken - rotisserie chicken, avocado crema, warm honey-dijon potato salad, crispy chicken skin, cilantro, flour tortilla. & MexiCali Shrimp - blackened shrimp, napa slaw, citrus lime crema, sriracha, avocado corn pico, micro cilantro, flour tortilla Chicken was dry. Blackened shrimp was cooked alright. In my opinion, these tacos weren't terrible but are a classic example of "less is more". Even if they want to go fusion style, I think there were too many ingredients that were a mess together instead of harmonizing. Tacos were pricey. I don't think they're worth it for quality but at least each taco is pretty packed.
Nolan, we apologize that our tacos didn't hit the spot for you. Â Please reach out to us at  Velvetgoldcoast@velvettaâ€¦  and let us know how we can make things right for ya!

So I lovvvveeeeee Velvet Taco. We ordered a Fried Paneer taco and a beer battered cauliflower taco, and OMG! Fried Paneer taco: Excellent! The paneer wasn't completely fried but I was happy that way. The flavors were soooooo goooood! Cauliflower taco: Complete surprise! How is that crunch being created? I love it. The spice with the corn create a wonderful contrast in taste. So two tacos should fill you up, but you can get an app or extra if you are super hungry. Price wise, not super bad. Service is alright, but it's a order and pickup place, not a dine-in type. There are seats upstairs if you want to seat in.  The food won't disappoint. Really.
Thank you for the 5-Star review! Â We are so glad you enjoyed some of our vegetarian options and we hope you come back soon to enjoy your favorite tacos!

Doesn't look grand but serves GRAND food! The fried paneer taco and the beer battered fried cauliflower taco are the best tacos I've had so far. It had the right amount of spices and offers a great fusion of Indian and Mexican food. I absolutely loved the taste and we ended up ordering the same thing twice. I wish this place had a branch in California! Great place for vegetarians craving spices.

Great food not nice people. We loved the queso Blanco. We were sure to get seats by the window first. Despite having a seat, we were told we had to get it" to go" . The margaritas and Paloma look great but No virgin options. The tacos were not worthy of a picture as they were smashed into the box. I tried to explain we had seats but rudely told sorry. Bad experience.

Velvet Taco is a solid taco spot that spices up its menu with unique flavors and ethnic influences and merges it into delicious bites. Service is pretty quick and there's a good amount of seating. If you come late, you just have to make your way through the lengthy line for Jeni's. The Spicy Tikka Chicken had a good cook and decent flavor. Light on the spice but they have condiments around to kick it up a notch.  Cuban Pig - Was a solid taco that hits as expected  Tacos are of decent size for the price.

Loved this place! The Indian fusion vegetarian taco options were so unique and delicious! Wasn't a huge fan of the falafel taco but loved the paneer one! The queso and chips are a must.  Perfect spot for a delicious meal that's quick and super satisfying. Will recommend to others!
Thanks for stopping by and trying out some of our unique tacos. Â We hope to see you again soon Isha!

Velvet Taco - open in Columbus Ohio! My mother and I ordered five tacos and their Tator Tots. We were definitely eating with our eyes as each taco is filled heartily with yummy goodness. The flavors are simply amazing. Each taco has the taste you would expect from its name.  While we did not finish all five tacos in one sitting, we did enjoy them a bit later that evening and they were still tasty.
Marie, we are so happy you and your mother enjoyed the tacos!!! Â We pride ourselves in global tastes and tacos filled with yummy-ness!!! Â We are happy ya'll were satisfied with the food!!!

It was so delish! Â I was pleasantly surprised. Â My brother and I each tried 3 tacos a piece. Â The cheese burger taco was my favorite that chicken taco was great too! Â The manager in training greeted us and explained everything to us. Â That margarita was perfect.

Short review- People Place Product Price The full review People - Hip groovy staff, hopping to get the order done in a line of mostly millennials at Noon on a Sunday!  Place - great location in the heart of rich Gold Coast. The second floor has a great view of the park in front of Carmines - nice spot for super car watching.  Product- Cuban taco was good. The black angus my wife like a lot. All the taco meats were generously portioned including the shrimp. However, the green chili pork is the piece de resistance. It seems to have cheddar grains in the taco, very distinctive. Quality in every bite.  Price - all the tacos except for the shrimp was about $4.50 the shrimp was $5.75. Folks the park across the street sells the most expensive Gelato/ice cream I've had in Chicago. The restaurants lining this triangle plaza are all very ritzy. Velvet Taco is in a bougie spot you can have on a beer budget.

Pretty good tacos. I loved it. I ordered the Buffalo chicken, rotisserie chicken, and spicy tikka chicken and the fish and chips. My favorite would probably be the fish and chips. I am biased for fish tacos. Second favorite was probably the Buffalo bc I always love a good chicken tender.  The one I liked the least was the chicken tikka, only bc I don't like rice and didn't realize it had in there. Other than that flavor was good.  I liked the rotisserie because it had a lot of freshness to it like lettuce and tomatoes, and corn.

While I've gotten tacos from here over the years, I feel like it could be a hit or miss. Sometimes the ingredients are dry (Cuban pig, always) but other times it's good. This most recent time it was GOOD.  My bf and I took tacos to-go since it was near closing time. He ordered the Korean pork and I got the Grilled Flank Steak and Shrimp 'n Grits, both which I've ordered before. He liked his and I really enjoyed mine. Meat was tender, both were flavorful, and they really hit the spot after a couple of drinks.  I love to come back here when I'm looking for specialty tacos.

Still, hands down, my favorite taco place.  My friends and I came here after a night out (move over Chinatown and McDo's). I don't know why we didn't do this sooner.  The place was busy but nothing crazy. I ordered the Kobe or wagyu burger taco and the shrimp 'n grits taco. The burger taco was really good but the shrimp 'n grits one was AMAZING.  This place is worth going to at any time of the day.

I finally came back after a year! I went in October with a friend. I ordered the flank steak taco, Cuban pig taco, and the margarita. The flank steak was still my favorite. It was tender, juicy, and cooked to perfection! The Cuban pig was decent. The margarita was quite strong and for a good price too. I'll be coming back here for a long time!

I LOVED this place :) I went here with some friends to catch up because one of them said she heard raves about their tacos. I ordered the Cuban Pig and Grilled Flank Steak. The steak was my favorite but I will definitely come back to try the others. I have suggested the place to my mom and other friends, but maybe I should keep it to myself so only I know about it :P (just kidding). Also, the Crispy Tots & Local Egg was mouthwatering and delicious.  The place also looks nice: clean and very colorful. Two floors and long tables with stools. The mural is great, too. We are all her when we eat here!

I was very surprised by how good this place was. Not a lot else was open for food on a Tuesday night around us, so that's why we came here to be honest. Being from San Diego, we are spoiled by top notch tacos, so my expectations were low. But, the tacos we got tonight were so delicious. We got two steak, one or the Indian curry, and one Buffalo. So delicious.  I spoke with the manager afterwards to let him know and he was very humble. Would recommend.
Nima, we appreciate you stopping by and leaving such a wonderful review of your experience with us. Â We hope to see you again the next time you're around!

Best taco and good portion ! We go to del Seoul for tacos but this place blows them away ! My Jew favorite place for tacos . The portions are generous. Which I appreciate. I wished we lived closer so we could go more often ! Definitely the best fusion taco In the area !

Went in for the galbi Jim with cheese. Very spicy so perfect for those who want to try a spicy challenge but you can ask for less spicy! Don't underestimate it! Service was great and you can ask to mix the remaining sauce with rice to finish it off! I would save some meat to throw that in the mix! Would recommend!

Went in for the galbi Jim with cheese. Very spicy so perfect for those who want to try a spicy challenge but you can ask for less spicy! Don't underestimate it! Service was great and you can ask to mix the remaining sauce with rice to finish it off! I would save some meat to throw that in the mix! Would recommend!

Went in for the galbi Jim with cheese. Very spicy so perfect for those who want to try a spicy challenge but you can ask for less spicy! Don't underestimate it! Service was great and you can ask to mix the remaining sauce with rice to finish it off! I would save some meat to throw that in the mix! Would recommend!

Went in for the galbi Jim with cheese. Very spicy so perfect for those who want to try a spicy challenge but you can ask for less spicy! Don't underestimate it! Service was great and you can ask to mix the remaining sauce with rice to finish it off! I would save some meat to throw that in the mix! Would recommend!

Went in for the galbi Jim with cheese. Very spicy so perfect for those who want to try a spicy challenge but you can ask for less spicy! Don't underestimate it! Service was great and you can ask to mix the remaining sauce with rice to finish it off! I would save some meat to throw that in the mix! Would recommend!

We got take out from here and it was awesome! The Korean tacos (pork and beef) are such a fun twist on traditional Korean food, and the jap chae and bibimbap were excellent too! I ordered on Yelp and they called immediately after placing my order to let me know they were out of white rice and offered the black rice instead. It was delicious and I appreciated the quick communication! It was ready in about 30 min for pick up. The toppings on the bibimbap were amazing, and I hope they add a dolsot (hot stone bowl) option once they reopen for dine-in service!

This is by far my favorite restaurant in Chicago. It comes down to two things-  Price -  It's only $8 for two tacos and they are quite large so that's basically a full meal. Instead of chipotle, try to mix it up for less money and get more flavor  Taste -  Their tacos are insanely flavorful, i especially love the spicyness. The shells are so soft and perfectly hold the meat and toppings  This is a must try in the Wicker park/ bucktown area!

This place is terrific! I've been wanting to try it out for years but now that I live closer, will frequent this places It has a small menu - paratha tacos, bibimbap, sashimi bap, and a few appetizers like dumplings and japchae noodles. I tried their pork and beef tacos - they are pretty sizeable and I was stuffed from two tacos. The shell is flaky and delicious A- reminds me of a Chinese scallion pancake without the pancake. Each taco order also comes with a spicy aioli which was delicious - spicy with a hint of sweetness.  My husband and I both preferred the beef over the pork because the pork texture is more broken up, whereas the beef is more distinct pieces of bulgolgi. The spicy pork was also pretty high on the spices, which we usually enjoy but it meant we couldn't use as much of the aoili. All in all, both were good and we will definitely be back! Only suggestion would be to add some items as appetizers like kimchi fries.

Food: excellent  Service: quick Counter service spot with a few communal tables that has been in this same location for many years. Love how fresh the ingredients are - the bibimbap bowls are delish and their tacos are so, so, SO GOOD. THE "tortillas" are fried or something and it makes them flakey and extra delish. Two tacos is plenty of food for a meal. The pork is my favorite meat there but is a bit spicy so buyer beware. Have been coming here since 2014 and will continue to!

This is my go-to quick dinner spot. They have fast service and the tacos and bubimbap are my favorite. The cashier is so nice and always greets you with a smile and hello. When I lived a block from there - I'd eat here at least once a week. Never disappointed, constantly delicious.
Love En Hakkore. I've probably already given them a good review but they are truly one of our go to eats especially now as we don't eat out nor order out much since last year.

I absolutely love En Hakkore. I generally get the two tacos when I go -- Of them are good: tofu, veggie, pork, beef. I'm not a fan of corn tortillas and the tortillas here are flour which are a great fit for the Korean flavors. If it's been a while since I've been there I start to crave them. I know others who love the bibimbap. Staff is super friendly and on the whole the atmosphere is good. Sometimes the music can get a little bit loud. I wish they used compostable Takeaway containers.

Love this place for a fresh twist on bibimbap and some Korean fusion dishes. I always get their bibimbap w/ beef and the spicy pork paratha tacos ~ really really delicious (I'm Korean so my standards for Korean food are pretty high lol). Indoor space is cute and always clean which I appreciate. Â Parking is usually pretty easy on Damen. Service is friendly and professional. Â Definitely one of my go-to places in Chicago for fast fresh Korean food!

The serving sizes were pretty decent besides the kimchi. The side of bulgogi was more like a rice bowl and the sauce for the bulgogi fries were great. They didn't put sauce in the bibimbap sushi burrito but it had a great assortment of things like imitation crab meat and avocado. It doesn't come with a large amount of sauce but it doesn't really need it. I ended up just putting it in a bowl with the kimchi and the sauce so that I could mix it all up. I got this delivered, so not sure what the restaurant experience is like.
35-45  mins

I've been here twice now, and plan to come back again soon (I HOPE)...  These Paratha tacos are so good and tasty, you can't go wrong with either BBQ Beef or Spicy Pork. I eat these so quick, because they are so good when fresh and hot out of the kitchen.  I'm not a food chemist but...  Crispy, slightly chewy, sweet: Paratha Salty, sweet, spices: Marinated Beef/Pork  Fresh, crunchy: Slaw I think that hits all the corners of sensation to unleash an amazing combination that simply hits the spot so good when you're craving asian food/spices.

Here's the long/short of it: this place has the best Korean BBQ Beef tacos I've ever had. Period. It doesn't get any better than the way En Hakkore does it. Would highly recommend to anyone who is looking for something that is truly best in category of tacos and Korean BBQ. Will be returning again, again, and again.
Be aware when you pick up pork taco- sauce is dripping! Â  (Beef taco was okay) Yet the taste is good. Hopefully they change the taco packaging.

It looks cool, It feels cool, and It taste great. I had the spicy pork and beef taco. The pork is a touch too spicy but I'm not complaining others might and the full effect of the spice takes about 5 seconds to bloom. The Beef is great. Now I have previously stated Del Seoul has excellent tacos - they still do. What this place has is tons more atmosphere. Look at the pics Thanks to Nick G for leading to this place  Excellent tacos as usual 032619 had the beef, pork and tofu it's spicy- be warned. Â The bimbimbap plates was good but I much prefer the Tacos.

It looks cool, It feels cool, and It taste great. I had the spicy pork and beef taco. The pork is a touch too spicy but I'm not complaining others might and the full effect of the spice takes about 5 seconds to bloom. The Beef is great. Also their tortillas is unique it's, It's has more substance than your usual tortilla. Now I have previously stated Del Seoul has excellent tacos - they still do. What this place has is tons more atmosphere. Look at the pics Thanks to Nick G for leading to this place.

Can't go wrong with a meal from En Hakkore everything is delicious. The portions on the quality well worth the meal you are that experience. Whether you're with a group of people or just on a date or considering ordering you can't go wrong. Flavors are amazing

Like this place! The menu consists of unique dishes they execute very, very well.  My go-to dish here is the sashimi bap, which is essentially a salad with tons of fresh/pickled/marinated veggies, chunks of sashimi, and served with rice (go for the brown rice!) and choice of sauce (go for the gochujang for something a little spicy). Â Mix it all together, and voila, you've got the best rice bowl in Bucktown. So good!! When I'm in the mood for something more decadent, the paratha tacos and mandoo are fantastic. En Hakkore is right by the 606, and folks who run the place are always super friendly :-) If you've been there, you already know this place is legit. If you haven't, be sure to give it a try, you can thank me later.

Middle of the road. Not bad, not great. I'm thinking the tacos might really be where it's at, but unfortunately I had the Sashimi Bap with a side of paratha bread and didnt have an experience that is really worth talking about. The paratha bread was really good, and that's what they make their tacos with. The sashimi bap was a huge, half-filled bowl that consisted mostly of shredded cabbage. Very small portion of rice, tiny portion of sashimi, no sauce on it (though there were sauces on the table).  Once I put sauce on it, it was tasty enough, but I felt like I paid $11 for a bowl of raw cabbage. Probably would not order again. There are many other places that do poke better, even though this was not called poke. The service was very surprising. One cook, one clerk, and a bustling neighborhood of hipsters and millennial moms dining in and everybodyntheymama ordering delivery.  For some reason my paratha bread came out 10 minutes before my meal...*shrug* This place is also really small, offering cramped communal seating. And since so many people are crammed in a small space it is really loud. It is a personal pet peeve of mine when a place has a tip option on their checkout if I have to place my order at the counter and bus my own table. The girl walked three steps to bring my meal. I feel like a jerk if I don't tip when it is an option, but if I had not been prompted to, I wouldnt have even given it a second thought, since it was mostly self-serve. I might give this place another shot and try the tacos next time, but I dont really have high hopes for my opinion changing.

This is fusion done right! They make paratha tacos that are this smooth, silky, and buttery like taco that is also crispy. It has a soft crunch before it gives and the taco just melts in your mouth.  The spice level is great - it is hot, so beware of that! But it lets me enjoy my food really slowly and really take in the flavors of the pork. I also tried the beef and it is quite a competition for #1 between them. They are both so good. If and when I come back to Chicago, this will definitely be one of my first stops! Also for $4 a taco, this is such a great deal because it is so buttery and filling. I had a larger breakfast that day, and one taco was enough for me. As a meal by itself, two tacos would probably be best but I can see how one is adequate. The sauce and flavoring of the meat was to die for I really can't wait for the day I come back!

I'm not a fan of bibimbap just because of all the veggies but I can't deny the freshness and presentation. My friends all liked the mandoo and tacos which I feel like would have made more sense for my palate and I should have gotten instead.

The beef paratha tacos are worth visiting this place but the pork one is a tad too spicy.  I would skip the bibimbop as the rice was a bit dry and meat / protein proportion to the rice was underwhelming.
35-45  mins
Amazing customer service, Â jamia was very attentive and the food was amazing! definitely coming back!
Thank you for your review, Ajax and Jamia will be very happy to hear your feedback. Please join us again soon for the best happy hour in town!

The food was really good and they have a great selection of margaritas. Â The service is what set my experience apart. Â Our server was very friendly and was eager to help us navigate through the menu of food items and drinks to make a selection. Â Even though the restaurant was busy while we were there, it didn't impact our service or our server's attentiveness to our needs. Â I had to look up her name on the check and wanted to make sure she got credit for a great experience. Great job Emma, we will be coming back because of you.
Hello Karl, We are happy to hear about your experience! We appreciate you taking the time to share! Emma and team will be very happy to hear your feedback.

Pink Taco is a VIBE. The food is delicious , but the entire place was decked out with incredible mural art, and OF COURSE I loved all of the pink touches. I went for brunch, but I saw they have incredible deals on Tuesday's for taco Tuesday.  Here's everything I tried: Pink Tacos: The OG Pink (shredded chicken), Sweet Potato, Baja (fried shrimp) Strawberry Margarita (in a pineapple) - to be honest, it was just ok Pink Churro Pancakes (my favorite thing we tried) Mexican Bread Pudding French Toast
We are happy to hear about your experience! We appreciate you taking the time to share. - Sarah Barnard

Decided to give Pink Taco a try-- and I enjoyed! I do recommend making a reservation if you are coming on a weekend. We made a reservation and we were seated promptly however, we did overhear that for people walking in there was a 45-1hr wait.  I loved the ambiance here for a Friday! Very vibrant, great music, and lively people. The service was also amazing! Our server, Emma was great she was very attentive to our table, she gave awesome recommendations and was very prompt.  I ordered the fried lobster tacos and so so good. They came with fried lobster, a mango salsa, cheese and a sauce. I loved and would definitely recommend! We also tried the lobster enchilada and when I say it is Â MUST try, I loved the cream sauce, the cheese blend and the rich flavor. Again, a must try.  We also tried their margaritas which was great. I tried the mango and the strawberry in the a pineapple. Not only insta worthy (lol) but it was tasty, and strong. -- Overall this was a decent place if you're downtown and wanting to get some food and drinks. Give them a try! For more food content follow me on instagram @dinnerwithnea

Thanks for leaving us such a wonderful review. We are glad that you loved our services. Our staff will be pleased to learn of your high praise. They work very diligently, and it will provide them with great encouragement to keep up their hard work! - Sarah Barnard

Solid after work spot if you're looking for a yummy nacho and a decent marg. I like the vibes after work because they play good/up beat music.  It's not a place I'd go out of my way to for dinner but I like is as a happy hour option. Also they use creamy nacho cheese rather than melted shredded cheese which is a personal favorite method.
Thank you Rebecca for your review. Please join us again soon for the best happy hour in town!

Love this place so much! It's the place for IG spot lover. Sweet corn is my fav one. Guacamole is nice. I tried 3 types of popular tacos there but I love lobster the most! So happy to go to this place
We cannot thank you enough for the kind words about our restaurant. Your review means a lot to us and lets us know we are on the right track! â€“ Pink Taco Restaurant Group

I'm going to be pretty frank about this. I'm half Mexican and the food here is not going to please Latinas or Latinos. I image this being really good food for people who have never had their abuela make them tacos or tostadas homemade. Actually the quesadilla was good. I was satisfied with the quesadilla if you need to pick something from the menu. Also I'm from Texas and in Texas we know a thing or two about good tacos.  I give it three stars though because it wasn't a bad experience. Great atmosphere and amazing drinks. Hell after a few drinks their food will most likely taste like heaven. So start with a few drinks and then get your eat on! Very beautiful decor, so if you're looking for your next Instagram post, Snap, or Tik Tok then this is a lovely place to get those pics.

Hi Corie! We are so glad you liked Pink Taco Chicago! We appreciate you taking the time to leave such a great review and give us a little love. It makes our day to know we made you happy! Come see us again soon! Best regards

It is my first time here and I would 100% come back for second, third and so on. Alexis, the wonderful and attentive waitress gave us great suggestions and details about all the food and drinks. It is a great highlight of our Friday night. What else can you ask for more, maybe Alexis and tequila shots!!!!!!!!!!
Thank you so for your review. We look forward to seeing you again soon! â€“ Pink Taco Restaurant Group

We checked into our hotel and were looking for food. It was a Saturday around 2:00 pm and Lou Malnatis was an hour wait. So while we waited, we saw this place nearby and decided to order some snacks and drinks. It was very busy here so we had to sit at the top bar area. Bloody Mary needed a bit more alcohol flavor in it. The steak taco bowl and steak tacos were all decent. Meats were soft and flavorful. Food took a while to arrive but drinks were fast. They had some Saturday brunch deals going on. Good drink deals.
Thank you for the review Crystal! We love feedback like yours! Please join us again soon for the best happy hour in town!

Food is very bland and mediocre. Best part of the experience was the service. Our server Alex was amazing!! Other reviews say service is bad at the restaurant, we went at 5pm when it was not busy and did not have any issues. The frozen mango margarita was my favorite thing we ordered. We tried the carnita,al pastor, barbacoa tacos. Â The best tacos were the carnitas. Â Nachos were basic nothing special. Overall ok experience would not come back based on bland and basic food.  Happy hour 5-8 Taco Tuesday 4- close
Thank you for your feedback Mag T., we will share your review with the team. We hope to see you again soon!

I wanted to try this place for a whole year and boy was I disappointed today. My friends food was cold, bland and so bad it was left on the plate as we paid our bill and left. I was starving after ordering a breakfast burrito that was suppose to contain sausage and Mexican seasonings. The burrito was almost completely black beans which you can tell by the photo. It basically has no seasoning and was not something I ever thought a restaurant could screw up!  Why is this place so busy?  It has a catchy name, a great location, the drinks are amazing and the decor is very stylish. It is a hang out spot for young yuppies in the River North area. Once you've had a few drinks in your system you may be hungry enough to eat, I guess.  Lastly, the staff is very nice and provided polite customer service. When they noticed we left full plates of food they didn't ask if it was okay, and I suppose they are aware that their food is not good. They just need to do something about the ... food and this would be a great place. :-(  I provided one star for the customer service, and one star for the drinks otherwise the food was so bad I would've given it 0 stars, if I could.

Hello Kimmie, We would like to earnestly apologize for your recent experience. We take pride in being the best we can be and sincerely hope that every guest is treated like family. We want to make this right â€“ please reach out to me Arthur at 347-264-6787. Regards
Checked out their happy hour! They have $8 tacos and $8 margs on Tuesday-Friday from 5-8p. So good!!
Thank you for your review Julie, please join us again soon for the best happy hour in town!

Alright, still can't stop talking about the chips they serve at the table. PHENOMIAL. Salsa was alright but not here to complain about free chips & salsa.  The filling in the sweet potato taco was on point but the shell was kinda meh. Trying to hard to be pink.  Service was pretty slow over the lunch hour.
Thank you for taking to time to review our food and service. Â We look forward to serving you again.

**Vegetarian Friendly** Came her on a Saturday night, and we had more fun than we expected. Great place to catch up with friends, or just to come for tacos. This is also a larger restaurant, so great option if you're a larger group. I can see this place being very popular for Happy Hour and Taco Tuesday. I had the Sweet Potato Pink Tacos - they were tasty, but incredibly greasy. Sadly, they only have one vegetarian taco on the menu - but they have other vegetarian dishes. My one annoyance - the website says Happy Hour daily 3-7pm, and the restaurant would not honor it. We came here thinking we would be able to catch HH. Turns out Â it's only Monday to Friday, but it's not reflected accurately online. None the less, we will be back! **Beans and Rice** Vegetarian = Black Beans + Cilantro Lime Rice NOT Vegetarian = Pinto Refried Beans (made with lard) + Mexican Rice (made with chicken stock)

Thank you very much for your review Neeketa! We work hard at Pink Taco to make sure you have a great time whenever you spend your time with us! Come enjoy some tacos and great margaritas at indoor/ outdoor seating, See you again soon!

Such a disappointing experience. This place has such potential, but there were so many disconnects and missed opportunities tonight, we will never return.  Server was sweet, but lacking the "with-it-ness" a server needs to be successful. Drops off a carafe of water with no glasses. We had to ask for glasses. Drinks from the bar took 20 minutes (maybe more). We had to ask for silverware, napkins, and straws more than once. Same with more chips. Our company's tacos took 40 minutes. We asked her twice about them and she just said "ya I'll check on them".... But never resolved the issue. I got up and reported this to the manager because I had had enough. The table next to us were also very frustrated they had to ask for everything.  I also can't believe that we sat there for 2 hours and a manager never once checked in on us. Had the manager checked in he could have caught and resolved the issues early on. Poor service all around.  Also- ONE of the four stalls were working. One was locked, one was completely clogged, and the large handicap accessible stall's door didn't lock. Completely unacceptable. I told our server, a food runner, AND a manager.

Hello Alicia, Thank you for your review. We sincerely apologize that your experience was not a positive one. Please call me at 3472646787 at your earliest convenience to make this right. Regards, Arthur

Came in on Saturday for my birthday trip to Chicago. Of course we went into the Pink Taco because of the name, and because of the atmosphere. When we first arrived I ordered a Bloody Mary. My drink didn't come out until after my food was already at the table... I took a sip of my Bloody Mary and it literally tasted like water with lime and a splash of tomato juice. Filled with ice. I ordered the "fan favorite" per my server, the chicken taco bowl. There was absolutely no flavor, had way more beans than chicken and had pickled cabbage piled on top. The chicken was so dry I needed to drink my luke warm water they provided just to swallow it.  In conclusion, I wish I could give them 0 stars. Avoid the pink taco. The bloody Mary's are disgusting & the chicken taco bowl was HARDLY edible.

Thank you for your review. We like to sincerely apologize that your experience was not a positive one. Please feel to send me an email with your contact information so I can make it right for you. Arthur Setlight  Arthur.Setlight@xperiencâ€¦  â€“Pink Taco Restaurant Group

Doordash'd this. Got the Al Pastor Tacos and Sweet Corn. The tacos were pretty good.  The sweet corn came on the cob, but the pictures on the doordash page showed it off the cob. I prefer off the cob, so this was a slight disappointment. Overall, Pink Taco is alright, but not my favorite taco spot in the neighborhood. The value for quantity isn't quite there, and they charge extra for any salsas.
We cannot thank you enough for the kind words about our restaurant. Your review means a lot to us and lets us know we are on the right track! â€“ Xperience Restaurant Group

Cool restaurant, great drinks & excellent tacos! I tried the al pastor, Baja and carne asada tacos with a mojito. The tacos were all very flavorful and the mojito was refreshing. My friend had the lobster tacos and literally sang with each bite!!! Seriously, it was so good that we drove an hour the next day to have I again!! Only reason I knocked a star off is because the service wasn't anything to write home about. The 1st night, we sat at the bar and was never even offered a refill on drinks. No, it wasn't busy at all as it was within an hour and a half of closing. The 2nd day we went, the server wasn't very attentive but the hostess was. Meh, the tacos made up for it!
We canâ€™t thank you enough for your kind review of Pink Taco Chicago. We look forward to seeing you again soon for some fresh guacamole and some sizzling fajitas!

I can't say enough wonderful things about the Pink Taco. I moved into the River North neighborhood in August -lucky enough to be right around the cnr from the PT. First place I went. And I've been back every week since. Great atmosphere. Great Drinks. Great people. A trip there is worth the visit, even if to hang with Jamal, truly one of Chicago's great bartenders.

Was super excited to try pink taco for the first time, and as a vegetarian, I saw that the majority of their food had meatless options. Ordered the nachos for pickup, and when I got back to my place the nachos were covered in chicken, even though I hadn't paid the extra $5 for the chicken. I guess it's a plus if you're a meat eater, but for someone who hasn't had meat in over 12 years, not a great first impression. There was so much shredded chicken that even though I tried to pick as much off as I could, there was no way to make sure there wasn't any. As a heads up if you're ordering online and are a vegetarian, make sure you specify no meat, because I guess they'll put meat on your food even if you don't pay for it.
Thank you for your review. We apologize your experience was not a positive one. We would like to make this right please call me at 3472646787.

After having a bad experience with another Mexican restaurant (which shall go unnamed), I began my hunt for a great taco. I decided to give L'Patron a try since I heard good things. I ordered two steak tacos (which came Â with the usual cilantro and onions), and added lettuce and tomatoes. Also, ordered a small (more like tiny - 1 oz) guacamole and chips. While most of the meat was tender and hot, some pieces were chewy and indigestible, the tomatoes were not ripe, the guacamole was really pico de gallo, and the some of the chips were soggy (lime juice?) and too salty. Also, something gave me an allergic reaction; my face started itching. My search for a great taco continues.

I was craving tacos and this just hit the spot. I'm more upset at myself for not discovering this sooner.  Standouts included the al pastor and carne asada. They were out of lengua so that's for next time. The meat to tortilla ratio is about twice as much as other places nearby. And less greasy. Bring cash, I called for pickup and my order was ready on time.  Oh yea, my profile pic is me eating L'patron on my patio....

This restaurant does cook to order and can take a while before the food is ready. We were told it was take 30 minutes to prepare our tacos and burritos, so if you're looking for a quick bite, this might not be the place for you. Overall, not happy with my experience. The food was bland and overpriced for what you got. Guac and chips costed a whopping $7 and you only got a small side of guac for all the chips they gave.  -Cashier wasn't super friendly and very stingy. We wanted to order just guacamole because we still had chips leftover, but she insisted that we would have to pay $7 again.  -L'patron taco wasn't all that great. Tortillas were dry and the meat took a second for the flavor to come through. While I can tell the meat is of higher quality, I'm disappointed that it wasn't seasoned to really shine through the rice and beans.  -Elote was super bland. When i mixed it up, it was just oil and corn. I was expecting way more seasoning and spices, but they barely put a dash of paprika.  -Guacamole was meh. Really watery and had a lot more of the filling than actual avocado

First time here and would highly recommend; I look forward to coming back soon. Tacos are a bit on the expensive side (~$4ish) but really good nonetheless. They were out of tongue when we got there but considering it was past 8pm, it seemed reasonable.  I really liked the vibe of the place, they have a patio out back that seems to either have just opened or got a fresh new furniture change, definitely a great vibe - they call ur name on a speaker so you can hang outside if you want to. They also have a window upfront for pickups and take out, much appreciated mid pandemic. Drinks were also in the expensive side $10 each - it seemed like a lot for the baby margarita you're served, but they do give you a good sized Michelada that also comes with what seemed like a full cucumber hahah.

Came here for the first time and it was so so good! I ordered two carne asada tacos, one poblano taco, elotes, and a side of rice. The only thing I didn't care for was the rice because to me, it was stuck together and had a gross texture. Just wasn't the rice I was expecting. The steak in the tacos was so fricken good and it had amazing flavor... almost had a burnt/charcoal taste to it without being burnt. The meat was instead so juicy and perfectly cooked with no fat. The poblano peppers were also so good! The elotes was also so full of flavor. The corn was sweet and buttery, and then the cheese on top made it a little salty. The flavors mixed together were perfect. I wish you could buy a taco dinner with rice and beans on the side, because they make you pay for everything a la carte. They also have two salsas: salsa verde (the best one) and the red hot salsa. I didn't realize this place is CASH ONLY, so please make sure you bring cash before coming. They do have an ATM, but who wants to pay to use an ATM. No thanks.  The decor is vibrant and colored, and the workers were all friendly. The way you order is uou order at the counter when you walk in, and then sit down and wait for your name to be called so that you can pick up your food. They also have a takeout window where you can wait in line outside so you can take food to go without stepping foot into the restaurant, which I thought was cool and convenient. I also heard they have outdoor seating in the summer and have a food truck! Overall, the food was great and I'll be back!

Ok so we had no idea what to expect finding this taco joint walking distance from our Airbnb but good god. After an afternoon of day drinking, L'Patron had everything we needed to recover.  The menu was not what I expected from a usual taco joint - so I had trouble deciding what to order. I figured I couldn't go wrong with what was labeled under the House Special. I'd never heard of the gringa or the gringo so I decided to try one. The gringa is tortilla filled with carne al pastor and melty cheese and GOOD LORD ALMIGHTY. The greasy meaty goodness was all I needed and then some. Paired with some refried beans and rice? I was in Heaven.  Prices are cheap, although cash only. Although sometimes, you know a hole in the wall restaurant isn't any good unless they're cash only. I've gotta come back and try other options from the menu next time I'm back in town!

Ordered carne asana burrito and a L'patron taco. Both items were excellent. The char on the meat was perfect and the lettuce was fresh and crisp. I haven't seen a burrito wrapped this nicely in a long time. The tortilla was fresh too. Nothing more you could ask for in a good burrito. The taco was equally delicious. Highly recommend L'patron tacos.

Excellent limeade and lomo encebollado (ribeye and onion) burritos.  I ordered the tasty gringa (al pastor and cheese between two tortillas), but my friend Sarj's lomo was definitely the stronger choice and better value.  Cash only, but there's an ATM inside.

The best Lomo Tacos I've ever KNOWN I drive for hours for that taco ALONE Tastes as good as when Trump was OVERTHROWN Come and get tacos at L'PATRON Gives me funny feelings in my private ZONE Sometimes I've drove here, sometimes I've FLOWN One of the best baez in town, like JOAN Everyone loves tacos from L'PATRON Drake's girl used to call him on his CELLPHONE Austin Powers got down with his own CLONE Ian McEwan told us how to ATONE But nobody makes tacos like L'PATRON Can't afford a taco? Take out a LOAN Cause skipping this taco I can never CONDONE Bring a bunch of friends, or come on your OWN Cause nothing tastes better than L'PATRON L'Patron Salsa is my fave COLOGNE You don't like the tacos? I don't like your TONE I'm gonna put "L'Patron" on my TOMBSTONE It's the Queen Of Tacos and my mouth is the THRONE Afterwards we'll go to the hotel and BONE And after a few you'll say "my how you've GROWN" I'll tell you a joke, you'll ((rolleyes)) and GROAN Then you'll spread your legs like Sharon STONE I'm way more attentive than the dudes you've BLOWN The whole hotel will hear you MOAN I'll put the Desi in Desire like SUNNY LEONE And afterwards we'll go back to L'PATRON WHAT Chicago's best taco. One of the best 5 ribeye tacos in USA (which is the best kind). One of my 10 fave taco places ever (and I've tried a f**kload). My first experience here? Having my car stolen. I told a cop: hey, my car was parked right here, now it's gone! He said, damn, where'd Chicago? What to get: Lomo Encebollado Taco What is it: Ribeye w/Grilled Onion Why: It's life-changing What else to get: All their meats, tacos, tortas, etc, are good Seriously, Patron has - and for many years now has been serving - some of the greatest tacos in the history of tacos. They've grown up from a little place that not too many people knew about when I first tried it over 10 years ago, to being one of the most beloved and popular (and to some degree hipster) taco places around. With hipsterism comes responsibility (crap menu additions), but they still manage to crank out some of the most wondrous tacos you'll ever have. The ribeye (Lomo Encebollado) is the way to go, no matter what you usually like in your tacos, no matter what anyone recommends, you have to try it.  There are not that many people that can make a truly life-changing ribeye taco, but these guys are those people. I'm pretty sure I will always be in love with their tacos, and if they ever up and close on me, the punishment level would be cruel and unusual. Luckily this life-changing taste of these ribeye tacos has helped to make them very popular in a very Latin town (Chicago has better Mexican than NYC). The decor is gorgeous too, colourful, orange and memorable. Perhaps Chicago's best Mexican food - definitely up there, tied with Gorditas Santiago (in the real Barrio).
