A word of warning though: If you have expensive CARGO And have to drive to FARGO Don't stop in CHICAGO Or you'll be asking "where'd my CAR GO" Now let's finish with more rap: So no need to be miserable, no need for the SORROWS Tacos will cheer you right up, so you don't need WALLOWS I promise that I'll follow back if you give me FOLLOWS And then we'll go for dinner at L'PATRON TACOS So I can sit right on your lap like in Santa's GROTTOS Or I can lean into the rolled down window of your AUTOS Or I can bring my Barbi and you'll think you won the LOTTOS But the best plan of them all is that we go to L'PATRON TACOS I will bring my Devil's Tower and Barbi'll bring her LAGO You'll find I'm a strict machine, but not like the GESTAPO Barbi's hotter than Ipanema girls, and I'm bigger than SAO PAULO And the best Rib-Eye Taco is an L'PATRON TACO Barbi charges more than I do for her AVOCADO And when she gets Chilly I take her to SANTIAGO Then I make her squeal repeatedly just like VIBRATO Then we're hungry so we get an L'PATRON TACO! Some people say I'm girlie, others say I'm MACHO Some people know real Mexican food, others just eat NACHO I cross the Rio Grande at will, you just watch RIO BRAVO And when I'm in Chicago, I get an L'PATRON TACO Barbi doesn't like to suck but me I love to SWALLOW Anything for Barbi or for money is my MOTTO I've had some problems down in Houston just like the APOLLO But when I want Chicago Tacos, it's an L'PATRON TACO I've been to South America, the Mid Easts and MORROCCOS I've been labeled deep AF while others think I'm HOLLOWS Some say we're a cute couple, others call us PSYCHOS But one thing that I know is that we love L'PATRON TACOS I like to pretend I'm okay but that's just my BRAVADO Sometimes I feel so cold inside like Frances was in FARGO Sometimes I feel so frozen I'm like Barbi in CHICAGO But when in the windy city, I get an L'PATRON TACO! WHAT

I've ordered takeout a few times here, but have yet to dine in. I heard there's a patio open now and the place it fairly busy so I'm happy that business is doing well after the past year. But anyway, on to the food! The tacos are fantastic. The al pastor is probably the best, so much flavor. It's sweet and smoky and charred... Let me stop drooling thinking about it. They have the Gringa and Gringo items, which are handmade tortillas with cheese and either al pastor or carne asada (get the al pastor). It's rich and delicious and a lot heavier than a taco. I had a burrito here recently and while the meat (I got al pastor lol) was delicious, I was suuuper disappointed they put lettuce and tomatoes in it. Like wth. Burritos consist of rice, beans, meat, cheese, salsa, and maybe guacamole and sour cream. Is that so hard to follow? I'm not at Chipotle, so I wasn't expecting to find such a thing. Guacamole is good but portion is a little small. The chips are tasty tho, you can tell they're freshly fried in house and seasoned with the perfect amount of salt. Overall, a really good spot. Just stay away from their burritos, but everything else I would gladly order again :)

Not sure what happened during the pandemic but steak in our food was all dry and hard. Â I've never seen it this bad before. Â Pre-covid I've always been able to get nice juicy pieces but it was like jerky if anything. Â This was quite disappointing, especially since all that food I ordered was supposed to be for a birthday celebration too. Felt so bad! Avoid their asada at all costs for now. Â Not sure what the reason is but it's pretty much inedible. I won't be ordering that any time soon. If you want steak, go for their lomo(rib-eye). Â That was totally fine. Â This one tends to take longer to make than the asada but it's worth it. It was flavorful and tender. When my order was taken over the phone they asked if I wanted "everything" in the burrito but when it came time to eat it, "everything" was not in there like I had asked. Â Where was the rice? Â Where were the veggies? Â It was pretty much a dried meat jerky burrito. Ack! Â Pass! The shrimp was spot on. Â Love the slaw they put on top. Â Normally I'm not a big fan of slaw but I do make an exception when it's from here. Â The shrimp was very plump and juicy just like you'd want it.

Whatever taco you order, make sure you get it with the handmade tortillas. Â It's worth it. Â Definitely a game changer. Â I've been spoiled by this place that it set a new standard for me for what I look for in a taco. The tacos pair well with the escabeche (pickled veggies). Â It's the Mexican giardiniera. Â Make sure you wash it down with their horchata and tip them well. Â They're so hardworking.

Have you ever had a roasted veggie burrito because you should definitely try that. The cashier and I could not stop giggling, we were both in a silly goofy mood. The first time I came here was with a new friend, the second time with an old friend. Sharing tasty meals with your loved ones is among the nicest things in life. Xoxo we luv u l'patron
Good decent Tacos.  They have a very modern approach to the Taco business.  Many interesting choices and flavors are really good!  Worth trying.
Kept calling to order and the guy would say please hold and never answered the phone. It's cash only and the ATM didn't work. Why do they make it so hard.
2.5 stars, Expensive for a taco spot.... Nothing special  One of my last Logan square taco options

I don't give out many 5 stars but my first offering from here was fresh and phenomenal. I was serviced immediately walking in the door by the cashier who grabbed my 2 go order. I had there legendary ( America's 5th best ) carne asada burrito. Fresh, decent portion, and wrapped suitably to go. I will try rest of menu as this was my first

The hubby and I ordered 2 al pastor burritos The first bite I took I could taste the pineapple, which is the right way al pastor should be cooked, with pineapple. My only complaint is that the al pastor meat was shaved off in very big chunks, al pastor should be small chuncks of meat, these were BIG  I personally was not a fan

Authentic and delicious!! Â Two tacos was perfect!! The rice and beans combo, so tasty. I loved my pollo taco with a nice cilantro sprinkle! The shrimp, wow!! My daughter loved her carne asada. Cash only!
Tacos are so freaking tasty. I highly recommend the gringo. Homemade tortillas are dreamy. Cashiers are always so nice and give plenty of extra salsa.

After hearing they had the 5th best Burrito in the Country , to be fair , i went in expecting some serious magic , Entering the restaurant i noticed it was very clean and somewhat stylish , i was soon greeted by a very polite server , so far so good , Â I started with chips and guacamole, the chips are great, assumingely freshly made , The Guacamole even though fresh , Â was really bitter due to unripened avocados , im sure this changes day to day but they dropped the ball on this visit! Â I ordered a side of rice and beens and they were spot on , to drink i ordered a Horchata which was delicious , (quick note)if rice and beens are bad and if a place uses powdered horchata , run for your life , its the simple things that count !  Now for the Steak Burrito , (5th best mind you) Steak was good but only just slightly better than average, sorry , i felt they do use good steak and put a bit more time into preparing it so thats a plus and worth mentioning , the rest of the ingredients were fresh, but if your looking for a great Burrito , its worth the stop, if your looking for a life changing burrito , i personally i don't think so ,
